Review_text: The hotel needs refurbishment.  Some of the corridors and courtyards were in a very poor state. The meals were OK, although not up to 5 star standard. Review_text: Our planned highlight, to the end of our Sri Lankan tour, was a frustrating disappointment.  We arrived tired and sick, hoping for a clean comfortable room and some simple food.  Even though we had booked and paid 6 months earlier, it took a long time to allocate us a room.  The room smelled of mould and mould was easily found in the bathroom. My wife complained, but all the staff could do was find the missing outdoor furniture. At dinner, the first night, we had difficulty finding plain food, that would not aggravate our upset stomachs.  The chef kindly offered to prepare mashed potatoes, peas and grilled chicken, for us, the next night. However, the next day, this offer was undone by management, who declared we had been selected for "Fine dining". Fearing this was Sringlish for extra spicy, we gave up and went to bed early, without dinned, which we had already paid for.  At least at checkout, as some compensation, the hotel did not charge for the sandwich and hamburger, we had at the bar.  After my wife presented mouldy toiletries to management, they did offer to change rooms, on the second day; but it was too little too late.  The hotel has an impressive entrance and sea view.  But what good are those when the hotel fails the basics of room and food.

Review_text:
Stay was great but
1.  Considering there is nothing nearby to eat the food choices for A la cart and Room service are very very limited.
2. Phone receiver was smelly. None of the buttons worked
3. Door stopper broken and the the door kept banging if left open for a few seconds
4. Space beneath bed had not been swept or cleaned in a long time
5. TV was not working .
Hotel staff were warm and Service was lovely. The location and rooms were fabulous, so we overlooked all faults except  Point number 1 on Food.

Review_text: 临到出行前，酒店才通知说没有房间，给替换到另外一家酒店。对酒店这钟行为非常鄙视。抵达到酒店前台交涉期间，路线有外国团队来办理入住，个人觉得就是把我们预定的酒店让给了别人。酒店真的很美，环境不错，早晚餐也非常丰盛，对于这次没有住到这家酒店感觉很遗憾。
processed_text_Review_text: before the trip, the hotel notified that there was no room and replaced it to another hotel. i despise the behavior of this hotel clock. during the negotiations at the hotel reception desk, a foreign team came to check in the route. i personally think that it was to give the hotel we booked to someone else. the hotel is really beautiful, the environment is good, and the morning and evening meals are also very rich. i feel sorry for not staying in this hotel this time.

Review_text:
We felt we could not relax whilst in the grounds, the local sellers both men and women, hid in the bushes of the hotel on the beach, waiting to get people's attention.  As soon as you stepped onto the beach, you were surrounded by them.  Also so much rubbish strewn about the perimeter.  Overall the hotel lacked any atmosphere, maybe it is too large for that?
The staff were all lovely and friendly.  For the money we both felt very let down, it is marked as a 5 star hotel but I would disagree with that.

Review_text:
バワ建築好きなので、ゆっくりしたいと3泊しました。部屋も素敵だったし、ご飯も美味しかったし、ビーチも目の前で、滞在自体は満足のいくものでした。
しかし、それを台無しにする残念なことがありました。
１つは、滞在が週末だったため、とにかくうるさかった事。隣の部屋では、若い男女が10人以上で、爆音の音楽かけたり、バルコニーで騒いだりしていて、注意してもらってもまた騒ぐという感じでした。プールも若者のグループや家族連れで騒がしいので、ゆっくり過ごしたい人は、週末は避けた方がいいと思います。
あと、支払を現地払いにしていたのですが、チェックイン時に請求された金額と、Agodaで予約した時の金額が異なったので、チェックアウト時に確認したのですが、係りの人は「間違いありません」の一点張りでした。急いでいたのもあり、あとはAgodaに間に入ってもらって、話をしてもらいますと伝えて、ホテルを出ようとしたら、他のスタッフが調べるので時間をくれと言って来ました。結局、ホテル側のミスであることが判明しましたが、予約管理も出来てないのかな？と、気分が悪いままホテルを後にしました。
現地払いのプランで予約する場合、支払時に確認を忘れないようにして下さい。
processed_text_Review_text:
i love bawa architecture, so i stayed for 3 nights to relax. the room was lovely, the food was delicious, the beach was right in front of us, so the stay was satisfying.
but there was something unfortunate that ruined it.
first, it was so noisy because i stayed on weekends. in the next room there were more than 10 young men and women playing loud music and making noises on the balcony, and even after being warned, they made another fuss. the pool is also noisy with young people groups and families, so if you want to spend your time relaxing, it's best to avoid it on weekends.
also, i had paid on-site, but the amount charged at check-in was different from the amount i booked at agoda, so i checked it when i checked out, but the staff member was saying "there's no doubt about it." i was in a hurry, so i told agoda that i would come in and talk to him, and when i was about to leave the hotel, the other staff asked me to give me some time to check on it. in the end, it turned out to be a mistake on the hotel, but perhaps they can't manage their reservations either. i left the hotel feeling unwell.
if you are making a reservation with a local payment plan, please do not forget to confirm when you pay.

We were asked to go to the coffee shop, over there we were told they would prepare something veg and would take 45 minutes.  But what we were served was inedible even our dog back home wouldn't eat it. Over all the hotel was great but we had a bad time with food.  The breakfast was good. But rest of the time we had to go to taj Bentota for food. Wouldn't recommend the hotel to vegetarians

Review_text: Excellent value for money and a beautiful property with a wonderful staff.
Review_text_2:
The room was just beauuuuuuuuutifullllllllllll! the design and finish is so amazing. Such a nice color palette for the room we absolutely loved it. The staff is soooooooo warm and welcoming. The initial welcome felt like we were royalty. They handed us some local sweets followed by wet towels and welcome drinks. The staff engaged with us with a lot of warmth.
The value for money is excellent. The breakfast lay out is beautiful with good taste and a huge variety. The resort design is amazing with a lot of local and Dutch design elements. The pools were warm and felt just right. 
Overall we really really enjoyed our stay there.

Review_text: Great premises but room was small
Review_text_2:
When we arrived, the room was ready. We were served welcome drinks which were fresh fruit juices.
The hotel room and the porch outside, overlooking the swimming pool and after that the sea, were very good.
Baby cot and tub was provided on request.
The premises of the hotel were vast, and roaming in and around the hotel was fun.
There was live music in the evening for both the days that we were there.
A la Carte Restaurant was very nice. They had the best Sri Lankan food that we tasted.
Breakfast Buffet had many options, and multiple types of salads and sandwiches which we absolutely enjoyed.
Review_text_3:
Room size was smaller than expected. After the baby cot was put in the room, it felt a lot more cramped for space.
In house liquor was really expensive. The USD to LKR conversion rate applied by the hotel was pathetic.
processed_text_Review_text: great premises but room was small

Review_text_2:
Breakfast great, staff receptive, all food excellent. Hats off to two staff members Dil, who seemed to be everywhere every day. Every Hotel needs a Dilith fixer, sorter, meeter, greeter immediately likeable, shows genuine concern and solves problems. A great face for the Hotel and it's high standards. Also, a great mover on the dance floor where she encouraged several guests to get up and boogie. They just needed to be told!. She told them. They loved it!
The other Dil is Dilishia (prob spelled wrong) who serves drinks at the cocktail bar (amongst other stuff)  and does so with thoughtfulness, efficiency and class. Always smiling, always with eyes to the customer for easy contact. Happy to assist. Couldn't fault any staff members, but these two stood out for me.
Review_text_3:
Weather Lol! Rained most of the week, water came in and shut down mode applied.
Shame because beach and pool are lovely. Just not so much in the rainMpx

Review_text: The perfect end to our trip around Sri Lanka
Review_text_2:
My husband and I stayed here with friends for four nights after we had been travelling around Sri Lanka. We ended up staying at the hotel for pretty much our whole four days there as we were enjoying relaxing and also there were government enforced curfews and things were difficult at that time.

The hotel was large but because the staff were super nice so it always felt intimate. I was 5 months pregnant and always felt well looked after and cared for by the staff.

Our room and bathroom was large with lovely character and a balcony. The rooms varied in size but all were comfortable. The rooms were well equipped with everything we needed and anything extra we just called reception for and they were very happy to come and sort anything. Our Aircon stopped working at 4am and a maintenance person came up immediately to look at it. Namal did a wonderful job freshening up our room every day, and we were always excited to see what creative bed decorations he'd left for each of us after breakfast.

The breakfast was very good.
We ate lunch at the pool bar every day and dinner at the restaurant every evening - these both had outside areas so we were able to always be outside. The food was good and a good price, but the menu was a little small to eat there every day!

We enjoyed both pools very much. We played table tennis and tennis, but the net took a couple of days to be put up (it was in town being serviced) and there were only two rackets.

We used the laundry service which was great and a very good price.

We all had massages which were wonderful and the therapists were lovely, but it was expensive.

The hotel provided a room for our driver for free and offered his meals for around £1 a meal, so obviously we were able to pay for that.
Review_text_3:
There were lots of dogs around that followed you to your room - I am afraid of dogs so it made me very nervous when I was walking around on my own. They could have some simple gates at the entrance to the stairs and this would stop the dogs getting to corridors with rooms.

Booking.com advertised a few restaurants but only one restaurant and one pool bar were available to us. All inclusive guests were invited to a second restaurant but we were not allowed.

Booking.com advertised shows and animators but there were none.
processed_text_Review_text: the perfect end to our trip around sri lanka

Review_text_2:
The best thing about this hotel is the nature. You will be surrounded by monkeys, birds, chipmunks, iguanas (who may sometimes even swim in the pool :) ), little crabs, not to mention dogs, cats, fish in the ponds, and all kinds of insects, big and small.
The territory is pretty green and provides a lot of natural shade, saving you from sunburn.
Massage in the Spa was good.
The room we were in was pretty spacious and featured a beautiful view over one of the pools and a little "chunk" of the ocean. The food was good, and the selection was quite interesting, mixing local and more "European-oriented" cuisines in a balanced way.
Review_text_3:
In terms of service, this is the worst experience we've had so far :D. I travelled through over 40 countries, and nowhere did I see the personnel so chilled - but not in a good way :) 
Restaurant & bar team easily forgets your order, and even when they don't, you can wait for a simple coffee in a bar with 2 tables occupied for over 0.5 hour. They  graciously add someone else's drinks to your bill (8 glasses of wine instead of actual 2? easy!) Moreover, some of them literally beg for tips, and when you tip them, it doesn't mean the service becomes any better. I had a birthday on the first night of our stay, but the reception forgot to inform the restaurant, so we went to ask for a candle. On the same evening we asked for refill of water, coffee and tea in the room (we didn't get a refill on that day, so we called the reception to ask for it as they themselves advised us to do), but instead a boy came with a brewed coffee charged extra...

The room keys didn't work on one day, so we had to go all the way back to the reception to then be escorted back to the room by the maintenance guy who spent quite some time fixing the issue. Oh, and as for maintenance, you simply can't be left in peace here - e.g., laundry man barbarically opens your door even with the DND sign on...
Last but not least, on arrival, my bank card didn't work, while on the check-out it did. Quite strange. Luckily we had another card.

Will I recommend this hotel? Not really. Maybe only for 1-night stay to enjoy the beauty of nature. But if you want nice service and a proper care you would expect for this price, avoid this place. :)

Review_text: Beautiful (and pricey!) destination ruined by huge groups of rude and uncultured guests.
Review_text_2: I love this place for its beauty and architecture and have been coming here for years (the first time 30 years ago as it was my Sri Lankan father’s favourite) . However the profile of the hotel seems to have changed -accommodating large groups of badly behaved guests has brought the experience down .
Review_text_3: As mentioned above the hotels seems to have changed its profile. The first thing that meets you after the majestic entry, that took my breath away the first time I came, is a large Russian banner. The hotel seems to accommodate huge groups of tourists from this country and many of them behave badly, bringing glass bottles into the pool, (drinking a lot in general) ignoring the personnel, treating the personnel like lesser beings (we saw this several times) and not greeting, making eye contact, or even acknowledging fellow hotel guests. I can understand that the world situation makes this awkward for them, but if you choose to travel out, you should make the effort- not expect to take over a beautiful tropical destination and ignore and cancel all others just by outnumbering them. I will not return to Heritance Ahungalla (the Triton to me) until this has changed. It was very expensive too, which is such a shame when the experience is so negative. I can understand the need to make money, but ruining such a beautiful hotel and experience along the way can hardly be worth it in the long run . I’m sure the architect Geoffrey Bawa would’ve hated this development!

Review_text: Do bot recommend to stay here
Review_text_2: It’s 5 stars hotel with guaranteed cleanness and some degree of service
Review_text_3:
1. The hotel did not reply my inquiries I sent via booking.com. Unlike other hotels I booked via booking.com, they always replied within 24 hours.
2. In contrast, they charged the room fee one day before I arrived based on the credit card info left here. My experience is the credit card is used for guarantee while other (5 stars) hotels will check with me my payment preferences when I check in. They can charge me via credit card if I didn’t show up in the end.
3. I asked if I can have late check-out at 12:30 one night before checkout date. Hotel staff just told me she can’t confirm it right now and asked me to check again the next day morning. My feeling is they don’t care customer satisfaction but care more abt their occupancy rate as this is 5 star hotel, which they probably think they can always get sufficient tourists to stay.
4. Lastly, some staff i.e breakfast time is less patient.

Review_text_2: Das Hotel an sich ist wunderschön, besonders gefallen hat uns die Parkanlage und dass man dort im Schatten der Bäume seine Ruhe hat.
Review_text_3:
Wir hatten das Deluxe Zimmer mit 2 Einzelbetten gebucht! Unser Zimmer entsprach in keinster Weise der Beschreibung und den Bildern bei Booking.com.
Das Zimmer war klein!! Ich denke, dass kleinste im ganzen Hotel!
Der angeführte Sitzbereich war nicht vorhanden, er hätte auch gar keinen Platz gehabt. Um die Klappe zum Wasserkocher öffnen zu können, musste man den Kasten verschieben, der Schreibtisch war im Weg. Safe war auch keiner vorhanden, wurde uns aber auf Nachfrage in den Kasten gestellt.
Bei unserem Zimmer stand der Zusatz:  Free room Upgrade upon available, Early Check In&Late Checkout upon available...war leider nicht möglich, mit der Begründung, dass Hotel wäre voll. 
Wir waren eine ganze Woche dort und bemerkten, dass dem, allem Anschein nach, nicht so war! 
Wir hatten das Zimmer nur mit Frühstück gebucht, hätten im Hotel gerne das eine oder andere gegessen oder getrunken.
Das kommt aber wirklich teuer, ein Teller French Fries knapp 10 Euro! Es kommt bei allem,was auf der Karte steht noch insgesamt 28% dazu!
Schade!
processed_text_Review_text_2: the hotel itself is beautiful, we particularly liked the park and that you have your peace in the shade of the trees.
processed_text_Review_text_3:
we had booked the deluxe room with 2 single beds! our room did not correspond to the description and pictures at booking.com.
the room was small !! i think the smallest in the whole hotel!
the seating area listed was not available, it would have had no place at all. in order to open the flap to the kettle, you had to move the box, the desk was in the way. nobody was there either, but we were put in the box on request.
in our room the addition: free room upgrade upon available, early check in & late checkout upon available ... was unfortunately not possible, on the grounds that hotel would be full. 
we were there for a whole week and noticed that it was not that, it was not so! 
we had only booked the room with breakfast, would have liked to eat or drank one or the other in the hotel.
but that comes really expensive, a plate of french frieze just under 10 euros! with everything on the map, there is still 28% on the map!
too bad!

Review_text_2:
Хорошие номера. Небольшие, но уютные, хорошо меблированы, чисто, удобная кровать. 
Замечательные очень большие бассейны. Их целых два на огромной территории. 
Тишина, никакой музыки. Постояльцы в основном люди в возрасте. Идеально для спокойного отпуска.
Еда в ресторане хорошая (но дорого). 
Первая линия. Океан прямо перед глазами.
Review_text_3:
Огромные неуютные пространства внутри отеля. Километровые пустые коридоры. Все, что за пределами номера как будто в запустении. Сам по себе отель (не считая опять-таки комнат) производит впечатление старого советского пансионата, руководство которого осталось где-то в 80-х

Раздутый персонал. Десятки людей мельтешат туда - сюда, но толково помочь с конкретным вопросом они не могут. На ресепшне нас регистрировало 8 человек (!). Между ними был бардак и неразбериха. В итоге мы ждали 40 мин, чтобы отсунировали наши паспорта и дали оплатить комнаты. 

Нет оборудованной зоны на пляже. Отель стоит на первой линии и имеет прямой выход к океану, но территория для отдыха не оборудована. Нет лежаков, зонтиков, урн, охраны. Просто сеточный забор заканчивается и дальше иди себе сам на песок. Может кому-то такой дикий вариант и по душе, но я не смогла сидеть спокойно и читать на песке, потому что ко мне приставали все проходящие мимо мутные личности. Пяти минут не давали спокойно посидеть. Кто-то все время что-то продавал, предлагал, хотел поболтать и тд. Если бы отель огородил свою территорию, такого не было бы. Так что на дикий пляж по сути ходить не очень нужен комфортно. 
К тому же отель не чистит его. И песок завален пластиком и мусором, принесенным  волнами.
processed_text_Review_text_2:
good rooms. small, but cozy, well furnished, clean, comfortable bed. 
wonderful very large pools. there are two of them in a vast territory. 
silence, no music. guests are mostly people aged. ideal for calm leave.
the food in the restaurant is good (but expensive). 
the first line. the ocean is right before the eyes.
processed_text_Review_text_3:
huge uncomfortable spaces inside the hotel. kilometer empty corridors. all that is outside the room as if in desolation. the hotel itself (not counting the rooms again) gives the impression of the old soviet boarding house, whose leadership remained somewhere in the 80s

brown personnel. dozens of people are flickering to it - there, but they cannot sensibly help with a specific question. at the reception we were registered by 8 people (!). between them was a mess and confusion. as a result, we waited 40 minutes to absent our passports and let the rooms pay. 

there is no equipped area on the beach. the hotel stands on the first line and has a direct exit to the ocean, but the territory for rest is not equipped. there are no sunbeds, umbrellas, urns, security. just the grid fence ends and then go to your own sand. maybe someone likes such a wild option, but i could not sit calmly and read in the sand, because all muddy personalities passing by me molested me. five minutes were not allowed to sit calmly. someone all the time sold something, suggested, wanted to chat, etc. if the hotel fenced its territory, this would not have happened. so in essence, it is not really comfortable to go to the wild beach. 
in addition, the hotel does not clean him. and the sand is littered with plastic and garbage brought by the waves.

Review_text_2: O parte din personal este amabil.
Review_text_3:
Am avut upgrade de camera gratuit, obtinut prin booking, insa pentru ei asta insemna sa ne dea aceeai camera, doar ca la un etaj superior. Dupa ce am stat 3 ore in receptie am reusit sa obtinem camera conform rezervarii, insa nu are legatura cu pozele. Mucegai in camera. Pretul de 250 de dolari pe noapte este exagerat pentru o camera cu tavanul plin de mucegai. Mancarea nu este chiar buna. Peste pretul din meniu se va adauga: 10% servicii, 3% alte taxe si peste toate astea (pretul de baza + 10% + 3%) se adauga tva de 18% la toata suma. 
Hotelul este plin de rusi, ceea ce nu este placut pentru noi cei din lumea civilizata. Se trezesc de dimineata, isi pun prosoapele pe sezlong pentru a le rezerva si se duc inapoi la somn. Apar abia pe la 12, timp in care tu nu gasesti sezlong liber.
processed_text_Review_text_2: some of the staff is kind.
processed_text_Review_text_3:
i had a free room upgrade, obtained by booking, but for them it meant to give us the same room, just like a higher floor. after staying for 3 hours in the reception we managed to get the room according to the reservation, but it is not related to the pictures. mold in the room. the price of $ 250 per night is exaggerated for a room with the ceiling full of mold. the food is not really good. to the price in the menu will be added: 10% services, 3% other taxes and above all (the basic price + 10% + 3%) is added 18% to the whole amount. 
the hotel is full of russians, which is not pleasant for us those in the civilized world. they wake up in the morning, put their towels on the sunbed to book them and go back to sleep. they appear only at 12, during which time you do not find free lounge chair.

Review_text_2:
Room was decent, nothing fancy. Beachfront was nothing to die for. There are so many better beaches in southern coastline of Sri Lanka.

The let down was how the hotel staff discriminate between dark skin people and white skin people. Initially I thought it was a mistake, then a coincidence when differential treatment continued and then understood it is a systemic issue in this facility. All 3 of us had experiences that we can relate to.

Also, they make you wear a wrist band during your stay: reminds me of a hospital admission. Perhaps, they cannot remember that you are a hotel guest without having the band.

Pools are good and the pool boys also nice. 

The housekeeping staff, especially Rukmal is amazing.

Downside;
The hotel has terrible price policy. You need to pay for everything + 18% and extra service charge. The prices are huge and complexity unfair. This is the reason why I will not return here.

Review_text_2:
Disappointing Dining Experience at Ahungalla Heritance

I had high expectations when visiting Ahungalla Heritance (part of the Aitken Spence chain), but the food quality was a major disappointment. The lunch buffet was underwhelming, with most dishes lacking salt and flavor. The fried rice, made with samba rice, was a poor choice and didn’t complement the rest of the dishes at all.

Tea-time snacks were no better—minimal variety and nothing appetizing or memorable. We even raised our concerns with the chefs, but unfortunately, there was no noticeable improvement.

For a reputed hotel chain, the dining experience was far below standard. I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and works on upgrading their food quality and variety.
processed_text_Review_text_2:

Review_text: Popular and busy hotel with locals. A bit tired.
Review_text_2:
This was the last stop on a busy 2-week Group Tour of Sri Lanka. It was our least favourite hotel. It looks tired in places. 
We had a spacious ground floor room with a small triangular shaped bathroom. The shower doors looked in need of a good clean. Our patio doors we discovered hadn't been locked properly so anyone could have pushed them open. In the early hours of the first morning we heard 2 distinctive taps on the patio doors which was unnerving. We didn't get up to investigate but whilst the hotel is behind gates and security at the front it seemed to me that there was nothing stopping anyone wandering in off the beach area.
This hotel is very popular with locals especially at weekends so when we arrived the hotel was packed with a large group of young men playing volleyball in the main pool. All sunbeds were taken by families sitting round chatting. As this was the only day of R & R part on our trip it was a bit concerning but by Sunday afternoon things had quietened down.
This is a very large busy hotel so breakfast was a bun fight and it took us 10-15 minutes to get served tea or coffee.
Nice outside seating area by one of the bars. 
As you are nearer Colombo you will get pestered on the beach to buy things.
The sea was too rough to swim in and there are dangerous rip tides.
There is nothing to do locally but we did visit the Victor Hasselblad Sea Turtle Research And Conservation Centre just 3 miles up the road. Well worth an hour's visit to see the wonderful work they are doing.  None of the multiple hotel staff hanging around reception had heard of it even though it is literally up the same road. But a taxi driver Googled it for us and took us there and back. 
The Hotel is off one busy road with shops and other Hotels but not in a specially pretty area. 
This area was impacted by the tsunami so you will see little graveyards and monuments in memory of people who lost their lives. Especially on the train that got swept off the track.
Review_text_3: I wouldn't recommend booking this hotel. It is aimed at locals more and is a bit tired. Old bedroom furniture, old towels by the poolside.
processed_text_Review_text: popular and busy hotel with locals. a bit tired.

Review_text_2:
Our last visit to this wonderful hotel was in 2022. We have also been coming since the early 2000’s too.
We had a very nice suite on the 3rd level, overlooking the main pool and near the main restaurant. 
Despite the rainy weather and rough seas in October, we had a great time. 
Food (as buffet menu) was fantastic, staff were very helpful. Any little issues we’re dealt with professionally and quickly.
We would like to thank all the staff we had contact with. Special thanks go to Ms Jayaru in Customer Relations, Chaminda in housekeeping, Ms Hasini and Duminda (who remembered us from 2022) in the main restaurant. They were able to reserve a table by the window we liked. 
A very enjoyable stay and a place we would recommend.
Review_text_3: We prefer to come during weekdays and avoiding holidays which will be busier times. Around 2 hrs from Colombo via the highway.

Review_text_2:
Very nice hotel. 
Well situated on the beach. 2 gorgeous large swimming pools, clean and clear. The food was excellent with a tremendous variety of fish and seafood cooked to perfection. Nightly live music. Nice poolside bar that made excellent drinks. 
Staff were friendly and professional. 
Highly recommend
Review_text_3: The ocean is pretty rough. Red flags were out all 3 days.
processed_text_Review_text_2:
very nice hotel. 
well situated on the beach. 2 gorgeous large swimming pools, clean and clear. the food was excellent with a tremendous variety of fish and seafood cooked to perfection. nightly live music. nice poolside bar that made excellent drinks. 
staff were friendly and professional.

processed_text_Review_text_3: the ocean is pretty rough. red flags were out all 3 days.

Review_text_2:
My wife and I spent two amazing nights with our cousin Nishanthi and Savi who took us to Heritance Ahungalle on the start of our vacation in Srilanka.
The hospitality and friendliness of the staff was evident from the moment we stepped in to the lobby.
our room on the 3rd floor overlooking the Indian  ocean was spectacular. the room was very spacious and comfortable. The balcony outside the room afforded us time to read and relax in the evening.the bathroom was very clean and had ample counter space to keep our toiletries.
I must make special mention of the unbelievable spread at each if the buffet meals. We arrived just in time for the lunch buffet Starting with soup to salads to Srilankan Indian Chinese and western dishes the spread was enormous. The dessert menu too was too numerous to
mention. The  dinner and breakfast menus were excellent with the gourmet spread to cover every pallet needs.
We must  make special mention of Mr. Pradeep Guneratne the FnB Executive who ensured our stay was memorable, Being a long weekend in Srilanka the hotel
was at its capacity. Pradeep and his staff ensured that the guests were seated with the minimum wait times. Pradeep surprised us with a special dish of Srilankan crab curry Coconut sambol and roast bread which truly was a delicacy we had not had in years.
Thank you Nishanthi and Savi for choosing Heritance Ahungalle to host us for a relaxing stay, our sincere appreciation to Pradeep and staff at Heritance for the comfortable stay and providing us a great culinary experience.
Review_text_3: avoid long weekends as it gets crowded with locals but the guests are very freindly too

Review_text_2:
Heritance Ahungalla is really a lovely place to visit  with a marvelous architecture and a beautiful beach. Though  our stay was short we enjoyed a lot ,as there were a lot of extra activities indoors and outdoors as well. Rooms were very clean ,buffet meals offered were delicious with so many verities to choose as two in our family were vegetarians.,most of all what I loved was the way the whole team at Heritance had prepared our room and organised a small birthday party as we visited the hotel intending to celebrate my birthday....special thanks to Restaurant manager Mr.Duminda and his extraordinary, workaholic team who worked throughout tirelessly to make all the guests a memorable unforgettable stay.
Thank you once again for making our visit feel joyous and memorable.

There are two big pools, one is a bit quiter and secluded for more a relaxing atmospshere if requiredThe restaurant offers delicious food of all kind, a lot of local dishes and a great choice of deserts. Review_text: 1st time in Sri Lanka- And what an experience
Review_text_2:
We stayed in Heritance Hotel for couple of weeks in mid June 2024.
We are family of 3 and this was our 1st Holiday in Sri Lanka. On arrival to the hotel we were greeted in very friendly way by lovely staff. Our room was amazing- The biggest we ever had on this kind of Holiday. The bathroom was also big and we always had plenty of fresh towels and toiletries. 
Hotel is very environmentally friendly and what we loved was that everything in the bathroom was plastic free. 
 One of the 1st things we noticed about the hotel was just cleaned and well maintained it was. The gardens were well tended too- The gardener would always prepare fresh bouquet of flowers and through it directly to us in the morning on the balcony... such a nice gesture
2 swimming pools were always clean and watched by professional staff - we actually witnessed couple of emergencies - The staff was well trained and attended without delay. In both instances it was resolved quickly and successfully

Other Hotel  staff were extremely hard working-  you could not ask for nicer bunch. We had Raveesha and Kalinga among others looking after us at the bar most of the evenings-  most hard working people I ever met. Always smiling , would literally go over and beyond to make sure our Holiday would go smoothly
In the evening we had Duminda in charge looking after us in the restaurant- Again- what a hard working- always smiling person !  He also advised us on local area and which places best to visit to make our Holiday extra special
In the restaurant we could not be be more happy with selection of food. Hotel was very quiet some days due to low season and we would be served at the table- There was always interesting , tasty food on the menu. The days when hotel got busy and restaurant was running at 100% it was packed with delicious fresh food. We love tasting local cuisine and we were spoiled for choice. 
During the days we tried to explore Sri Lanka and on our returns we often felt like returning home- greeted as family in most friendly manner. We were even invited to be part of the Poya celebration which was organized by hotel for the local people
It was absolute pleasure to spend 2 weeks here and we are very grateful to all hardworking staff for looking after us. 
We look forward to see you hopefully some time again
Review_text_3: Please do not expect to swim in the sea- we were told from April to September the currents are so strong the sea is closed to swimming.

Excellent facilities. Pleasing environment with 2  large pools and access to a golden sand beach.
Staff was very attentive to every need and it is the hospitality that stood out the most. 
Hotel had nightly entertainment, very good dining options, and plenty of outdoor spaces for quiet times. 
Highly recommend Heritance for a relaxing vacation.

Review_text: Relaxing day with great service and facilities all around
Review_text_2:
Exellent hotel with staff dedicated to serving the guests. From Checkin to the bell desk to the restaurant, the staff is always smiling and ready to attend to your needs.

The food served at the main restaurant on all 3 meals is very good. There are few live food options also which is very good. The only disappointment is the desert section, which is nothing much, certainly no verity.

Rooms are big with comfy beds, fluffy towels, excellent amenities, and a good combination  of tea and coffee. You are set for a comfortable stay.

Because  of the heavy rains, we used the pool only for a limited time. But they do have 2 large pools and a pool bar also.
Review_text_3: Avoid rainy season, especially Southwest monsoon season, because outdoor activity will be limited, including  pool access.

Review_text: Very dissapointing stay here, wouldn’t stay here again.
Review_text_2:
This is meant to be a 5 star hotel, but is lacking in so many areas.

The positives first. The restaurant staff and room cleaning staff were excellent.  The rooms are very nice, spacious and beds are extremely comfortable.

Unfortunately the reception staff and management were extremely unhelpful and didn’t address issues when highlighted.

We visited during Sri Lankan new year and we knew shops and restaurants would be closed, we asked the reception staff and were advised Fri and sat (which is what we expected) I also asked if they knew if restaurants in Galle would be open on the Sunday and was advised they would all be closed as still new year so better to stay at the hotel. This was incorrect as a discovered through a Facebook forum and visited Galle on the Sunday were all restaurants were open. This felt like an attempt to keep you in the hotel spending money.

The prices at the hotel were also questionable. The hotel we stayed in the week before had clear pricing on there menu  eg Nani goreng 1800 Sri Lankan rupees.  The heritance menu do 10% state service charge to be added, but also to be added is 18% vat meaning the prices stated which were already at least 20% higher than the previous 5star rated hotel we had stayed in were much more costly than other similarly rated hotels and more concerningly this isn’t clear.

The pools open at 8am which is fine as they need to clean them, but the bed cover and towels aren’t available until 8am and as I am an early riser and like to get up and spend some time in the sun before breakfast and the sun gets too hot this was disappointing. Also out of the 5 nights we stayed here I had to trek around the resort on 3 separate days to find a pool attendant as you can’t get the mattress and towels yourself, having gone to reception on 2 occasions it took until 9 am on 2 of the days to get the towels and mattresses, and all the manager Clive could do was apologise, which given it happened again the following morning was very poor. The issue clearly hadn’t been addressed. Also around the pool, wasn’t cleaned with cigarette ends (dissapointing that’s scruffy guests leave this is the first place) plastic bottles and beer caps left on the grass for the last 4 days we were there. 

I would not recommend this hotel to stay at and instead would highly recommend the 5 star Taj Bentota which is only 20 minutes away and is excellent with much more around the hotel as well which if you want to explore is great.
processed_text_Review_text: very dissapointing stay here, wouldn’t stay here again.

Review_text: 1 star hotel not 5!!!! Do not go
Review_text_2: The worst hotel I’ve been to, even 1 star is a lot , this should be a 5 stars hotel but it’s the total opposite, rooms are very old and dirty, corridors are horrible, and when I made a complain their explanation was it’s rustic architecture not dirty and it’s not an international hotel it’s a National hotel, which didn’t make any sense to me What does cleanliness have to do with National or international, the restaurant was like a fish market, stations were unclean and no hygiene at all, in the reception they were putting a welcome drink trolley when I stood by it the servant told me that it’s only for check In customers, people in the hotel aren’t allowed to drink which is very funny… I came with my family to relax for couple of days but unfortunately it was a disaster..

Review_text: I do not recommend it if you have actually previously vacationed in 4*-5* hotels.
Review_text_2: Categorically unacceptable conditions in controversial situations, the hotel thinks only about profit. This is not a 5* hotel, the furniture and renovations are from the 80s, and in some places there is fungus in the showers and on the balconies. Location is the end of the world, transfer to civilization from the hotel is very expensive for Sri Lanka. I do not recommend it if you have actually previously vacationed in 4*-5* hotels.

Review_text_2:
The hotel really is tired, needs updating and a good clean in places , some staff rude and unhelpful.  All inclusive package is not worth the money as they run out of the decent beer and water down cordial to put into spirits as you can’t have fresh juice. Food is very good. I find the hotel is not like the pictures.  Sun beds are filthy and in need of a clean. Swimming pools are too hot and could do with some cold water as it is not refreshing when your sunbathing and need to cool down.electrical sockets came out of the wall and needed to be repaired, patio doors did not shut properly this also had to be rectified. Needed som information on transport from reception and we were told to Google it, Unbelievable.  Shame there is not separate smoking areas as you choke on smoke wherever you go. 
I am well travelled and shocked that this hotel shows 4 stars.
Other than this I would recommend to anyone who wants a 3 star hotel.
Review_text_3: You have to travel quite far for any experiences a lot of trips leave at 4.30 in the morning

Of all the hotels I've been to, I will definitely return to this one! All the staff are Unique! These are not just staff, these are people every fine hotel should have! Exceptional professionals who know how to make your stay and vacation unforgettable! Spotlessly clean room daily, thank you Lokusuviqa. Pastry Chef Kavinda Hashan, followed every single detail meticulously, assisted all the guests punctually, nothing was missing. Special thanks to Kaveesha and Dilsha- guest relations executive, you girls are awesome. The guy who used to make my unique vegetables, thanks Prarodha, you are the top.
And now I pay special attention to a wonderful boy who really impressed me a lot.
Special thanks to CHAMUDITHA who is an amazing SUPERVISOR . He is extremely responsive and helpful throughout our stay. His positive spirit made our stay very nice and smiling. For sure for our next holiday we will back in Sri Lanka Heritance hotel . Thanks to Chamuditha .
All good hotels should have such staff!
My stay at this hotel was simply fantastic and I would recommend it to everyone I know!

Review_text: Not bad but desperately needs improvements
Review_text_2:
The hotel itself is more than enough for a great holiday. You have your pool, your beach, and your room. The staff is polite and friendly. The food is good to great. Lots of meats and veggies. We only had breakfast and dinner - both were good. 

However, there were many problems. The rooms are somewhat clean. I believe Sri Lanka was open for tourism long enough to learn how to properly serve customers, but they are still… bad. So don’t expect a perfect room. Rukmal - good cleaner who tried his best to make our stay more pleasant. Appreciate the towel elephant) 

Also - as long as you are not afraid of wild animals (monkeys, monitor lizards, insects), you will be fine. Otherwise, there are not many places to go to on the hotel premises. These animals are everywhere and I personally was terrified. Nevertheless, great opportunity to get close to wildlife! 

Overall, the weather and the ocean were unbelievable! Everything else is just a minor inconvenience. Would recommend!
Review_text_3: Go outside the hotel and get a tuktuk to the bazaar - cheap exotic fruits.
processed_text_Review_text: not bad but desperately needs improvements
processed_text_Review_text_2:
the hotel itself is more than enough for a great holiday. you have your pool, your beach, and your room. the staff is polite and friendly. the food is good to great. lots of meats and veggies. we only had breakfast and dinner - both were good. 

however, there were many problems. the rooms are somewhat clean. i believe sri lanka was open for tourism long enough to learn how to properly serve customers, but they are still… bad. so don’t expect a perfect room. rukmal - good cleaner who tried his best to make our stay more pleasant. appreciate the towel elephant) 

also - as long as you are not afraid of wild animals (monkeys, monitor lizards, insects), you will be fine. otherwise, there are not many places to go to on the hotel premises. these animals are everywhere and i personally was terrified. nevertheless, great opportunity to get close to wildlife! 

overall, the weather and the ocean were unbelievable! everything else is just a minor inconvenience. would recommend!
processed_text_Review_text_3: go outside the hotel and get a tuktuk to the bazaar - cheap exotic fruits.

Review_text: Beautiful hotel designed by Geoffrey Bawa
Review_text_2:
We stayed only one night in the hotel which was fully booked this day. The only option was to confirm a suite room. Price was ok since I am a resident and the room spacious and clean.
The bath hub is a catastrophe since you cannot enter. The rain shower also should be repaired....
The highlight was the food. Huge selection of local and international food in good quality. 
I asked for the chef to thank him. His name was Lakmal.

Review_text: Potential to be great and probably once was, but not now !
Review_text_2: My stay at Heritance Ahungalla was disappointing. The management's poor communication left me frustrated, and the staff although willing to help where poorly trained, lacked any authority or understanding of their own systems & processes which lead to a subpar service. The food and bed linens were only of average quality, further diminishing the overall experience.

Review_text: Need some improvements as a five star
Review_text_2:
I was there for two nights with two of my French friends (Tour Operators) 
The first impression on arrival was extremally good and the welcome was quite impressive even together with the General manager himself of the hotel.
Well trained staff in every department and food served was too extraordinary and absolutely there was nothing to grumble...

However as a five-star property, this hotel needs an immediate renovation pretty soon. The corridors and most of the other public places look very dull and gloomy.
Whilst thanking the management for providing us luxury renovated rooms, we also noticed during the hotel visit that the non-renovated rooms too need an immediate upgrading to compete with the upcoming new properties nearby.
(it has been noticed that some renovations especially on the roof are underway)

Review_text_2:
I am still here, few more days left!

The food is lovely, and the staff are brilliant - always there to support. The breakfast and dinner buffets were out of this world. The only minor improvement needed is for the lunch buffet, as it's not actually a buffet - you have to order the main meal, which can take a while. The rooms are clean and well kept, but they do look tired. Don't forget to bring your plug adapters. The only quirk is that without the Venetian blind, there's visibility into the toilet and bathroom, so it's more suitable for partners.

What might need improving, room facilities, the bathroom/toilet.

Can see into the toilet and bathroom, unless you have the blinds down.

Lunch is not a buffet. You will have to order from a  set menu.

Review_text_2: It was a family trip with my husband and my 16-month-old son. The room was very good. We booked a Premium King with Sea View, but we got a pool-view room. However, the view was not bad but wished they gave us what we booked. The food was not as I expected at all. I stayed at this hotel a few years ago and the food was amazing then but this time the food was very average. I got a rotten taste in one of the meat items. The jacuzzis in the pool area were not working also. Overall it was a bad experience because we had high expectations compared to the last stay. Nevertheless, we liked the rooms very much. It was very clean.

Review_text_2: As a well travelled guest, Heritance Ahungalla was one of the worst hotels I have been to. My friends and I arrived at the hotel after a long day, expecting the welcome they advertise. But we were greeted with nothing and yet I noticed the foreign tour group next to us at the hotel were getting a great welcome. The foreign guests were given a welcome drink in front of me and even when j was checking in, nothing was really done. This was extremely disappointing to see as their attention was on the foreign guests, even though the hotels are kept afloat by locals even in times of crisis. In a sense, it felt as if I and my friends were purposefully ignored at the welcome to focus on white people. Next, the rooms were OK and clean with the needed amenities. The pool was ok and the environment was relaxing and calm. But the Jacuzzis are broken and one was unusable. This really dampened the experience. Thirdly, the buffet. The food experience was TERRIBLE. I stayed ful board for 2 days and the food was the same everytime. There was not much variety and so, it was really disappointing. At one point during lunch, I found MOLD in my food!!! The same night during dinner, my friends and I ate carved roast pork and the meat was rotten. It smelled bad and when I ate a bite, it was so rotten and I had to throw it away. The breakfast buffet had some diversity and was enjoyable. The staff is nice and accommodates our wish. The bar makes a really good cocktail called the green pool. Other than that, it was a poor experience. Serving bad food to guests and ignoring local guests to focus only on foreign guests was what made me write this review. I never badly review anyplace I travel to unless its horrible, like ahungalla was. It did not serve a purpose to my business trip either. Would never visit again.

Review_text: Celebrated Earth Day by getting choked in air full with Kerosene
Review_text_2: We were unfortunate to stay at this hotel on a day that they celebrated the Earth Day in 2023. We love, encourage, and actively participate in similar programs.  The problem was, how the hotel management went about the celebration and their lack of planning. Hotel management decided to shut all electrical lights in the downstairs lobby area, then lighted kerosene torches. There were so may kerosene torches lit all over the area (including bar, near pool etc.) and the smell was unbearable, air was unbreathable. Add 100C temperature and humidity to the situation and it was absolute hell. What was the point of this stupid show? They probably added more pollutant to the air by burning all the kerosene for few hours than the greenhouse gases emitted to generate electricity. Stupidity at its best was in display at Heritance Ahungalla on 3/23/23.

Friendly staff.

Pretty an ordinary set-up, not the hotel it used to be.

Review_text: Classy stay, brilliant surroundings, warm hospitality and good food!
Review_text_2: Located 10km north of the city of Ambalangoda, Heritance Ahungalla offers classy stay along a beautiful beach. It has two pools, one with two heated Jacuzzis and a friendly staff. We were warmly received by Ms. Mithma who showed us around and made us feel home. The room balcony had a magnificent view to the Indian Ocean and the beach. The food could have been better, but it was definitely above average. We will surely come back for another stay for the beach and the hospitality!
Review_text_3: Traveling to Ambalangoda and getting a tuk/bus from there would be a cheap way of traveling.

Review_text: Average experience.. Needs improvements to keep up with other five start hotels
Review_text_2:
Well The overall experience is not bad.. The two Pools were clean, big and had a good time swimming.. But the Jacuzzi pools were not clean.. Was very unpleasant to get in.. staff is friendly and supportive, except the staff in the buffet area.. Its like they are annoyed with the guests who are dining there..  One girl poured water to the glass until its over flowed.. She apologised but ddnt have enough time to clean it for us she got occupied with something else.. I dont blame her, But the hotel management becauae it seemed like they were over worked the shifts.. Some of them were exhausted and unable to provide the service as expected by the guests paid for a pleasant dining time.. Poor service from taking away the finished plates to filling up the finished dishes.. Buffet was average in my opinion, food is good, considerable amount of variety was there.. but i hope they can improve a lil bit more when it comes to buffet and dining.. 

Apart from that the stay was satisfying.. We booked  a premium delux room.. Which was spacious and clean.. But the bed was uncomfortable.. I expected for the bathrooms to be cleaner and more pleasant looking for a five start hotel..  Heard complaints from the guests in deluxe rooms.. So make sure to book higher rooms..

I recommend this hotel for a get away with avarage expectations.. Surely not upto five star standards specially compared to herritance kandalama..

The reception staff was very nice.. The check in was easy and quick.. Beach was clean.. Place is quiet and peaceful.. Just some improvements are needed to keep up the five star standards..
Review_text_3: Buffet experience was poor..

Review_text_2:
Driven by excellent previous experiences we had at Heritance Kandalama, we booked a 3 nights’ half-board stay at Ahungalla with similar expectations: that we will receive a service in accordance to a 5 stars hotel, customer oriented and with attention to detail. But unfortunately this was not the case. With the exception of the reception staff who was very friendly and efficient, the rest was below the average, especially at the main restaurant. On more than one occasion had to make exaggerated gestures to catch the waiters’ attention and had to repeat our order of water and or coffee during breakfast and dinner. The used plates were often not removed, so we either had to again make exaggerated gestures to get the assistance of a waiter or make room ourselves. On top of that, getting the food from the buffet was quite a stressful experience by having to dodge tables, chairs and people (it was way too crowded!). 
Likewise, we faced a similar situation at the infinity pool bar. Given that the waiter was taking too long to come –we opted for standing up and going to the bar too make our order. Then we had to do a similar thing to get the bill as well. It was also quite unfortunate that the bar from the guests’ pool was not operative and no equipment was provided to get a better use of the lovely beach (lounge chairs and sunshades).
A real pity, we expected much more from what it used to be such an iconic hotel.

Review_text_2:
We stayed here in January / February 2023. The hotel its self is a beautiful building and was immaculately clean and well maintained. as far as I could tell all the rooms faced the beach with either a balcony or terrace. Our room 219 was clean and well equipped with everything you would expect from a hotel of this standard. There are two pools one is a quiet pool where ball games etc are not allowed the other is for fun and games, the pool attendants are friendly and and attentive. There is also a reasonably well equipped gym and a spa which is really well priced.

We found the staff to be so friendly and nothing was  too much trouble every request was met with a smile and service was efficient and prompt. The food was very good although if I had one suggestion it would be to remember that not everyone likes spice in their food, my wife is one who does not and on occasions found her choices very limited, but then there was always cake!!

To conclude I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and should we decide to return to Sri Lanka (and I hope we do) we would certainly go back to Heritance.

Review_text_2:
We've been holidaying at Heritance Ahungalle for around 10 years, and have always loved it. Unfortunately it's now in a very sorry state. I can no longer recommend it. 

The management is shoddy, and the staff barely trained. We faced a catalogue of bad experiences - long waits at check in, meals not being available until 20-30 minutes after advertised start time, wrong orders at bar, shoddy service .... and on and on.

The swimming pools and beach are still excellent. But the rest has sadly been allowed to slip. Such a pity.

Review_text_2: It was an overall disappointing stay at Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel was fully booked during our stay, given the holiday season. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly. It is an old building and definitely needs maintenance, particularly the rooms. For a 5-star property, the room is small, and the toilet hardly has any space in it, which is not what you'd expect given the star category this hotel boasts about and when compared to other similar 5-star hotels and resorts in Sri Lanka. The quality of the extra bed in the triple room would possibly befit a 2 or 3 star hotel. On the other hand, the king bed in the room was very comfortable, and one of the pluses was the sea view from the room, which was amazing. The food lacked variety and if you are a vegetarian, stay away from Heritance Ahungalla. They simply don't cater to those needs, even if you make a special note of it. The lunch buffet was the worst of the three meals we had. This was brought to the attention of the chef and the restaurant manager, and they were most apologetic, but it was an overall bitter experience in the end at Heritance Ahungalla. On the contrary, the desserts were superb and delicious. Overall, our stay did not offer any value for money, so I would never visit or recommend this hotel.

We stayed nearly two weeks with our little one at Heritage Ahungalla which was an amazing experience. Thanks heaps for Dhananja and his front desk staff for your immense hospitality. Dhananja is very friendly, polite and did his best to make us comfortable which was beyond our expectations. Also Duminda Restaurant Manager and his crew for being such caring and thoughtful for our needs and offering their utmost  service to our family that can't be any better than that. We would like to extend our gratitude to all the housekeeping staff, pool staff and security guards for the amazing job they are doing at Heritance..Thank you for the love you all have shown at our little one who missed it badly back home and we very well know that he dearly loved every single hug, thouch and kiss from almost every MAMA and NANDA at the hotel. See you soon guys..

Tharanga ,Arya and little Aegon

THE HOTEL IS LOOKING VERY DATED AND IN NEED OF A FACE LIFT AND THE FOOD IS NOT  UP TO 5 STAR DINING, THE MENU WAS QUITE LIMITED, BREAKFAST MUCH BETTER THAN EVEING MEALS. Review_text_2:
This is the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed. Not compared to other 5 star hotels even just some random hotel with no star ratings is better than this.
Our check-in was at 2.00 and we arrived at about 1.50 and the person there asked if we are starting from dinner and she said lunch will be closing at 2.30. once we went to get the lunch all the tables were full. they told us to wait outside till a table is available.
we booked 2 sea view rooms and only view we got was pool. rooms were not cleaned properly. you cannot even walk barefoot on those floors. bathrooms were dirty and not properly maintained.
we went to the pool at about 7.00pm and the person there told us the pool will be closing in 10 minutes. but when we asked before they told they close the pool at 8.00pm. the guy at the pool don’t know how to speak to people. after 10 minutes he came back and told us to leave.
there was a lasagna at dinner buffet that smelled really bad. There’re so many other things and this hotel shouldn’t be a 5 star hotel. mainly the staff is very rude and they treat guests like they are staying for free.

I want to say thank you for this special stay in this hotel.
It was a plesure to spend the vacations here. The very nice hospitality of the people in the hotel is remarkable.

Thank you again and see you soon.

Best regards,
Josi and Sebastian (Germany)

Review_text_2:
The staff are amazing and very attentive. Special thanks to Jagath who went above and beyond to look after us. Most mornings, the gardener gave me flowers which was a lovely touch. 
It could be a nice hotel however it is very dated and needs some tlc. The hot tubs did not work and to our knowledge it was at least 4 weeks. The bar could not cater for cocktails until I made a complaint and they ran out of diet Pepsi. This is unfortunately not a 4☆ hotel. 
I think the worst part was the building work that was started with no notification, and them having to cordon off part of the pool bar area. 
There are pros and cons with this hotel. It is very far from the airport and you need transportation to visit anywhere. Like all hotels, they overcharge for trips. If you do visit this hotel and wish to go on trips, go to the beach and see Siri. We used him for 2 weeks and you can't get better. Amazing person and very knowledgeable.
I would think about returning however, not until it is updated and worthy of a 4☆ plus

Review_text_2:
We booked a double room and from the time of our arrival it felt like we were in a quarantine facility. For a beach hotel that should exude a relaxed vibe, the entire entry was roped off!! We were taken over by a hostess from the time of arrival and directed like school children - "stay here, do that, etc". Walked through an xray scanner which is quite okay but which was the only entry. Ordered to sit down, ordered to wear masks etc.  It is a really open space and we are all triple vaccinated. The elevators were not working. The room was good but was definitely overrun with moisture issues.  "Double" meant two single beds pushed together!! Tried to order a cocktail in the bar but was told that because of "supply issues" only Arrack cocktails were available.  Had dinner in the coffee shop and were served french fries cooked in rancid Coconut Oil!! When asked why, was told "supply issues". I was offered a replacement but wondered how was I going to receive a replacement if there was indeed a supply issue??
Was a victim of overt racism at breakfast.  As a Sri Lankan, I was singled out and ordered to wear a mask!! At a buffet!! All the other non Sri Lankan guests were exempted including my partner.  I did complain to the restaurant manager who was very receptive and apologetic.
Tried walking on the beach - impossible. All the vendors and touts just follow you around and obviously there is no control from the hotel.
Overall a disappointing experience
Review_text_3: The rooms have good views overlooking lovely gardens

Review_text: The stars of Heritance Ahungalla will SHINE AGAIN !!!!!!!!!!!
Review_text_2: • I am a frequent guest at Heritance and for the second time in 2022. My holiday joy and that of many other guests was spoiled by the majority of holidaymakers from two other countries. Her reckless and disrespectful manner caused anger among the other guests and hotel staff. Parents didn't take care of their children. The children took over the restaurant as a playground. Eating behavior unacceptable, ……. .Pool was polluted with sand. The employees tried everything to change this situation, but only met with rejection. Not exactly motivating. It's over now!!!!!!!!!!!! From March 31st no more guests will come from these two countries. The Heritance Ahungalla will shine again in its former glory. Come to Heritance Ahungalla and enjoy unique Sri Lankan hospitality nestled in the hotel's paradisiacal setting. I wish you an unforgettable time.

Review_text: Package holiday camp overrun with Russians
Review_text_2:
The hotel looks lovely and the rooms are very nice - large, airy and tastefully furnished in a modern take on traditional.  Wonderful big comfortable bed, excellent rain shower, big flat screen TV, minbar, generous safe and covered private balcony.

Public areas are open plan and also look very nice - until you spot the package operator signs & programs, hear the scream of children in the pool (right beside the only bar & lounge) and realise the predominant language is Russian.

Service is hit and miss - there are some excellent staff who cannot do enough to please, but there is also a lot of inexperience and a shortage of staff for the number of guests - leading to some extremely poor service experiences (eg. Wine ordered  at dinner not arriving until after dessert; dirty plates left on tables for long periods; tables not properly cleaned between use; buffet dishes not replenished; etc.)

The food quality in the buffet is poor - tough cuts of meat, over cooked curries and left out/not refreshed very often.  Even at the fresh food stations the ingredients were not top quality and over cooked - and at best all the dishes are luke warm. Breakfast was no better - some good curries, but otherwise heavy doughy croissants, ‘butter’ that was in fact margarine, a couple of cheap jams, limited selection of fruit and one person cooking eggs and another cooking hoppers for the 100s of guests.

To round it off - the majority of the wine list was unavailable (excuse being difficulty with supply chain due to pandemic - but the other hotels on our tour hadn’t suffered the same problems), as were a number of items on the pool bar snack menu.  The sl a carte restaurant and the other bars / coffee shop weren’t open either.

Definitely not a five star experience.
Review_text_3:
Rooms further from reception are quieter.
Eat early for best selection / later for quieter days experience
Top floor rooms have a sea view
processed_text_Review_text: package holiday camp overrun with russians

Review_text_2:
I have such mixed feelings about this hotel but I’m confident in saying that this is not up to the standards of a 5 star.

We stopped here for the last week of our 2 week trip to Sri Lanka for our honeymoon and on arrival to the hotel from the lobby/main gates it looked exceptional! On arrival to our “deluxe” room we were instantly disappointed. The room apparently had just been refurbished which I found really hard to believe. The shower was covered in limescale and the room was tiny. After a bit of a battle we were finally allocated another room. This room was slightly bigger but the bathroom was once again the bathroom was again covered in limescale, half decorated, very basic and we couldn’t see anything deluxe or 5 star about it. Earlier in the week we stayed in a deluxe room at a sister hotel ‘Heritance Kandalama’ and the room there had an amazing view, whirlpool bath & amazing decor… so as you can imagine we were really disappointed with this room. I’ve attached a couple of photos for reference too.

The food was really really good at the buffet and snack bar and we thought the verity of alcohol provided on the all inclusive was good. The staff were friendly but there wasn’t enough staff and they couldn’t keep up with how many people were there. 

I personally wouldn’t recommend to anyone looking for luxury to stay here and agree with the below comments that this is an equivalent of a European 3 star hotel. 

Finally, it seems that the management and staff prioritise the returning customers which is such a shame as if they put the effort in to new customers (especially ones who have spent a considerable amount of money on honeymoons) too along with a few touch ups, they’d receive better reviews.
Review_text_3: Be prepared to be hounded by locals if you leave the hotel. We were followed one day by a couple of men and felt quite unsafe.

Review_text_2:
Years ago this was probably a very grand hotel, however the grandeur has faded. 
The location & facilities appear very good, however the devil is in the detail and the lack of cleanliness makes the whole place feel grubby. 
I have stayed at numerous 5 star hotels around the world and have seen how standards vary in each continent. So using a European standard I would only rate this 3 star, which might meet some guests expectations. 
The staff are very friendly and energetic as we have experienced in all seven hotels during our two week Secrete Escapes tour. 
What this hotel lacks is Management direction to fix the cleanliness issues. As an example I enclose pictures of our recently renovated room where staff regularly create “towel animals” when they should be directed to scrub mould of the newly tiled bathroom walls & floors.

Review_text_2:
Our room at the hotel was very impressive but sadly quite noisy. You could hear everything from the corridors and in the room above. The hotel itself was a bit tired.  The green swimming pool was amazing and usually quite quiet but the main pool was very busy all the time and with lots of children playing games so it was not very peaceful. 

The setting is lovely and the beach is really very beautiful, we enjoyed spending time on it.

The staff were well meaning and friendly however we did have a few issues. I think perhaps not all of what we said/asked was understood but instead of asking to clarify they said yes and just said of course, no problem. This meant that we had a couple of situations which left us with problems. 

We booked a PCR test and expressly asked if the cost could be charged to our room. We were told that this was fine and no problem, then when we came to do the test we were told we needed to pay in cash which we did not have. The hotel did. It do anything to help and we found ourselves roaming the streets in the midday heat desperately trying to find a cash machine and very stressed. 

We also arranged a late check out which we had to pay for. We agreed this and then confirmed it the next day. Despite this on the day of check out we got a call saying we needed to vacate the room. We queried this and confirmed what we had arranged previously and were told they didn’t have anything on their system and we would need to clear our room straight away but they could put us in another room. We were not packed or prepared for this and the whole thing turned out last day into a really stressful and ruined day.

Review_text_2:
We stayed at this hotel for the first time back in the late 90s, when it was called Triton. By the way, the statue of this Triton still flaunts at the entrance. It was a marvelous, respectable hotel with several restaurants, a tea room, fine service, and two lovely swimming pools. This is a beautiful colonial-style building, inside there are very beautiful galleries, between which water flows, trees and flowers grow. This is real architecture, not a soulless block with rooms. Unfortunately, the hotel ended up under water in December, 2004. The staff will tell you that only the first floor was flooded, and they will lie. Typical tsunami traces will also be on the third floor, this can be seen, although the walls are being tinted. I don't really understand how they got 5 stars. It is a very sad sight of destruction and extinction. The hotel is a pity as an old horse, from which they are trying to squeeze out the remnants of strength. Unmown grass, peeling sun loungers, frayed beach towels, yellowed bath towels, stained old linen, squeaky air conditioner, mildew, dampness, musty. Tiles are falling off in pools. Fence-mesh around the perimeter.
And that is not all. This once beautiful hotel is now used as a staging post for bus groups, arriving  to spend one night before departure.
From the pros:
It is still an outwardly beautiful building
The staff works with full dedication
Decent cuisine for Europeans, not too spicy, many adapted dishes.
In the room, like more than 20 years ago, a bowl of fresh seasonal fruits will be waiting for you.
The staff is still on the ball.

Review_text_2:
We had an overall good experience when we were quarantined for 13 nights at Heritance, Ahungalla.

The hotel: It was a pleasant hotel. There were many activities, functions for the guests, but we didn't participate because of personal choice.

The room: We stayed in a luxury suite, and it was very roomy. I had a large balcony so I could relax while distancing myself from others. I felt like we were staying at a single-bedroom apartment.

The staff: Every single person we met went above and beyond. Especially, Duminda and the team and housekeeping. There was not much Sri Lankan food for us, so the F&B team made special orders for the ex-Sri Lankans. That was the highlight of the stay. There was no office room available, so they let me do my work from the cafeteria. Also, Jaminja (Cpt) made me some excellent ginger tea and coffee.

Food: Main meals we sub-par for a five-star hotel, but the dessert menu was the best dessert menu I've ever seen. The person who was on the wok station made sure we get tasty meals as well-my personal favorite food station!

Tours: We took a 1-day tour to Anuradhapura. Our tour guide did his best to make sure we enjoy our trip, but overall the tour did not meet our expectations; we paid $350 (Rs. 69,500). For breakfast, we received one water bottle, a sandwich made with ham and butter, an orange, a banana, a piece of cake, and a sugary snack. And we received the same for lunch. The vehicle was not roomy; made for long tours- we are average-sized people, and there was not much legroom. We had another tour planned for the day after next to Pollonnaruwa, but I decided to cancel it. We don't mind paying money for the tours but expect a way better service.

Overall, it was good. I hope this review would help make things better for future customers and give credit where it's due.

Review_text: Terrible. Unbelievable. Worst Experience in any  Hotel in Sri Lanka, let alone a Five Star one & we have stayed in many
Review_text_2: On arrival, when Reception was informed we'd been confirmed Room 333, we were  told that our room would not be ready for another 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, we were then told that it would not be ready for another few hours as it's a luxury room & will take that long to clean. When we asked if this was because the previous occupants checked out late, we were told they didn't know, and when pressed, they admitted that was the reason. When we said that shouldn't have happened as the room was booked, & previous occupants should not be allowed to check out late, they offered us a "transit room, free of charge" until the room we had booked (which was more expensive than this "transit room" was ready. How could they possibly think we would be happy with a "transit room", which was cheaper & more basic than the one we had booked & put up with the inconvenience involved in changing rooms? When we said we weren't happy with this & insisted on talking to the Manager, he finally  turned up some time later & said the previous occupants couldn't be vacated on time as they were elderly & disabled, but they would have four cleaners clean the room & it would be ready in 30 mins. Finally, we had access to the room we booked at 3.45pm (although, we should have had the room at 2pm), but we still had to wait another 15 minutes (i.e. until 4pm)  for our luggage, which had been sent to the cheaper "transit room"& had to be brought back. So, they broke their contract. A room we should have had at 2pm, was only given to us at 4pm (2 hours later). We later discovered that the previous occupants were not elderly at all. Therefore the Manager LIED. We complained to the head office and got nowhere. We have not stayed in this hotel again as a result of this disgusting treatment and we NEVER WILL. This happened some time ago, but I'm still so angry about it that I want to report it.
Review_text_3: Don't ever stay here.

Review_text_2: We checked in to the hotel with 2 room bookings on 31st December. The earlier review of ours were all about negative and positive sides. This comment is to mention the good side of the hotel staff and their superb services. Firstly I must say about staff from the time we checked in to the room and until we checked out, the staff was always very attentive to our stay. The Chef of the Hotel too was so good and I must say their food was so good and tasty. Although local rates were low, they have taken every effort to provide a nice buffets for the guests. Hats off to the Chef and his team. The YAARA TEA they provided was so good and the best we ever had. The rooms were very well-done and clean. The front office staff, the Security staff and the baggage handling staff all were very good and smiling and friendly. We will surely come back to enjoy another stay at Heritance Ahungalla and loved the hotel and their services. The only bad comment was our earlier review about the poor and disgusting attitudes of their FOM Srinath. If not for him, our holiday would have being even more wonderful. Hope the Management of the hotel will look in to it that it will never happen to any guests coming in during rainy days.

Review_text_2:
When we hear the name Heritance of Aitken Spence, we usually consider it to be one of the most exciting stays. But unfortunately it is a shame to the so called brand Heritance and as well as for the Aitken Spence.

We went there for our annual gathering of my workplace and we have reserved about 19 rooms for the last weekend.

please find the following:

Welcome:
They have warmly welcomed us and given the rooms on time. It is appreciated since we got the rooms just within half an hour.

Rooms:
The room given to me and my wife was on the third floor. Right at the moment we stepped in to the room we felt that it was not cleaned properly. Basically it was not swept at all for weeks as we felt.

We were not even provided with the bathrobes to the rooms. Further, only two towels were available at the room and not even the face towels were placed.

Bathroom amenities were so old and an immediate renovation should be taken place.

One of the Tea/Coffee mugs in the room was not washed (Pictures attached).

Buffet:
Only one restaurant in operation or only one restaurant is available. It was totally crowded.

Dinner on 26th Sept 2020:
Restaurant was fully crowded. They do not provide at least the enough seating capacity for the guests. If I'm not mistaken, there were two other groups checked-in to the hotel during that day. However they have arranged some tables outside the restaurant where they were not attended by a single restaurant staff member just to refill their water goblets.
Food was totally bad and had a very bad experience with the so called Sri Lankan Chicken Kottu Roti. It was totally frozen andwas not tasty at all. I have complained but the only answer I got from the so called F&B Manager or the Guest Services Representative was 'Will inform and will check with the chef'. Is that an answer from a so called hotel chain like Heritance by Aitken Spence??? 
Restaurant staff were not capable of attending to the guests and could not even clean the buffet frequently. Please find the attached pictures of the Ice Cream corner. 

Breakfast on 27th Sept 2020:
Compared to the dinner on previous night, this was slightly okay. But they failed arrange the seating for the whole set of occupents.

Lunch on 27th Sept 2020:
Again it was horrible and had nothing to eat at all. We went for lunch around 1.30pm and even on that time they are out of some food. They had a bowl with a name tag 'Chicken Sausages' and only a half of a sausage is left. When I asked for 4 sausages to me & my wife, the guy came and noted our table and promised to bring them to our table. But unfortunately I couldn't see him afterwards. When it comes to desserts corner, there were nithing to eat at all and please refer the pictures attached. No more refilling or serving and the time was 2.35pm.

Premises:
There was a very bad smell in the whole hotel from the evening to the noon of the next day. When inquired, they said it is from the sea. But please note that this is not the only hotel we visted in the sea side and we have no any kind of an experience from the rest of the hotels we visited.

I have never being to a Heritance Hotel before and I hope that the rest of the Heritance hotels would not be like this.

Personally, I'm so disappointed with the hotel and I didn't expect this kind of a service and an experience from you guys. 

Lack of staff, does not mean that you are free from providing the five star hospitality. If you don't have the sufficient staff, please do not accept so much of bookings for a day.

In my opinion, you should pay more attention to the above in order to provide a better experience to the people who visit Heritance Ahungalla. Further, especially in this period, you all are surviving just because of the locals.

I'm truly disappointed and also feel very sad.

By the way, Good Luck!

I ordered a baby food in advance but that was prepared in the last minute and was served really hot. There is no emergency lines to call in the nights. We asked for in room dining but staff were hesitant and was saying to join the buffet. We were waiting for our breakfast to be brought to our room for more than an hour.When we called the room service they said buffet is still not open due to less staff but the time was 7.10am. Highly disappointed.
