Suddenly decided to have hotel stay.
Took several searches and decided and heritance ahungalle as final stay.
Online booking had added some discount about 15000 lkr.
Rooms— stayed at basic delux. Had no tub on it.
Clean. Attractive. I didn't asked for king size bed so got 2 single beds. It's my mistake.
Food- all meals were buffet, may be due to weekends. Desert table is very good. Had sea foods also including prawns.
But better if breakfast spread is much better specially on desert table.
Pool- no baby pool. But 4 ft at non deep end.
Staff- really friendly, really helpful.
Keep it up and really thanks for that.
It impress us as last time heritance kandalama experience.
 Altogether cost took 25000.
Had 3000 credits to purchase food and with happy 2 hours local spirits were free.

Review_text_2: Very creative bedroom decor by Room boy Sumudu. He is very courtiers & obliging. Well done. Keep up the good work. F&B maneger Rasika too was very courtiers & obliging. Pool table had not been maintained well. Full of dust & sand. Disappointing.

Review_text_2:
4 of us stayed here from the 7th to the 18th of January. We had originally booked the Turyya Hotel , also  5 STAR , but had a call from our tour operator MERCURY to see if we wanted to change to the Heritance because the Turyya had been downgraded  to a 4 Star Hotel due to a lot of complaints. We were happy to book into the Heritance . But did not have the good experience that we had expected. Our rooms were quite dirty . So much so that my daughter cleaned her room with a packet of Babywipes. My Husband did some cleaning with a towel . I refused to do so . I do not think that this should be part of my Holiday. Then we checked our pillows and duvet and had a big shock. We took our bedding to the lobby and were quickly ushered in to a back room . After complaining we were offered an , as the Manager called it , an upgraded room. We were taken to have a look at the room and were happy to move in to it . It was actually exactly the same room as the dirty one but newly decorated with a new shower etc. Before we moved in to the new room the manager asked would it be Ok if he would go and check the bedding . Of course we agreed . At around 11 o'clock I heard loud voices from my daughters room . I went to see what was going on and again the bedding was dirty . Duvet cover had a big brown stain on it and one of the pillows had mould all over it. The manager told us " that is why we put 2 pillow cases on it "  OH DEAR !!!!!!   But after that , I must praise the boys who cleaned our room , everything was spotless.    
                       The next day at mealtimes we were surprised that the restaurant staff seemed to be totally confused . It was a bit like FAULY TOWERS .   There were other issues but it would take to long to mention them all . Would we come back to this Hotel . absolutely not , never ever .

Review_text: Lovely hotel and setting spoilt by the attitude of some staff to all inclusive guests
Review_text_2: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our Sri Lanka trip in 2 rooms.impressive driveway and entrance lobby and friendly greeting and check in .Rooms are large and had good views to the garden and towards the sea, well equipped and very clean with great service from our daily room attendant, although on arrival both rooms had cockroaches but he dealt with these swiftly and they did not reappear, comfortable beds and nice linens and towels. No signage to any of facilities such as gym. Great pools and very spacious gardens and lots of sun beds with good service from pool attendants.The major disappointment was the attitude of bar staff and some of restaurant staff to all inclusive guests, unfriendly and unhelpful to the point of rudeness! Why offer an all inclusive option and then treat these guests as second class citizens? We were frequently ignored in the bar area and bills presented in a manner which suggested you shouldn't order anymore! Totally spoilt what otherwise would have been a very pleasant stay.

Review_text_2:
We visited this hotel at the end of a group tour and were very disappointed with our accommodation. The other members of the group were given different quality rooms despite having paid the same  and were mostly very happy but our room was unacceptable. ( I think from the website images it was a ‘deluxe’ room with partial sea view) The electrics in this part of the hotel were obviously in need of urgent renovation. Two of the plug sockets were damaged with melted plastic around the pin holes and the air conditioning would only work at all by fiddling with the slider switch on the wall and then went off again after a couple of minutes. We complained and a manager said they would sort out the plug sockets the next day but asserted that the air conditioning WAS working although obviously it was not and the room remained very warm. Apparently the hotel was fully booked and there was nothing he could do about it. I was online looking for alternative accommodation when the situation was resolved by our tour guide who generously swopped rooms with us and this room was lovely. 
Although the electrics were our main complaint, the room also smelled damp and was generally in need of renovation, not really five star. 
The rest of the hotel was very good and the restaurant was excellent so our experience was a great shame. 
(Although a word of caution re check out- all members of the group found that they had paid their bills in pounds with a poor exchange rate although the invoice was in rupees and nobody was asked about paying in sterling)

Review_text: An unpleasant experience with a hint of theft from staff
Review_text_2:
The room itself was okay, relatively clean and fair in size. My biggest issue with the stay was that, when relaxing or walking on the beach, there were around 15ish street merchants constantly harassing me and other guests to buy their clothes (at extortionate prices compared to going to a local shop or market), as well as being badgered to book tours, again at 2-3 times the price when booking away from the beach. I have to point out that these were not hotel employees, but independent traders whom for some reason had access to the hotel every day we stayed there.

The hotel offers a baggage handling service where they will move your bags to and from your room for you free of charge, however, be vigilant as personal items were stolen from our luggage between us leaving the room to checkout, and our bags being moved by one of the staff members.

In all honesty, I have stayed at many hotels in different countries and I would say, this is the one time I have gone on holiday and not felt like I was actually on holiday as there was just that much badgering going on that it was almost impossible to relax. Upon walking out of the front gates of the hotel, you would have 4-5 tuk tuk drivers ask and try to take you to places you have repeatedly told them you do not wish to go and although this is not the hotel's fault, when it happens every single day, I feel as though it has to be mentioned.

Anyone considering going to Sri Lanka, I recommend it - just consider staying somewhere else because for me, this was a 5-star mistake.

Review_text_2: I think this one of the worst places I have ever seen. Very bad experince with the reception team. No smiles, they want to charge me for the air I am breathing. They intentionally selected a very far away room although we are a family. They know it is one night so we will have no time to complain and request room change.

Review_text_2:
We travelled around Sri Lanka for 2 weeks staying in 6 different hotels, and this was by far the worst service we received out of our entire stay. 

The hotel itself is nice, rooms spacious and clean, pool area is nice. We dined in the a la carte restaurant which was nice. Don’t bother with half board / all inclusive - there’s a handful of restaurants on the beach with better food. 

The worst part is there seems to be some American expectation of tipping for absolutely everything, and if you don’t then you simply won’t get served!! 

Despite many signs around the pool saying sunbeds can’t be reserved, it seems the pool boy is more than happy to reserve these for a tip. I was up at 7:30am (jetlag), and there was just 1 set of sunbeds left despite no one actually being by the pool! We stayed there until midday, and some of the reserved beds only became occupied at 11am! So frustrating for everyone else. One woman took the reservation off and the pool boy flat out refused to give her a towel, even arguing with her! She went and got her own, and by midday no one had come to claim the bed! Awful! 

We went to the bar one night, they saw us walk in. They proceeded to offer every other group table service but us! I had to go to the bar 3 times for menus, drink etc., yet they still charged 10% service! 

On check-out you get shoved in some tiny room round back to pay your bill which is actually quite intimidating. No one asked if we had a nice stay or where we were going next, or even said bye when we left! 

While I do appreciate Sri Lanka is a poor country and tipping is needed, this was the only hotel during our whole trip that had this greedy mentality. We saved hard for this trip and don’t appreciate being treated like lesser people because we don’t have lots of extra money for tips! 

They also seem to have no problem in letting touts in to the hotel who come up to you on your sunbed to sell you a sari! I get that this happens on the beach but they shouldn’t allow them in the hotel grounds.

Review_text_2:
Booked this for my office staff trip. Place is absolutely beautiful with necessary amenities. Hotel is very old including most of its architecture. Beach access, facilities, Monster pool makes
 you to feel they are complete. Their dining area is so dark. I think that's one of those dining areas which can attract and impress many. It looks dull. 

Food variation was average. I was expecting Kandalama and Earls level of food variation which I didn't get. But I'm not worried about the food which was available too. Presented course was well balanced. 

Room interior is too old in my opinion. Staff was Okey! Had nothing to complain about. Time for an upgrade though. This hotel can easily become the best in Ahungalle

Review_text: Average hotel and should not be part of Heritance Group
Review_text_2: It was a very warm welcome from the staff. And took so long time for checking process even though it was not a busy time. The room we received was not at the expected quality and filled with flyers. We had to request several times to remove flyers and finally we requested for new room since we were with an infant. Initially they rejected our request and I had to talk to FOM to get a new room. So until 6. 30 pm from the time we checked in (3.30pm). It was such a unpleasant experience. Other room services were all good. Restaurant services and foods was very good. Sleeping in the new room was a night Meare because of the noise came from ceiling. It seems that the room was just below a walking path or some steps. Infant was waking up most of the time because of this noise.

Review_text_2: Me and my family planned this small vacation to Heritance ahungalla because of a recommendation from a friend and after seeing the amazing photos that they have in their website. We stayed in two rooms and the rooms were pretty much normal. The view of the sea was covered from trees as it was in the 1st floor. And basic amenities were there. Nothing to get excited for. Food and the buffet was terrible. Only few options were there for vegetarians. They have not given their attention to minor things. For an example I had to request a different salt shakers during ALL the THREE meals I had during my stay. (One table didn’t have any salt/ pepper shakes, other two times - the salt was stuck in the shaker) . Also the arrangement of the buffet was hideous. Food were all over the place. The variety of food was really poor compared to the price we paid. The pool was amazing though!!! The view and the feeling was spot on ! And top notch!

Review_text_2: We checked into the hotel the day before a public holiday. Following day while chatting to a waiter he said there is going to be a huge crowd for lunch hence come by 12:30. Apparently they were going to have about 350 day visitors when the restaurant can accommodate only 175. We had breakfast around 9:00, and no way we could eat again at 12:30. We had no choice but to cut short the holiday and go home. How can a hotel treat its in house guests like this? Instead they should have arranged lunch for day visitors in a separate hall. Everything else was ok.

Review_text: Great Location. Ancient old rooms & poor Service.
Review_text_2:
We visited to celebrate our anniversary. Even though its quite apparent that we are a couple, a  twin room was provided. In the reservation page its mentioned about a sea view room  ("best perhaps are the private balconies – from where it will seem as if the sunsets are ablaze in glory, just for you"). The photo also showing a sea view room.  But we were given a garden view room in an isolated corner. When inquired the answer was "sorry sir we are full today". Its not an excuse.  I must mention that we were not late for our check in . Actually we came around 12.30pm because we planned to have the lunch as well . 
Then moving to the condition of the room itself, It's very old looking small one. The doors were rusted, stained & discolored. The Bathroom is small, ancient & basic. Walls faded & definitely need painting & renovation. Even most of the 2-3 star level hotels provided a much superior rooms than this. 
Neither Toothpaste, toothbrush nor shaving items provided which are expected to be provided in a  5 star hotel. We had to asked for it. When asked  they have provided us with two packs of toothbrushes & only one of them had a tiny toothpaste for us two. Anyway we manged it economically for two days although both of us used to brush teeth after each & every meal. We didn't bring those because all the other five star hotels we have visited have provided them without any fuss & we honestly expected this hotel to be the same standard level.
 I noticed the lack of the shaving kit  only in the next day morning. I knew i had to ask for it again. But as we are checking out anyway i didn't bother the housekeeping staff early in the morning and left my self unsaved for the breakfast. I'm wondering whether they are providing older rooms especailly for the discounted booking offers.
We reserved Heritance Ahungalla thinking that they would provide with the same exceptional service like their Heritance Kandalama which we visited sometime back.  Anyway we have determined to avoid Heritance hotels here after as its not worthy taking any risk ,after our anniversary got totally ruined.
I truly hope you could make some improvements in the future.
Review_text_3: May get a ancient room if you have done the reservation is under a promotion/offer

Review_text_2:
We have just finished a 3 night stay at this 5 star resort, as a wind down at the end of our 14 day JourneyScapes tour. The hotel is on the beach but unless you are a strong swimmer I suggest you stick to the pools! Beautiful at sunset but expect to be harassed by the lovely ladies selling sarongs!
This resort was designed by famous architect, Geoffrey Bawa, is is cleverly constructed with nature and building blending perfectly together, as is the case in Bawa’s beautiful Lunuganga estate nearby. Don’t miss the  old Triton builders’ lift he designed, now displayed in the foyer! The hotel is not new and could do with some renovation in the future, but it offers everything a 5 star resort should, from two large and immaculately clean pools and well tended grounds to excellent service from all staff. Our room attendant, Suranjith, was especially kind and helpful, always with a smile on his face. He even went out of his way to find out the brand of the lovely bath products in our room. 
Food in the main restaurant was buffet style, except for the last evening, when most guests had departed. This menu is extensive, well prepared and delicious! There is an emphasis on amazing Sri Lankan food, but there are sufficient choices to suit even the fussiest diner. We particularly liked the delicious a la carte meal on the last night. There is also a cafe and a Seafood Restaurant. The friendly, informative head chef, Chaluka, told us that where possible the food is sourced locally. So fresh!
We were at the hotel over a weekend and Saturday was very busy, with lots of people coming for the night. Could be very crowded in peak season. However the staff managed the large numbers very professionally. On Sunday we had the pool to ourselves once again!
Our room overlooked one of the pools and was well appointed, with comfortable beds and a large bathroom. Suitable towel rails are lacking however, with the main one over the toilet. However you can ask for new towels whenever you need them. Suranjith decorated our beds every morning with fresh flowers. A lovely touch!
Overall an amazing stay, and a great finish to our holiday!

Review_text_2:
We checked in to the room not knowing they have given us a twin room. What made us upset was the girl who escorted us to the room Dinushi, the excuse she gave was "if you checked in early we would have given you a better room" I was stunned! I immediately told them that we will be checking out the next morning even though we were booked for two nights. It was around 6pm when we checked in and we were too tired after traveling from colombo otherwise I would have definitely checked out the same night. Room was so small and very dirty and old. Bathroom was very small and mind you a huge cockroach was running over our bathroom amenities imagine using rhose tooth brushes and soap and those refill type shampoo bottles which were anyway spilt. I was so upset I cabt tell you how much because we were there to celebrate a birthday. It was all ruined. 
Later on the duty manager came and ask whether we would do a room change and said the hotel was full but we didnt want to trouble the house keeping staff as we were anyway going to check out next morning.
Food at the restaurant was ok but not the best of heritance maybe the reason why was because all the guests were locals. Restaurant staff was good. Friendly. 
Next morning when we came down to the lobby to check out, i cant believe the same girl Dinushi's attitude towards us. Even though I looked at her she made sure to frown at me. Not bothered to atleast talk to us nor apologize. Wow I am from the same industry and I cant imagine the way she acted. Sadned by the fact that we are from the same industry yet we've been disrespected this way.
I am disheartened to write all this because as hotelliers we all have so much expectations from Heritance hotels.

Review_text_2:
We decided to visit Sri Lanka as 3 couples me and my wife, sister, brother, sister in-law and brother in-law. 
We booked our trip through Tui and decided to book the Heritance Ahungalla as our accommodation. The only problem was that my brother and sister in-law did not book until a week later and did not manage to book this hotel as it became fully booked so they booked into the sister hotel next door which was the Rio which was partly owned by Tui.
Firstly I want to make a comparison between these two hotels the Heritance is more a Sri Lankan style hotel and the Rio is very modern. The rooms in the Heritance are big and comfortable but could do with some updating. It has 2 swimming pools which are very warm. 
There is main restaurant were everbody eats is ok but can get busy and you may sit outside if you wish you can also eat at 2 additional restaurants at a price if you are all inclusive like us you can get a 50% discount. 
You have to be aware that even if you are all inclusive not all drinks are free, usually locally produced drinks are but not here. If you eat in the main restaurant and have drinks its all inclusive soft drinks, beer and wine. If you go out to the bar to watch the entertainment and ask for wine you have to pay not only that but even for a 
cappuccino, even locally produced alcohol. This is not all inclusive!
Be aware the staff at the hotel don't speak very good English not like in the Rio. We found that we had to keep asking the waiters and waitresses continually in the restaurant to get a drink as they kept forgetting, but outside in the bar they were pretty quick to serve you drinks.
I found this to be penny pinching not like in the Rio as the staff would serve you quickly and what ever you wanted at not extra charge as we found out due to my sister in-law paying for us to have all day access to the hotel for her Birthday. 
I would say that its up to the individual on what hotel is better suited for your needs.
Positive if you want peace and quite pick the Heritance if you want modern with everthing included in the all inclusive price pick the Rio your choice.
 Tipping staff is helpfull to get what you want.

Review_text: So it doesn't have a Corby Trouser Press but those who want one are missing the point
Review_text_2:
An awful lot of the people complaining about this hotel are moaning that it 'isn't five star'. As I recall, until fairly recently, a hotel in the UK had to have a Corby Trouser Press in the room to gain that vital fifth star. So maybe people are taking their view of '5 star' from the UK and, if they are then they are probably right - it isn't UK 5 star. But if it was you'd be paying a hell of a lot more than £150/night for it.
It is, by any measure a stunning hotel. Cleverly designed by Geoffrey Bawa this low rise hotel (ground floor and two floors above) is laid out to create a series of separate spaces that never seem crowded (they only have just over 100 rooms). The setting, right on the beach, is terrific and the two giant pools are a delight.
Those people giving it a poor review also complain that it is 'tired'. It would hardly be surprising given the fight against the elements that must be waged to maintain it but I can't agree. The grounds are imaculate and, yes some of the corridors are showing their age but the spacious rooms are absolutely fine.
I've also found the staff to be gracious, charming and attentive. Most Sri Lankans are but here they definitely go the extra kilometre.
And you can't fault the food, especially the buffet breakfast which will set you up for the entire day. The buffet supper is also excellent with a cornucopia of choice and a good selection of wines.
Don't believe the nay sayers, there's nothing wrong with this hotel.

Review_text_2:
Nothing five star about this hotel. That doesn’t mean it’s terrible, it just doesn’t do what it says on the tin. We should’ve realised when we saw the deal we got. However, blissfully unaware we departed for what was meant to be a 5* hotel in Sri Lanka. From the start things went wrong. I didn’t understand how a hotel with 5* reviews on Tripadvisor could be so different to reality. But, what they do is they hand out cards asking you to rate them 5*, i presume most oblige as if you don’t they repeatedly ask you and get a “bit” irritated if you don’t. Unpleasant and unnecessary and not something you would ever experience in a 5* resort. 

Room: Our first room smelled like an ash tray, for two non smokers this was just an immediate no. After we said we wanted a new room they looked frustrated, but acknowledge the smell. Seemingly they wanted us to just ‘get on with it’. I don’t know if a 5* hotel which permits smoking indoors, especially with private terraces available. Finally we moved rooms (having to unpack / repack). Our second room had a broken AC, which in 32 degree heat was also unacceptable. After two nights of no sleep, 5 complaints about the AC and being told “it’s fine”, we finally moved to a third room. The AC worked and the room was much larger, an upgrade we thought. However, after the first night it was all clear. We were next to the maintenance and cleaning room, so at about 6.30-7am every morning we were woken up by the sound of trolly wheels on the stone floor. It is so loud that you don’t stand a chance of sleeping through. Initially they don’t turn down the bed and don’t give you the water they promise. 

The upside of the rooms are the large and comfy beds, and our room housekeeper (Rukhal) was good and left funny towel shapes (monkeys, dogs etc). 

Poolside: the pools are great, we spent most of our days by the green pool. Lots of space and a nice atmosphere. However, they don’t clear up so following morning you will find yesterdays banana skins, glasses etc. Quite disgusting. We ended up clearing up ourselves. 

Staff: some great members of staff, highlight was definitely Waruna. Seemingly the only trained and wanting to please member of staff. The rest don’t want to be there and expect to be greated with eye rolls and attitude even when ordering food. You feel like you’ve inconvenienced them at great length. Try ordering a cappuccino at breakfast and you’ll know what I mean. Especially when you get a cold one and ask for a hot one. Three people will try to tell you to drink it and then dip a finger in when you say it’s cold. Going the extra mile certainly doesn’t come naturally. 

Another upside was when the guest relations manager walked around asking for feedback. We shared our experience and things improved, that evening our bed was turned down, more water was given and pool was improved. It lasted merely one day though. 

Also, one member of staff in the restaurant wears an unsightly net vest! I think he is trying to be funny. Seems unhygienic and out of place. 

The hotel is filled with staff but they are untrained and only do one job e.g open door, fill water (no other beverage) so you end up waiting a long time. They also take your food away from you before you have finished and give you bill before you are ready. Stressful, to say the least. 

Food: the local food is great, especially the Dahl. Lots of food available and we can’t complain. Not 5* but still very good. 

Facilities: they claim to have several bars and restaurant but there aren’t, or at least not in use. They also have mould in several areas, cracks and paint chipping. The toilets don’t have soap and are often untidy. 

Spa: fab! Loved it and worth a visit. 

Entertainment: avoid! Hotel should stick to the live music. The shows and plays ruin what would be a romantic evening with your other half. 

Overall: despite all this, we had a great holiday, but that was down to my husband and I laughing about it all and making the most of it. I would even recommend this place to others, but with the caveat - you get what you pay for. It’s a firm 3*. WiFi is also fab! 

Tip: visit some of the local restaurants on the beach! Great food. Also, stay away from ocean - strong currents and big waves. Can be very dangerous and if red flag is up your insurance won’t cover any accidents. Don’t forget to check your bill, they say 50% off but don’t give it to you unless you remind them. Expect an eye roll and potentially an argument before it happens.

Review_text_2:
After visiting Sri Lanka 4 times over the last 6 or 7 years visiting several different hotels, I have to say I wasn’t overly impressed with the Hotel. We stayed for a week in January and to be honest the hotel was ok, the staff were great and the setting beautiful.

But I have to buck the trend of good reviews because to be honest the food was average at best. As mentioned above my wife and I have visited Sri Lanka many times without any issues. But unfortunately by the second night my wife and I came down with severe diarrhoea and stomach cramps which lasted the whole week. This could have only been the food or drink because we always drink bottled water.

You also dont expect ongoing hotel maintenance in high season with mobile scaffold in the hotel entrance and around the front of the pool for 3 days.  Seeing men with breathing equipment sending huge clouds of white smoke into the air in the courtyard outside our room. It was so bad we had to put a towel at the bottom of our door.

All together if wasn’t for the setting and the staff it would have been a poor stay in a 5 star resort.

Review_text_2:
If you are going to visit this amazing desitination, head there soon and stay at the Heritance Ahungalla - a true oasis of calm and rejuvenation.

Right next door is the Hotel Riu - an ugly blot on the shoreline that reminds you more of holidays in the 70s in Benidorm, than resting in the idyliic spot that Sri Lanka is. Word on the street is that next door to the Riu an 800 bed hotel is planned - ruination of the beach thanks to the developers who seem to be focussed more on quantity not quality.
Review_text_3: We were located in 258 which overlooked the second (quieter) pool at this hotel. It suited our needs as a couple without children

Review_text_2:
First time in Sri Lanka but have done Goa so knew what to expect
The heritance hotel in AHungala is former five star colonial styled hotel set in beautiful grounds with a magnificent beach golden sands which stretches for miles
The rooms are comfortable and clean the staff are extremely friendly and the service is great
The buffet style restaurant offers good selection but it gets bit boring if your there for two weeks as we’re
We went for the all inclusive package which is a bit of a joke as apparently all inclusive does not include a whole list of things inc wine at the bar use of the merge sports facilities anything from the mini bar etc.
The main problem with the hotel is it’s loaction once you walk out of the heavily guarded front gates you are straight onto the main columbo to Galle Road 
The reality of Sri Lanka hits you with a vengeance the local village is a ram shackle mess of half finished buildings with rubbish piled up everywhere 
The road itself is a constant stream of horn blowing buses lorries car taxis and the famous TUk TUk
Not the picturesque photos seen in the holiday brochures 
It’s also a long way from the main tourist triangle where the main temples and sigara rock are located 
We did the two day trip the return journey was six and half hours mainly stuck in traffic not pleasant 
I was ever to return to Sri Lanka I would certainly choose the location of the hotel so as to be closer to the sights maybe week in Kandy the week at the beach

Review_text_2:
With a 4.5 Tripadvisor rating, and nearly 3,000 people rating it either excellent or very good, it’s hard to be the minority guest who complains, and this is perhaps the problem – a little like The Emperor’s New Clothes;  if enough people say it’s great, then surely it must be great ?

Well no, not necessarily . . . while the hotel is very good in many respects, it has a few underlying failings that are not expected in a hotel of this grade, with the whole experience only held together by a brigade of (on the whole) excellent staff to detract from what was largely a disappointing stay in a number of respects.

CHECK IN
Absolutely 5 star; we did not even go to the desk; our luggage disappeared in one direction while we were led to the poolside bar and given cold fruit juice while our check-in was processed.
We were then escorted to our room and shown the mini-bar, air-con, etc.
Very difficult to fault, and a first class welcome.

ACCURACY OF BOOKING
The first let-down; we requested a top floor quiet room, not overlooking the pool.
We got a 1st floor room, not only overlooking the pool with a sideways sea view, but directly over the pool bar.
Due to the horse-shoe design around the pool, we assumed all rooms faced the pool; it was only a few days into our holiday we discovered an additional wing either side of this with garden / sea views.
By this time we were well and truly unpacked, but how difficult would it have been to read our request and put us in the appropriate room on arrival?

ROOM FACILITIES
A little tired and showing signs of age, but on the whole everything you need.
Excellent a/c that is on 24/7, unlike many hotels where it goes off when you remove your key card.
Sliding door-type window blinds that gave a complete night time black-out.
Safe in wardrobe, but on top of a small chest, so hanging anything above meant clothes draped over the safe – obscuring the safe and creasing clothes.
Extremely comfy beds with daily linen change; ditto daily towel change.
Uncomfortable sofa in room and ditto 2 x chairs on balcony; not designed for long chilled evenings – perhaps they would prefer you to be in the bar instead of drinking on your balcony?

BATHROOM
Excellent shower with toiletries topped up daily.
Extraction not 100%, with lots of steam and condensation after showering.
A down-side also is the hair dryer; hard-wired to a spur in the bathroom meaning 2nd person could not shower until 1st person had dried hair, or 1st person sat in the room with wet hair while 2nd person showered.
Also no nozzle on hairdryer making styling impossible.
A strange design of windows in the bathroom stud walls with Venetian blinds; lots of gaps all around, meaning you will need to be on very good terms with whoever you are sharing with.

DINING
The biggest disappointment of all; we had read all the reviews prior to booking, and were geared up for a feast of real Sri-Lankan buffet nightly;
The reality was the same thin, on-the-bone chicken curry trotted out daily, with some variation of veg sides; biggest disappointment was that for the whole 10 days, including 2 Gala Dinners, we did not eat anything that was truly hot.
All dishes, from breakfast through to the last dinner, were tepid or luke-warm, with some cold.
The selection of dishes might be huge, but the quality is well, well below this grade of hotel.
A big issue was the amount of large tables for 12 or more that dominated the dining room to accommodate the several large parties who were there; we struggled daily to find a table for 2 that was not sandwiched between one of these.
The sound of grizzling children and loud parents all shouting over each other became the backdrop for all of our eating; the last time I ate in this type of environment was at Pontins Blackpool in 1990.
A mass dining hall, not a 4/5 star hotel restaurant.

YOUR FELLOW GUESTS
We were told by several different staff members that rooms are routinely sold off at highly discounted rates to Sri Lankan and Indian families; not what you want to hear when you have just spent 5K on your holiday . . . 
This ensured a strange mix of European honeymoon couples, families who had booked through a tour operator, and a disproportionally huge amount of large families of 12-16 who had grabbed a bargain.
This was echoed in the dress code – or lack of – in the restaurant, with people rolling up in beachwear and skimpy shorts, while reception was awash with people dashing from the pool to the lift in swimwear, dripping wet and soaking the tiled floors.
More 3 star Spain in the 1980’s than a 4/5 star experience.

THE STAFF
Perhaps the nicest, calmest, and politest staff we have ever come across anywhere in the world, which I fear is what stops most people from complaining or ‘making a fuss’.
One or two exceptions; the cashier who, on our changing up money, threw back 2 x £20 notes with a sneer saying ‘dirty money Madame’ because they had pen marks on, (from the bank not us I may add);
The boy on reception who, on being asked for help with train times, told my wife to ‘look it up on line’ then took her phone, switched off flight mode, and connected her to International Roaming; cue a dozen updates and text messages from U.K.
Thanks for that; we await our O2 bill with some trepidation.

ENTERTAINMENT
As above, more 1970’s than post-milenium, with the same dated song-book standards being peddled out nightly by a band who are in desperate need of a lead singer.

NEW YEAR GALA DINNER
This deserves a review in it’s own right – a band who had been warming up since 5.00 in the afternoon playing 80’s American rock at an ear-splitting volume; a D.J. who begins his set with Bohemian Rhapsody and Another Brick in the Wall; and best of all – a beauty contest by the pool that started around 10.30 p.m. and resumed again after the New Year count-down.
Once again, ‘entertainment’ more worthy of Pontins or Haven than a luxury resort, and more to the point, a spectacle that the U.K. consigned to the history books some 40 years ago.
As for the food; more of the same; a huge spread, and the work the kitchen put into creating a wonderful display was a marketing exersize worthy of Satchi and Satchi, with hundreds of photos appearing on Facebook and Instagram world-wide; sadly, nothing hot enough to enjoy.

ACCURACY OF YOUR TAB ON CHECK-OUT
This has to be the prize for staff member(s) most in need of re-training;
On paying our bill at 7.00 a.m. on check-out day, we were amazed to see over £200 had been added as a ‘half board surcharge’ when we had booked and paid for half board with mercury holidays.
Perhaps they hoped we would not notice?
Well, we did, and the resulting argument was not a great start to the day. ‘Sorry Sir, he is training’ . . . , sorry, but training or not, somebody input the charge into the computer when it should have been absolutely clear what board basis we were booked in on.
Another sting, (which we were aware of before arrival so we factored in) is the 10% service and 15% Govt. tax that is added to all advertised prices, making a hefty difference to your bottom line.

IN SUMMARY
A rather pretentious and tired hotel that could very easily be a great hotel if a few easy-fixes were put in place; 
This is unlikely however when the staff ask ‘is everything ok’ and we all say ‘oh yes; it’s lovely . . . ‘
They will continue doing more of the same until guest stop being in awe of the overall experience, wake up and smell the coffee, and politely tell them where they are going wrong.
processed_text_Review_text_2:
with a 4.5 tripadvisor rating, and nearly 3,000 people rating it either excellent or very good, it’s hard to be the minority guest who complains, and this is perhaps the problem – a little like the emperor’s new clothes;  if enough people say it’s great, then surely it must be great ?

well no, not necessarily . . . while the hotel is very good in many respects, it has a few underlying failings that are not expected in a hotel of this grade, with the whole experience only held together by a brigade of (on the whole) excellent staff to detract from what was largely a disappointing stay in a number of respects.

check in

Review_text: Be carefut to send e-mail and book a hotel taxi.
Review_text_2:
I am disappointed with Heritance,Ahungalla very much, for pick up taxi from the airport to the hotel did not appear in spite of calling and sending e-mail to request.  
Further worse, the hotel man said that this occasion had happened because I had not sent him confirmation e-mail and ordered me to call the taxi by myself when I telephoned him to help us with nervous at the air port.
After all, I ordered him to arrange the taxi and my husband and I could reach the hotel by local uncomfortable taxi.
When I arrived at the Hotel, he did not appear, and no one touched this situation.  So I requested to meet him, but he did not appear.  So I requested to meet the hotel manager, at last He appeared. 
 He did not apology and insisted he had never received confirmation e-mail,
but had done his best.  So I showed him my mobile to prove sending him confirmation e-mail after 8 minute later his e-mail.  He insisted that he had never received e-mail by showing me his mobile(perhaps he cut my confirmation e-mail)and at last unwillingly apologized me.  
This time, My husband sent e-mail to request the taxi~ no reply, then I sent e-mail~no reply.  Then I telephoned to request taxi, and then received the e-mail with taxi fee and requesting confirmation reply, so I sent back shortly.
Is Heritance Ahungalla good hotel?  I have never meet such a rude and impolite hotel man like him.  
I sent my opinion to improve hotel  by e-mail and left  the hotel's questionnaire sheet, but I have not received anything.

Review_text_2: Not at all a 5 star hotel. Would have chosen a better hotel for this price and facilities. It’s a mediocre 3 star hotel. Front staff made us wait for 1 hr before handing over keys to our rooms. Bathroom was clogged. No response by housekeeping. Paid for sea view facing rooms instead got pool side rooms. Would not stay or recommend to stay at this place.

Review_text_2:
I woul not recommend this hotel. Specially if you plan to come here on vacation during weekdays.  They host weddings and the noise level is really high. We experienced this on a Thursday night where the band that was playing,  played until 11 pm at night.  It is not a relaxing experience.  The noise was overwhelmingly loud. We called the management but they said the loud outdoor music will go on till 11 pm. 
The service at the restaurants were very slow and unresponsive too.  The bars served cocktails that wasn't made properly.  It was a disappointing experience at this hotel for us. Will not return here

Review_text: If you are looking for relaxation.. look no further
Review_text_2:
My family and me (including 2 senior citizens) visited this beautiful hotel this November. Every thing about it is great

Lovely property, extremely warm and friendly staff and scrumptious food. Being a pure vegetarian family they made special arrangements for us for the food. We took the half board deal (Breakfast and dinner). 

Not only is the property good but the rooms are equally enjoyable. Neat clean and quick service.

A 10/10 rating for Heritance Ahangulla

Review_text: Great location and property......below average food and service
Review_text_2: The hotel is a beautiful Bawa designed property with an impressive lobby that overlooks and infinitely pool that goes out to the edge of the beach with the ocean just beyond. The rooms are large and well maintained. But the food was really below average and the service bordered on the indifferent. The dining hall staff were really quite awful and looked and behaved like they hated their job. Tables not cleared, no one coming to check on you etc. Very disappointing on that end. The housekeeping and the rest if the staff were good. Will not return.

Review_text: Stunningly gorgeous hotel, amazing food, exceptional service
Review_text_2: I’ve visited this hotel several times in the past, so I knew what to expect. I have to say that they have improved even more and the service was excellent. Chef Manjula and his staff went over and above to make sure we were well served. He had the kitchen bring out something special for my daughter who didn’t fancy some of the desserts. The food had a good mixture of local and international cuisine. The beach and swimming pool was so gorgeous and such a beautiful experience being in such beautiful surroundings.
Review_text_3: There are several floors, so hindsight I should have asked for a downstairs room as my parents found it hard to access the room.

This hotel is beautiful and our stay was quite enjoyable. The rooms were such a relief after days of hostels and camping, the staff are very helpful and the beach is lovely.
The entrance is perhaps misleading in how luxurious the rest of the hotel really is, but it isn't an issue.

Review_text_2:
We have always wanted to stay at this hotel and this was the first time we had an opportunity.  We stayed recently for a few days whilst visiting Sri Lanka.  

The hotel really needs to be updated, compared to other beach hotels this hotel stands out for being old and dated.  Not a good place to be.  The rooms are a good size and comfortable but everything needs to be modernised.

The food was quite nice and really enjoyed our dinner and breakfast.

The hotel is overlooking the sea and the views are great.  Both swimming pools are really big and very conveniently placed.

The staff make up for the disappointing look of the hotel.  They are extremely nice and helpful.  They really made our stay and amazing one.

The price paid £ 155-160/- per night per room is really not a fair price for this hotel.  Hence will not return.
Review_text_3: Note sure, dated hotel and some rooms have been refurbished still not great.

Review_text: Hoped for a 5* haven for a few days after travelling around Sri Lanka
Review_text_2:
We have just returned from a fabulous 2 week honeymoon in Sri Lanka.  We had stayed in 3 fab places before our final stop at The Heritance.  From looking at the website and booking the holiday through a luxury travel agent, it looked like it was going to be a lovely retreat to relax in for 5 days.  Unfortunately this wasn’t quite the case...

I had e-mailed and Facebook messaged the hotel the day before arrival.  I asked whether they had any suites or some of their best rooms available to upgrade to, as we were on our honeymoon and wished for something extra special.  The responded via Facebook asking for my e-mail address so that they could forward information on.  I responded and I didn’t get anything back.  I then e-mailed them directly-nothing back again!! Nothing was said on check in...no special greeting...nothing.

We were taken to our room, I told the lady taking us there that I had e-mailed and wanted to make sure we got a sea view.  She was quite dismissive.  When we got to our room, it was ground floor level taking us straight out to the pool.  You could hear the sea, but defiantly couldn’t see it.  The room was pleasant enough-modern with a big bed but definatly not 5 star.  There was a congratulations cake on the table to great us (we had one at most places we stayed to be honest).  But that was the only thing we got to feel special.  No one asked whether we would like to organise a special dinner etc etc.  

As the cake was so big, it was going to take us several days to eat it.  Housekeeping could have taken it away and put it in the fridge, but instead it was left out on the side to attract ants.  

We were just overall a bit disappointed...it was defiantly more of a family hotel and there were kids everywhere the whole weekend we were there and breakfast was crazy-we thought that the hotel was opening up the restaurant and pool to non residents at the weekend.  The restaurant needs a facelift for sure as it again did not feel like 5* dining.  At breakfast we always waited patiently to be seated, once seated the waitress or waiter would hurry off without asking whether we would like tea or coffee.  I then had to try and grab someone’s attention again so it basically took 15 minutes to get a hot drink.  A little poor for 5*.  

We had lunch via room service a couple of days and that was pleasant enough-very little choice but if you like chips and sandwiches then it’s fine.  They had no samosas and very few of the wines on the extensive wine list on show.  I had to chose 3 different wines before finally getting the 4th one I asked for.  Also if you like cocktails, you will be disappointed as the ones I had at the hotel were not very nice.  

We only ate dinner in the restaurant once during our 5 night stop, as we decided we would get better service and food elsewhere.  The fine dining restaurant had no people in on any of the nights we were there and we just couldn’t think of anything worse than the madness of that buffet restaurant again.  Where the staff were in attentive and miserable.

Sorry Heritance but we just expected more I’m sorry.  And to top it all off we got a phone call the morning of check-out just to make sure we were checking out on time or if we had booked a late check out.  And a bill pushed through the door the night before.  Come on...it was low season, hotel was not busy at all and we were on our honeymoon.  

Every morning we were woken at 5am by noisy people checking out of their rooms or walking in high heels right above our bedroom.  With being on the ground floor, we were right on the main drag for people moving around.  If we had been higher up with a lovely sea view, then we would have hopefully had some peace and quiet.
processed_text_Review_text: hoped for a 5* haven for a few days after travelling around sri lanka
processed_text_Review_text_2:
we have just returned from a fabulous 2 week honeymoon in sri lanka.  we had stayed in 3 fab places before our final stop at the heritance.  from looking at the website and booking the holiday through a luxury travel agent, it looked like it was going to be a lovely retreat to relax in for 5 days.  unfortunately this wasn’t quite the case...

i had e-mailed and facebook messaged the hotel the day before arrival.  i asked whether they had any suites or some of their best rooms available to upgrade to, as we were on our honeymoon and wished for something extra special.  the responded via facebook asking for my e-mail address so that they could forward information on.  i responded and i didn’t get anything back.  i then e-mailed them directly-nothing back again!! nothing was said on check in...no special greeting...nothing.

we were taken to our room, i told the lady taking us there that i had e-mailed and wanted to make sure we got a sea view.  she was quite dismissive.  when we got to our room, it was ground floor level taking us straight out to the pool.  you could hear the sea, but defiantly couldn’t see it.  the room was pleasant enough-modern with a big bed but definatly not 5 star.  there was a congratulations cake on the table to great us (we had one at most places we stayed to be honest).  but that was the only thing we got to feel special.  no one asked whether we would like to organise a special dinner etc etc.  

as the cake was so big, it was going to take us several days to eat it.  housekeeping could have taken it away and put it in the fridge, but instead it was left out on the side to attract ants.  

we were just overall a bit disappointed...it was defiantly more of a family hotel and there were kids everywhere the whole weekend we were there and breakfast was crazy-we thought that the hotel was opening up the restaurant and pool to non residents at the weekend.  the restaurant needs a facelift for sure as it again did not feel like 5* dining.  at breakfast we always waited patiently to be seated, once seated the waitress or waiter would hurry off without asking whether we would like tea or coffee.  i then had to try and grab someone’s attention again so it basically took 15 minutes to get a hot drink.  a little poor for 5*.  

we had lunch via room service a couple of days and that was pleasant enough-very little choice but if you like chips and sandwiches then it’s fine.  they had no samosas and very few of the wines on the extensive wine list on show.  i had to chose 3 different wines before finally getting the 4th one i asked for.  also if you like cocktails, you will be disappointed as the ones i had at the hotel were not very nice.  

we only ate dinner in the restaurant once during our 5 night stop, as we decided we would get better service and food elsewhere.  the fine dining restaurant had no people in on any of the nights we were there and we just couldn’t think of anything worse than the madness of that buffet restaurant again.  where the staff were in attentive and miserable.

sorry heritance but we just expected more i’m sorry.  and to top it all off we got a phone call the morning of check-out just to make sure we were checking out on time or if we had booked a late check out.  and a bill pushed through the door the night before.  come on...it was low season, hotel was not busy at all and we were on our honeymoon.  

every morning we were woken at 5am by noisy people checking out of their rooms or walking in high heels right above our bedroom.  with being on the ground floor, we were right on the main drag for people moving around.  if we had been higher up with a lovely sea view, then we would have hopefully had some peace and quiet.

Review_text_2: Perfect Hotel! Very great and polite staff! The service is perfect, you will feel like King and Queen Special Thanks to Rukmal, our room was every day an event.... see the pictures... definitely the best Roomboy ever!!!!!

Review_text_2:
we spent 1 night full board at this really good hotel over the weekend. i highly recommend this hotel for couples, family and friends. 

the staff is very friendly and courteous..always with a smile.

the rooms are over looking the beach and very nice. the bathrooms i felt needed a upgrade and a good clean..not a deal breaker..!!. the bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows for 2. 

i wish the TV was bigger and the movie channels were better...

the meals were superb..maybe not to everyone's liking since my wife thought some of the dishes were tasting bland... 

parking is available at the property. i recommend using the valet. 

overall i highly recommend this hotel...will defiantly come back maybe this time stay for 2 nights.

Very good stay
 This is our 5th visit. When we want a break from our busy life we always end up at Heritance.  Very good atmosphere.  The food is great.  I love this place . The friendly staff.  And usually when the check out time comes they don't call and give reminders.  And it's upto us to be ethical in vacating the room.  This is what I like in them.  I feel it's like my second day home

Review_text: Does not live up to the brand
Review_text_2:
I returned to Heritance Ahungalla after several years to relive my memories from the last trip which was excellent. This time however the hotel fell way short in meeting my expectations. It all started with a 45 minute waiting time just to get checked in. The lobby was storming with guests and baggage scattered everywhere reminded me of a government hospital than a star class hotel.
The room was very clean and neat however, I had booked myself in to a "Deluxe King" room with a "King Size" bed on the ground floor (printed on the confirmation). However I had been given a room on the 1st floor with two single beds put together. We were so eager to get to the beach that the minute we came to the room we unpacked and stormed off to the beach. It was when we returned we figured out that it was not a king size bed. Called and complained to the concierge and I was told that "Sir, you have to make a special request for a king size bed at the time of booking if you needed one". After 15 minutes of arguing and speaking to the duty manager was I offered to be shifted to another room. Again, a very clean and comfortable room but a small shower in a very odd triangular shape. Not for someone who is claustrophobic. 
We went for dinner in the main restaurant and it was chock-a-block. They had stuffed every available chair and table in to it and we could only move about sideways. The seemed to have a shortage of plates as we had to wait up to 5 minutes sometimes for fresh clean plates. And no service what so ever. There were only five or six waiting staff to serve and we hardly caught a glimpse of them. We were never even offered water. And I am still waiting for the tea I ordered to the table on the second morning of my visit.
Dinner was really good. There was a very decent variety of food and the taste was very good. But breakfast was not so exciting. There was no variance and every day it was pretty much the same assortment. In-room dinning was an absolute disaster. It felt as if "In-room dinning" is a whole new concept that the hotel staff is yet to hear about. There was no menu available in the room and two cheaply printed A4 sheets stapled together arrived at the door 30 minutes when we called and asked for one. We ordered two fried rice and let me tell you that I have had better fried rice served on a plane. It was a mixture of rice and boiled chicken with the odd piece of carrot. 
The hotel is beautiful, comfortable and very clean. As long as you lower your exceptions in terms of service, you might have a decent stay. For me however, I do not see myself returning any time soon.
Review_text_3: I believe all rooms are pretty much the same.

Review_text: Good pool and beach. Less varieties of food and some rooms not good
Review_text_2:
Rooms - We booked 4 deluxe rooms. Our deluxe room was spacious with music in the room. It was overall good. Two other deluxe rooms were smaller than this a lot but we're new. 1 deluxe room looked very old and was not spacious at all were disappointed to have in 5 star hotel.

Bathrooms - Urs was spacious with music and a good showerplace. Other 3 bathrooms were very old and aging. the walls were no tiled as well and only concrete was seen. They were very small as well. Very disappointed.

Food - This was a beachside restaurant but the buffet was not good at all. there were very few varieties of food and the only seafood for dinner was fish and prawns. Even the restaurant is too packed and not appealing.

Others all good. 

I rated this according to the room we got and not considering others rooms

Here's how I gave rating

1-Room
1-Bathroom
1-Pool
1-Beach and other recreational activities
0-food

Review_text: Don't be fooled by the photos, it's a disappointment!
Review_text_2:
Overall, the facilities were nice but we found this property to be poorly managed.

1) Check-in process wasn't organized well. 2 days after check-in, I was contacted and told I had an extra person and I had to pay more money. They didn't even bother understanding their error! We had provided all passports at check-in and we had booked 3 rooms. They had mixed up the adults/kids in the rooms and thought we tried to sneak in an adult at a kid rate. How is that possible if we provided our passports at check-in??? Then at check-out I was still charged and had to get it resolved again.

2) Food was average. And the setup is not optimal. Buffet is split into 2 rooms, with one room having large, open doors which basically let's in bugs/flies. This comes across as unhygienic and dirty. 

3) When sitting out by the pool, had to ask 3 times to get towels and ended up getting them ourselves. 

4) The room setup isn't good. The bathroom has blinds so it makes it really awkward for someone to use the bathroom. Also, the thermostat directions are on the balcony door (why not next to the thermostat).

5) We arrived on a Wednesday and were excited there would be a show. The show was terrible with what appeared to be some sort of mime type of performance.

6) The gym is a joke! You don't even feel like working out. It's small & cramped with old equipment.

7) There is one elevator that is old and slow.
Review_text_3: As for a renovated room

Review_text: A relaxing fortnight in a lovely setting
Review_text_2:
I will start with the positives as they far out way the negatives. This was my 8th visit to Sri Lanka and because the bentota beach was closed for refurb we stayed here for the first time and will return.
Positives
Arrival - greeted with fresh juices and friendly smiles, check in was smooth and stress free. The reception area was well presented, spacious and had stunning views of the pool.

Food - main restaurant food was varied and very tasty, catered for all tastes and the head chef happily cooked us a "special dish". Staff in the restaurant were friendly and everything was so clean. Towards the end of our holiday a large Arab family arrived and they were picking up food with their bare hands and putting it back, being hygienic I complained to a floor manager and very quickly the baskets of touched food was quickly removed - I was impressed. The pool snack bars served the most amazing "fishfingers" etc so we ate their for lunch
Drinks - the local alcohol was quite pleasant and plentiful in choice, international brand mixers were also included. 
Pools - the infinity pool was not to our taste as most of the sun beds were under low lying trees so offered little sunlight. We opted for the residents pool which offered lots of sunbed space, lovely pool staff, its own bar (with friendly bar men) and 2 jacuzzis. The staff kept the pool and surrounding area so clean.
LOcation - right on the beach, although too rough to swim the sea was fab for a dip and a mess about in the waves (sadly an English man drowned whilst we were there - he did however ignore the no swim warnings) and the staff at the hotel were fantastic with his poor wife and handled the situation with dignity and respect. There are a couple of shops just outside the hotel and bentota is a 20 minute drive away if u want to see a real local town. 

Staff - we have friends in Sri Lanka and our good friend Sunil introduced us to the hotel manager and several other people who ensured our stay was (almost)  perfect. It was the first time we saw so many female staff in a Sri Lankan hotel and it was refreshing and showed they are more forward thinking than other hotels we have stayed in over there. himaesha was a lovely lady and a real asset to the hotel. We also found fernando (who stemmed to work everywhere) a pleasure to spend time with-always smiling and upbeat. All in all the staff are top notch throughout the hotel.

NEgatives
I travelled in a small group (5 of us) one of which was disabled and myself on my own so I requested rooms together, we did not get them and could not of been any further apart - being spread out on 3 separate corridors.

Rooms - balcony size varies two of the rooms had huge balconies with amazing views and mine you could not swing a cat on it! My room also had a view of a large tree! The rooms are very dark and lighting needs to be looked at as they do not make much difference in the rooms, if you get rooms 242 or close by request a change I tried and was told the hotel was fully booked....

Beach sellers - that is where they belong but for some reason the guards were allowing them within the grounds (not as far as the pool side) weaving between the beds on the grass which if I had been sat in the area would have seriously hacked me off.

So that's it, we loved it, want to return and would recommend the heritance ahungalla
Review_text_3: Avoid rooms around 242, rooms 228 and 236 had lovely views and big balconies

Review_text_2: My wife & I have just returned from a 2 week holiday staying at The Heritance Ahungalla resort & we can only say....wow what a great hotel, the setting,staff,food were fantastic. Please try the seafood & fine dining restaurants, you will not be disappointed. The overall atmosphere is one of pure relaxation. We will be back.

Review_text: Six years later... We went back to Heritance
Review_text_2:
(+)Same old same old... and it is what we like about this overprised hotel. We recodnised an amazing flavor of Heritance Ahungalla first go. Our suite room was perfect. Greate stuff and cervice level. 

(-)The hotel was overbooked. After checking - in  (13p.m.) we could not find a free couch with the pool area and  put our things on the stairs. We could not to find the stuff as well. The next day was the same situation.
processed_text_Review_text: six years later... we went back to heritance
processed_text_Review_text_2:
(+)same old same old... and it is what we like about this overprised hotel. we recodnised an amazing flavor of heritance ahungalla first go. our suite room was perfect. greate stuff and cervice level. 

(-)the hotel was overbooked. after checking - in  (13p.m.) we could not find a free couch with the pool area and  put our things on the stairs. we could not to find the stuff as well. the next day was the same situation.

Review_text_2:
So first impressions...
Hotel design and overall impression is just lovely. It is airy, with open atrium spaces dotted throughout the hotel, filled with established trees, beautiful.
Room - needs some TLC and more clothes hangers!! NB there never is in any hotel!!! Extra ones delivered within the hour. but overall was clean and spacious. Twin bed quickly made into KS (within 30 mins!) and handle not attached to drawer... fixed next day. Could do with some more easy accessible plug points in the room.
All staff very friendly and keen to help and someone always cleaning somewhere!
Food - OMG!! Curry heaven!! Mix of western and traditional, some curries not for the faint hearted... Head Chef walks around the restaurant speaking to the guests and offering to cook requested dishes (within reasonable limits) which is a nice touch. 
Things to know:
Lunch at the coffee bar a good option, fish fingers and chips delicious and not what you expect....  sometimes service here a bit slow, but you are on holiday!!
Go for the quiet pool, though more people getting to know about it, on sunny days monkeys come to the fruit trees here about 5, but not every day. Lots of wildlife, lizards, geckos, palm squirrels (look like chipmunks), birds and the random cats and dogs
Do have a look at the non-inclusive cocktail menu : )
Be careful of what is not all inclusive...Diet Coke not, zero coke is!! Nor are the bits in the mini bar 
Evening entertainment mixed, but the Sri Lanka day on a Friday is lovely.
Unusually, the hotel shop is not very well stocked, so do not rely on it for emergency toiletries!! Luckily I don’t. Sells mainly gifts.
Dakshika and Trilishiya on the reception desk always greet you with a lovely smile and will try and help any way they can, they are both a real credit to the hotel.
Danuka in the bar area is really helpful and attentive (swear he has a twin brother as he is always there!!) and very kind.
Jananjaya is great with keeping us topped up with tea and coffee at breakfast!!
A thank you in Sinhalese is always appreciated.

Hawkers on the beach and edge of hotel do stop you but will take no for an answer, always haggle by at least half. 
Chaminder at the beach great for arranging transport, did a tuk tuk to Bentota and driver stayed with us the whole time and translated and helped haggle. 
Later in the holiday we hired a mini bus with driver through Chamindra to take four of us to Galle, firstly £50 all in versus £50 each they TUI! Stopped at a moonstone mine on the way, did a spot of shopping en-route. At Galle, walked and drove round the fort and town, stopped for lunch on the way back in Hikkadula, then had  walk round Natural Silk factory and shop on the way back, some lovely bits there!  Bought some tea from a local tea shop in Ahungalla for a very good price and lastly to the Spice Garden in Ahungalla, again interesting but beware the hard sell and the ‘free’ massages which are far from it...donations are expected. Got picked up at 10 and back by 5

Trips:
Elephant day at Uduwalawe amazing! Long coach trip there and back about 4 hours each way. Loo and later lunch stop at Centauria Wild, lunch ok, but the hotel also gives you a lunch  box as well as breakfast one! Give one away to the driver , Well worth the money and the early start!! (4.30 pick up back about 6.30)
Whale watching - accept there is no guarantee of what you see, we luckily saw dolphins, pilot whales and blue whale, amazing!! However, if it is a rainy day, take a change of clothes and a waterproof bag for your camera and phone!! We got soaked by rain and salt spray from the boat, plastic bucket seats really uncomfortable and not for the larger derriere ... the real shame is the amount of boats out at the same time, convinced it scared things off! The boats are not well designed in that the seats are very close together so it is really hard to get across and see things on the other side of the boat and some people do not move to let others see. The whole itinerary is great value for money if the weather is kind, but if you can stretch to booking a private car and boat, do it! Now I know what I know, that’s what’s I would do next time. This is a 4.30 pick up, back for just after 7
Madu river cruise - AMAZING! Do it!! Great value for money, short coach journey (less than 20 mins) we were lucky enough for the time of year to plant a mangrove sapling and release a baby turtle into the ocean, but think both these things depends on the time of year, so ask the rep. It is an afternoon trip so you get to spend the morning by the pool, back by 6.30
Kandy day, very very very long day... picked up at 4am from hotel got back at 9pm..... did the part coach, then train, then coach back, train was fun, a throwback to the 60’s... some other groups got back at 11pm...
Temple of the Tooth, whilst very interesting, we went the day before a National holiday and it was rammed! Beautiful building and setting, but too busy to take everything in. Lunch was the usual buffet affair, then onto the botanical gardens, lovely if you like plants and gardens, sadly wasted on me! Onto the tea factory which was really interesting, you can buy it cheaper from a local supermarket, but from the factory you know exactly where it came from. Final stop was a herbal and spice garden, which again is very interesting if you have not done it before. Least favourite of the four visits as too long a day and too much crammed in. Remember...4.00 am pick up and back for 9pm.... if you are lucky!

In summary, loved Sri Lanka, the people, the environment and would very happily come back to the Heritance.

things to know:
lunch at the coffee bar a good option, fish fingers and chips delicious and not what you expect....  sometimes service here a bit slow, but you are on holiday!!
go for the quiet pool, though more people getting to know about it, on sunny days monkeys come to the fruit trees here about 5, but not every day. lots of wildlife, lizards, geckos, palm squirrels (look like chipmunks), birds and the random cats and dogs
do have a look at the non-inclusive cocktail menu : )
be careful of what is not all inclusive...diet coke not, zero coke is!! nor are the bits in the mini bar 
evening entertainment mixed, but the sri lanka day on a friday is lovely.
unusually, the hotel shop is not very well stocked, so do not rely on it for emergency toiletries!! luckily i don’t. sells mainly gifts.
dakshika and trilishiya on the reception desk always greet you with a lovely smile and will try and help any way they can, they are both a real credit to the hotel.
danuka in the bar area is really helpful and attentive (swear he has a twin brother as he is always there!!) and very kind.
jananjaya is great with keeping us topped up with tea and coffee at breakfast!!
a thank you in sinhalese is always appreciated.

hawkers on the beach and edge of hotel do stop you but will take no for an answer, always haggle by at least half. 
chaminder at the beach great for arranging transport, did a tuk tuk to bentota and driver stayed with us the whole time and translated and helped haggle. 
later in the holiday we hired a mini bus with driver through chamindra to take four of us to galle, firstly £50 all in versus £50 each they tui! stopped at a moonstone mine on the way, did a spot of shopping en-route. at galle, walked and drove round the fort and town, stopped for lunch on the way back in hikkadula, then had  walk round natural silk factory and shop on the way back, some lovely bits there!  bought some tea from a local tea shop in ahungalla for a very good price and lastly to the spice garden in ahungalla, again interesting but beware the hard sell and the ‘free’ massages which are far from it...donations are expected. got picked up at 10 and back by 5

trips:
elephant day at uduwalawe amazing! long coach trip there and back about 4 hours each way. loo and later lunch stop at centauria wild, lunch ok, but the hotel also gives you a lunch  box as well as breakfast one! give one away to the driver , well worth the money and the early start!! (4.30 pick up back about 6.30)
whale watching - accept there is no guarantee of what you see, we luckily saw dolphins, pilot whales and blue whale, amazing!! however, if it is a rainy day, take a change of clothes and a waterproof bag for your camera and phone!! we got soaked by rain and salt spray from the boat, plastic bucket seats really uncomfortable and not for the larger derriere ... the real shame is the amount of boats out at the same time, convinced it scared things off! the boats are not well designed in that the seats are very close together so it is really hard to get across and see things on the other side of the boat and some people do not move to let others see. the whole itinerary is great value for money if the weather is kind, but if you can stretch to booking a private car and boat, do it! now i know what i know, that’s what’s i would do next time. this is a 4.30 pick up, back for just after 7
madu river cruise - amazing! do it!! great value for money, short coach journey (less than 20 mins) we were lucky enough for the time of year to plant a mangrove sapling and release a baby turtle into the ocean, but think both these things depends on the time of year, so ask the rep. it is an afternoon trip so you get to spend the morning by the pool, back by 6.30
kandy day, very very very long day... picked up at 4am from hotel got back at 9pm..... did the part coach, then train, then coach back, train was fun, a throwback to the 60’s... some other groups got back at 11pm...
temple of the tooth, whilst very interesting, we went the day before a national holiday and it was rammed! beautiful building and setting, but too busy to take everything in. lunch was the usual buffet affair, then onto the botanical gardens, lovely if you like plants and gardens, sadly wasted on me! onto the tea factory which was really interesting, you can buy it cheaper from a local supermarket, but from the factory you know exactly where it came from. final stop was a herbal and spice garden, which again is very interesting if you have not done it before. least favourite of the four visits as too long a day and too much crammed in. remember...4.00 am pick up and back for 9pm.... if you are lucky!

in summary, loved sri lanka, the people, the environment and would very happily come back to the heritance.

Review_text_2:
Perfect landscaped and self sufficient garden which is designed by Geoffry Bawa.Peaceful place to relax 
We had a couple of rooms for our changing pourposes.hotel rooms looked lovely and very clean 
The food was excellent.our group had a mixture of western and local food.it was wonderful and memorable stay. Kind,polite, and pleasant staff. I really appreciate their service.special thanks to Mr.Praveen Fernando ( food and beverage executive )he was the person who took care of us and arranged everything during our stay.I should say that as much as our group and myself enjoyed a lot at Heritance
I left determined that my next visit to Heritance Ahungalla must include an overnight stay.

Best Regards

Review_text_2:
Our problem started upon our arrival when we were told that we had been upgraded to a luxury room, but it turned out to be an isolated one (at the very end of the hotel) with a view on tennis courts. In addition, the room contained only 2 beds (One queen-sized and another “Extra” bed). As we had explicitly requested (and confirmed twice with our travel agent) a room with 3 beds and a sea view, we made this clear to the staff member who showed us the room. After she spent some time on the phone, she referred us to the manager on duty( Srinath A ). This manager was beyond rude and impatient, immediately telling us that there were no other rooms available for us to change, because apparently we had checked in late (6 pm). Brushing aside this unprofessionalism, we peacefully requested a refund, in order to be available to switch hotels and find what we are looking for elsewhere. At this point, the manager refused and defiantly told us: “We don’t have money at the hotel. Talk to your travel agent to get money, and go''. After spending 3 hours in the lobby and threatening to escalate if we were not refunded our money right away, suddenly and magically, a suite became available for us to move into, which uncovered the lies that were being told before about the hotel being fully-booked. 
Such dishonesty and disrespect is not worthy of a 5-star hotel.

Review_text: Fantastic F&B degraded by dirty old rooms
Review_text_2:
So it seems that even though we booked a 5⭐ hotel, we were unlucky to get the most outdated dirty rooms I've ever seen in such highly rated hotel. I always judge my room by the condition of the bathroom.  The bathrooms here in both rooms were so dirty.  The shower was the worst. The shower screen was completely covered by soap scum. The tiles were mouldy. Clearly the housekeeping had not heard of bleach or sugar soap or any kind of deep cleaning.  Even run down hotels can be presented well with proper maintenance & care. These rooms don't deserve anymore than 3⭐ rating. Very disappointed. 

The food outlets however were fantastic.  We dined at 3 outlets during our stay and each area was superb.  Food was delicious. Best buffet food I've experienced this time in SL. The service was equally incredible. We travel with a toddler and we can demanding however the team made it so pleasant for us.  Thanks you F&B team. Keep up the great work.  You guys run a true 5⭐ rated Hotel restaurant.

Message to the Heritance brand.  High time you pay attention to the condition of your rooms rather than leveraging off the great locations your hotels are based at.

Review_text: No where near being a 5 star hotel!
Review_text_2:
Our stay at this property was 9 nights during our holidays and we wouldn't have expected much from this hotel's overall experience if the grading system of this hotel was honest about being below a 4 star.  

Despite the general friendliness of staffs at the hotel, there is absolutely nothing to recommend about this hotel if you are expecting it to be a 5 star. 

From:  
- trying to put us in a lower category room (which we didnt book through Agoda)
- bathroom amenities were never refilled and replaced
- what 5 star hotel does 2 in 1 shampoo and conditioner???
- room walls were made paper thin and it didnt help they placed us beside the housekeeping room and we heard every clamour there were starting from 7am every morning
- bed sheets looked and felt like it was 30 years old from the stains and the lint built-up which was made to feel like climbing into rough potato sack fabric.
- on the swimming/lounging private part of the property they allowed hagglers still on the property to haggle guests to buy products or their services.

Overall, it should be reviewed how this property gets to be a 5star or be honest and lower the stars for what this property actually deserve which is no where near being a 5 star.
Review_text_3: Double Deluxe room in the renovated part recommended, if we would recommend anything in this hotel.
