Review_text: Good property but unable to handle crowds with poor processes in place
Review_text_2: We were a group of 10 adults (couples) and this property was part of our itinerary. The minute we entered the property, we were in awe of it but thats it. Our problems began right from the word Go. Our check-in process took almost an hour which ideally should have been a 5 minute job since our passport copies and all details were with the agent and hotel. Post the checkin, our ordeal just began to rear its head. Of the 5 rooms we were provided, 3 of them were with twin beds when it was clear to the hotel that were were couples. Then further, of the 5 rooms, 2 of them were side corner rooms which were nowhere near the deluxe rooms as shown on the website. The plumbing and the lighting too wasn't in order. On asking for a room change, the manager on duty just told that this is all that is available. With absolutely no remorse on settling us for subpar rooms. This is surely not how a 5 star property treats its guests. Thank god I stayed just 1 night. The room service was pathetic and they took almost an hour to get to us since the mini bar was completely empty. What I liked about the property was the various activities, the food and the variety. I liked the proximity to the beach but I just hope the property gets their act together, have proper signboards on each floor and get better processes in place.
Review_text_3: Check and avoid corner rooms since they are MUCH smaller for the same price

Review_text_2: We were a group of 20 people in 10 rooms at Heritance Ahungulla for the new year. The service is absolutely the worst I have encountered across Asia. Staff in general are unhelpful and sometimes rude. The breakfast place is fine but the bar and snack place is absolutely terrible. We had to wait for almost an hour for a club sandwich and when asked three times they kept saying “2 minutes”. Finally when I approached a more senior person at the bar, he was totally unapologetic and asked the same waiter who said “yeah, I will get it”. This is one example amongst many incidents - from no towels in the pool to poorly made up rooms. I certainly do not recommend it - there are many other places in Sri Lanka that are far better.

Review_text_2:
We were a family of ten having booked five rooms in Heritance Ahungalla and were really looking forward to our stay after a long drive of Six hours from Nuwara Eliya.
But right from check in it was a big disappointment, as check in itself took more than one hour. The rooms were not as expected of this property, the key didn’t work for one room, lights didn’t work in another room, the wash rooms were ancient looking with flush making scary sound in another room. The pass word for wife was outdated and had to be changed.
The duty manager was not apologetic but showing his helplessness , arrogant and argumentative.The rooms were of different sizes and badly done up, never expected from Heritage Ahungalla.Instead of king size beds we were given single beds joined . It was a terrible experience stay and the worst of our trip of seven days in Sri Lanka.
We will never recommend this hotel to any one.
J P Alex and family.

Review_text: Worst Heritance Hotel I have ever been
Review_text_2:
One thing which makes Heritance Hotels stand out is the food and hospitality. So I had high expectations. I have already been to Kandalama and Negambo, in both cuisine and hospitality is great and flawless.
The first thing I noted is that they (Heritance Ahungalla) cannot handle a crowd. No welcome drinks for some of the guests. Very few (sometimes none) food options to vegetarians. The restaurant space was not enough when crowded. 
Service is really bad at the restaurant. Several times we had to ask for water and wait for it. Both Negambo and Kandalama is excellent in service where they event do not let the water glass finish in any of the tables. So lot of improvement is needed. And it is noted that the service is delayed not because the staff is very busy, but because there are some idle staff as well. More organization is needed.
Rooms are okay. The first day there were only one shower cap in the room. The other shower cap box is empty. On top of that, the second day, there were no soap. Even the soap from the previous day has been removed.
Location is okay. Nice pools. If the main is crowded or sunny in the day you can use the other pools.

Review_text: If it wouldnt be so sad, it would make me laugh...
Review_text_2:
Working in the Hotel Industry myself, this is an experience I havent made before. 

I contacted the Hotel over 2 months ago, asking for an offer for a Family of 4 and myself for 4 days, Half Board.
- used the Website mail: no answer
- used the contact form: no answer
- sent a mail to the Reservation department: no answer
- Called the Hotel: was given another mail address: no answer
- called again, persisted on the Reservation department directly: Reservation Agent (Trevin von Gunster) confirmed that he saw my mails from 10 days before, but was ´´too busy´´ to answer. 
- received an offer for 3 people, not 5, as requested
- asked for a Change, over a week: no answer
- called again: same person, apologies again, promised a new offer
- receive a new confirmation, again for 3 adults, Kids missing
- asked for a Change: since the 29th of November: no answer.

I am trying since roughly 6 weeks to make a 2.500 Dollar booking, have spend hours and significant amounts on phone calls to Sri Lanka, have been kicked out of line repeatedly by the reception, have sent dozens of mails by now, and the result is: Zero. 

Absolutely astonishing.
processed_text_Review_text: if it wouldnt be so sad, it would make me laugh...

Review_text_2:
Though it's described as a five-star resort, my parents and I were sorely disappointed by this hotel and will not be returning. 

The cons: 
1. The receptionist offered us the opportunity to upgrade to full-board or half-board at a discount (USD30 instead of USD25 per meal). When we asked which restaurants this was applicable for, they said that it was only for the main restaurant, but failed to mention that it was ONLY valid for the buffet. If we had known, we wouldn't have signed up for two days of buffet-only meals. We found out because the waiter told us we couldn't have ala carte, and all of this happened after we'd paid for half-board for two days. In addition to not being told exactly what we were paying for, we discovered that the buffer cost LKR3,700 (USD24.2). So you're telling me that I didn't receive a discount--I'm actually paying the full cost of the buffet AND I'm locked in for a two-day commitment. This was dishonest on the hotel's part, and according to our travel agent, they shouldn't be directly giving us discounts--they're supposed to go through the agent. All in all, very poor form on the hotel's part. 

2. On the morning of our check-out date, my bathroom didn't have water. I couldn't use the sink, I couldn't shower; it's a good thing I didn't have to flush anything. I checked my dad's room next door - also no water. It took two calls for housekeeping for the water to come back. How is this acceptable? 

3. Our room had an odd smell that came from the bathroom drain. When we told the GRO, she said housekeeping would be around shortly to attend to it. They arrived 18 hours later. 

4. When we first arrived, there was no porter to be found and we waited a solid few minutes before the receptionist noticed that we wanted to check in with our bags. He then rushed out and seemed very frazzled. Out of the 7 hotels we stayed in Sri Lanka, this was by far the poorest reception we'd received. 

The pros: 
1. The restaurant staff were lovely, warm and attentive. My mum had a broken arm on this trip and the chef himself came out and helped her take food for the buffet and then walked her to her table. 

2. They provide comfortable flip flops for guests to use on the beach and around the property.

3. The food was delicious. Every dish we had was delicious--both Sri Lankan and international fare.
Review_text_3: You'd be better off staying elsewhere

as a returning guest i was impressed by the improvements at heritance , the refurbished rooms with the washrooms are much brighter also the food was much better this year, maybe the competition next door has helped in this, but the biggest star of the heritance is its staff Thushara, dinesh at the pool nimasha,chamichand thanks for the flowers each day Sodad , to name but a few but everyone made our stay very welcoming ,
great location on the beach ,good food , comfortable rooms,
room 246 . 23/11 - 3/12

Review_text_2:
We came to this hotel for a couple of days of rest and sun at the end of a two week tour of Sri Lanka. I have to admit it was my least favourite hotel. Yes there was lots of opportunity for sunbathing around the pool. The men were very attentive with keeping the grounds immaculate and bringing mattresses and towels. Also the bars were located around the grounds so drink was easy to obtain. 

But despite this being a hotel designed to blend with nature, I found the stark long corridors austere and unfriendly, and very noisy. In fact they echoed any noise particularly in the early mornings. 

In the restaurant there were far fewer waiters than previously and those that were in attendance were much less attentive. 

And the entertainment was a mixed bag. We saw a delightful cultural show followed by a very amateurish fire show. 

Positives? Lovely large rooms. The quietest air con ever. Great range of food. Lovely location on a pristine beach.

Review_text: A tad more touristy than 15 years ago - but still a friendly service and nice atmosphere
Review_text_2:
I visited Heritance Ahungalla first time 16 years ago and again 15 years ago (when it was still operated under the name Triton), so I was very excited to go back to the hotel to see if it still carried that adventurous atmosphere that it did 16 years ago. I was also vevry excited to see how they had renovated the hotel after the horrible tsunami that destroyed much of the hotel about 10 years ago.

I remembered the hotel as a luxurious hotel with a very high standard both in the restaurant and in the small bars around the area where you could buy from a large snack menu. Many of these places were closed now to my disappointment. The hotel of course more or less looked the same and the beautiful architecture of Geoffrey Bawa - Sri Lankas world renowned architect - was of course still stunning.

I should say that my previous visits was during the peak season in february where the weather on that part of the island is fantastic. This time I visited in october and we experienced several hours of heavy rain on several of the days we stayed there, and of course that adds to the experience and the atmosphere as they had to keep huge plastic curtains down at all times to keep the water from running into the reception area and the bar area. The hallways was flooded due to the heavy rain and the open design of the hotel so they had to keep staff constantly mopping up water and that was of course no fault of theirs. That's just how it is during this season.

But something seemed changed. The hotel seemed to have lost that exclusivity that set it apart from other hotels in Ahugalla/Bentota region.15 years ago there were a wonderful atmosphere in the evenings with jazz band and dancing in the lounge next to the reception and pool area. This time around that was gone - much to our dismay.

We also remembered that every afternoon there was a very nice complimentary afternoon tea with buttercake and scones that you could enjoy just next to the large pool but when we asked if they still had it noone even seemed to remember that they had it 15 years ago.

We stayed in one of the huge suites with several rooms a seperate living room two bathrooms, a huge balcony overloooking the residents pool with a view of the ocean behind the row of palm trees along the coast line.

I don't know if some of the changes to the design and decor was due to the tsunami 10 years ago (after I visited the last time), but I remembered the beautiful residents pool (the other pool that are closed to anyone but guests in the suites and rooms in the fine wing with ocean view, and it was originally made with the most beautiful dark blue tiles that made it one of the most beautiful pools I had ever seen. This time the tiles have been removed and the pool was just an ordinary pool with a normal lightblue surface on the sides and bottom and not made from tiles anymore, just like so many ordinary pools you see all over Sri Lanka. That was sad - I thought. I may have needed refurbishment or renovation but they should have stayed true to the original design with the beautiful dark blue tiles when repairing the pool instead of the cheaper solution, as this did something to make the place stand out in a way that it now doesn't anymore. They also had a wonderful original boat like the ones used by the original population in Sri Lanka that was a trademark of Triton (as it was once called) but they had done little to keep it maintained, so it had obviously deteriorated over the last decade so they hadn't saved it (unless of course it was taken by the tsunami ten years ago). To me it was just a little sad to se that on the patio where it was once standing proud in the middle of the large pool was now just an empty plate with nothing to decorate the otherwise elegant pool area around the public pool and bar area.

Another thing that added to the impression they had lowered the standard since we last visited 15 years ago was the many families with screaming children running around the pool. 15 years ago there was a much more tranquil and serene atmosphere with adult guiests with a certain sense of etiquette, which includes preventing your children from running around the other quests at the pool and adressing strangers asking all sorts of questions instead of staying near their parents as they are supposed to when using the residents pool.

What had since we last visited become a sad but necessary precaution was a several meters high fence between the hotel grounds and the beach where only a small opening heavily guarded by two guards at all times (day and night) was the only passage to the beach. In the old days one could just stroll down through the line of shady palm trees and reach the beach from anywhere along the hotel grounds. But it was obviously a necessary precaution as we could see that many more touts and beggars and people selling all sorts of ridiculous junk and overpriced sarons, were all over the beach. It even seemed to us as if some of these local hustlers had some corrupt arrangement with some of the guards as they sometimes happened to be inside the fence (which means they have passed the guards unattended), and even when guards saw them on hotel grounds contacting the guests, they did absolutely nothing or very little to stop them from intimidating the guests and/or even excort them from the grounds, which would of course be their duty. One of the nights I stood in the dark on my balcony outside our suite and I noticed a visibly drunk guard who could hardly wallk in a straight line talking a little with himself while he suddenly stopped near the tennis court and fumbled with his trouser until he mannaged to unzip his pants in the middle of the lawn and urinate. That latter I could even live with - I'm no prude - had he just walked behind a tree and taken care of business, but I didn't find the fact that he was visibly drunk very reassuring.

The folloing nights I stayed for an hour on my balcony to see if the guard from the night before would return, would return, but much to my surprise I saw something very strange occur. One of the guards (not the same as the drunk guard from yesterday) suddenly turned on his torch and he waved it up and down and from side to sight while pointing it in the direction towards the edge of the hotel grounds. Shortly thereafter I saw two locals walking past the tennis courts and sitting just below my balcony between the building/wing and the tennis court. They couldn't see me as I kept the balcony lights off as well as the lights in the livingroom so I was hidden in the dark. I looked in astonishment as these very suspicious looking local people arrived and they opened small packages and presented them on the top of low walll surrounding the terrace belonging to the suite just below ours and the guards looked at the "goods" in the beam of their flashlight at what looked like small packages of either pot or very small portions of khat to me (I've only seen khat but nevver tried it so it could be something else, but I know that khat is very poular if you have a job where it's hard to stay awake and it's popular amongst lorry drivers etc. so I could imagine that a boring night shift would also tempt someone to use khat to keep from falling asleep as it is a mild energy booster that make that kan keep you awake and alert) and khat is actually not amongst forbidden substances in all countries (at least not in Europe), so the use of khat may even be legal in Sri Lanka, that I don't know. Well, that aside, the guards clearly counted and exchanged money for these "goods" in the dim light from their torch. Suddenly one of the guards heard me making a noise as I was taking a step back and he pointed the torch directly at my face and for a short while I was blinded, and they saw me on the balcony, so he turned off the torch and they exchanged a few hasty words with the locals who then wrapped up the rest of their goods and ran away along the tennis court and disappeared in the dark. This was in no way frightening or intimidating, but it just seemed like something that wouldn't have happened at the classy and stylish Triton of the old days, and it only contributed to the vague feeling that the standard of the hotel was not quite the same as it was 15 years ago.

From the experiences above one would have thought that it was a horrible experience, so why do I give it four stars after all? Because they still provide many of the things they provided in the old days. We always live in large suites when we travel, so I have a large backlog of experiences to use as comparison, and I must say that the suite was wonderful. It was clean and beautifully furnished and the large balcony streched all the way around the suite and had access doors from all rooms in the suite.

I will also like to give the place the benefit of the doubt, because many things were closed - and that might be because it is the low season in october, so my final judgment should not be made until I've tried the place again in the high season between medio january until medio march where the weather in the southwest part of the coast line of Sri Lanka has the most beautiful weather.

We also dined at the a la carte restaurant (not the large dining hall, but Restaurant Mustard at the terrace on the left side of the reception area just after the reception desk around the corner). The food was delicious, the service was perfect, and the setting was cozy with a dimly lit area and a very romantic atmosphere. So taht was truly perfect.

The in-room dining (room service) was also very good and arrived quickly. The breakfast was wonderful and came on time every morning exactly at the time we've put on the breakfast list to hang on the door before going to sleep.

The staff couldn't do a better job. They were quick, courteous, smiling, polite and they didn't hover at any time or made certain trick to earn extra tips (such as coming two persons to a one man job, or staying in the room and keep asking if everything is to our satisfaction, etc. - you know the drill). But none from the staff we met did that at any time. Of course my wife and I both agree on giving a generous tip at no less than 20% of the bill every time something is served, so we allso made it easy for the staff not to hover, and that should perhaps be taken into consideration, but we also find that people in Sri Lanka live on extremely low wages, and compared to the prices in Denmark where we live, even an additional 20% still makes for a very cheap price for people living in Europe, Australia and North America, so i cost us so little but means so much to them, so there is no need to be a miserly cheapskate. If you can afford an expensive plane ticket and to stay in a somewhat pricey hotel like this you probably can also survive giving 500-1000 Rps ($3-$6 USD) more when tipping the  waiter, room boy, luggage carriers, drivers, etc. It takes so little and being generous when tipping often comes back a thousand fold throughout your stay when you are being served by the grateful, hard working, staff at the hotel, trying to accomodate even your most extravagant wishes and habits.(That's just my personal opinion on this subject, and each to their own, of course).

I believe all rooms are non-smoking but most rooms are with a balcony (or a terrace if at ground level) so this is a comfortable hotel for smokers.
Review_text_3: The large suites are beautiful and comfortable. Stay above ground floor.

Review_text_2:
Was here on a two night trip with the rest of my colleagues from office. Really not much to write home about. It didn't stand up to my expectations of a five star hotel.

The staff was very courteous and helpful. There is no argument about that but the hotel infrastructure wasn't exactly that great. The car parks are somewhere way away that you have to rely on valet parking. This means you have to pick up every single thing you need from the vehicle before you check-in. The dining halls are pretty dark and gloomy, mostly I believe due to the dark colouring of the ceiling which is decorated with batik. The buffet area was really odd, it was almost like walking in to someone's kitchen to get the food served, the dining hall and the buffet area have very different vibes. The pool is good and well maintained and they do have some activity rooms where you could play 8-ball or carrom or chess. But the overall set up just put me off. Will not be returning here.

Review_text: Awosome place 99% perfect 1%  not for not giving me sweet hoppers lol..
Review_text_2:
Everything was so perfect nice view two big pools clean rooms.Staff is exceptionaly well trained restaurant staff is very well organized.we really enjoyed our two days.fire thing that had on tuesday night was so good we had so much fun.there were some nice games as well.only negative experience that i had was with the lady who make hoppers.she was so rude i greeted she did not greet back.i asked for a sweet hopper one with sugar in it she said cant only plain and egg hoppers available.then i asked for a treacle one she again said cant.she needs some customer service training.i ended up not having any hoppers.she was plain rude.

Other than that everything was perfect.we loved it.

Review_text: Water dripping off the ceiling | spoiled holiday
Review_text_2:
I want to share my experience (no so good) at The Heritance Hotel Anugila.

I along with my 2 sisters  had made a booking for the 3 of us for 2 nights 17th and 18th August 2017 at The Heritance hotel Anugula.

We checked-in the hotel on 17th Evening and were smoothly escorted to our room number 224.

1- On reaching the room we noticed that the floor was a little wet and asked for it to be cleaned with a delay of 5-10 minutes the floor was cleaned.

2- Tired of all the travel throughout the day, we thought of making some tea/coffee in the room, just to find that there were only 2 of all the things in the room. 2 cups, 2 glasses, 2 spoons etc. (for a room booked for 3).  Why would the arrangements be for 2 when the booking is for 3???

3- The electric kettle was placed in a cupboard which had no plug points. we had to shift the kettle to some other table to actually use it. But again to my surprise, the electric kettle plug (Flat pin) and the plug point (Round ones) in the room did not match.

4- My sister sat on the third bed to find out that the bed was actually not stable. If you sit on one side of it, it would lift up from the other.

5- We called up the rooms service for the above 3 points (2,3 and 4), but to my disappointment they could not have been slower. When you have a 5 star facility I would expect the staff to know English. The room service were not able to understand our plain English!! The room service addressed the plug problem, we made tea, and one of us had tea in a glass tumbler as there were only 3 cups in the room!

6- I went for a swim in the evening and came back to my room to take a shower. I land up in the bathroom to find out that there is no Shampoo or conditioner in the room!!!

I call up the reception for the same and they tell me they will send it to my room. I wait for almost 15 mins no hear no knock on my door. In the end I had to take a shower without a shampoo or conditioner.

7- At dinner that night, my sisters were a little disappointed as there were not much veg options (they both are vegetarians). The chef was there taking feedback and my sisters told him the same. The next morning we were to go for an early whale watching trip and had to leave at 5.30 AM. We had already asked the reception to pack our breakfast. Previous night, while talking to the chef, my sisters told him that we would be leaving early and to pack good breakfast for 3 (2 veg (for my sisters) and 1 non veg (for me)).

We woke up and were leaving for the trip. The reception handed over our breakfast nicely packed.

We opened the packets around 10AM on our way back from the trip to find out 3 non-beg meals!!!!! My sisters could not have breakfast that morning, thanks to the chef’s goof-up!

8- We reached our room, called up the reception for shampoo and conditioner (Which were still not there in the room). The room service comes to the room with an unlabelled bottle and said that was shampoo.  I asked for a hair conditioner and I am still in shock that he did not know what that was!! I explained what that was, and he said that they do not have a hair conditioner available!!! Believe me I am in shock as I write it!!

9- The day went on, we did not want to spoil our mood as we were on a 3 sisters vacation!

But the next morning when we woke up, we found out that the entire room was dripping of water (see pictures attached). The room had always been wet throughout our stay (as found on check-in) but it started dripping literally next morning. We had our luggage placed on the table above which the ceiling was dripping! All our clothes were wet! We had to quickly move the luggage from there to the beds. And then there was no place to sit.

I called up the room service to show them that, to hear a reply that we should not have the window open.

We were in a sea facing room and were there to enjoy the sea, not to seal ourselves up in an AC room. That we do anyway at our offices when we are not on vacation.

Why would you be in a sea facing room and not have the balcony or windows open??

I have not seen a beach side 5 star property of not having slippers or bathrobes in the room. I do not think these facilities should be provided on request. Isn’t it obvious that on a beach side resort the guests will go to the beach (or swimming pool) and would need slippers? Why should they have to ask for it??

Again still in shock - No conditioner!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

There are no plug points next to the bed!!!!! only 1 plug point far away fromt he bed. No multi-plugs available in the room. You have to call room service for that as well!

We were in Sri-Lanka for a 7 day trip, stayed in all 4 star resorts. We wanted our last 2 days to be special and relaxing and hence we chose a 5 star.

Our experience in all 4 star places was far better than these 2 last days!

A Dissatisfied customer
processed_text_Review_text: water dripping off the ceiling | spoiled holiday

but the next morning when we woke up, we found out that the entire room was dripping of water (see pictures attached). the room had always been wet throughout our stay (as found on check-in) but it started dripping literally next morning. we had our luggage placed on the table above which the ceiling was dripping! all our clothes were wet! we had to quickly move the luggage from there to the beds. and then there was no place to sit.

i called up the room service to show them that, to hear a reply that we should not have the window open.

we were in a sea facing room and were there to enjoy the sea, not to seal ourselves up in an ac room. that we do anyway at our offices when we are not on vacation.

why would you be in a sea facing room and not have the balcony or windows open??

i have not seen a beach side 5 star property of not having slippers or bathrobes in the room. i do not think these facilities should be provided on request. isn’t it obvious that on a beach side resort the guests will go to the beach (or swimming pool) and would need slippers? why should they have to ask for it??

again still in shock - no conditioner!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

there are no plug points next to the bed!!!!! only 1 plug point far away fromt he bed. no multi-plugs available in the room. you have to call room service for that as well!

we were in sri-lanka for a 7 day trip, stayed in all 4 star resorts. we wanted our last 2 days to be special and relaxing and hence we chose a 5 star.

our experience in all 4 star places was far better than these 2 last days!

a dissatisfied customer

Review_text_2: I used to be very pleased with service and product. Today after 4 month I come again but the place has changed. Now be careful if your bill. A waiter asked me you know how many beer you have consumed, my answer yes; 3. Waiter no 4.well it is only 3 and this is fraud attempted by the staff. They had to admit that yes only 3 beer was served so why have this stupid discussion trying to make me pay for something not consumed. Very disappointed.

Review_text_2:
We spent 3 weeks in Sri Lanka and stayed in 12 hotels and this we ranked last at number 12.

On arrival our room was not ready despite it had gone 14:00. We were told this was due to a late check out and we were made to wait at reception without any offer of a refreshment.

We reserved a table for evening food and upon arriving at the reserved time the table had been given to another group.

We received phone calls on both mornings waking us up. One was at 07:30 regarding some washing being ready for us despite not having any done. The laundry department were insistent it was ours and then Hung up when we told them it was not.

When we tried to speak to management we had to ask three times and after 10hrs we got to speak to a manager. They heard our complaint and offered half price food for the evening as a good will gesture. The buffet was on par with other hotels and the restaurant food was very good.

Unfortunately despite the managers efforts at departure time we were phoned regarding when to collect our bags. We asked for 10 minutes time which they said they could do. After 25 minutes we walked our own luggage to reception and left the hotel in the same style we arrived, little to no service.

During our visit some of the facilities were shut despite the hotel supposedly being fully booked. The room was fine and clean but the communal areas looked tired and not what was expected from a 4 Star hotel. The restaurants lacked soul and character.

Due to our experience I can not recommend this hotel and I would question the awards and endorsements it has. I hope that others receive better service than we did given the price.

Date 16-19th Apr 17, Rm 333

Review_text_2:
Every so often even the mighty falter. What matters is recovery. 
After an impressive check-in, things went south at dinner. Inattentive service, cold food and total apathy left me wondering if this was the wrong place to spend three nights. I usually provide feedback at the end of my stay, but this bothered me enough that I penned an email to the corporate office that very evening. I did not expect a quick response. 
The next morning, with a fair amount of trepidation, I went for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised when a staff member approached me and apologized for the unpleasant experience the evening before. Before long another two managers stopped by to offer their apology. 
The balance of my stay was perfect. 
This property is beautiful. I was fortunate enough to get a room with an incredible view. The accommodations were comfortable and technologically up to date. 
The pool is huge and strategically located within 10 meters of the beach. 
I was on a half board plan and had the breakfast and dinner buffets during my stay. Good selection as well as taste. 
One of the days I ate lunch in one of the restaurants that offers a la carte service. I asked the chef to prepare lobster Sri Lankan style and it was absolutely delightful. 
All in all an excellent place for holiday in the Galle district.

Review_text: Do not trust Heritance nor Agoda
Review_text_2:
We arrived at the Heritance Ahungalla at 9pm yesterday evening after a long journey from the States.  We were told that the rooms we had booked and paid for were no longer available.  
This is a small boutique style hotel. They solution was to send us next door to a large all inclusive party resort 

We contacted Agoda who booked the room and failed to notify us it was cancelled.  They offered a 15% discount.  Big deal, we had already lost our first day of a three day visit getting bounced around and treated like a bad disease. 

Escalation within Agoda was requested but ignored. Instead we got an email congratulating themselves  on how well they did resolving our issue.  

Heritance management were worse and could only blame Agoda for not telling us they would not honour a fully paid reservation.  

Bottom line, do not trust doing business with these two shysters.

Review_text: Let down by slow dinner service and a poor meal
Review_text_2: We had 4 nights here at the end of a tour and it was by far the worst of the hotels we had stayed at. No problem with the room (though our friends managed to get their room booked out whilst they were in it!) but the service on two nights in the Coffee Shop and the Upper Dining was VERY slow. Added to this was the meat when it arrived after 90 minutes (!) in our meal at the Upper (Fine) Dining was overcooked in part and a lump of fat for the duck! This was very disappointing as we had been introduced to the company's head chef at a previous hotel. The Jade restaurant (buffet) was good both for dinner and breakfast though.

Review_text_2: Arrived at the Heritance Ahungalla at 2.00am in the morning after a 10.5 hour flight from Gatwick and a 2 hour coach transfer from airport. Absolutely tired out. We had booked 2 double rooms and 2 single rooms through Thomson's I had had problems regarding the wrong names in the wrong rooms and couldn't get it sorted through their call centre. When we went to check in they had only three rooms with a little bit of stern talk they sorted it. I believe the problem lies with Thomson's Their airport Rep was with us but did absolutely nothing to help.  After that the Holiday was superb. The Hotel has the most friendly of staff Especially Himasha. The Buffet food is excellent with a vast variety of cuisines from English through Italian to Chinese and Asian. One tip! every one advises not to swim in the sea. as there are strong under currents  safe enough to paddle but even then you can feel the under current drawing you out. However the 2 Hotel pools are beautiful and so swimming is no problem. I should give this hotel a rating of 5 but the problem at check in forces me to drop a star sorry.

Review_text_2: Walked to this hotel from the Riu down the road and found an amazing colonial style building with astonishing grounds, where we came across a rather large Monitor Lizard, and beautiful beach front. We enjoyed an ice cold bottle of Lion Beer while sitting in the shade by the large swimming pool surrounded by fig trees. A fantastic way to spend an hour away from our hotel. Would look into staying here but might be put off by the price because the two beers cost us 1,300 Rs, which seemed a bit steep given the cost of living in Sri Lanka.

Review_text: Good but falls short of Excellence
Review_text_2:
My wife and I had a two week holiday here in December.
Weather was good and we did trips to Yala National Park (4 hours by car) and Kandy (4 hours by car). 

I list below the positives and the negatives of our holiday.
 
Positives :
Good food in restaurant buffet with a different daily menu.
Friendly and generally helpful staff throughout the hotel.
Excellent sea view from our first floor bedroom balcony.
Excellent sea front location offering lovely beach walks.
Two very large and spacious swimming pools kept clean.
Room very clean and some wonderful animal shaped towels kept us amused.
International plug sockets, always a help.
Good size balcony.
Much needed cold drinks upon arrival.
Clean sheets and towels daily.
Large 50" TV in bedroom. (A negative for us as we don't watch TV but probably a positive for others).
Plenty of colourful bird life in the hotel grounds.

And so to the negatives.

No Jacuzzi for our entire stay.
When we enquired we were told they were waiting for a part but by the time we left the Jacuzzi was looking very grubby with gathered dropped leaves and rainwater.
Alcoholic drinks were expensive particularly a small glass of wine with dinner.
Costly alcoholic drinks turned up very quickly at dinner but not the free water.
On several occasions I had to ask three times for water.
Lack of local railway train information at reception.
No postcards sold at the hotel.
We had air conditioning problems in our room which took a while to resolve.
The plug in the wash basin didn't operate properly.
No curtain in the bathroom for the first three days of our stay.
Wobbly fan on the ceiling (maybe it was meant to be like that !).
Wobbly bedside table definitely shouldn't be like that.
Nowhere to walk to / have a coffee/beer/snack out the front of the hotel (busy road).
That's even if you manage to get past the tour guides who hover by the hotel gates.
Lack of lighting at night between the hotel front and the hotel gates.
Insufficient staff in the restaurant when busy. This was particularly noticeable at weekends.
Noisy building work being carried out on one wing of the hotel during the day.

Some of these points might seem petty but added together it wasn't the holiday my wife and I had hoped for.

Would definitely recommend Yala National Park.
A visit to a Turtle hatchery.
The Botanical gardens at Kandy.
The fort at Galle

  

.
Review_text_3: There is very little to do or walk to in Ahungala

Review_text_2:
The location: Pleasant drive from Colombo.Beautiful , tranquil entrance. But the feeling did not last so long as it was a pain to check in. So many forms to fill and signatures, 4 separate ID documents for the 4 rooms. I would suggest the guest relation takes care of the forms instead of requesting the guest to fill it.Different ID docs per room, different signatures!!!! Absolutely ZERO CHILL!!! 

The rooms :Drab & dated in stark contrast to fond memories i had, visiting this establishment few years ago

The food:Good variety , delicious & living up to Heritance standards

Service: There were a few attentive staff.But had some bad experiences. My mother had a cramp (after swimming in that gorgeous pool) and requested some warm salt water brought in late night(10pm) .It took more than 30 mins for it to arrive .I wonder how long it would have taken to get a meal to a room. Dogded that bullet!! I feel like the new property next door must have poached best service personnel from here.

Review_text: Sri Lankan hospitality at its best!!!
Review_text_2:
Returned after 10 years and found the place to be just as amazing as I remembered. 
What I didn't expect was the care and kindness from the staff. I was sent a surprise birthday cake after dinner! But i was moved by the assistance provided to us when my 4yo daughter slipped and fell near the pool just before checking out. Family members left in the hotel, while we were at the hospital, were looked after well. The staff were kind enough to arrange a special meal for us as we were not back till hours after the buffet lunch was over.
processed_text_Review_text: sri lankan hospitality at its best!!!

Review_text_2:
Just return from a week in Herritance Ahungala. The hotel is amazing with its infinity pool facing towards the ocean. Plenty of sunbeds, beautiful beach. Maybe the rooms needs to be renovated but that is no important, the most important are the people, with their heart on hands just to make your stay perfect. They are not a staff they are a heritance family and try to do everything that you become also a part of their family. 
Food prepared by Chef Manjula is just delishes. Beginning from European cuisine ending on real taste of Sri Lanka. Grilled lobster, crab curry, dhal, egg hooper are to die for. The food was the best I have been eaten in the all-inclusive hotel. Must say that in many good restaurant you will not eat better. Chef Manjula, who I have had chance to meet personally gave me is even his secret recipe for dhal.
I have seen some negative comments about the rooms, food, cleaning- so if you look for a just the hotel (good drinks, animation, standard hotel food) do not go there but if you want to feel the soul of Sri Lanka is the place for you.

Review_text_2:
First of the good:

The people and the rooms are great. Very helpful and kind staff. Rooms have a great view.

The bad:

Co-ordination of our trip was very poor. We got in very late and realized that they only booked us in 1 room when our reservation said 2 rooms. They ended up finding a room for my wife and I, but it had 2 twin beds rather than a king/queen. Same goes for my parents room.

Food: Food was average at best. At a 5 (or 4 star) property, you expect the food to be excellent as you end up spending a lot of time just hanging out at the property rather than running around from place to place. Us being vegetarians was especially hard. We had the same 3-4 dishes to pick from. Most of them even seemed to be served from the meal before. The chef told us that we should have informed them of our dietary restrictions. However, from a 5 star resort, you expect them to follow up with you prior to your visit or during reservation, asking you of these things. Nothing of the sort happened. Of course, if they had followed up prior, the mix up with the room would not have happened either. In addition, if they followed up, they would've known that my father is disabled and would have found a room closer to the elevator....

I can't really recommend this property for the price we paid.

Review_text: Construction=some new parts and some dilapidated parts
Review_text_2: This hotel is hit or miss. We stayed in a beautiful room but had a view of trash and falling apart tennis courts. There were ants in our room. There are some nice areas (main pool) and some very run down areas (spa area).  The beach is nice and long but water is rough with currents and rip tides. The breakfast buffet and lunch buffet were plentiful so it was easy to find food for each preference.  The service was good but slow. It took us 20 minutes to check out through some outdated cashier methods (spa had to bring a paper copy of their charges while we waited).
Review_text_3: Ask for a room away from the construction
processed_text_Review_text: construction=some new parts and some dilapidated parts
processed_text_Review_text_2: this hotel is hit or miss. we stayed in a beautiful room but had a view of trash and falling apart tennis courts. there were ants in our room. there are some nice areas (main pool) and some very run down areas (spa area).  the beach is nice and long but water is rough with currents and rip tides. the breakfast buffet and lunch buffet were plentiful so it was easy to find food for each preference.  the service was good but slow. it took us 20 minutes to check out through some outdated cashier methods (spa had to bring a paper copy of their charges while we waited).
processed_text_Review_text_3: ask for a room away from the construction

Review_text_2: Glad to see you are renovating the rooms which are far better than the drab rooms with rusty fridges on the other side but what happened with the food which was very average maybe even poor , heritance was known for its food, we only had one night of decent food and that was for a tour group, also I see nothing has changed with the beach boys/men hovering at the hotel and a constant annoyance,

Review_text_2:
The hotel is too large and it is a 40 year old 
So it is kind of an old hotel 
The room service is late 
We checked in and the shampoo and body gel bottles were empty 
Regardless of all this they have a nice looking beach 
The lobby is wide and open to the ocean and unfortunately it is as hot as the ocean and the outside street 
I dont know it is a good hotel if they did renew it

Review_text_2: We travelled with family on an outing, that had been planned a couple of months in advance. One of the members of our party is in a wheelchair and from the time of booking, this was mentioned as a special request. However, it was extremely difficult in getting confirmation from the hotel (both head office and hotel were contacted) if they were able to accommodate this guest. Several calls and emails went ignored and we resorted to calling a friend. This was extremely annoying as full paying customers you would like to think that the hotel would want to provide you with this basic service. A complaint made to the FB page provided some call back, but as always the trail went cold. We were unsure as to if this guest was able to make it, so in sheer desperation we had someone physically visit the hotel the week prior to our holiday and ask if they could be shown a few of the room categories, we were happy to upgrade if necessary. However, the person was not shown all categories and so the guest decided to only come for the day. Needless to say, we went there already disappointed with what the hotel had to offer. Once we checked in, we realised that one of our rooms was able to accommodate the guest in the wheelchair, and then proceeded to go to great lengths to ensure this guest joined us for the night. When we questioned the front desk as to why this room had not been shown to us, we were not given a valid response and we let it be, as we felt like we had already exerted way too much effort in what was meant to be a relaxing holiday! Needless to say, I felt like reservations, front desk and the head office staff were negligent and incompetent in this regard. Thereafter our trip went along smoothly, the staff were friendly and courteous and cooperated with requests such as bringing out a birthday cake. The rooms were clean and the common areas pleasant. It is a decent family hotel. The food was average at best, with no real highlights. Nice enough for a holiday with kids, but not good enough to compensate for all the hassle with the levels of initial service rendered.

Review_text: Great Architecture coupled with horrible management equals: We don't come back
Review_text_2:
We are a European Asian couple who came to Sri Lanka for our Winter vacations. We admire Geoffrey Bawa as a legendary architect and decided to come to one of the hotels designed by him to live his work for real. So We booked two nights in Heritance Ahungalla. 
Today is the second night of our stay and we just left the beautiful beach after the music reached the point of a super loud sound test. 

When we checked in we were made to sit and wait in front of a really loud bad music group. We complained a few times about the loud music right in our ear but they smiled and continued, forcing us to move away with our bags. Otherwise the treatment we got in checkin process was cool. But all the good mood was gone thanks to the awful music. 

Bawa designed his buildings in a way that the outside is coming to the inside and there are lots of open spaces. So really bad music in full volume means that you will hear it all over the hotel even in your own corridor. 

We complained more than 10 times and witnessed that other tourists were laughing at the music and walked away as far from the lobby as they could. 

The hotel management put really ugly ridiculous christmas decoration in the lobby and inside the beautiful infinity pool making, a big mockery of Bawa who designed the lobby so that you see the sea behind the infinity pool. 

The food was okay, nothing special other than a terrible vegetable chop suey and vegetable fried rice we got for yesterdays lunch. They have great freshly baked bread and spreads which we loved. And nice veggie burgers. 

Our room was interesting, as it seems to be originally as designed by Bawa years ago. The mini bar was dirty inside and the refrigerator quite rusty.
The wifi worked well for my computer every where in the hotel, but my wife had not as much as luck as i did. 

The staff were trying to give us a friendly face and some times we met nice people. A front desk guy called Khan was really funny and cool to talk to when he helped us secure the late checkout which we were promised via booking.com. 

The dining area got really wet under my own feet with lots of rain water this morning when it was heavily raining. Our corridor and the bar/ reception area was flooded because the roofs and windows were leaking.

They have amazing pools designed by Bawa and we used every opportunity jump in to them. The hotel is an architectural masterpiece and in a very cool location. However, the company that runs it seems to be treating this paradise for architectural lovers as just a another cheaply run 5 star hotel to use as space for mega groups they bus in to maximise profit. 

The loud music and badly maintained building may kill it for most. For us, we will not come again unless some miracle happens tomorrow. We are extremely disappointed of the fate of Bawa's hotel.
Review_text_3: Book this hotel if you need to crash not to enjoy Bawa's building to the sound of the sea.

Review_text: A Great Place but missed on the basics.
Review_text_2:
Came in here over the weekend, drove from Colombo and got in late but the reception was ready for us and got us checked in real quick. They had a spacious room for three but they missed the basics like refilling the amenities like toothbrushes etc. and had to  be ordered. And the shower gel, conditioner and Shampoo had no labels so we had trial and test to see what was what. So frustrating!! Nevertheless they made up with the amazing location absolutely amazing service and great spread for both breakfast and lunch as that's what we had.  Ordered room service for dinner which was apt but they overkilled on the French fries!! 

I'd recommend you guys to go for the ambiance and location and hopefully if they correct these small issues you have a killer deal!! 

Cheers!

Review_text: Excellent Location, Friendly Staff, BUT Not that Vibrant
Review_text_2:
I used to be a frequent guest since early 2009. This hotel used to be one of the best in every possible way. I should say that the location is great, with absolutely stunning views of the southern beaches of Sri Lanka. The architecture, flora and fauna gives a very relaxing feeling away from the commercial/business feeling. 

The staff is still very helpful, most would bed over back to entertain the guests. During the last visit with my wife they even upgraded me to their best suite, the Sachin Tendulkar Suite with no buzz or hazel at all. 

I must say, the rooms are of good size. 

But unfortunately that is where it ends!

The buffets are not up to the standards ( I am being very polite and generous towards the hotel here). Variety is lacking, taste is lacking, freshness is lacking. The edible items run over in 1 hour, so if you go there it late - you are left to trial the buns and sandwiches like parchment, and some left over stuff. As with many other hotels in SL they seem to cater a specific corporate client base, as a result the food spoils it for the relaxing holiday traveller. This is not just one time experience, but my observations over time. 

Restaurants and ala carte has little to offer. 

The "best suite" feels like collapsing on one end, not cleaned for days on another note, and worse of all even the renovation seems to be left at half way. 

Little activities happening at night, and the management does not seem to be interested in addressing it for years.

Last few visits all I felt is that the staff at junior positions, room services, and reception are trying to blow some warmth and energy into it, but the higher levels seem to be not bothered about what they offer to the clients. 

While I do believe, looking at the number of corporate customers in the restaurant (mainly East Asian and Indian - whom I have randomly come to contact with, have informed me that they are sent to this place via corporate arrangements, not by choice) that the hotel is likely making good returns and is not financially pressured to invest in restructuring and renovation; it makes me sad that this is like an aincient giant which is approaching its last legs.

Would I recommend it to anyone? 
Probably not if you are on your vacation. Given there are quite nice new boutique hotels in the area, for a fraction higher price point. 

Would I go there again?
Probably not, unless the hotel addresses these issues effectively, because it's a waste of time and money the way it is.

Review_text: Terrible experience with shameful behaviour from staff
Review_text_2: This place has deteriorated unbelievably. I have visited the hotel on multiple occasions. In the early 2012s the Hotel was decent with friendly staff. Now its all gone down sour. I revisited again in 2016 but was shocked to find out that the standards have turned so bad. Firstly, I was welcomed by the usual friendly smiles and what not but the staff at the pool were extremely rude, and racist... I took some family visiting from the middle east for lunch and soon found that the hotel service made them very upset. They tried to use the pool, however soon knocked back and told that 3 quarter shorts weren't suitable for pool. These idiots have no idea. As a traveller in many western countries, I have never seen such fools running a hotel.. They don't know what guest services means... then the racism part kicks in where the staff are plain rude and are like robots and smiles at white skin guests, but frowns upon anyone with a tinge more of colour... Absolutely ridiculous and I discourage anyone from travelling and staying at this hotel....

Review_text_2:
Me and my family stayed on FB basis for one day at heritance, ahungalle in october. the best thing was the food there. However, except for the welcoming staff at entrances staff was un or minimally attentive most of the time, of course they attend to us if we go and poke them repeatedly. 
              we have booked a triple room and checked in around 4pm but there were twin beds in the room and after repeatedly reminding them they finally added an extra foldable bed. the person who brought the bed looked like a senior for that area, when we complained he just muttered something like 'twin bed room is the only room type available at heritance when you book a triple room and we always add an extra bed , only difference is you will get meals for 3 people' and walked away rapidly, on us...
                there were no room amenities in the room- no iron or ironing board, no water for three people, no slippers ,toothbrushes, cups etc at all. when we needed something we had to call and wait and call again . ultimately one person appeared with a trolley and instead of replacing missing items asked us to take whatever missing in the room. and the dark color pillow covers were so dirty we just kept them away. no one has bothered to change them for ages .
               safe was not functioning and when we typed numbers it missed some and got locked,then the person who attended late to fix it couldnt identify that its battery was low. finally it was fixed and by about 8.30 we managed to go for dinner. it may be due to overcrowded hotel but they already had 2 hours extra to check the room beforehand since we were late for check in. 
                        meals were good, staff was also more attentive. no one offered a baby high seater for our 3 year old and we had to go after them at all the 3 meals for a chair... restaurant is overcrowded and no one is there to offer water or clean tableware. they are only interested in taking plates away, at least that's a good thing.
                   chefs and the restaurant manager were very supportive and offered some food for our baby , they were kind enough to deliver the dishes to our room as well.
There is no sea view from the room and there was some construction work going on right next to our room which we didnt mind much..
               next morning we asked them to take the plates away but no one showed up. by 1pm we were ready to check out and until that time no cleaning was done and room smelled of stale food. 
overall we didnt mind it as it was a one night thing ,tolerable on a full stomach and surely this place happens to be a typical siri lankan hotel, no matter how many stars they got,..
Review_text_3: better to check for all facilities yourself once you get the room

Review_text_2:
Submitted for a friend on holiday with no internet access: 

If you are considering going to Sri Lanka with Thompson don't bother and have had to post on here as your in resort reps are ignoring everything!!

Ahungalla Heritance Sri Lanka,  in resort rep name is Ruwan and his team leader won't even speak to us, they won't move us and are not interested.  

The toilet is leaking into the room !!!

There is massive construction work that we were not told about going on with jack hammers on the go, on top of this there was no privacy in the bathroom due to the room/window set up and when it was complained about a member of the hotel staff used masking tape and cardboard to cover it!!!! 

We Have offered to pay the difference to move next door And the hotel and the resort reps don't care,  and to top it off despite paying for all inclusive .... they won't give out soft drinks. 

Shocking customer service, shocking in resort service do not use this company or resort they do not care!!!

Review_text_2: My partner and I have arrived from the UK this afternoon and we knew instantly, that we had made a big mistake choosing this property as our base in Sri Lanka. The lobby has as much ambience as my mothers funeral in September!!!!!! It is dark, unwelcoming, cold,uncomfortable furnishings and lacks any kind of warmth and inviting environment. We had paid for an upgrade on our room prior to leaving the UK with a double bed deluxe sea view. We got neither. Room was damp with a smell of urine from the bathroom. Interior was again dark with numerous scratches on furniture. No ocean view and two twin beds put together and the safe was not secure to anything!!!!! Tiles missing from the bathroom and no kettle,ironing board and iron!! The list is endless. Complained to the management and the front of house manager did state some of the rooms had not been upgraded in thirty five years. We were moved to another room which was supposed to be an upgrade. Alas not. Toilet that leaks, as well as the air conditioning: no secure safety box and the smell of fresh paint. Have eaten n the restaurant this evening. Best described as bland, average and uninspiring. We have already been in touch with our tour operator to move us or we will be returning early home. The only positive are the very friendly staff. If any of the hotel management read this we are in room 355. If you want luxury, with the added little touches do not come here, save your money and go elsewhere.

Review_text: The food was not very good.
Review_text_2: We checked in on the first week of Oct. The check in staff was friendly and welcomed us with a refreshing drink. The room was spacious but we received two single beds for me and my husband. Which I found really ridiculous. They should have inquired regarding this when we made the reservation or at check in. When we asked to change they said the hotel was fully booked. We then asked the housekeeping to dress the beds with a single double bed sheet. Which still didn't make a big difference. The room fridge and the phone was not working. Informed them and they replaced it. The rooms need refurbishment and new equipment. The lunch buffet was not that great. The Srilankan option was good but the other dishes were not tasty. The starter section looked really pathetic.  And added to that the prawns were not de-veined. Which was unacceptable. The waiting staff was dazed. We had to ask for water. Nobody escorted us to tables. The staff was basically a little lost. During dinner they had barbecue going on which was good. They had a seafood dish again the most prawns were not de - veined again. Brought it to the attention of the management and informed them that there could be consiquences for consuming non de - veined prawns. They apologised and offered to get something else. I informed them I don't need anything else but to keep the kitchen staff informed regarding this. Breakfast was good and tasty. Again during breakfast the waiting staff was lost. Asked for coffee and never got it. I just left it. The other complaint is to get more high chairs for kids to restaurant because our friends needed a high chair and everything was taken. So if the hotel is full there is no option. But I have to tell that hands down the best buffets to go to for is heritance Kandalama and Negombo. So tasty and great variety.

Review_text_2: Have to say, its not a great hotel in need of some serious updating, lots of new hotels about to open very close by so they either need to up their game or rebuild the place.  Beach sellers/beggers were a pest and security didn't seem too bothered with their presence, one lunch time we watched some sneaking in.  Buffet restaurant, was not well stocked once the first lots of food was taken, the room didn't seem all that clean, bedrooms were tired, the ala cart restaurant was empty and expensive for the food on offer.

Review_text_2:
We had 5 nights here with 3 adults and 2 kids. 
After a bit of a slow check in and having to swap rooms because of renos, we settled in and had a merry old time.
Fab swimming pool and warm, friendly and very helpful staff.
The food was terrific, we ate in all the restaurants in this hotel. The amazing team in the kitchen cooked us up some top seafood nosh. Loved the beach dining.
There were a few niggling issues with a lack of hot water hot water and dodgy door locks but that aside I would not hesitate to recommend. 
Ware the beach boys prowling the shore, ready to pounce, and I don't recommend swimming in the surf, massive undertow!!

The bell boy was very careless. I personally told him to be careful with my CK bag. Not to put it on floor. When The bag is inside the room I noticed dust marks on the bag :(

Food is good. Gym and swimming pool is good too. Other staff members were acceptable and one front office staff member was exceptional (Kanishka).

Review_text_2:
One of the best hotel located on the west coast of Sri Lanka. 
Vast, luxurious, spacious, multi pools, many bars across the property located 45 minutes north of Galle and 2 and 1/2 hours south of Colombo Airport via the new Express way. Great beach. Lovely gardens. The rooms are large, well appointed, with lots of wood all around. Nice spa attached to the hotel. Friendly and helpful staff

Review_text_2:
We finally decided to give this hotel a shot as we were traveling through the area mainly due to its architecture (Jeffrey Bower design) and location. Sadly this place failed us. Trivago lists the room that we were given for around $90 US. We paid $175 per night for the two day stay with the full understanding that we'll be getting a decent room. I was expecting much better accommodations given it's the off season and the hotel in near empty. Firt room we got was so bad that I refused it immediately.  They then moved us to a different "deluxe" room, as I was told, which was marginally better than the first one. The bathroom is dirty, no bath robes in the room and the view is sub par. The room is located in the far corner of the hotel. It is a smoking room and we were not offered the option to choose whether we needed a smoking room or not. It's puzzling to me that the hotel staff felt this room is consistent with a 5 star hotel. I'd rate this place and our experience at 3 stars at best!

I've given them two opportunities to rectify the situation and they utterly failed both times. They've had a golden opportunity to wow us and grantee a repeat customer but for some reason, that I still can't understand, they chose to make sure that we will not come back again. In this copetitive field, where there are many other options availabe, the accommodation we've received is not what I had expected from a Heritance chain (Kandalama in contrast was fantastic). We'll be in this country 3 more days and was hoping to to spend it in this area had they met our expectations. Instead we'll be moving to the Hilton in Colombo for the remainder of our stay. Needless to say that this is the first and the last time for us in this perticular facility. Situation of this type do not warrant a third chance.

To the management team... look very closely into the culture that is set forth. I don't think you can afford to have customers like us, who travel all over the world and are often in Sri Lanka, to be this dissatisfied with your facilities. Every one that complains on a site like this, ten goes without taking the time to do so yet they are just as dissatisfied. You're alianating the very customers that is your life blood. This is an absolute self inflicted wound.

Review_text_2:
On our way from Colombo to Galle we stopped by this establishment without prior reservation. The grand driveway and facade of the Heritance Hotel where impressive at first sight. Having arrived there the good impression faded quickly. 

The room rate given at the reception was US-Dollar 140 per room without breakfast, which is expensive for the island, but we accepted without a written receipt.
First of all we had to wait over 1 hour to get the room. By that time the dinner was about to finish, so we were advised to go to the restaurant where a buffet was presented. The quality of the dishes were far from higher standards. The room was alright, but nothing special. The hotel was crowded with tourist groups from China. 

The next morning by the tome of check-out a bill was presented of 280 US-Dollar.
The chef concierge refused to get the man on duty from yesterday night. The outrageous room rate was ompared by us with rates shown on booking sites.
The same night rooms had been available from 58 US-Dollar! 
After were rude discussions we left the hotel with a "discount" of 60 US-Dollar and
paid incredible 220 US-Dollar. 
A never come back experience!
Review_text_3: First-floor rooms have a terrace

Review_text: Great Staff but very dirty and old hotel
Review_text_2:
We have just returned from our first trip to Sri Lanka. We had a wonderful time and Sri Lanka is stunning. We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla expecting a little bit more than we got however the biggiest disappointment was how dirty and aged the rooms were. There was no bath and the shower was filthy as was the rest of the room. My son on the first night was sick (not sure how) however we asked that the room be fully cleaned the next day which is was not. You could still see the smears of sick on the floor from where we had cleaned during the night. The bed sheets were also stained and did make you wonder if the sheets were clean stains or not.

The corridors to the rooms were also in a poor condition and looked more like the corridors on a run down housing estate (I can say that as I lived on one for 5 years).

The  bathroom amenities are also just refills with dirty lids so make sure you bring your own!

However!! The staff were amazing and so attentive and the natural beauty of Sri Lanka makes it all worth while. Would we go back to the same hotel? No! Would we go back to Sri Lanka? Yes! Yes Yes! 

Special mention to Sri Lankian immigration too who are so friendly. 

Looking forward to returning to Sri Lanka.

Review_text_2: When we arrived we were taken to a room that clearly wasnt set up for us and our two kids. Not only was no baby beds set up, we could not commit to the room as it was too dangerous for our kids. The balcony had steps to railing, which meant our 1 year old could jump or climb over. There were holes i  the railing where our 1 year old could slip through. We then spent almost 2 hours looking for another suitable room. Its been horrible as the only room they could put us in has no floor space to walk as the infants beds and pram take up the entire room. Im so sad that i bought my family here on a holiday as its horrible. They are moving us rooms but this is costing a lot more. This place is not for families.

Review_text_2:
We stayed here for 2 nights with high expectation, but were a bit disappointed about the in room facility.   The room is a bit old,  the electric water pot was quite dirty.  The tooth mug was dirty with crack,  the shower gel container also had crack and without a cap.  I don't expect all these for a 5 star hotel!

Speaking of service particularly the restaurant serving the buffet.  It takes me several attempt to refill the coffee and got the plates collected.  The waitress saw us and not responding.   However,  they are responding proactively to non Chinese.   This gave me a sense of discrimination!

Despite the negatives,  the swimming pool is fantastic.  It faces the Indian Ocean which is awesome!

Review_text: AWSOME LOCATION GREAT FOOD INNUMERABLE MINOR GLITCHES
Review_text_2:
As you enter, the view of the beautiful pool .... merging into a pristine beach ... merging into the sea sweeps you away. 

Unfortunately you don't get swept off your feet at this property. Since we didn't get a booking at the VIVANTA by Taj in Bentota we thought we'd try the Heritance. 

The property is run down and seems to have seen better days. A renovation should be on the cards sooner than later. 

We were upgraded to a suite named after the legendary Sachin Tendulkar but unfortunately  the exhilaration of of the room or the hotel in no way matched the Little Master's batting. 

The room was ill-planned. No light switches and plug points in the right places, basins in which you couldn't splash your face, a Mini Bar fridge with a broken shelf, and never replenished, pathetic mal-functioning wifi...... and one could go on and on.... Minor glitches but collectively a huge nuisance for the price we paid. 

The biggest problem was the air-conditioning, never below 24 degrees Celsius. This in a hot and humid Bentota was a big problem. 

Two large swimming pools. Wow !! one for  playing and kids and one for peaceful and serious swimmers like me. A Great idea! However the pleasure was short lived when we entered the pool. The water was cloudy and had particles flowing in it. Temperature was like soup. 

The Gym was exceedingly ill-equipped for the number of rooms. Only two treadmills, one of which was closed non-functional for the duration of my stay. 

One large dining area for buffets. One fine-dining restaurant but we never saw a living sole there in the 4 nights we spent. The food at the buffets were exceptional,  but in case you're a vegetarian please be very careful. Options are very limited. 

Since large groups were coming in the buffet tables had huge queues. I for one am fond of nibbling tit bits going often to the table. But that was a Big no-no. 

Dealing with the lower staff is impossible. Not only is their a pathetic standard of English, many of them pretend to understand and say yes but things are not done. 

However I'd be failing in my duty if I didn't mention here, that the senior staff ably led by GM Mr Upul Peiris and the F&B Manager Gamini, were extremely courteous and helpful. Highly responsive. Problems brought to their notice were promptly attended to. I believe Mr Peiris has been here only for a few months. Seeing his leadership abilities and genuine concern for the customer I'm very sure these glitches should be a thing of the past very soon. The management needs to move from Responsiveness to Pro-activeness. 

My recommendation is to go here at a quiet time and not during peak season.

Review_text: Very poor start to 5 days at this so-called 5* resort!!
Review_text_2:
They say first impressions are everything!! We knew we were in for a rough time as soon as we arrived.

On arrival we were shown to a scruffy bar area with tatty leatherette seats which were all torn and ripped.

For the third time in 6 days in Sri Lanka we were taken to a really horrid room (No. 228)!! OMG what a dump - we had paid for a king-size luxury room and what we got was a prison cell twin!! It was filthy, pokey, run down and utterly horrid. Needless to say we made a fuss and were initially told we would have to pay for an upgrade!! We were finally upgraded to a suite gratis. Unfortunately this was not much better!! The hotel is in a terrible state and is in dire need of major renovation. One of the biggest problems in this hotel is the design. This hotel is celebrated for it's design and architecture but in my opinion this is misplaced. All the bathroom walls are simply skimmed concrete which gives them a horrid dingy, dirty prison cell-like appearance. There were no curtains - just these filthy heavy shutters which moved in filthy tracks. The blinds were broken, filthy and flaking!! Pillows were stained. The remote control for the TV was held together with sticky tape, the hotel guide book was covered in sticky dried food, the chair at the desk was filthy and the mini-bar fridge was rusty and leaking water. The final straw was the insect life living in the room!!

We were tired, upset and ready to leave. By this time it was very late at night and we contacted our travel agents in UK and told them we wanted to return to UK asap. 

We were told there was nothing that could be done until the morning.

We spent a very uncomfortable night and waited to see what would happen.

Well; we had obviously stirred the hornets nest!! Next morning we were contacted by the front of house manager and within minutes we were surrounded by loads of staff members apologising and promising to make things right. After a short while we were upgraded again to a genuinely luxury suite which was lovely. Clean linen, clean floors, curtains and the biggest jacuzzi I have ever seen!! 

Throughout the whole process all of the staff at the hotel were wonderful and helpful and charming!! We enjoyed the rest of our stay.

Once this hotel has been renovated it will be fantastic, if you are looking for a stunning beach resort. The location is idyllic. 

The buffet restaurant is good with plenty of high quality options - western and local cuisine. 

Make the most of the area - hire the bikes that the hotel offer and enjoy the amazing countryside. - we spent a couple of hours cycling through the local village. What a treat!! Giant Monitor lizard by the side of the road, buffalo wandering towards us on the road, local farmers working in the paddy fields surrounded by cattle Egrets and monkeys jumping through the trees!! It was very hot but one of the highlights of our trip. A day trip to Galle was very worthwhile as were trips to the local towns. The local Turtle hatcheries are wonderful but beware the 'Spice Gardens' - rip-offs aimed squarely at parting unwary tourists from their cash!!

I was genuinely shocked at the number of people putting their towels on the pool-side loungers before breakfast and then obviously spending the whole day baking and drinking beer. Bloody long way to go for skin cancer and to not experience all the amazing sights, people and wildlife this wonderful country has to offer!!
Review_text_3: Wait for the promised refurbishments before booking!!
processed_text_Review_text: very poor start to 5 days at this so-called 5* resort!!
