they say first impressions are everything!! we knew we were in for a rough time as soon as we arrived.

on arrival we were shown to a scruffy bar area with tatty leatherette seats which were all torn and ripped.

for the third time in 6 days in sri lanka we were taken to a really horrid room (no. 228)!! omg what a dump - we had paid for a king-size luxury room and what we got was a prison cell twin!! it was filthy, pokey, run down and utterly horrid. needless to say we made a fuss and were initially told we would have to pay for an upgrade!! we were finally upgraded to a suite gratis. unfortunately this was not much better!! the hotel is in a terrible state and is in dire need of major renovation. one of the biggest problems in this hotel is the design. this hotel is celebrated for it's design and architecture but in my opinion this is misplaced. all the bathroom walls are simply skimmed concrete which gives them a horrid dingy, dirty prison cell-like appearance. there were no curtains - just these filthy heavy shutters which moved in filthy tracks. the blinds were broken, filthy and flaking!! pillows were stained. the remote control for the tv was held together with sticky tape, the hotel guide book was covered in sticky dried food, the chair at the desk was filthy and the mini-bar fridge was rusty and leaking water. the final straw was the insect life living in the room!!

we were tired, upset and ready to leave. by this time it was very late at night and we contacted our travel agents in uk and told them we wanted to return to uk asap. 

we were told there was nothing that could be done until the morning.

we spent a very uncomfortable night and waited to see what would happen.

well; we had obviously stirred the hornets nest!! next morning we were contacted by the front of house manager and within minutes we were surrounded by loads of staff members apologising and promising to make things right. after a short while we were upgraded again to a genuinely luxury suite which was lovely. clean linen, clean floors, curtains and the biggest jacuzzi i have ever seen!! 

throughout the whole process all of the staff at the hotel were wonderful and helpful and charming!! we enjoyed the rest of our stay.

once this hotel has been renovated it will be fantastic, if you are looking for a stunning beach resort. the location is idyllic. 

the buffet restaurant is good with plenty of high quality options - western and local cuisine. 

make the most of the area - hire the bikes that the hotel offer and enjoy the amazing countryside. - we spent a couple of hours cycling through the local village. what a treat!! giant monitor lizard by the side of the road, buffalo wandering towards us on the road, local farmers working in the paddy fields surrounded by cattle egrets and monkeys jumping through the trees!! it was very hot but one of the highlights of our trip. a day trip to galle was very worthwhile as were trips to the local towns. the local turtle hatcheries are wonderful but beware the 'spice gardens' - rip-offs aimed squarely at parting unwary tourists from their cash!!

i was genuinely shocked at the number of people putting their towels on the pool-side loungers before breakfast and then obviously spending the whole day baking and drinking beer. bloody long way to go for skin cancer and to not experience all the amazing sights, people and wildlife this wonderful country has to offer!!
processed_text_Review_text_3: wait for the promised refurbishments before booking!!

Review_text: Certainly not a 5*, but going there
Review_text_2:
Since I stayed in the hotel for almost a week with all inclusive package, I have had enough time to examine every part of it. 

ROOMS. 
It can be seen that the hotel is old. So are rooms. Even though staff cleans them regularly, you can't hide things like mold or very old and severely used furniture. 
Bathroom was clean, but not in the best shape either. Our neighbours had some creatures coming out from bathroom sink, but the issue was quickly solved by staff (so be careful and notify staff if you see anything weird). 
Rooms are not soundproof at all, so you hear all the noise from the hallway and from outside (especially, from a wedding or a "private party").

FACILITIES.
Pools and theirs surrounding facilities are fine. The only annoying thing are beachboys (some guys offering you tuk-tuk rides and women selling clothes). These people might follow you and annoy from day to day, but a firm "no" is ok for them to go away. Be aware that prices are higher than anywhere else. Also, be careful with the tuk-tuk guys. Negotiate the final price and all other aspects right away, so you won't get fooled in the end. They will tend to bring you to their "friends" (places, where prices are super high and tuk-tuk driver gets his cut), such as local ayurveda farm/massage, gemstone mine, souvenir shops, and some tea shops/ spa's. 
Beach is not populated - guests are swimming in the pool (which I found weird, because the ocean is so warm). 
Some (and again, SOME) of the public bathrooms around hotel stink like hell. They were clean, but that smell... I can still feel it. 

Also note, that the hotel is located in Ahungalla, which is not that famous for its tourist attractions. New hotels are being built, but it takes time until the whole tourist infrastructure will appear around this place. 

FOOD AND DRINKS:
Breakfast, lunch, and dinner buffets are fine. The variety of food is also fine, however, if you stay more than 5 days you will get bored with the food (it is different, but usually tastes the same). One great thing: desserts are marvellous! 
The barman at the pool bar is quite experienced and nice.
A la carte menu is somewhat average. Be aware, that "service costs" are usually will be between 25 and 50%, which I found ridiculous.

STAFF
Friendly, as mentioned before. Not all of them speak proper English, so if you have a question or a request - try to use simple words.
During the buffet, drinks are poured by waiters. From the day one I realized that you have to say twice if you wanted to have a drink, otherwise they would forget it. 
Some of staff saw my all inclusive bracelet and asked if I could get a beer/cocktail for them from a bar. 
if you want to use their taxi service, I highly recommend a driver named Nishan. Competent young man, who does not try to fool you. 
Overall, good experience.

CONCLUSION.
There are some positive things, but you can't say this hotel has five stars just because of friendliness of staff. Rooms, some facilities, surroundings, and other minor things don't make it a 5*. So, for this price you can find (I believe) something much better. 

But I wish good luck to Heritance and hope it will change to the better.
Review_text_3: Not above the restaurant (smell, and all these constant endless parties/weddings, that take place in front of the restaurant).

Review_text: We loved this hotel, it will be 5* after the refurbishment programme which unfortunately has been delayed
Review_text_2:
We stayed for 10 in the luxury room during February. The room itself was large and clean, however the accommodation in general needs to up its game to 5 star standards. We were shown two of the newly refitted rooms which were beautiful, however planned works due to start in May have been delayed. What a shame! Other areas of the hotel are showing signs of wear and tear for example the gym with its old equipment. 

Now to the positives of which there were many. The layout of the hotel is stunning with two massive pools at either end of the hotel. The staff at the hotel are outstanding with particular reference to the pool boys and resaurant staff. Nothing was ever a problem and each request was greeted with a smile .

I would advise to eat at the hotel as there aren't that many options outside. Although buffet fare there was always lots of variety, and we were pleased

We had a couple of issues , however these were sorted out by the general manager. If you are not happy speak with him and the issue will be resolved.

We had a super relaxing break and felt totally looked after with that personal service 

The hotel will be 5 plus after the refurbishment. We visit again
Review_text_3:
Upper floor sea view 
Luxury room double the size

Review_text_2:
I planned a day out two weeks ago and requested details from the Hotel. I got the confirmation on 10 Feb with the reservation number. Representative from the hotel called me and confirmed my booking also.
When We went to the hotel, the front office said they could not give us a room since hotel is fully occupied and they give the rooms for the day use on availability basis(not informed at the time of booking). However, they agreed to give us a changing room (B Grade room as per the front office) on FOC basis and we said ok since we traveled 2 hours from Colombo to Ahungalla.
However, we didn't get the changing room also which was agreed to give within 10 minutes. We were there for about 1 hour and we cancelled our day out and came back to Colombo. At that time the front office staff asked the confirmation number and he said the booking was in the system. :(
I don't about the process of Heritance Ahungalla, but this was my experience with this Hotel.

Review_text_2:
As we pulled up outside the entrance to this hotel we were amazed at the view.  We were looking forward to some relaxing days.  We were shown to our room which was disappointing.  It had a poor view and the shower was in need of some good quality cleaning products, with the grouting all black and the glass door was covered in limescale.  We were so unhappy and disappointed (this was the third hotel in the group that we've stayed at on this trip) that we asked to be moved to a different room.  This was facilitated but we had to wait almost two hours for the replacement room to be ready.  This room had a much better outlook and whilst the grouting was cleaner, there was still the same issue with the shower door.  Some good limescale remover used regularly would work wonders.  That said, the overall cleanliness of the room was very good.  The room cleaning service was always good and the guys couldn't have been more helpful.

The pool and gardens are nice and the staff at the pool were very good.  On one occasion a man was in difficulty in the pool having wandered out of his depth, and the lifeguard on duty leaped to his aid.  A happy ending.  Don't be too worried if you see chipmunks and land monitors passing by.  Perhaps even the occasional monkey.  

We found the service at the pool bar to be friendly but quite slow, with some staff, on occasion, preferring to stand and chat together.

We ate in the outdoor restaurant twice and found the food to be pretty awful.  After those poor experiences we ate in the buffet restaurant.  I wish I could be more positive but I can only be honest - the evening meals were not up to the level of that at the previous hotel at which we'd stayed.  We found many dishes overcooked and almost cold.  At the dessert bar, only half the items were labelled, and if you went to eat after the main rush it felt like we were being given the leftovers.  The whole presentation was lacklustre.  The staff though, were very nice and friendly and the service good, though some worked harder than others.  I feel this establishment would benefit greatly from more staff training and motivation.
Review_text_3: Refuse the room next to the gym if you don't want to be woken at 7am by someone dropping weights or pounding the treadmill.

Review_text: Poor Service, Terrible Toilet Conditions... etc (list goes on)
Review_text_2:
Room was satisfactory at best. Few charger portals also phone kept going off at random times.
Toilet was in a dire state. For a '5 star hotel', the toilet cleanliness was spotty at best. 
Dinner Buffet was expensive which was why we expected better quality food as compared to the hotels we stayed in Sri Lanka. There was limited variety and food lacked freshness. For a 5 star hotel with 5 star prices, this was a very terrible stay

Review_text_2:
We stayed from 18 to 21 January with a group of 13 family members. This was the second hotel in the Heritance group we stayed at during our 23 day holiday in Sri Lanka. Compared to Heritance Kandalama Ahungalla was a real disappointment. 
It looks great when you first arrive - the pool looks fantastic but everything else about it was disappointing - the tiles in the foyer area and along the corridors are stained, the bathrooms need a really good scrub, the food in the buffets was boring and many of the staff looked like they just didn't want to be there. 
Overall there just didn't seem to be the attention to detail we saw at Kandalama - we booked 3 double rooms, 2 twins and one triple room. On arrival the 3 doubles were all made up as twins and the triple had only 2 beds. One of the couples called reception on arrival to have the beds remade as a a double and had no problems, the second called and was told that it was not their practice to do that and in order to have a double bed the couple would have to be moved and that couldn't happen at the time because the hotel was full, the third couple then rang and was upgraded to a better room, despite the previous couple being told that there were no other rooms at all. In the triple room a small fold out bed was provided and most of the first evening was spent trying to explain to the staff that the tiny bed was not large enough for a teenage boy. Eventually after much conversation a better bed was provided. 
My parents have visited this hotel 4 times, however I would not go there again. In its current condition it is not worth the price charged.

Review_text_2:
We visited on 19th December we were a group of 7 adults and 3kids we received a warm welcome and it was a very busy day to fount office. All three meals were very good kids also enjoyed as well as us and rooms are also good and clean... we have booked 2 double rooms and a one triple room, But they don't have triple rooms they only give a extra bed for the third person... Wen they fixed the third bed  it was a tragedy! none of us can sleep on that bed because it was a very small folding bed. I have never seen a extra bed like that in my life. we have visited many star class hotels, and we always booking a triple room as we are travelling with our mother. I have never seen such a small extra bed.... When we ask about this from the hotel they told us this is the size of a extra bed they provide. That bed is good for a kid not for a adult... I'm very very disappointed...But I couldn't let any one to sleep on that bed I barely manage that bed so didn't had a good sleep... It was a sleep less night.
But except the bed all other things were at the hotel is good... We enjoyed the beach as well as the pools...

Review_text_2:
We have been traveling around south India and Sri Lanka for almost 1 month. This hotel is not the worst of the lot, but it missed only by one place. In general it looks an feels very tired and you don't have to look very hard to find the dirt, grime, dust, and sand, and that was just in our room and bathroom. The same goes for many other public areas. 

With the exception of a few staff members we got the same impression. Tired of dealing with tourists...

The food was only OK compared to everywhere else we stayed.

It's a beautiful location, but unfortunately a disappointing experience compared to almost every other resort or hotel we have stayed at on this trip.

Can't reccomend.

Review_text_2: We are in this hotel end of last december 2015. This hotel has aged quite a lot, even including the rooms. In our washroom water was not draining properly. Complained but nothing happened. Food was very mediocre...mostly Sri Lankan cuisine. Hotel check out was quite haphazard...You need to get into a room to checkout but not at the reception, looks like government organization.  Staircase is not kids friendly. There were no safety railing in the staircase; kids can fall through the staircase. Requested the manager to give a feedback, but he was unavailable and he send the housekeeping manager (even though I explicitly requested the manager).  They say resort is due for renovation, mid 2016. Well if it is due for renovation why charge premium rate...hmm not value for money.

Review_text_2: We were visiting from Chicago, USA, and  spent a couple of days at the hotel with my brother's family. And Wow! What an amazing time it was. From the time we drove in to this breathtaking site we were treated like Royalty. We received a very warm welcome from the front office staff. The staff was always very pleasant and were always willing to cater to our needs with a smile. It was a Bonus to meet with the GM of the Hotel Mr. Refhan Razeen. It was beautiful to see the Top Guy of the facility always being around, meeting and greeting his guests, and offering his services. It was obvious that he was much loved and respected by his staff. Mr. Razeen has put together a great team who seem to love and take pride in their work. The hotel rooms were very clean & comfortable, with great views. The food was exemplary, with so many choices prepared tastefully. It was truly a Five Star Experience for us.We look forward to coming back again when we are visiting Colombo at the end of the year.
Review_text_3: Don't hesitate to ask if you have any special needs or requests.

Review_text_2: When we entered the room, we complained about the smell of mould - the hotel did nothing. We had paid for this hotel nine months previously and we were now trapped. At dinner that night - we were asked how our soup was - and we honestly advised there was too much salt (another freshly made batch was produced). Twenty-four hours later, I was screaming at a lady from Guest Relations, the Food and Beverage Manager and the Housekeeping Manager, all standing in our room, (yes at this stage they were willing to change rooms - why I cried, you did nothing 24 hrs ago when I complained.) So they said we were being upgraded to Fine Dining - oh really, we had already paid for an evening meal, So we went for a snack, then slept. (The night before there had been a graduation - that's where the blood came from - and our future leaders had a wonderful noisy night). Upon checkout I was asked if I would like to complete a feedback form - oh dear, you really want me to write about our experience and state that we had to pay for our food. To her credit, she ran and my husband was given back the money he had just paid - and I received two bottles of water. The photos speak for themselves. Five star accommodation - I don't think so.

From the time We entered the hotel to the time We left they made sure we were well taken care of.

Want to come back for sure to enjoy comforts to the fullest.

Review_text_2:
We arrived at the hotel after almost 20 hours by plane  and found out that espresso coffee is a special coffee and will have to pay, although it has the same taste and in no case was an espresso. I mention that we had an all-inclusive supplement and the coffee was included
First Breakfast: i wanted an omelette  I asked the chef to prepare "well done", but he became visibly irritated because I have explained in more detail. He said something in his language, evading after I asked him what he said.
I inspected the room where I was staying and found that under the bed were traces of visible dust probably old before those who have been staying here previously, the bathroom is not the bathroom of a 5stars hotel. The towels are to used and have old stains. On the ceiling we discovered traces of mosquito / dead flies on the ceiling of the bathroom
The beach behind the hotel filled with annoying vendors that are allowed by the security agents even inside of the hotel property limit.
We found the waiters mostly unprepared, lazy and disinterested. At the pool if you order a drink lasts an eternity. In fact, if you order anything in this hotel last an eternity.
The food at dinner buffet is an ordinary cantine  and you can easily see that they recycle the food from evening to another or is the same food.
The concept of all inclusive is a joke, because there are only a few types of local drinks and those bad.
Beach towels are to used and have old stains.
We chose the restaurant "fine dining", but the disappointment continued. We first drink comes after 15 minutes, and the food was brought after an hour of waiting and although you must have 15 / discount due prepaid package of all inclusive, we were charged 100 / requires that the next day to ask for explanations, explanations that reduced bill. However, the food is typical of a normal restaurant. Not bad, but nothing special.
I have to mention that in the fine dining restaurant were only 2 tables with people. It was empty!
The new years evening was ok, but we wanted to order champagne and they told us they are out of stock.
We wanted Moet, they gave us Mumm. How can you not have stocks of champagne for New Years Eve?
The food was very good. If this have been the food for all the holiday i could have forgot all the other things 
 
At 14.30 in the nect day the room was not cleaned in the context in which We left at 9 am the room.
 I ordered a soft drink included in all-inclusive package, it was added to the bill and replaced at the my request.
Conclusion: if you're not careful pay twice. 
Wishing to relax at the beach we waited 30 minutes for the staff to find sun beds towels.
Another breakfast: I asked two omelets ( for me and my husband) everything OK, I asked him and the third omelets for my son and the cook was getting nervous. The adventure continues...

For sure the  hotel management will have a respond to this post, but it will not make any difference , because my new years eve holiday was ruined, so I recommend you avoid this hotel that can be classified as no more than one 4-star hotel!

Review_text: The staff manipulate the guests to write the reviews they want. And the service is poor.
Review_text_2: The rooms were very clean. The pool of the hotel was huge and was maintained very well. However, when we checked in, the staff took ages to give us a room because it was not ready at that time. Even they took another half hour to bring out luggage into the room. We came to the hotel at about 7pm, and their normal check in time is 2pm, so they had ample time to prepare the room for us. We wanted an extra bed and so told the reception at the time of check in, but they brought the  extra bed at around 10 in the night. At lunch on the second day, their was a live insect in the passion fruit dessert and when we told the staff they just took it away and didn't bother to apologize. Then at check out, they manipulated us to give 5 stars and write a good review on trip advisor. No wonder it has a rating of 4.5 on trip advisor. Overall the service was poor and not to our satisfaction.

Review_text_2:
This is absolutely not a 5 star resort - not by international or Sri Lankan standards. Everything from the small room to the aged gym and very basic amenities was a disappointment. The food is admittedly excellent but the restaurant staff have absolutely no sense of how to host more than 100 people.

On the whole, the staff are friendly but typically clueless. Basic hotel processes such as charging drinks to a room or booking a spa appointment have proved very trying. Their cashier desk is simply a joke - patrons have to go to a little room in the back of reception to make small payments, as if they are in some bizarre 1950s public administration building. The overall impression is in fact an insult to guests who are paying a significant premium for their stay.
Review_text_3: choose a different hotel or a villa nearby - avoid this resort

Review_text_2:
I'm from Kandy. We (myself and my wife) went to Kandalama in dabulla and had a great time So we wanted to take our parents as well. 
It's pointless of going to the same place (Kandalama) twice therefore we decided to go to ahungama heritance since it's all from the same family. 
There's about 220km from kandy (up and down both about 450-500Km) it was along trip. by the time we got to the hotel it was 5.00pm on 05/12/2015. We told the reception we have 2 bookings, one double room and one triple room. The welcoming lady was a fat girl and she was very rude to us she did not support at all even when filling the forms during the check in. and she took us to our rooms

Double room (215)was ok but the triple room was very small (216) and fully packed most of all there were only 2 beds, so when i inquire about the 3rd bed from that girl we said " Ah.... ok i will send a folding bed for you" As if like we are servants/slaves. I told her politely. I request for a triple room and I have already done the payment by visiting to your headoffice at aitken spence colombo. Her reply was "all our rooms are this size there is nothing we can do" I said if you put another folding bed here, there is no space even to walk in this room. Her reply was "Sorry" she said it in a way either you take the room or go home, and she went away saying she will send someone with the folding bed.
My mother said "don't be mad putha we all came here to enjoy not to fight the other room(215) seems to be a bit large so we shifted to the next room. Then again I thought I already paid for a triple room and I don't get the service I wanted. If the hotel has only double rooms, they should have told me when booking. they never told me that.

I got mad. I called the reception and requested to connect with the manager. Unfortunately manager was not there and an executive officer was available named "Chathuranga" I told him about my situation. I have child about 10 months old. Myself mywife my child and my mother all are staying at this room, and the room is too small. he quietly listened to my situation and he asked me 5 mins and call back. then he called me and say "sir we have a large room vacant you can shift to that room" 
I was delighted we all went there to enjoy not to suffer and stay in a room like in a  prison cell. Then again I called to chathuranga and appologised him for getting mad and raising my voice what he told me shocking. he told me "sir it's better you told me now rather than checking out, if so we couldn't have done anything for you.
Review_text_3: If you don't like the room call the manager not the clerks, Managers thinks from the customers point of views and give you the best

Review_text_2: I visited this property for a destination family wedding and while the rooms, all beach facing and the property was great with the really nice swimming pools, the service levels expected for this category of hotel was severely lacking. We were 3 of us staying in a suite and we were categorically declined to be given another cinamon gel soap (they only give one for your entire stay) and we had to fight for extra drinking water, considering there was an extra person in the room. We had a housekeeping guy who was downright rude and hellbent on proving us wrong. Apart from this even refusal for giving us food from the buffet since we were late or allowing us to sit in the restaurant and eat. The point is that the staff blindly followed rules and did not care about customer service at all. Not once have they gone out of their way to help us feel comfortable.
Review_text_3: The suite room with its private garden was great

Review_text_2: My first impression as I drove into the driveway and into reception was quite good....then downhill.I picked the hotel as it was ranked a 5 star property,but by European I would give it a low 3.....I was in a luxury room...half the lights did not work,a damp smell lingered despite spraying,the room was old dated the shower over spilled and the water was not warm....I have to say the worst room I have slept in.The public areas and dinning room pool area also very dated.I was informed the hotel was closing in May 2016 for a full re fit....avoid until then....The staff need service training ...I found them lacking direction ....overall totally disappointed.

Review_text_2:
I am on a holiday to the beautiful country SriLanka.
My tour covers major 4 towns of this country .
1) Kandy
2) Nuwara Eliya
3) Ahungalla
4) Colombo .
I had chosen all 4/5 star properties for my leisure cum pleasure tour .
The best of all these is Heritance Ahungalla.
V were welcomed by very courteous staff with welcome drink & refreshment towels .
The check inn procedure was completed in just few minutes .
We were guided to our room with very well mannered , polite, courteous & well dressed personnel.
She explained us all the features of our room & the facilities available of the whole property .
Our room was very well made up upto the 5 star standards.
The food is also very good especially for we vegetarians with lots of choices .
I would like a mention of all the very polite & disciplined staff.
I would definitely recommend this hotel to all those who visit SL.
It's a property with heritage with all modern facilities

Review_text: Great looks outside but unpleasant inside.
Review_text_2: Big buffet but flies on table and crawling crabs under tablecloths in airconditioned dining room. The tiles in the shower area had never been cleaned. Dull resort as very little to do beside swim in their pool. The beach is unsafe, no water sports. Only one table tennis table and one carrom board.  Very warm and friendly staff but housekeeping and reception leave much to be desired. Not worth the price.Ground floor rooms are dark and dingy with blinds that need a tug of war to open and close.
Review_text_3: Ground floor are horrid but they give what they wish regardless of preference indicated.

Review_text: Really trying hard to give you a good experience
Review_text_2: We visited this hotael for one week after doing safaris just to relax. I must say its been one of the stays that gave me very mixed feelings at the beginning. The hotel looks quote nice and delivered excellent quality in foods, the rooms are clean. Even though the hotel puts a lot of effort in pest control we had a bug problem in our room on the first day. After mentioning this our room was gladly upgraded and the previous room closed for very thorough treatment. It is always possible to have something like this when traveling to tropic countries. But we didn't experience any more problems after that. The hotel more then compensated our discomfort and that says a lot about how they want you to feel after your visit. If you're afraid of bugs its always better to get a room on higher floors. The food was of good quality, also the drinks. The main dining area didn't feel very cosy to us but this is easily solved by eating outside in the garden. Also try the vegetable pati for snack, its awesome. The chef showed us around the kitchen (we made mention something was labeled as vegetarian which contained fish) but they took this small mistake (we saw it before eating) very serious. They showed us around in the kitchen which also was very clean and they also have a small atelier where the do food / sugar sculpting of which they won many international awards. It's a shame they didn't give this more attention in the hotel. The garden has nice areas to sit but we were confronted with another pest the hotel was working very hard to control, local sales men. The beach is public and the sales men bite hard and don't let go. For us this proved to be very irritating since they sometimes became really aggressive (I almost got in a fight with one of them after  I didn't agree on a price he started calling me out, even when I was further on the hotel grounds). A mention to management about this and since then we saw police patroling the beach. Notice that you'll have this problem at any hotel because all beaches are public. This hotel at least tries very hard not to let this be a negative factor for their guests. So in short the hotel is good with the potential to become awesome. There are a lot smaller details (as everywhere) they can still improve on, but never have I been to a hotel that was so eager to get feedback from their guests and implement it. Just make sure to talk to them if something is bothering you and they will be very grateful and make sure you walk out with a good experience. Don't just put it on TripAdvisor after you go. Maybe we had a bit of Murphy at our side during our stay but the hotel and very friendly crew and management went out of their way to make our stay memorable and they did in spades!
Review_text_3: Ask for higher room, all rooms have a splendid view of the ocean.

Review_text_2: Wonderful property. Warm people. Great hospitality. Lovely setting. Special mention for Praveen Fernando for being the warmest, and the most hospitable. Starting from the front desk to all the smiley housekeeping staff Chef Tilakratne and  Chef Kavinda are warm and kind and put their best on the table especially Sri Lankan specialities.
processed_text_Review_text_2: wonderful property. warm people. great hospitality. lovely setting. special mention for praveen fernando for being the warmest, and the most hospitable. starting from the front desk to all the smiley housekeeping staff chef tilakratne and  chef kavinda are warm and kind and put their best on the table especially sri lankan specialities.

Review_text_2:
The first thing that hits you is the chaos that reigns at the reception. It takes 30 mins to check us in . We were desperate for lunch.So at 2.30 the coffee shop seemed like a good option. But instead of quick service we were greeted by rude staff and poor service. The rice n curry we ordered was cold. Took them 25 mins to serve cold food. They did try n make up for it at their main restaurant. We were told "you just name it and we will make it". The buffet spread is vast.Vegetarian dishes they are yet to master.what they cook up as Indian fare falls woefully short.A quick rethink is needed here.
Being a resort by the sea side, Heritance could have been exciting but alas the only thing that they provide is the sea! No water sports.No beach based activity.
The staff is overworked. Its a mela out there. 
Bentota could be a better option with many hotels and resorts to choose from.Also it is the hub for water sports.

Review_text_2: One of the many Geffrey Bava specular hotels!! A perfect beach hideout that radiates good vibes of serenity and a stress free environment. Review_text_2: What a simply awesome place. The scenery, the rooms, the pools, the bars, the food - they were all top notch. The buffet was different every day so you didn't get bored. Best of all however were the staff which were the friendliest I have encountered. Well worth a visit.

Review_text_2: Amazing hotel - staff so friendly amazing facilities and they had the World Cup rugby. Great F&B offerings - very nice activities in and around the hotel. Will definitely come back soon. The location on the beach with a massive pool enables you to really relax and enjoy your time away.

Review_text_2:
The biggest highlight during my 2 night stay was the exceptional service demonstrated by the staff especially those at the restaurant. Lakmal, Nuwan and Nelka were always around to serve and take care of our meals. They even went to the extent of asking if we wanted anything outside the buffet. The ice cream yet brought to the room was a nice touch!
Given my toddler nephew (of less than 2yrs) was not in a position to enjoy the buffet, Lakmal and Nuwan approached us with their pragmatism of offering mashed up food for the baby. Quick thinking and awesome service once again.

The two hick up's were in relation to the room #253
1. The door lock wasn't functioning efficiently as it should. 
2. A ceiling leak left a puddle just outside the bathroom.

Nonetheless Nihal came to the rescue and sorted it out quickly.

All in all a very good 2 night stay.

Cheers

Review_text_2:
The atmosphere was relaxed and our every need was catered for.  The variety and quality of the food were outstanding.  We cannot speak highly enough of this amazing hotel.
We took a two day tour to Kandy visiting a spice garden, tea factory and gem museum/shop on the way.  Our hotel was good and the following day we spent time at the botanical gardens before visiting the elephant orphanage.  We had nothing but kindness all the way.
One evening after dinner the sous chef  Roshan Pujitha  showed us round the kitchens where he explained about the number of meals that were prepared each day.  We were also shown some amazing sculptures made from salt dough, butter and chocolate.
We shall tell all our friends about this hotel!

Review_text: Not as good as it seem
Review_text_2:
We stayed in Heritance Ahungalla for 16 nights. I want to structure the Review in positive, neutral and negative things and because everyone seems to tell just the positive things i start with the negative ones. 

Negative: 
- Dirty beach; the Hotel does not care about the litter on the beach. Of course it is a public beach but there are only Hotel guests. Thats why they should clean it more often. 
- Beach Boys: they wait in front of the beach and even whistle or shout for someone. You always feel observed when you lie on the pool
- Rooms are in poor condition. In the shower is mould, the curtains are dirty and the furniture is old (i enclosed some Pictures). This is definitely not 5-star-hotel-like! 
- The Hotel customer Service asked if we could give them a good tripadvisor-rating and they want to see if you give 5 points. Thats certainly the fact why there are so many good Reviews. 
- The Prices in the Hotel (if you dont have AI) are quite high. A 0,3 Liter Diet-Coke is about 3 Dollar, the dinner 26 Dollar. Very much for a Country like Sri Lanka. 
- When you leave the Hotel there are some Tuk-Tuk-Driver who want to bring you to the next herbal-farm or wants to sell you drugs. After our second try, we did not dare to go out
-The Bar staff was quite slow and we had to wait almost 15 minutes till someone cared. That happened many times.

Neutral:
- Loud Room: We had a room over the bar and the bass was quite loud till 11 p.m. But most other rooms which are further away are certainly quiet. When we told this to the front desk they immediately offered another room

Positive:
- The architecture of the Hotel and the beautiful pools. 
- The Housekeeping and almost every Hotel employee was extremely friendly
- The animals in the Hotel. There where cute chipmunks, funny apes, lovely ravens taking their bath in the pool, a lizard and even a big snake (i dont know if it was poisonous) 
- great Food. I dont think that you can find any better Food in Sri Lanka

I just rate the Hotel with two out of five because it is made much better on tripadivor than it is for real. In my opinion it is not better than a european 3-Star-Hotel and i know that sri-lanka-standard is far lower than european but unfortunately the Prices are not like Sri Lanka (Massage 1 hour- 100 Dollar!)

The breakfast and dinner buffets were both delicious.  The rooms were clean and we chose the deluxe ocean front room which was even better and would recommend to all

Review_text_2:
We spent six days in this hotel from Friday 18th September 2015 to 

Thursday 24th September 2015.

Overall, we were very pleased by our stay here and it was a welcome break as we had been touring Sri Lanka for the five days previous.

The hotel itself is very stylish in its design where the architecture is blended in with the surrounding environment. We particularly liked the wall along the main ground floor corridor which was open air with creepers coming down. 

Our room was on the first floor. It was a generous size with a massive double balcony overlooking one of the infinity pools and the beach.  It was stylishly furnished and it had good air conditioning. It had all the features you would expect such as a 
safe, tea and coffee making facilities, a good amount of drawer space, mini bar and plenty of free bottles of water.  The main down side to it was that it got pretty noisy, especially between 09:30 and 11:30.  It is directly above the pool bar, close to the 
reception area and every night, there was some entertainment there.  Any chance of having an early night was scuppered because you would get daily renditions of "Lady in Red", "I can't help falling in love with you", "Wonderful tonight", "Yesterday", 
"Strangers in the night" and other modern classics in various different musical arrangements. Saturday night was really bad. The room shook for two and a half hours and you could hear every word of every song played. We were on the verge of demanding a different room but decided that we didn't want the hassle and 
ended up putting up with it as some nights were a bit more subdued than others. Looking back, I think we should have demanded a different room.  I think that the rooms further away from this area are probably very quiet and peaceful but if you ever get given room 226, this is what you will get. 

The amenities are very good but perhaps not of a five star hotel.  The spa was excellent. My wife had a Balinese massage which she thought was fantastic although the spa prices are equivalent to salon prices in the UK. The gym had some reasonable facilities, including rowing, running and cross trainer machines. It had a 
reasonable weights section.  The infinity pool and resident pool were beautiful. The resident pool is quieter and has a beautiful tree which stretches down almost inside the pool - pure genius in design. It also has a jacuzzi.  The hotel is in a fairly remote area and you need transport.  There is a resident taxi service and we were told that you can take a public bus or train, or even a private rickshaw. The hotel did not give out much information about local transport (such as timetables) and you could not book any excursions through the hotel. You were asked to deal individually with the resident taxis (which demanded prices nearly as much as UK taxi prices). We found the financial amenities we a bit limited. My advice is to take plenty of cash with you to Sri Lanka. I was hoping that the hotel would have an ATM but it doesn't. It offers a money exchange service but will not accept card transactions - it's cash only.  The nearest ATMs are a 10 - 15 minute drive from the hotel. Furthermore, we decided to pay our final hotel bill a day early and use up our remaining Sri Lankan Rupees for drinks on the last day.  Unfortunately, the hotel doesn't accept cash for food and drinks purchased. 

The hotel overlooks a beautiful beach although the sea is too rough and you are advised not to go into it for safety reasons.  The main issue was that there were various hawkers who stayed just the other side of the hotel boundaries. As soon as anyone stepped out of the perimeter to go onto the beach, they would get hassled by these hawkers wanting to sell them anything from garments, excursions, meals at their own restaurants etc.  The hawkers would employ typical marketing methods, such as following you, shaking your hand, calling you from a distance , beckoning and enticing the children of hotel residents as a way of getting a sale.  

The staff were excellent. They were very attentive and provided a great service.  The hotel customer relations managers worked tirelessly along with the rest of the staff. We felt very pampered.

The food and drink was exceptional.  The main restaurant laid out buffets for breakfast, lunch and dinner and they were of a very high standard.  There was a large range of choice: salads, Western food, Chinese food and Sri Lankan food. 
 
I would say that on the whole, the hotel is more suited to large groups and families.
Review_text_3: Away from the reception area and bar area.

ended up putting up with it as some nights were a bit more subdued than others. looking back, i think we should have demanded a different room.  i think that the rooms further away from this area are probably very quiet and peaceful but if you ever get given room 226, this is what you will get. 

the amenities are very good but perhaps not of a five star hotel.  the spa was excellent. my wife had a balinese massage which she thought was fantastic although the spa prices are equivalent to salon prices in the uk. the gym had some reasonable facilities, including rowing, running and cross trainer machines. it had a 
reasonable weights section.  the infinity pool and resident pool were beautiful. the resident pool is quieter and has a beautiful tree which stretches down almost inside the pool - pure genius in design. it also has a jacuzzi.  the hotel is in a fairly remote area and you need transport.  there is a resident taxi service and we were told that you can take a public bus or train, or even a private rickshaw. the hotel did not give out much information about local transport (such as timetables) and you could not book any excursions through the hotel. you were asked to deal individually with the resident taxis (which demanded prices nearly as much as uk taxi prices). we found the financial amenities we a bit limited. my advice is to take plenty of cash with you to sri lanka. i was hoping that the hotel would have an atm but it doesn't. it offers a money exchange service but will not accept card transactions - it's cash only.  the nearest atms are a 10 - 15 minute drive from the hotel. furthermore, we decided to pay our final hotel bill a day early and use up our remaining sri lankan rupees for drinks on the last day.  unfortunately, the hotel doesn't accept cash for food and drinks purchased. 

the hotel overlooks a beautiful beach although the sea is too rough and you are advised not to go into it for safety reasons.  the main issue was that there were various hawkers who stayed just the other side of the hotel boundaries. as soon as anyone stepped out of the perimeter to go onto the beach, they would get hassled by these hawkers wanting to sell them anything from garments, excursions, meals at their own restaurants etc.  the hawkers would employ typical marketing methods, such as following you, shaking your hand, calling you from a distance , beckoning and enticing the children of hotel residents as a way of getting a sale.  

the staff were excellent. they were very attentive and provided a great service.  the hotel customer relations managers worked tirelessly along with the rest of the staff. we felt very pampered.

the food and drink was exceptional.  the main restaurant laid out buffets for breakfast, lunch and dinner and they were of a very high standard.  there was a large range of choice: salads, western food, chinese food and sri lankan food. 
 
i would say that on the whole, the hotel is more suited to large groups and families.
processed_text_Review_text_3: away from the reception area and bar area.

Review_text_2:
I had read so many great reviews about this hotel and was really looking forward to staying here,  and I somehow feel like I have stayed on another planet compared to the other people who reviewed here. I will comment that the Chef Sarun was fantastic and made the best meal we had in Sri Lanka, the gentleman who was serving us was very good. 
Now, the hotel is getting very tired and could use a renovation, I was first taken to a room with 2 single beds,  being a couple this wasn't good enough, but also laying on the bed it was comfy,  the second room had a double bed but was uncomfortable,  so we left it to the young man who took us to the room to try and sort out something else - either putting blankets under or a pillow top,  anything, we gave them 2hrs and nothing happened.  I went to reception,  spoke with the executive gentleman, who apologized and said we could look at other rooms,  apparently they only have 1 type of mattress which I don't believe. In the meantime I had ordered food from the restaurant and was told it would still be another 15mins away, we proceeded to the next room, same, next room same,  so I said I would settle just for the twin singles as we were only staying one night. He then said he would get a new room sorted out and have our luggage moved. When I got back,  my food was waiting and it was cold,  less than 15mins. I advised the waiter and he said thanks- what for ????? We waited 1hr for no key, went to reception and collected our new room key. Went to the room, located at the end of the hotel, and our luggage was not there yet. Next thing I'm looking at the table and there is ANTS EVERYWHERE,  now I'm talking about 1000+ all having a little party on the ground and under the table,  walking down the walls etc. I have plenty of photos which I will put up when I have better Internet at home. I rang front desk and we got moved again 2 doors down, we went for a swim for 1hr again,  come back and there was more ANTS in the room. We didn't get offered another room, but got dinner which is the only reason this gets a 2 star and not 1. We didn't sleep very well and the band / music was playing very loud well into the night. We had to check out at 7am, I had ordered a breakfast,  but when I went to check out, I was hauled to the cashier office, and they kept me there for 10mins arguing about the meal from the afternoon which was cold and I was told would be taken off the room, and, they also tried to charge me for a phone call from my room, which was the executive ringing the manager about the ANTS. The lady who apparently was guest relations needs to be sacked, the cashier needs to be sacked for trying to rip me off. This left the worst taste in my opinion of Sri Lanka and I cannot believe this hotels staff would act like this to customers. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone,  hopefully management looks at this and takes action.

Review_text: Another unforgettable vacation at Heritance Ahungalla
Review_text_2: This is by far my most favorite hotel in Sri Lanka... It's luxury and comfort with the welcoming and relaxing feeling of being right at home.. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating and went out of there way to tend to our every need.. Exceptional service which I have never experienced anywhere.. The food was fantastic.. The rooms were beautifully decorated, very comfortable and well thought of with all the amenities you would need.. They even helped us make baby food for my little niece.. And the views were simply breathtaking.. I can't wait to go back again to this amazing place with warm smiles, amazing food, beautiful architecture and most importantly the relaxed, peaceful and calm surroundings.. Absolutely loved it!!!
processed_text_Review_text: another unforgettable vacation at heritance ahungalla

Review_text_2: Room was average considering we had told them it was our honeymoon.  Food was not up to par when comparing with other hotels in Sri Lanka until we spoke to one of the chefs who made us a traditional Sri Lankan curry and brought it to our table.  Think they try to cater for far too many people instead of sticking to traditional dishes.  We were told that it would be good for snorkelling but the sea is too rough all year round.  Better snorkelling a few miles down the coast.  Staff were useless at bringing drinks.  Could take an awful long time waiting.  We got bored with the bar and mundane entertainment and walked along the beach to a ramshackle hut called The Sunset Bar where we were given a warm welcome by the locals who run this place.  Ending up dancing on the sand.  Soooooooooooooooo much better than listening to polite, elevator music back at the hotel!!  Wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone and wouldn't go back.  There are much better hotels around.

Review_text: Heritance is the hotel resort to go to Southwest coast of Sri lanka
Review_text_2:
So much to say.  The rooms were great,  try for 3rd floor oceanview. The service  was excellent.  So many people to thank for our stay Klarathna, thushara, nerosh, varuna.. too many.  Most particularly the front desk staff..  we toured sri lanka from Columbo to kandy to Penwalla to Nuwary Eliya to the hikkaduwa/batouna/Galle area.  We had reservations with airbnb,  and several hotels. When we arrived at the coast area we found none of the houses or hotels were anything like the websites depicted.  All were filthy and trash strewn and very small.  We came upon Heritance and were stunned .  The hotel grounds are lush and clean, the pools were immaculate and the beach was clean large and perfect! There were multiple restaurants and bars on the grounds.  There was entertainment .  We stayed 4 days three nights and did not regret it. It should be said unless you a very comfortable with local foods and living conditions, this is the only hotel resort that offered a respite from the congestion and sanitary problems you may not be accustomed to.   The hotel is also ideally centered between Columbo and Galle .  

We looked at almost every resort from Botouna to Galle,  physically , while scrambling to find a place after being disgusted by our original "resort"  this is far and away the best, by leaps and bounds . It is a five start resort at economy prices. ( we booked online in the lobby for a significantly reduced rate )

We also did half board which gave us breakfast and dinner. (We found this to be essential and we'll worth the little extra it cost)   You will  find the food choices were great and varied and the staff would accommodate any and all special requests.  I wanted chicken noodle soup one night as opposed to the two choices and they made me a batch
Review_text_3: Third floor ocean facing rooms are a must

Review_text_2:
Heritance Ahungalla Beach Resort is one of the best Hotels to stay. It was the first time for my husband to stay in a hotel in Sri Lanka, he is a Swedish National. 

I booked Heritance Ahungalla online for my husbands Birthday, it was a surprise gifts from me to him. He loves the Beach and the Sun. When we arrived to the hotel the reception staff was very helpful and friendly. They welcomed us with soft drinks and cold towels, they escorted us to our room. On the the day of my husbands birthday he received a birthday cake to our room. 

The room was really nice with a sea view. 
The food at the restaurant was really good, they had different variety of food to choose from. 
The staff was very friendly and helpful, always with a smile.

We both had a wonderful stay at the Heritance Ahungalla, and definitely we love to stay with them again.

Keep up the good work.

Review_text: A nice place if you want to de-stress
Review_text_2:
Having travelled to every continent in the world id say -
The hotel is a 4star property 

Mr. Pahan at reception was the friendliest face whose smile calmed me many a times

Beware of house cleaning who on three occasions walked in the room unannounced

Due to the climate the buffet area have a lot of fruit flies over the food at fruit and salad counter which is disgusting

Not many options for alacarte so best is to take a full board package

If ur a light eater then half board is good
Best part of food is the sri lankan cuisine

Pool is amazing and beach is untouched which are the two features i loved most
Overall de-stressing and relaxing 

Will definitely go back hoping for a better experience 

Used the spa which was average - they could do better with the massage and ambience

Oh yes and pls carry shampoo and shower gel as the provisions at the hotel not user friendly

- Globe trotter
Ms Dsilva R

beware of house cleaning who on three occasions walked in the room unannounced

due to the climate the buffet area have a lot of fruit flies over the food at fruit and salad counter which is disgusting

not many options for alacarte so best is to take a full board package

if ur a light eater then half board is good
best part of food is the sri lankan cuisine

pool is amazing and beach is untouched which are the two features i loved most
overall de-stressing and relaxing 

will definitely go back hoping for a better experience 

used the spa which was average - they could do better with the massage and ambience

oh yes and pls carry shampoo and shower gel as the provisions at the hotel not user friendly

- globe trotter
ms dsilva r

Review_text_2: Two of us stayed here for a business trip to this area. The staff are fantastic, friendly, courteous and ever helpful. The hotel itself is on a beach and the views are incredible. The Internet is not strong enough in the rooms, our mobile devices seemed to work but when trying to log in with computers it was a different story. The hotel was quiet, 1/3 of the rooms full yet the hotel still gave us two rooms above the karaoke that started at 8pm thru to midnight. We both moved room but not sure why the hotel would give these two rooms when the noise was so loud the walls were shaking. The restaurant was also a disappointment - cost wise was actually higher than some 5 star hotels in Colombo, and the quality not as good, as well as the restaurant under renovation and moved to a banquet room with no view - overall food was a disappointment.

Review_text: Terrible property, they have some audacity to call themselves a 5 Star
Review_text_2: The location is good right on the beach but that's about it. The sprawling property has no charm, no grace, it's actually disgraceful. The service is pathetic. There is only one elevator servicing each wing and reaching your room is nothing short of a long uninteresting walk. The lobby lights are off at night and we literally had to walk in the torch light of the mobile phone when we had to leave at dawn for the whale watching tour. The spa treatments are an eye wash. The food is so lousy there is no sense of any combinations also the main course is served in a bright white light area if chef fin dishes that are broken and it feels like eating at a very low budget wedding or a college canteen. The last night was my husband's birthday and I had even offered to pay for a good cake, but my agent assured that it had been arranged free. It was one of the worst cakes that looked like it had been bought from the cheapest bakery in town. The common area toilets were so filthy I dreaded going there more than once. The key card that was issued to me was in someone else's name. Just about everything was bad about this property. I wonder how they have procured a licence to operate as a 5 Star. I do not recommend it to anybody at all! When the staff came to know that we were upset, they wouldn't leave us alone at breakfast and created an unnatural fuss. I found that extremely unprofessional. One of the staff members asked me what the problem was and after I shared all the grievances with her at the end of the conversation she actually said "wish you a good stay Ms. Natu " what should I call that? Deliberate or really dumb? If they don't get their act together soon, I guarantee that they will have to close down in the next couple of years!
Review_text_3: Stay miles away from this property!

The view is amazing from the first step and has the best first impression by far of all the Heritance hotels. Especially I would like to mention Dinusha and Sachini from the front office, as they were very helpful with information and other requests of ours. The restaurant hostess were very well trained especially during the busy times, always working with a smile. The food is also exceptional and A big thanks to the talented chefs who created the meals. To end I say that Heritance Ahungalla is second to none! We hope to return very soon!

We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of 3 weeks touring  Sri Lanka. We really enjoyed the beach and lovely swimming pools. Our room was average directly above the main restaurant with a very hard bed we asked staff to it a mattress topper which they did but was not really any better the second night. We We're woken up very early one morning by room service but had not placed an order   Breakfast wAs more like a cafeteria this hotel is very popular with the locals and they obviously have very different standards to us they love a Buffett which is exactly what we don't want. This is supposed to be a five star hotel and they certainly charge accordingly but they are not providing five star service or food   More expensive for two coffees 
Than  in Melbourne we did not eat any other meals at this hotel we went out to local restaurants recommend jungle Beach 10 min walk turn left at the beach 
Heritance need to have a look at there food and in particular the price of water prices $100 US for dining on the beach without drinks and the food is just not good enough standard 
The staff were friendly and pleasant at all times we found this at all Aitken Spence hotels

Review_text_2:
My mother & I visited on a 2 day break whilst in Sri Lanka. We have been thoroughly spoiled during our stay here. The food has been absolutely delicious & the service excellent. We have eaten the best hoppers in Sri Lanka! Even my mother, who is extremely discerning in  her culinary opinions was dazzled by the food here- that is no mean feat!!

The staff are extremely friendly & cannot do enough to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The rooms are spacious & we had a beautiful sea view. There are 2 swimming pools, one of which is quiet & has a jacuzzi. The proximity of the hotel to the beach is an additional benefit as the beach is very soft sand & perfect to have a sea bath.

Overall a delectable & relaxing experience which I would recommend both to those who use this as a destination hotel & those who wish to use the hotel as a base to explore the south west coast.
Review_text_3: Ask for a beach view room.

Review_text_2:
We stayed on route to Australia 20th . 26th Dec . it was the worst Xmas ever. It poured with rain , the hotel was supposed to be a 5 star but really no more than 2 star. The only good point is the staff and they tried their best to please us .  but the bottom line is the dismal grotty rooms the gray plaster bathrooms poor quality towels , generally grubby. 

The main restaurant is dark brown , noisy scraping chairs, dingy, grotty. The food caters for the sri Lankans/ Indians not Europeans .  I got a bad tummy that stayed with me for two weeks.

I could write a book about all the horrid aspects of this hotel but suffice it to say Don't Go .

Review_text_2:
We were at Heritance Ahungalla  last weekend and were treated like VIP"S !  Special mention is made about  - the staff - extremely courteous and friendly, without exception ie from reception to the restaurant. Special  mention is made of Gamini Wijetunge, Head of F & B and his Assistant, Thushara, who went the extra mile to make our short stay memorable.l  The food was superb - the buffet was fantastic, be it breakfast , Lunch or Dinner... - what a spread !! -   Also the rooms are well designed, ( plenty of power outlets to charge phones, IPads and laptops) comfy beds, clean linen and towels,and of course, we were pampered with a fruit basket in our room !. The bathroom was large, with a rain shower and a bathtub,  specially the Luxury Room we were in. 

This review is not complete without a special mention about the infinity pool . Lovely view of the Ocean,,and although  the pool is massive , you can  wade in - safe for kids - with a specially  demarcated deep end area  and the the hotel looks like a fairyland in the night from the pool side... Thank you all,  for the wonderful stay. We will come back !

Ranjit and Kuveni Wijeratne

Hotels entrance and lobby is very good. Amazing ambience of reception part but unfortunately unexpected rooms. Horrible the first day when we checked inn the room. Room was in a very bad condition. After a fight with front desk got a new room but next day. That was better but not upto the mark.

Bad news for vegetarian indian food lovers "No much choice". But yes for any indian veg food requirement in the restaurant there is 1 very helpfull person available i.e. MR. Praveen.

He supported us a lot and arranged very good veg indian food for us for all 2 days.

Thanks a lot to him again.

Overall our stay was very good. Beach , Swimming Pool, Jacuzzi etc etc.

This hotel needs a renovation very badly.

Review_text_2:
We stayed at this hotel for five days from the 13-18 February, in a superior room, on the ground floor overlooking the gardens with a partial sea view. From arrival it was apparent that the room had a stale smell that had been unsuccessfully masked by the cleaning staff using cloves to hide the odour.In general terms the rooms are large,although extremely outdated by the original 1980's décor. Limited attempts have been made to upgrade the bathroom by the replacement of the original sanitary ware. Although bare plaster,binding door,pop-up wastes that do not seal negate part of this exercise.

The restaurant prides itself on the training of its Chefs,although has considerable difficulties in balancing the menu to provide a mixture between eastern and western food.There is little provision for some travellers who may not want to eat Sri Lankan food for the whole of their holidays. This was mentioned on more than one occasion to the Assistant Sous Chef,and The Sous Chef,who provided a detailed tour of the Kitchen,although no indication why the menu is so one sided.

The restaurant is open between 7-10 pm,when we arrived at 8.30 pm most of the salad trays where empty and had not been replaced. The one European dish,pasta, had two spoonfuls of "penna" left in the tray. When we queried this with the Assistant Sous Chef he asked what we would like to eat?,and this could be prepared for us.I also noted that many of the dessert trays where empty and would be withdrawn and not replaced,normally at 8.45pm. At this time the restaurant is open for a further 1Hours and 15 minutes.

I really would expect better from a 4*-5* hotel.

Service really good not a single issue about the service BUT The rooms - we booked 2 deluxe rooms one triple and double, as per my knowledge deluxe rooms should have a king sized bed not twin beds,  im quite sure we were given superior rooms not deluxe and the third persons bed was a folding bed, which made our stay really uncomfortable,  could not sleep all night.

Very old and unsatisfying. ..
Never going to any of the Aitken spence hotels ever...

Overall - BIG NO NO NO

Review_text_2: We stayed here for 11 nights and were really impressed with the consistently great service we received. The staff are such a credit, and they really look after you well. We loved the quality of the food, and the breakfast buffet was outstanding. The room was also good, with a lovely view of the sea. There were a few small problems with the room but nothing major. For example, we booked a double but got a twin room instead. Also our safe broke a few times, but this was always fixed promptly. The main disappointment was not really with the hotel but the beach area, and lack of life on the beach - except for pesky sellers. We didn't really understand why there were no sunbeds on the beach. So we made use of the pool areas which were great, but not quite as nice as the beach. Although you do get to see some of the lovely wildlife in the hotel garden... iguanas, squirrels and even black monkeys in a big tree just behind the hotel. We were really surprised by how much we were hassled and harassed by the local sellers... not a fault of the hotel, although they do get a bit close in the pool area, which can be a bit of a nuisance. Just a warning - the locals don't seem to appreciate that tourists want to relax and not be 'sold to' all the time! They always have a hidden agenda, and when you ask them to take you somewhere you want to go, they insist on stopping at rip-off tourist traps where they can earn extra commission. So be prepared to say NO a lot!  If you are wanting to eat outside the hotel Hikkaduwa is good - it's a 40 min tuk tuk ride. You can haggle down to 1500 rupees return, but make sure you agree the price before you go or you could pay double - Even if you've used the same driver already!! Also, a great beach awaits you at Hikkaduwa... not the part of the beach where all the tuk tuks stop but a bit further along... just keep walking and you'll find a huge beach with surfers, plenty of bars and cafes, sunbeds etc. Beautiful! Shame we only discovered it on our last day!
Review_text_3: Ask for a sea view - and double, not twin!
processed_text_Review_text_2: we stayed here for 11 nights and were really impressed with the consistently great service we received. the staff are such a credit, and they really look after you well. we loved the quality of the food, and the breakfast buffet was outstanding. the room was also good, with a lovely view of the sea. there were a few small problems with the room but nothing major. for example, we booked a double but got a twin room instead. also our safe broke a few times, but this was always fixed promptly. the main disappointment was not really with the hotel but the beach area, and lack of life on the beach - except for pesky sellers. we didn't really understand why there were no sunbeds on the beach. so we made use of the pool areas which were great, but not quite as nice as the beach. although you do get to see some of the lovely wildlife in the hotel garden... iguanas, squirrels and even black monkeys in a big tree just behind the hotel. we were really surprised by how much we were hassled and harassed by the local sellers... not a fault of the hotel, although they do get a bit close in the pool area, which can be a bit of a nuisance. just a warning - the locals don't seem to appreciate that tourists want to relax and not be 'sold to' all the time! they always have a hidden agenda, and when you ask them to take you somewhere you want to go, they insist on stopping at rip-off tourist traps where they can earn extra commission. so be prepared to say no a lot!  if you are wanting to eat outside the hotel hikkaduwa is good - it's a 40 min tuk tuk ride. you can haggle down to 1500 rupees return, but make sure you agree the price before you go or you could pay double - even if you've used the same driver already!! also, a great beach awaits you at hikkaduwa... not the part of the beach where all the tuk tuks stop but a bit further along... just keep walking and you'll find a huge beach with surfers, plenty of bars and cafes, sunbeds etc. beautiful! shame we only discovered it on our last day!
processed_text_Review_text_3: ask for a sea view - and double, not twin!

Review_text_2:
This is our third trip to heritance ahungalla and had a really poor customer service. First we had to wait for more than 15 minutes for our welcome drink since lot of foreigners arrived just AFTER us and had to remind 3 staff members. we went only for lunch buffet and while entering the dining hall our tickets were checked, but while we were dining one lady approached us and wanted to know our room number, so we told we are here only for lunch. Then she again wanted to see our tickets one by one while we were having lunch giving the impression we havent paid. we were amazed by this 5 star treatment.
This not what we are expecting after paying Rs 3500 per adult. we will never come back to this place.

Review_text_2:
We were in rooms 209 and 210.

Pros:
- well laid out and planned hotel
- swimming pool area is beautiful
- proximity to beach lovely

Cons:
- hardly any lights in room-very dim
- run down
- wifi not too great
- very sparse room-not even a coffee table!
- kettle had a calcified or corroded heating element so we did not want to take a chance with boiling water for our morning coffee. While it was well camouflaged, there was no plug point attached to the kettle so it would had to be physically moved near a plug point to operate-bad design.
- bathroom has windows with only dusty, uneven Venetian blinds for so-called privacy
- floor was dirty with dirt stuck on it
- room was smelling musty when we came in. Couldn't leave balcony door open for too long to air, due to mosquitoes.
- no room numbers written on key card envelopes-had to go out the door to check!
- no in-hotel numbers written near the phone
- cobwebs on balcony panels-rubber coming off
- hotel information papers in the binder were not in order-pages missing. 
- no in-room menu in room.
- checking in took time and we were shown a seating area that was impractical to sit in as sofas were not placed opposite of each other but next to each other. We stood around for about 10-15 mins and no one even asked us to take a seat at another more practical area which was close by.
- the man showed us everything in the room but to omitted to show us the balcony! We could not see it as it had opaque sliding type panels that covered the sliding windows
- the towels and sheets did not smell fresh
- hardly any vegetarian options in the menu to warrant the money so the only options were a la carte in the coffee shop and that were going to take 45 mins to order. That hardly seems fair for vegetarians, does it? Since there was no other option, we ordered 3 western choices from this menu. Unfortunately, we were disappointed with the quality and taste of all the options. The veg lasagne had pasta that was chewy, the pasta primavera had peas that were raw and the potato and bean 'pie' was in fact not a pie at all-just potatoes, onions and beans topped with cheese!
- The place needs a lot of maintenance.which it wasn't getting
- staff need to improve their English, esp since there are so many non srilankans visiting-language was definitely a barrier esp when it came to ordering food.
- staff need to be better trained to know what the hotel offers-boy who showed us to rooms said we could get a la carte in the dining hall. Instead there was only a buffet and no a la carte.
- in our room, 210, we had no locking system in the door inside the room-no latch or knob, so ostensibly, the master key could be used to open the door at any time from the outside, even while we are inside the room
- no tissues in tissue box in room 209-poor housekeeping
- took 20 mins and reminding a few times to get our coffee at breakfast
- took a long time for the dirty plates piled up from the buffet breakfast to be cleared. Had to point it out.

Sadly, the cons far outweighed the pros. I would not stay here again unless it undergoes a major restructuring.

Review_text_2: Stayed here in January with family. Set amongst beautiful pools and gardens on the beach, this hotel has huge potential. This was our second stay here and felt service and maintenance of the property had slipped considerably. Room are large and well equipped though a little bit dated. The pool and gardens are kept well however buildings were in a need of paint and maintenance. The service and food in the main restaurant were the worst we experienced throughout our stay travelling  throughout Sri lanka. Breakfast was a good spread with plenty of variety, getting a cup of coffee took time though, sadly dinner was the worst experience we have had through our travels, the food was just slapped on, we were there for three nights and for two of the three nights we encounted empty dishes when we were serving and this was not replaced for a considerable amount of time, there was more emphasis on western dishes and sadly not much  choice. We found service to be very slow, dishes were not picked up  when one had finished their meals and staff were not every efficient compared to all the other resorts we have stayed in and we did choose this hotel given the positive feed back that was left on past experience. Sadly we didnt think much of this hotel at all.

Review_text_2:
Well, if you like a large noisy hotel with shabby rooms and indifferent food, then this is the place for you.
On the plus side the beach is pristine, and the inexperienced staff try their best.
BUT it is a very large hotel which opens its doors to day trippers at the weekend, so the pool is full of screaming children.
In the morning you cannot sit by the main pool because of the noise from speakers accompanying 
aerobics - ugh.
The rooms are decorated in the bare plaster look which does not stand up to wear and tear. 
The food is average if you like buffets at specific times. A la carte is mainly burger and chips with variations.
The prices for food are higher than the Hilton in Colombo, and what really annoyed me the most was that the hotel write up proports to show this as a 5* establishment, with prices to match when in fact I have stayed in many rest houses with better facilities.
Review_text_3: Pick another hotel

Review_text: Tired, below average food and service but lovely setting
Review_text_2: We travelled as a family and stayed in a deluxe suite, so had plenty of room.  The furnishings in the room were a little dated, and the hotel as a whole could do with a revamp.  There is a new luxury 5 star hotel being built next door, and I wondered whether the Heritance is gradually sliding to the rung below international luxury hotel, so as not to have direct competition.  The food and service here were definitely substandard in comparison to the other hotels on our trip (Ulagalla, Anantaya and Jetwing Lighthouse and Yala), and our son ended up with food poisoning on our last evening, nearly delaying our return home.  It was hard to get a table in the restaurant, and once seated it was hard to get the staff's attention for any drinks.  The hotel was not very responsive to requests (we had problems with ants in the room, a lamp not working and a couple of other things) but the boy looking after our room was very attentive.  Having said that, the hotel was very helpful about allowing us to use another room on the day of departure so that we could continue to use the facilities.  I think there was a laundry issue:  each time we asked for pool towels we were told there weren't any, but they did eventually materialise from a tumble dryer.  Service at the pool bar was extremely erratic and inconsistent - we usually had to walk up to the bar to get attention.  The stretch of beach by the hotel was lovely, and the currents not as strong as in some places, but still a risk for swimming.  There was often entertainment on the beach, but two days after fireworks, the debris was still littering the beach.  You have a great stretch of sand, don't ruin it!  All in all, the hotel gives the impression of a gradual decline, which is a shame.  Our room (at the very end of a corridor) was very quiet, but our friends stayed in a suite nearer to the main part of the hotel (329, I think) where you could hear all the entertainment all evening.
Review_text_3: Ask for the rooms furthest away from reception to avoid the noise from the entertainment.  324 is a good suite and has lots of space.
processed_text_Review_text: tired, below average food and service but lovely setting
