Review_text_2:
The hotel is very beautiful and has 2 pools, and spa facilities. 
One of the pools had a live entertainer playing some sort of traditional flute. 
The location of the hotel is convenient as it's directly next to the beach. 

We tried the massage and the spa facility, and it was very good, although a bit expensive when compared to other 5 star hotels in Sri Lanka. 

The rooms were tidy and well equipped. The bathroom is a bit small, but up to the standards. 
As with previous Heritance hotel we visited, the bottles of shampoo and shower gel need to be reviewed from an ergonomic point of view.  They are difficult to pour from, either you pour too little or too much.

On the down sides, the check-in process took around 30 to 40 minutes. Not sure why. 

The buffet was a disappointment. 
After all the great things we encountered in this hotel, we were looking forward to an amazing gastronomic experience. However the buffet was poor in terms of both variety and quality. 
We happened to be at the hotel on a full moon (Buddha Day), which is a holiday in Sri Lanka. Maybe that was the reason for the bad quality of the buffet, due to lack of staff? I'm not really sure. 

In general it was a pleasant experience and would recommend staying at the hotel.
Review_text_3:
Our room number was 354, which is literally at the end of the world!
You had to walk for 10 minutes to reach the reception. Look for rooms closer to reception and pool area, so that you don't feel like an outcast.

Review_text_2: Nice atmosphere. Good place to relax your mind and soul. Nice sea view. Average service. Quality of food is not upto the star class hotel standards. Poor spread of food. Staff needs to be trained further.

Review_text_2:
We had bee here in 2002 and 2004 upon arrival having booked a suite it was full of Mosquitos we booked A I went for dinner inedible the wine was just terrible! We went to remember the 10 anniversary of the Tusnami , when we were there. It was a huge dissapointment!  It was with regret we had to complain. After a meeting with the general manager every thing changed, we renegotiated the AI do not do it! We re started on B&B it all changed. It is NOT the standard hotel it was, it is with regret I have to say this, the horribly black dinning room!

On we go the sun beds are so unbelievably bad they aren't describable , when you see the staff wheeling one wheel with the other on the top ready to stick it back on, residents having to use just the pads on the floor as they don't have enough beds and lying on the grass infested with ants.

There are so few umbrellas when yo leave your bed they have to move them for other residents , this is a 2 star or less and I really hate to gave to give this review , but I as an experienced well travelled Sri Lankan tourist I'm so sorry to say I will not be returning. Also to add the beach sellers who I had known since 2002 and have supported. Even to getting a sewing machine funded are the most intense in all our travels they drove us to distraction !

No we won't ever go back and this leaves me with a sad heart on my live of my beloved island

Review_text: Nice, but in need of refurbishment.
Review_text_2:
I chose this hotel because it was designed by Geoffery Bawa. The rooms and resort are lovely, but definitely in need of upgradation in many areas. The upper floors look like they've been refurbished, but the lower floors have not.
Upon check in, we realised the air conditioning in our room wasn't working, we got twin beds, when we had requested a king size bed and the wi-fi was intermittent.
Given the quality and state of the rooms, i was not happy to pay 280USD a night.
Review_text_3: Avoid the ground floor rooms.

Review_text_2:
Heritance Ahungalle Hotel is a great retreat in Sri Lanka, but you must adjust your expectations before moving in.  

We had booked a de-lux room with balcony overlooking the beach and ocean  - romantic, eh?Unfortunately,  the hotel and consequently the room was very 'tired' and had seen better days.  The hotel even suffered poorly maintained sidewalks, tennis courts, beach loungers, etc. Most was simply under maintained.
Our balcony was adjacent to the rooms on either side, separated only by planters, and the view of beach and ocean obscured by a large (but beautiful) tree.  It may not have been a problem anyway, as on the second day of our stay, the hotel maintenance people set up a huge beach-obscuring marquee (JAG_68056) for another wedding.  They have about 20 weddings per year, so we learned.  Perhaps that wasn't so bad either, but the band wars (wedding band, bar music, and local flute player) that ensued developed an impossible cacophony of loud music which made it impossible to sleep.  

Our 'package' was directly booked through Heritance's  agent: bed and breakfast.  We soon discovered there were many alternate  'packages' which ranged from full board to 'good deals' offering better accommodation for less than we paid.  Check it out before 'checking in'.

The food was good, especially the buffet (good value and variety) ... but  the beach-hawkers were definitely a deterrent  from enjoying the beach.  The hotel should definitely do something about them!  They were ever-present from sun up to sun down.

The redeeming feature of the hotel was the always friendly and hospitable staff ... always willing to serve and support.  The Guest Relations team did their very best.

One last word of advice would be to insist that any Ahungalla-related transportation from Colombo Airport to the hotel take the new  highway ... it seems that the drivers attempt to circumvent the highway-toll gates by taking secondary roads which are long, uncomfortable, dangerous, and nauseating.

Happy travels!
Review_text_3: Insist on the 'third floor' where views and quietness may prevail.

Review_text: Before booking, ask whether beach-obscuring marquee will be up
Review_text_2:
This is a nice hotel. We generally enjoyed our stay, but qualified by the comment below. Special commendation for the hotel's service staff who were very helpful and pleasant. 

The qualification: The hotel website features photos of lovely views of the ocean from the hotel's main dining areas and pool. Moreover, we booked a "premium" room to enjoy the view of the beach and the ocean that comes with these rooms.

A guest of the hotel should have a reasonable expectation that was is displayed on the website regarding visual amenity is what they will get if they book. 

However, for much of our stay, the hotel's beach-side amenity was marred by the construction and deconstruction (over four days) of a large marquee running the entire length of the hotel's main access way to the beach.

This marquee does not appear in any photo on the hotel's website. Its presence, in my view, thus represents a breach, however minor, of the contract between hotel and guest. Because full-fee-paying hotel guests were not put first in this regard, it is unlikely that we will return to this hotel.
processed_text_Review_text: before booking, ask whether beach-obscuring marquee will be up

Review_text_2:
I was attending a wedding held on 20th December 2014 and a friend of mine and I had decided to stay at Heritance. Coming from the UK I was keen to stay close to the wedding venue and enjoy the supposed five star luxury that this hotel boasted to offer. My friend a resident of Sri Lanka arranged the accommodation some five months in advance for us to stay from 19 Dec till 21 Dec, using Booking.com. However upon arrival, they didn't have our booking for 19 only 20. Some 45 minutes, emails and phone calls later I was given a room based on half board. The room itself was large and nice. A bit dark in decor but view of sea front was nice. The hotel is large however there is no clear indication of how the rooms are numbered on each floor. There is according to the member of staff showing me to my room a north and South wing again this is not indicated visibly so it's easy to get lost. The entrance of the hotel is stunning however the rest of the hotels falls in comparison. For four hours I was without WIFI, a number of phone calls later a staff member turns up and fiddles with my phone including switching my phone off airplane mode connecting me to my UK service provider and leaving me with a £40.00 data roaming fee whilst still not realising that the Wifi was an issue with the hotel and not my phone. After trying to relocate me to a new room much smaller with a terrible view I eventually head in hands and eyes filled with tears of frustration and tiredness, was placed in a more pleasant room with a bigger balcony that over looked the sea and the wedding venue. The sliding door which acts as a blackout was unable to fully close because the side table was too big. I had to move this in order for the blackout to fully close. The air conditioner controls were broken in all three rooms so I had to use my nails to switch off the air conditioner. The shower cubicle was placed in such a away that you had to get in close the door before turning shower on. The hotel toiletries were poor - the shower gel and shampoo were all placed in bottles that were not sealed and the soap was well rather useless. There were also no small hand towels or towels big enough to dry hair with. All in all two large bath towels and two hand towels. No bath robes either to sit and relax in. A basic I feel for a hotel claiming to be five star. The mini bar of the last room was broken and had never been checked so we found the drinks warm mouldy and in drinkable. The cost of a glass of wine in comparison to the bottle found in the mini bar also made no sense. It was cheaper in the mini bar. The dining room (only one restaurant in this hotel) was dark and dismal. The hot food area was hard to find until further inspection. The food was ok. A very basic selection. Nothing fancy or elaborate. The bar area outside by entrance was far more prettier yet the service was poor. 
Morning breakfast in the same dining room was a very dark and gloomy affair. The decor and seating was so basic and dark that you just didn't want to eat in there.
The only blessing was the guest relations officer Shanika who was so lovely and ever so eager to ensure we were happy that she went out of her way to do everything to make us feel at ease. 

We were on exit served with a $200.00 a night bill which I had to question over and over again. 

I am really sad to say that it was really shocked and disappointed by everything I had witnessed at this "luxury" hotel and having had a thorough read of what is expected to meet the international standards of a five star hotel - this to me is just a glorified bed and breakfast. Having experienced five star luxury and also other ratings of hotels I think I have had better staying in a cheap bed and breakfast in Brighton for far less the price tag. 

I can't say I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would recommend those that work hard for their money go look elsewhere.

Review_text_2: Visited the hotel for 4 nights. I had booked 7 rooms for friends and family. Great food and very courteous staff. I had booked a suite but the quality of the room was poor, when I discuss this with the front office he promptly moved us to another suite.

Review_text: Don't come here if you want to sleep
Review_text_2:
Claims to be a five star resort. It's not. Five star resorts,  in fact any decent hotel should care about their guests.  They do not have a bloke with the loudest industrial strimmer working right outside a guest's bedroom ceaselessly from 5.30 am.
Oh and the wifi is crap.

Review_text_2: After coming from Heritance Kandalama we expected the same. This is not the case. I did not want to jump on here and be outright negative, but there is good and bad here. Our room has a broken aircon, bathroom exhaust fan, telephone and main door lock, with no safe. Pretty alarming. Our guy that cleans the room is wonderful and has tried his best to get everything fixed up. So far the kettle has been replaced. They have tried to fix the phone several times with no luck. Reception rings you constantly but you can not talk to them, very annoying. Outside the gates are pushy tuk tuk drivers in a dirty street. Surprising since Sri Lanka is a very clean country with mostly beautiful helpful people. Not here though. We were really looking forward to a few days in the pool looking at the ocean after a pretty hectic schedule. As soon as you get to the pool the yelling people on the beach trying to sell dodgy wares ruins it straight away. Even security and staff were called several times to try and help ripped off tourists. But security does nothing. It is like they work with them. After all the places we have stayed in Sri Lanka this is the worst. We would not come back here again.

Review_text_2: I went to this hotel after 15 years. It was our Annual Company Staff trip. Rooms were ample and well kept. Very comfortable bed and suiting lightings. Food was to be amazed not so good. Everything was lacking something and not the best food ever surprisingly. Service wasn't up to the standard. I had to wait more than ten minutes after requesting cutlery for dinner. And requesting hot water took more than ever. At breakfast I had to eat without a serviette because Steward never showed up. Sometimes I had to yell at them in order to get water. This type of service is never expected from a five star rated hotel. The night club was so much fun. The other terrible fact about the hotel was they switch off the lights in the corridors and we had to assist ourselves with a torch in order to find the room. Some of my friends had mistakenly tapped the wrong room. I mean this is a hotel which operates 24/7 and why do they wanna switch off the lights? Anyway I'm very disappointed with the service and food. I hope this will no longer continue. The best thing was the soothing beach view which was so relaxing. The two pools were breathtaking too.

Review_text_2:
See comments below.
Rooms - very poor, given cost
Food- depends when you eat, the later the worse.
Beach location excellent
Gardens excellent.
Staff good
Definitely wouldn't go again or recommend. Yet the outdoor areas were lovely
Review_text_3:
Pointless in requesting any type of room beforehand. It didn't happen for us! As soon as we entered our room, there was a terrible smell of damp. On our balcony there was a white powder. I cleaned this up, and there it was again. It turned out they were decorating the room upstairs, and the "powder" was paint being rubbed down. You couldn't sit on the balcony without it getting on your clothes, and the stench in the room was really bad. In fairness, they said we could change room. I went to check and there was no smell or powder, and the room was prepared apart from bed and bathroom linen, but still they said it would not be ready for 24 hours. We then went for dinner around 9.00 pm. Unfortunately, the food had obviously been there since there since the start, and was either "scrapings" or what no one else wanted. Good nights sleep, then we both became I'll. I just had moderate sickness and diahorrea. My partner had diahorrea , but really, really bad vomiting. It lasted 15 hours, before he finally settled. Towards the end of this we were advised our new room was ready. I said how we sick we were. Probably, a language problem, but they offered us room service!!! The last thing we needed was food - we couldn't keep anything down. We couldn't move room  - we were in bed, intermittently, using the bathroom.. By the following day, the powder has stopped appearing (later found out they had stopped rubbing down) and we kind of got used to the stench, and couldn't face packing up again and moving for 3 nights. 
The beach location is beautiful. The gardens are lovely. Our balcony view was lovely. 
The rooms are smelly and need updating(maybe why we got the powder). . I didn't enjoy the food, probably because we were ill,  but it was varied, and maybe our sickness had nothing to do with it, who knows. But I would suggest you eat early, rather than later, when the food has been kept around for a couple of hours rather than replaced.
The food in the cafe is lovely, hot and freshly cooked. The staff are really good.

Review_text: Lovely location spoilt by the lack of customer service
Review_text_2:
After visiting the sister hotel in dambulla, I had high expectations for customer service. However I was sadly disappointed apart from a very few members of staff.

We arrived after touring Sri Lanka for our honeymoon for a rew days relaxation by the beach..
Dispite the local security we were often harrassed by the local "beach boys". A stroll on the beach was anything but relaxing. Although not a private beach the constant calling and shouting at by the locals was very annoying. Even after explaining we were on our honeymoon we were still surrounded by a number of the locals. Obviously this is made worse by the lack of security at the hotel, which allows locals to stroll around even to the resident only pool.

After on evening sitting for a pre dinner drink I noticed a number of flis around and which point my husband pointed the food and liquid on the adjacent table. After letting the staff know and expecting a prompt clean up, nothing was done about the mess. 
In comparison to other hotels within this chain and other hotels we stayed at the hotel was not well maintained. I never saw anyone clean the main lobby and bar areas dispite obvious mess. In fact e only time I say a brush was during a lunchtime of heavy rain to brush the water out and this was only done once.

There is a lack of information provided by the hotel. This could easily be rectified by adding a little more information into the room guide. Information about the surrounding area, places to visit and information about food within the restaurant.

The hotel food however was of brilliant quality. We enjoyed a meal at the fine dining restaurant and can say this food would not have been out of place at any top london restaurant. The food at the the al a carte restaurant was also of a good standard. The evening buffet was expensive and so we avoided this as we felt it would be poor value and probably poor service what experience we had of breakfast. Now breakfast was a terrible fair, although a wide selection of food not enough waiters or chefs. We came down for breakfast at various times, but noticed if we came after 9.30 no one was around to provide tea or coffee or chefs to cook the food. If we came earlier it was so busy we had to queue for the dishes and the cold foods we're not refilled often enough.

Rooms were of a good size and clean. However try to get a room a reasonable distance from the lobby as this can be noisy especially on the weekend.

All in all this hotel has the basis for being lovely. The food was good, the views gorgeous, just a little more customer service and focus would improve anyone's experience massively. Maybe the staff here should vist kanadlama or the tea factory for some tips!

Review_text: Friendly staff but starting to look tired
Review_text_2:
First of all, the staff at Ahungalla are extremely professional and very friendly, so I give them 5 stars for customer service. The general setup of the property is nice, and it has two excellent pools. The food is great, with a wide range of delicious salads, mains and deserts, with enough vegetarian choices.

The rooms were generally clean, but some of the furniture was looking worn-out. We were on the 2nd floor and had a good view of the ocean. We had a strong musty smell in our room, and were told there were no air-fresheners. The linen and towels were fresh and clean.

There was some construction work going on (probably a good thing in the long run!), with hammering from what sounded like above our room, however, this would start around 8am and had stopped by night-time.

Good place for one night, but I think there are better options around.
Review_text_3: Probably avoid the wing away from the pool at the moment because of the construction work.

Review_text_2:
Spend a night with my wife in this hotel. The room is done up so nicely. Room comes with a balcony with lounge chairs. It also has a nice view of the sea, just lovely for reading a book and watching the sunset. Food was great lots of selections. Most important thing is the service and the hospitality of the hotel staff. It was superb.  Speedy free Wi-Fi (Need to get the free voucher from the reception) .
Had a chance to participate in the Christmas cake mixing. It was a wonderful evening. We enjoyed the stay in Heritance Ahungalla.

Review_text_2: We stayed 2 days in this hotel. Unfortunately the pictures on the website correspond to a long gone history. This hotel needs urgent maintenance. Especially the bathrooms, the floors, and the gardens and furniture around the pool. The people are really kind and try so hard their best, but we considered the place as a wrong choice.
Review_text_3: Choose a room far from the bar and leisure room.

Review_text_2:
we stayed 5 nights up to the 22nd sep in a luxury rated room which I upgraded to for £50 per night extra from a deluxe room they wanted £61 but a deal was done ,the room was fine good size .ac did not regulate cold or cold.
in general hotel is very tired and needs a refurb,looking shabby the public areas in particular,chairs and tables in bars and restaurants are sticky thru not being cleaned properly.
only really one main bar area next to main pool and reception this is completetely devoid of ambience and comforts hardly a good advert for checking in guests who are brought here.
the a la carte restaurant next to the main dining room while serving reasonable food is dirty with table runners stained and dirty when restaurant manager challenged about theis he quickly had it changed the same night our food came out cold ,not good for curries!the meal was remade but it was too late the damage done,they tried to make amends with a free dessert please  too little too late.
the main dining room is where we took breakfast and on one occasion a buffet dinner,the tables and chairs again dirty also the table runner.food wise the breakfast is good also the dinner buffet with plenty of choices available.
we tried the fine dining restaurant one night and it was very good my wife taking the new zealang beef and me the 2 fish curry price wise of course dearer than the other two dining rooms but light years superior which you would expect if you pay more but not expensive to European prices.
a bone of contention ,if you have a wine list then maybe the odd bottle is out of stock,but it got to the point all that was left was the expensive wines costing £25 plus for what we get at home for £6 now I know all about mark ups but rip off!
the daytime was spent by the resident only pool as this was the quietist and the pool attendant was very good at arranging our beds and towels on the same vain all the staff were very good one or two thrown in at the deep end I suspect with a poor lack of English in the restaurants.
avoid the weekends as it fills up with locals on a freebie with their company and they are noisy and usually drunk playing drums at all hours.
now while you are relaxing on your sun lounger near a pool you will be beckoned over to the hawkers trying to sell sarongs tee shirts or days out in a taxi,now they are not supposed to step over a line in the sand enforced by security guards but all day long they are shouting to you waving the sarongs etc,they stand on the boundary of the hotel and the beach which means the beach is a no go zone unless you don't mind saying no thank you many many times over.
don't know what can be done they need to make a living you are trying to have a peaceful holiday.
so to sum up after touring around sri lanka for a week we intended to chill out for 5 days didn't feel we achieved it so we do not recommend this overated hotel more 3 star.

Review_text: Avoid this hotel in September unless you can sleep through night time maintenance!
Review_text_2:
We visited three Heritance Hotels during our stay. This was sadly the only one where customers were secondary to hotel maintenance. We were Woking up by hammering of temporary barriers and scaffolding at 2 am as well as loud porters moving beds all through the night. 
That said, the day staff were all pleasant and helpful but little thought was given to guests when they carry out maintenance work both day and night.
The hotel rooms were tired and needed the work, but managed well, they could have sealed sections of the hotel rather than maintain where guests were occupying rooms.
Review_text_3: Only visit in season. Avoid angled rooms as they have limited views. Keep to right side to get quieter accomodation.

processed_text_Review_text_3: only visit in season. avoid angled rooms as they have limited views. keep to right side to get quieter accomodation.

Unfortunately, I went on holiday to this hotel recently and i was greatly disappointed.  The suites are ridiculous and needs refurbishing, the bathrooms in the suites are laughable.  The food was the only thing that lived a little bit up to expectation.

Review_text: A good make over is needed !
Review_text_2:
I am writing this over a cup of coffee from the hotel. I have visited this hotel from the days it was triton and this officially concludes my 8th visit to this place (yes thats right !) And i am not joking ! Why so many times well two things always bring us back , one is the food and next is the service and fllexibilty.  So this makes it my first visit for this year and believe or not i m due there in september as well. Over the years this hotel was able keep up as one of the trendiest in the vicinity however now it seems to lack behind. The food was once heavenly but now let me simply say " not as heavenly" . We were always amazed by the weekend dinner barbecue but this time it was highly dissapointimg and disorganised. We always loved the jumbo prawns and lobster (cray fish) that they always did have . but this time the stock seemed old and frozen . Worst of all the buffet spread never seemed to be re filled . Todays breakfast , i had to tell more than 3 jr chefs to re fill the bacon and it took them 20 mins.  So yeah alot of negatives seemed to be observed by our group of friends who have just like me been patriots of this establishement. Rooms seemed to have changed very little. Some rooms seemed to be well stock with all the essentials some rooms seemed to lack a few  things e.g bottle openers tea /cofee refills and glasses . However for a person visiting for the first time this perception can definitely differ . This was written with a lot of dissapointment and heart break hope the management will be able to revive this place before it becomes uncontrollable ( not that it is bad ) .

 Ps one thing that has never ever changed is the friendly staff so kudos for that. Love how pleasant everybody is ! C u soon as always :)
processed_text_Review_text: a good make over is needed !

Review_text: Lovely hotel, beautiful people, glorious sunsets
Review_text_2:
I wrote the review earlier when I said this was a lovely hotel but spoilt by the guests.  It seems only fair to revisit that review in the light of the rest our stay and the efforts made by the management to address our concerns.

 Apart from one disappointing day the rest of our holiday was bliss- and the response from the General Manager to my review typified how hard everybody worked to make our stay special.

It's a wonderful hotel, beautiful location and fantastic food (particularly when the focus is on Sri Lankan food).  The sunsets are the stuff of films. What makes this hotel stand out above many others is the staff. They are unfailingly helpful, polite and utterly charming.  It is difficult to pick out one from the many who made our stay so memorable but I want to make a special mention of Madhu, who was so patient with our beginners' Sinhala and helped create some special memories.

Go to the Heritance and enjoy the view, the charm, the food, spectacular pools and sunsets and most if all the people working within the hotel who work hard to make any stay extremely special.  We felt very welcome and will be back.
Review_text_3: During peak season stay away from the club!
processed_text_Review_text: lovely hotel, beautiful people, glorious sunsets

Review_text_2:
This is my 5th visit to this hotel.

Like always "Great friendly staff great food! ". I always love the way they welcomed us to the hotel.

It was a very nice experience, with the 2 huge swimming pools near the beach and the nice buffets with a large variety of foods to taste. We played tennis for almost 2 hours with a fee of  Rs. 400 per hour. We did enjoy our game but they must resurface both tennis courts(clay).

The rooms were very comfortable in few years back, but unfortunately not now. It was terrible dirty and smells like cockroach. The building really need to renovate to keep up with changing times and tastes

We used to love our stay in this hotel!!!

We were at heritance ahugalla for Two days on the 21st and 22nd of June 2014.

While the other aspects of our stay was satisfatory the food was HORRIBLE and maybe even nearing on Atrocious!!

In all meals the food was actually flavor less... the worst part is that most of us had to suffer from food poisoning  and purging the same day! 

I will definitely never visit this hotel again and will definitely advise all of my friends and family to never go there even if it was the last place on earth!! solely because there was something that was seriously wrong with the food in that hotel

So please if anyone of you are thinking of going there... Think again

Review_text_2:
The staff are so polite and helpful, including the restaurant manager, the lifeguard and the reception staff. The room
Was clean and comfortable with a lovely beach view. The food was very good, the staff couldnt be more helpful offering to make you anything that was not available already. The chefs were really polite and friendly. The pool was lovely in particular the second pool. We watched a lovely wedding on the beach. We only stayed 4 days but were really sad to leave.

Review_text_2:
I am surprised at the number of glowing reviews this hotel has received. Either my wife and I were unlucky, too hard to impress, or other reviewers for this hotel were being too kind.

Ill start with the positives. The hotel grounds are very nice, the pool is excellent, the location right on the beach very nice. The rooms are ok, they have everything you might expect or want. Nothing more or less.

However this hotel seems to follow the usual business model you find in these types of regions. Hire the cheapest staff you can find, provide only the basic training, charge the guests international rates, make a fortune on high margins.

Staff were slow and spoke very little english. They cannot engage in conversation which is frustrating when you need to ask about the local area, request extra food items, or anything you might require.

There was no imagination, such beautiful grounds yet no outdoor BBQ for guests during the day or night, outdoor pool bar, or even music.

And then there is the idea of apparent supplementation of hotel income by allowing corporate/local guests in with their families in tow on weekends. About 20 screaming kids in the pool and all the deck chairs taken forcing guests like myself to retreat somewhere else. I just dont expect this at a hotel that wants be considered in the luxurious category.

Food was overpriced for the quality. It was fine, just not what you would expect for the price. Staff would take away an empty bottle and just fail to ask if you wanted another. Basic stuff.

Staff are just in a constant state of apathy. I found myself having to look for the barman, find the guy to bring my wife and I the towels for the pool area. They were just never where you wanted them to be. When you did they were slow and emotionless.

And the hawkers waiting outside the hotel limits on the beach. I mean that put me off straight away. We couldnt go anywhere without being accosted by these people. If I want a poorly made garment Ill go the street market myself thanks. Other guests actually hesitated walking on to the beautiful beach just so they didnt have to interact with these people. How is that fair?

Upon checkout, my wife and I sat in the lobby area for 35 minutes as we waited for our driver and werent offered a single beverage/refreshment. Guess once you check out you arent worth the time anymore?

Given so many of us only have only a few weeks a year allotted for holidays due to work commitments, its heartbreaking not getting what you think you are paying for.

I think the Heritance Ahungalla has become complacent due to all the kind reveiws. When compared to the surrounding area it is 5 star quality, but internationally its 3 star at best.

Its not a bad hotel at all, just not that great. Therefore I gave it an "average" rating as its simply average. 

UPDATE: We have just checked in to the Fortress in Galle and it makes the Heritance look even worse. I wish we hadnt bothered with Ahungalla at all now.

Im sure Ill get some half-hearted response from the management regarding my critique as they have done to others. I would have given it to them personally had they asked, but they never did.

Review_text_2:
This is the most difficult review I have written so far. The hotel has two parts – one is brilliant and another is terrible. Therefore I summed everything up and evaluated it as average.
Brilliant points: 
Extensive, very clean beach with clean ocean water.
Fantastic pool area (two pools fit for any taste) with very good service.
Nice reception, pleasant and airy open lobby.
Beautiful grounds with veritable zoo: variety of birds, squirrels, shy langur monkeys, almost friendly molitors, etc.
Superb food both at evening and morning buffet.
Terrible points:
Rooms and bathrooms are outdated, dirty, smelly (sometimes smell of sewage is overwhelming) and ill-kept, some may be cockroachy. After one night I asked to change my room on the ground floor which totally awful to only slightly better on the first floor (at least with more light).
Housekeeping is poor: rooms are not cleaned until very late and then, several hours later, in the evening there comes house keeping again for god knows what reason. Also in the dining area at one point the floor was slippery because of spilt fat and remained so for at least two days.
Hotel spa prices are more than exorbitant, go for massage to the village. 
Beware when dealing in cash: bad exchange rate (and different than told at the reception) the cashier cheats (tried to swindle me and one of our group too), so count your money carefully.
Even when in the hotel grounds (and especially on beach) you are periodically accosted by touts, seller of various goods, tuk tuk drivers, etc. If you leave the grounds and go to the village you are immediately swarmed with “helpers” who tussle between themselves and finally you will have one fixed “leach” who will follow all the time offering all kinds of goods and services.
So, if you are indifferent to the room you sleep in, the hotel is perfectly all right, even great. But otherwise consider other possibilities.
Review_text_3: Never take the rooms on the ground floor unless they open direct to the pool.

Review_text_2: Absolutely no choice of food for a vegitarians. Even after the Manager and the Chef were appraised, having promised vegitarian food, they gave only two eggless hoppers after a wait of 20 minutes. Chef Dinesh gave an excuse saying that he had to manage the hotel with two chefs as others have gone for a competition. There is a massive choice for non vegitarians. We are waiting to get out of the hotel as it ruined our holiday and wasted our money.

Review_text_2:
First the good bits: pool and beach here are gorgeous. Staff are all excellent and try very hard. 
That's it for the good bits
This hotel is on desperate need of an upgrade to claim its 5 star rating. 5 star this is not. Tired rooms, leaking shower, bath that did not drain , mouldy screens etc. Lobby bathrooms - 2 out if 3 cubicles no lighting, doors did not lick and paint chipping off the doors. The food here is ok. If you are looking for a good 3.5 star hotel then this is fine but we have stayed in many other so called luxury hotels on this trip and they were all way above this hotel in terms of fit out and upkeep . They do many things really well here but 5 star lodgings it is not.

Review_text_2:
i love sri lanka but i'm not coming back to this hotel. 
we got bad service in the reception, with the cashier, at the pool bar, at the fine dining restaurant and the buffet restaurant ... 
we stayed there for three days and in the end we were pleased indeed to leave. we experienced that the staff was highly incompetent and at times rude. they also had no track of bills and there were a long wait at all, even the purchase of a single Soda! the exception was the friendly helpful people at the pool and housekeeping. they did a really good job.

loved every minute there and was so reluctant to leave

Review_text_2: It was only because of the hotels staff that my 2 nights stay here from being a horrible one to a very good experience. We checked in very late one evening and were given rooms above the coffee shop grill which meant that the rooms were full of the grill seafood smoke. A few minutes inside the rooms we started feeling like grilled fish ourselves. Upon request for room change we were told that the hotel was full and our request thus denied. Dinner at the coffee shop was a pretty sad affair too. The chicken that we were served was so hard that I am sure if I'd thrown it at a passerby that person would get hurt. After a stroll on the beach when we came to our rooms past midnight we realized that there was no water supply in the rooms due to some maintenance work and that it'd be restored around 2 am. That too did not happen. Our arms full of woes we met the Resident Manager Sampath De Silva and were surprised that he offered no arguments but only an apology. From that point onwards our stay turned into heaven. Mr Sampath offered to change our rooms and the staff went out of their way to be helpful, courteous and friendly. I'd particularly like to mention manager Praveen from the restaurants who made sure that the fare that was served to us was excellent. I'd recommend that future travellers take advantage of an exclusive special table d' hote that they arrange on the beach. The experience is put of the world.

Review_text: Incredible architecture and situation with poor service and maintenance
Review_text_2: Ceylan (Sri Lanka) is astonishing! Unfortunately this seaside hotel was the worse in our journey around Sri Lanka. Even if it's classified 5 stars, on reality it is not. The hotel needs a huge renovation ( a must for the 80's superb architecture from very well known Sri Lanka architect), the cleanliness could be much better and the staff (almost all of them very friendly) should have better management and be more professional. Even though ( even next time going visit Ceylan is better booking and hotel north of Colombo, because is near the cultural and forest tours), the stay was relaxing and, for a change at the far east beaches, there were 26º C 3 meter waves to brake....
Review_text_3: rooms 301 till 317, avoid rooms above the grilled buffet restaurant or rooms at the far rigth far away from the entrance, main pool and restaurants
processed_text_Review_text: incredible architecture and situation with poor service and maintenance

processed_text_Review_text_3: rooms 301 till 317, avoid rooms above the grilled buffet restaurant or rooms at the far rigth far away from the entrance, main pool and restaurants

Review_text_2:
Just returned from an 11 night stay at Heritance Ahungalla and already making plans to return.
Check in was fast and faultless. The room was well appointed, spotless and, considering the amount of guests, quiet too. Efficiently cleaned daily (even the balcony), tea/coffee replaced, evening turn down service, couldn't fault it. Having spent a month travelling,in Sri Lanka, this was by far the best hotel of my trip. Breakfast buffet was something to look forward too with a superb and varied choice. The evening meals had a different theme with a massive array of western and asian dishes, all cooked and presented at a high standard. After a longish stay at a hotel, buffet meals can sometimes become a bit tedious with a longing to eat elsewhere, but despite several beach cafe choices, we were never tempted away from the quality food served at the hotel. Getting tea and coffee could require a bit of patience in the mornings but this is not logged as a complaint just a niggle when you need your early morning caffiene fix. The pools are amongst the best I saw in Sri Lanka, cleaned daily, the grounds kept neat and tidy and the beach vendors kept at bay by security and a respected boundry line although they do become a complete nusiance shouting and calling out to try and sell their goods but after a couple of days they tend to get the hang of who is worth pursuing and who needs to keep having sales tactics applied to. Beach is a beautiful mile plus of fine sand backed by palm trees and suprisingly free of plastic debris; not totally free but judged against standards of some asian beaches and the collection of bags etc that gets washed up, it's a gem. Only problem is that a walk along this beach is punctuated by the attention of several 'best friends' you never knew you had that want to get you to a cafe/gem shop/ tour but a firm 'no thanks' seems to be respected. There is a handy wine shop to the right of the hotel and several little shops that sell most stuff you could need but don't let any of the men that pounce on you the moment you walk through the gate follow you or continue any sort of converstion as they will be clocking a commission at your expense for taking you to the shop. They get the plan and politely telling them to stop, stay here and don't follow me is respected and didn't cause offence. Would I return to this hotel, too right I will. Would I recommend it, absolutely without hesitation!

Review_text_2:
I have just returned from a one week stay at this hotel.  The day of my arrival was Independence Day and therefore preparation for celebrations were in full swing, funnily I immediately felt part of the hotel.

The staff were lovely, helpful, calm and polite even when I was a bit fraught with things not exactly working out as planned from my travel company.

Lazy days on the beach were marred by enthusiastic beach vendors, however with the help of a German guest I managed to negotiate a good price for a silk scarf having told myself "I am most certainly not going to buy anything from them!"  

Sri Lankans are welcoming people and not all are after your money, although I did find the tipping to the hotel staff obligatory which got embarrassing, if not down right annoying one guy round the pool seemed to want tipping to speak to me!  Yet another saved my sunbed all morning for only a smile. 

On my last morning my pick up time was some unearthly early morning hour, but the kitchen staff managed to lay on my own personal buffet breakfast AND I received a breakfast picnic to take with me to the airport. 

Food was mediocre but good a selection at breakfast, dinner with my half board was a bit "breakfast warmed up" with some dishes, although as a vegetarian my tastes were well catered for plus an offer of my personal selection from the chef.  A Fawlty moment one evening when I asked for a black coffee to complete the meal. I was told "Coffee off, no more coffee, sorry coffee is finished" err is this a hotel?  this was rectified when a member of the waiting staff later turned up with my coffee.  

It needs more polish.  Little things like a stain on the table cloth, cloudy glasses, no hair conditioner, a chip on the bathroom mug,a stain on the net curtains in my room and the corridor to the room looked more "seaside guest house".

They were improving the walls on the stairs of the hotel with stencilling. A warning, I hit my head on a metal plank balanced precariously between the bannisters where the "artist" stood. Health and Safety in the UK would have closed it down.  I did mention it and the reception staff thanked me for drawing it to their attention.  The plank remained. 

The hotel was over all quiet and the music went on till only 10.30pm I did like an early night but the music was pleasant enough despite hearing it in my room and as I say it was only to 10.30pm.  The hotel did seem to regulate conferences/weddings to noise minimum and respect to their guests. 
 
It might pass for a 4 star only Sri Lankan style but it was not 5 star.  

Too many rude Russians but this is not a hotel issue just a way of life on holiday now.

Review_text_2:
The hotel is a bit old and I would not rate it as 5 star hotel.
I stayed there for 3 nights last FEB in a 2 interconnected rooms, the view was nice but the rooms were poor and give you the feeling of the 80s starting from the metal key to the furniture, the AC, the toilets…etc.
I had all the meals in-room dining and it was by all means disaster, not clean at all (hair in the food, dirty plats, wrong orders) I made a complaint and the reaction of the restaurant manager was excellent and honestly he was professional gentleman…thank you Mr.KK.

Review_text_2:
We had booked this hotel some time ago, as part of a package with the parent company, Aiken Spence. The trip was paid for and confirmed.
We arrived at around 1pm on the scheduled day, to be told the hotel was overbooked, and that we were to go to a smaller hotel 2km away.
They apologised but offered no compensation. We had to demand to see the new hotel (we were told the room would be a suite, it wasn't). We had no call previously.
The front desk people were very keen to move us along rather than ensure we were satisfied with the arrangements.
Only after a displeased call to aitken spence were we offered recompense- half board at the hotel and a room upgrade, when we arrived there the next day.

This practice of overbooking at hotels in Sri Lanka is not unheard of, but ought to be discouraged.
Our advice would be to call the hotel to confirm yourself, and, if it happens, don't leave until you have spoken with the manager.

This is a very shoddy way to treat paying guests. Apologies don't cut it, especially when over bookings are either deliberate or easily avoided,

Review_text_2:
We spent 7 nights at the Heritance in Ahungalla, and enjoyed the beach and the pools of the hotel.
The hotel is very nice and the hotel facilities were great: 2 large pools and lots of sunchairs and umbrellas for relaxation in the shadow. Our 2 kids spent most of their week in the pool, but the beach and ocean is amazing. There were a red flag on the beach throughout our stay, which meant you should not go into the water, but unfortunately this is only for 'insurance' reasons for the hotel. The waves were big in the afternoon, but the wind and surge were not very dangerous. Small children should probably stay out though.
Ahungalla village did not provide any restaurant nor sight of interest, which was a small disappointement. But since the food and buffet at the hotel was outstanding, we did not suffer.
We went on day trips to Kosgoda for Sea Turtle Hatchery, which was interesting. I suspect we were tricked by the tuktuk driver to go to a place which was built up only for tourists. Run down and dodgy, but kids loved it because we could hold sea turtle babies in our hands. I would chekc up on these hatcheries, there are apparantly 2-3 to choose from.
We also took a boat trip at the Madu river. Basic but still very nice. Recommended, and our local boat driver Dinesh was outstanding.

We also used the Spa at the hotel for a Balinese massage, highly recommended.

Review_text_2:
This hotel in the past was one of the best in Sri Lanka,but now it is a well worn ,out of date of the modern class of hotel.
Since the name change from the Triton years ago, it's been on a downward spiral.We used to visit every year until the Tsunami occurred,we were there then as well.
We revisited it two years later when it re-opened 
Lots of the old staff that knew what they were doing have gone,replaced by new , not sure of what they're doing.
It is now full board, all inclusive has disappeared along with the regular visitors to the hotel.This is now made up by having day visits of Sri Lankan  people.
This I accept as you need custom.
But when I've paid good money to stay in a 5* hotel, and I have to put up with locals using the swimming pool, fully dressed in all the sweaty clothes that they have travelled in, then walking round dripping wet,playing water polo in the pool bawling their heads off, not giving a hoot for the residents,and with kids running wild, then that is the time to take a good look at the hotel and wonder if it is a good place to stay after all.
The hotel itself is in need of a good maintenance team,not just the paint brush brigade,covering over cracks.
On the beach, you are now pestered from morning to night by the beach sellers, who previously weren't allowed to come close to holidaymakers,but now the exclusion zone is minimal.

We only stayed here for one night - it was a beautiful hotel - our room was lovely and great bathroom. The hotel is very open and spacious - we did have a long walk to our room, however we did not mind - we saw monkeys in the trees as we walked to the main hotel area.
We had the buffet dinner which was very good - breakfast was the usual Si Lankan fare

Review_text: Returned our lost iPad. Thank you!
Review_text_2:
After leaving the hotel we realized that we had left a iPad at the hotel, but didnt know where we had misplaced it. It could have been left in the room, pooside or anywhere in the hotel. We called the hotel and they were very professional in locating it and returning it to us promptly. Thank you very much! 
 We have been to Hesitance Ahungalla  many times in the past. As always staff and service is here is just exceptional!! Far better than at Cinnamon Bey, Beruwala, which was our next destination which was a nightmare. 
At Heritance, everyone from the front desk to the pool staff to the restaurant staff to the gentleman who reads palms is friendly, attentive and courteous.
The lovely hotel in the beautiful location could do with just a little bit renovation to make things perfect.
We will definitely be back!

Review_text: We were there from October 21 til November 19
Review_text_2:
During our 4 weeks we had really a very nice time a part from some rain in the evening.Beachfront hotel large and well kept property, Room confortable with everything you need, rooms a little too dark in the evening.Towels and bedsheet in perfect conditions, rooms very clean.Staff kind and helpful also in the 2 pools, the pool attendents were always ready to give you new towels and to help you to change place when necessary.The food in the main restaurant , usually self service, is various and abundant, of course  You must like oriental food, not accordingly to european tast, but very spicy, ( not strong or pure fire,) just spicy as a matter of fact the majority of the guest are arabs, indians, and other asian countries.For us italian was OK. Good entertainment afternoon and evening, fire works, shows , music etc.Something special was the man playing flute in the morning at the main pool.What was not good at all, was the great quantity of russian, ukrain and soviet people, noisy,arrogant,impolite, mainly dressed with shorts, shirts withouth sleeves and sandals, and all this at the main restaurant. Also a great deal of small children were roaming shouting and screaming in the main restaurant sometimes . In a 5 star hotel this is not acceptable!!!!   
In any case this hotel is good and advisable. bruno e marisella torino italia
Review_text_3: upper floor the 3rd, but those not near the reception and restaurants are more quiet.

Review_text_2: Very disappointed with our stay. Rooms definitely need upgrades. Stayed in a triple room where the third bed was just a small folding bed. Blinds in the bathroom were broken and could see through them from the room and the outside. Flies in the room. Communicated all this to front desk but nothing done about it. The second pool was "apparently" under maintenance every time us locals wanted to use it but all the foreigners were constantly swimming!!!!! Again spoke to front desk and we were told the pool was not closed???? Very sad is all I have to say. If this is what we call 5 star then I have no words. Will not be staying here again.

Review_text_2:
Having traveled and stayed for extended periods of time in the US, UK, Dubai and a few Asian countries and enjoyed what some of their hotels have to offer I have to say I have found my Home away from Home at Heritance Ahungalla! having stayed there 7 times I think I can say that I know what I am talking about. 

The staff at the entrance have always been very welcoming, and it is nice to see a few familiar faces when we walk in. The last few visits have been with our lil baby and they made sure that we are checked in within no time. Within a few minutes of us calling, a cot was delivered and set up. 
We are very concerned with the rooms being clean and free of any dust, The rooms were spotless and the toilets were very clear. 

The food at the fine dinning restaurant was excellent. It was quite obvious that a lot of attention to detail had been given. The level of service was even better. It was very kind of the waiter to push the stroller around with our baby to calm him down when he was getting a bit restless, Even the chef who came to the table to inquire about the food was entertaining baby with his hat. We did not ask either one of the to do this nor did we expect them to, This for us was going above and beyond the call of duty.

At the buffet we are always greeted at the entrance with big smile, the food, the variety and the service have all been of the highest order. During the week end during peak season there have been times where the service has been a bit slow due to the packed buffet hall. Generally the staff would inquire about the food and the service. 

A few observations, Wheel chair access to the buffet hall (Didnt see/notice it from the mail entrance) also the use of long carpets to connect the buffet hall with the mail hotel during heavy rain.   

Reading some of the bad reviews I was really shocked because All most of of the staff that we have encountered have been pleasant and helpful. I must take a moment to give credit to a few members of staff who we feel deserve recognition for their service as well as the lengths they go, to ensure the guest are well looked after, Gamini who is always checking up on guests make sure all our needs and requirements are taken care of, Thushara will visit every table at the buffet and see to all the guests culinary requirements are met and last but not least Sampath who seems to make it his mission to make every guest's stay at Ahungalla a memorable and special one, My wife as well as I can vouch for this having spent a wedding Anniversary & Birthday at Ahungalla and plan to go there for many more.

Review_text_2: Stayed here with my wife after a week in a hotel in the north of Sri Lanka. The food in the buffet was extremely poor. The al carte was very expensive which would of been ok if the food was good but it was terrible. We had bolognese one day and the spaghetti had been cut up in to tinny pieces or they had served us the crumbs at the bottom of the packet. Second time we ate there the lasagna was also terrible. It had been reheated so much that that the pasta literally could not be cut let alone eaten. When we complained it took nearly half hr and a six man conference In the kitchen to come to the conclusion that it was not edible. We then decided to try the fine dinning restaurant only to find out it was the same chef from the al carte restaurant ! We ate in local restaurants from then on which were really nice and a fraction of the price. Finally upon checking out we were charged for basically the entire mini bar !  After disputing this are bill was quite quickly adjusted to what we had actually taken from the mini bar. In conclusion the hotel is drab over priced and you are extorted at ever opportunity ! My advise would be to keep well away
processed_text_Review_text_2: stayed here with my wife after a week in a hotel in the north of sri lanka. the food in the buffet was extremely poor. the al carte was very expensive which would of been ok if the food was good but it was terrible. we had bolognese one day and the spaghetti had been cut up in to tinny pieces or they had served us the crumbs at the bottom of the packet. second time we ate there the lasagna was also terrible. it had been reheated so much that that the pasta literally could not be cut let alone eaten. when we complained it took nearly half hr and a six man conference in the kitchen to come to the conclusion that it was not edible. we then decided to try the fine dinning restaurant only to find out it was the same chef from the al carte restaurant ! we ate in local restaurants from then on which were really nice and a fraction of the price. finally upon checking out we were charged for basically the entire mini bar !  after disputing this are bill was quite quickly adjusted to what we had actually taken from the mini bar. in conclusion the hotel is drab over priced and you are extorted at ever opportunity ! my advise would be to keep well away

Review_text_2: The hotel was quite good. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was clean and well organized. I especially liked the swimming pool area facing the beach. Although, there were a couple of things that could be improved. For one thing, the rooms I stayed in had a few maintenance issues (the ac was not  working properly for one of the rooms and the shower drain was clogged). Rooms where not that great. The food in the hotel was good but not nothing special compared to other hotels I've visited in Sri Lanka. Another thing that was lacking were the sports and recreation facilities. All in all, it was a nice stay but I definitely would not the best in Sri Lanka

Review_text: Too many things wrong made for an uncomfortable stay
Review_text_2:
From most of the reviews here and because of the generally good reputation of Heritance hotels we had high expectations for our stay here. This was the last part of our Sri Lankan trip before returning to Colombo and the plan was to relax and enjoy a luxury hotel along a beautiful beach. The beach was beautiful but the hotel was disappointing. 

Pros: 
-Beautiful beach-clean, not crowded. 
-Decently appointed room with large balcony. 
-Wifi that worked well. 
-Lovely reception area and infinity pool. 
Cons: 
-Room floor was sandy, bathroom mats with dirt smudges. 
-Bad housekeeping service. After being out all morning our room still wasn't cleaned - I called and asked to have it done right away while we were at lunch. They finally arrived while we were napping three hours later. 
-Broken minibar never repaired or replaced, after we requested 
-Breakfast buffet restaurant -Very strong moldy/mildewy smell permeates. Buffet adequate but not great. Chaotic atmosphere and spotty-to-bad service. 
-Hall noise (many children in hotel during our stay) 
-Noise from pool area - music at night, exercise activity in pool mid-morning

Altogether there were too many things wrong with this stay. Disappointing for what is touted as a five star hotel. We would not return or recommend.

altogether there were too many things wrong with this stay. disappointing for what is touted as a five star hotel. we would not return or recommend.

Review_text_2: If you want a large hotel with conference facilities this would be a good choice. However if you want a 5 star luxury hotel look elsewhere. The hotel is noisy the rooms decidedly past their use by date. The location is a problem with limited local facilities. Taking a walk was a hassle both on the beach and in the village. The main buffet restaurant is extremely tired. The one saving grace are the staff who are really excellent.

Review_text_2:
Stayed 2 nights. Wonderful hotel, with great food and a  relaxing spa. Very hospitable staff, helpful & always with a smile.

Although you are inside the building its like living outdoors with so many court yards , trees, water pools inside the hotel....Could hear the sound of the sea while in the room....

The massage at the spa is worth the price... 

Would certainly visit again....

Overall had a wonderful stay.

Review_text: spent a day - the pool view is to die for
Review_text_2:
we did not technically stay at this hotel as the hotel authorities had messed up our booking and had to re-accomodate us with some other properties.
they did make up for their mistakes with a few upgrades and free food and wine thrown in, no worries.

the reason for this review is the time we spent at the swimming pool side - the awesome pool view and location that this place has! infinity pools should look like this...very nice!

also - a word for the staff...though they had messed up the bookings, they did try to make amends as best as possible with the re-booking at a resort in Hikkaduwa and also free lunch and dinner thrown in with some bottles of wine.

Review_text_2:
i was at the hotel afew days ago with colleagues for a workshop. The location is well located. Staff were also pleasant and of help while needed.

My main disapointment was the rooms. As i was taking a shower, water didnt run through the drain as fast as its supposed to. This was a clear indication that the drainage is poor. Also, i noticed a dry roll of tissue placed on top of the septic tank, Yak! I immediately threw the tissue in the bin.The walls of the bathroom are not very clean. I would suggest that they invest in putting tiles on the wall. The sheets were also not sparkling clean. One had a stain of something......i dont know what. The towels are also not new. I had one tired look towel which they tried to hide with the newer towel. 

The hotel needs to really look into the small things that give guests total satisfaction. Otherwise, i dont think i would want to go back there in the near future.
Review_text_3: rooms on the bottom floor are a good deal but not the ones on the furthest from the reception. It's creepy walking all the way at night :-(

Review_text: Overpriced, dirty and with no concept of service.  Weak link in the Heritance chain.
Review_text_2:
We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for 4 nights in August 2013 at the end of a 2 week visit to Sri Lanka.  The Heritage Ahungalla is the only hotel where we experienced poor service and poor housekeeping and felt that the hotel did not live up to its literature (website).  Things started badly and unfortunately certainly did not improve.
On arrival only some of our party of 5 were offered hospitality and this itself was done unsatisfactorily, being given before the hand towels were provided.  A small blip but, as it turned out, indicative of what was to follow.
The check-in process was acceptable, slightly slow but not beyond what was reasonable.  The assistant (off his own back) confirmed that my wife and I would be in one room and our 3 children in another room (as we had booked).
We were then shown to our two “luxury” rooms.  The children were allocated an incredibly large room with a double bed for the girls to share (not uncommon in Sri Lanka) and a separate bed for our son.  No complaints there.  My wife and I were then taken to our room.  This was approximately half the size, and had twin beds pushed together to resemble a double bed – with a double bed headboard and the top blanket pulled across the pair – but there were undeniably two separate beds.  It was hard to believe that the two rooms were of the same category.  It was also perplexing that the hotel had designated the rooms as they had and, most of all, astonishing that they had not put my wife and me in the room with the double bed (the other room was still plenty large enough to accommodate the children).  We raised the matter at reception but were told that nothing could be done; no double bedded room was available for us.  The only thing the hotel suggested was that we could swap rooms but by that time everyone had unpacked and settled in and (quite apart from the obvious inconvenience entailed) this reversal would hardly have gone down well with the children whose expectations had been raised by what the hotel had given them in the first place.
Dinner: Unlike everywhere else we stayed, the main restaurant (the Jute) did not offer an a la carte dining option, only a buffet, although the in-room literature (itself in a ragged state) indicated it did.  To rub salt into the wound, the buffet was very expensively priced compared with the other comparable hotels we stayed in.  It then emerged that the policy on what rate to charge for children was seemingly wholly arbitrary and depended on whether one asked about it.  The default position was a full/adult charge but when this was queried a concession was immediately made for the children, this being apparently down to the attitude of the particular manager in question.
We chose to dine in the Mustard Coffee Shop (a much smaller establishment) where one can purchase individual dishes.  The food was acceptable but of a distinctly lower quality than we had enjoyed elsewhere.
Breakfast: This (included in our package) was provided in the main restaurant.  The food was ok and there was a fairly good selection.  However, the service was undoubtedly by far the worst we experienced during our holiday.  Quite simply, there appeared to be too few waiters.  It often took quite some effort to order tea and to have dirty plates etc. removed – in marked contrast with the attentive service consistently shown at other hotels.  Also, it appeared that the hotel provided breakfast for substantial numbers of non-residents (attending conferences etc.); this made the restaurant particularly busy and not the place for a restful, relaxing meal.
Housekeeping: A joke.  Our room had not been properly cleaned on arrival; there was sand all over the towel hook.  We had to call twice to have it seen to.  Our request that a blown light bulb be replaced was never met.  The second day was ok.  However, on the third day housekeeping did not come to either room.  It took 3 calls from us to get them to clean the rooms – which they did eventually in the late afternoon.  Further, they failed to leave any bottles of water in the children’s room, even though they had done so the previous day and despite the fact that on the same occasion they left fresh water in our room.  When our daughters asked for a supply for them (to brush their teeth etc.) they were told that water was only provided free-of-charge for the first night and that thereafter it must be purchased.  This was a clear fob-off (inconsistent with and contradicted by the hotel’s own actions on other days and in relation to our room).  It took intervention from my wife to get this issue resolved.
Down the corridor some other guests had spilled fruit over the floor.  Housekeeping, along with a trolley of cleaning materials, passed by the scene but failed to clear it properly.  Eventually we asked for it to be cleaned.  When we left there were still watermelon seeds on the (sticky) floor.
Pools: The main pool (featured on the website) is open to non-resident guests and can become very busy, meaning that in effect you feel confined to using the second pool.
Check out: We had to leave at 4.30 a.m. to catch our flight.  I told the hotel this and settled our account around 10 p.m. on the final evening.  The hotel thus knew our plans.  At 4.30 the following morning we all trooped to reception with our cases and I handed in our keys.  It was clear to the staff that we were leaving then.  We waited in front of the desk with our cases for our taxi to arrive.  There was no sign of it; the forecourt was empty and there was no vehicle visible.  After 10 minutes or so my wife asked the reception to telephone the taxi company for us.  Only then did the staff inform us that the taxi had actually arrived some time ago and was parked in a dark corner with all its lights and engine off!  Why they did not volunteer the information before is a total mystery.  It was sheer good luck that we asked them to make the call for us (rather than trying to call the tour company ourselves); otherwise we could have been waiting at reception indefinitely, oblivious of the fact that the taxi was just some yards away!
Indeed, when we were on the road the taxi driver told us that due to some confusion (for which the hotel was not responsible) he’d been booked to arrive at 2 a.m.  On arrival – having entered via the security-controlled gates – he had told the staff.  Why they had not seen fit to call us in our room to notify us is again utterly inexplicable.  It is just typical of the absence of service we experienced throughout our stay.
All in all: the Heritance Ahungalla should be avoided.  It is very much the weak link in the Heritance chain (we stayed at Heritance hotels in Kandamala and Nuwara Eliya which were both good).  By all means visit Sri Lanka – but I strongly suggest you find somewhere else to stay.
Review_text_3: Book a different hotel.

Review_text_2:
This hotel was recommended to us by people who stayed here 4 years ago as 'best hotel in SL'. Unfortunately the hotel did not live up to expectations of 'best hotel' or even a 5 star hotel.
The upkeep of the hotel is very poor. I understand the humidity and moisture in the air would make it difficult to maintain but the other hotels are managing to maintain standard.
Firstly the rooms are looking tired and old!!
-The bathrooms were filthy!! i asked house keeping to re clean!! Shower screens had mould and l was told this is hard to keep clean! - what a load of rubbish!! 
- Beds had bed bugs in them, we were bitten so badly and i thought this was odd as we have been traveling around SL for 2 weeks and not one mozzie bite throughout the whole trip!
-Cockroaches in the bathroom after dark! 
- Complex too large (may be a positive for some people)
- Main dining room dark and mouldy smelly

+ The positives are the staff!! Always friendly and very eager to help. When i complained about the first room we were moved immediately
+ house keeping really tried to clean the room upon complaint

Needless to say as this was the part of our trip to relax we moved hotels and could not have been happier.  

If this hotel was rated down then i would not have written a review like this but this is definitely not a 5 star hotel

Review_text_2: Our vacation to the South has always been at Heritance Ahungalla or Triton as known in the past. Thought of having a change this time and checked into another 5 Star Resort Hotel in Beruwela. Never felt comfortable from the time we stepped into thier lobby although it was a hotel built long after Triton and refurbished very recently. So the same evening made reservation at Heritace Ahungalla and shifted the following day, which was only a 15 minutes drive.

Review_text_2: We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights on full board basis. The design of this hotel is magnificent, with great attention to detail. The amenities are amazing. We would especially like to mention the animators who kept us all busy with water polo, table tennis, boules, volleyball, the evening shows etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much for them. The food at breakfast, lunch and dinner was outstanding and the variety amazing. We will definitely be returning to this hotel next year for two weeks!!

Review_text_2:
I had my first visit to Hertance with my family, it was our office trip.

The rooms are above average, but food and other restaurant services were not great.

Most of my family are vegetarian, all vegetarians had the same food experience as we had. Dinner had a BBQ and some dishes, but lack of tasty vegetarian food, they should have at least added some Indian food items.

I hope they will seriously look into this.

Thanx
Anura

Review_text_2:
The beginning of the holiday started in a very disappointing way. We arrived at the hotel at 2PM on time for check in. However we were informed that the rooms were not ready. As a result we had to wait for over two and a half hours to get our rooms which was a very disappointing experience to start a vacation.

The excuse given by the staff was that the guests have not vacated the rooms on time. This is not a plausible excuse. The hotel should know when to call and inform guests that they need to check out on time. The least they could do then is call us and let us know there is a delay so that we can plan to arrive late to the hotel.

My mother who is elderly had to sit for along time in the reception area and found it difficult to walk afterwords as well.

We actually decided never to come back to this hotel again but we changed our minds after the experience afterwards.

The staff in the hotel mainly the room maintenance and restaurant staff were very polite friendly and courteous. Never before had we experienced such a good service from staff in any other hotels we had been to.

Another plus point was the food. The food was excellent. There was a wide variety and it was very tasty. One negative aspect is that we stayed one night on a day where there were less guests. On this day the food variety was not there and that was a bit of a undermining experience for us.

Another unsatisfactory experience I faced was with the pool attendant. When I went to the swimming pool I asked the pool attendant for a towel. His reply was that the hotel had instructed him to inform guests to bring their room towels. This seemed very odd to me as I saw other patrons having pool towels. Anyway I proceeded to have a swim and I could not  dry myself as I had no towel and I had to go to the room all wet. With the cold wind blowing I could have got pneumonia as well but thankfully that didn't happen.

Later on I called the reception to clarify this and they said that the pool attendant should have given me towels and that he had given me false information. In any case I do hope the hotel takes this experience as a learning and inform their pool attendants as to not to refuse to give patrons pool towels.

Finally I would like to say that the hotel did allow us to have a late check out in order to compensate for the delayed check in.

Overall I would say that I would come back to Heritance Ahungalla due to the friendly and polite staff and the good food. However I hope that I will not face the unpleasent expeirnces I mentioned above, the next time I visit..

Dilshan Thambawita
processed_text_Review_text_2:
the beginning of the holiday started in a very disappointing way. we arrived at the hotel at 2pm on time for check in. however we were informed that the rooms were not ready. as a result we had to wait for over two and a half hours to get our rooms which was a very disappointing experience to start a vacation.

the excuse given by the staff was that the guests have not vacated the rooms on time. this is not a plausible excuse. the hotel should know when to call and inform guests that they need to check out on time. the least they could do then is call us and let us know there is a delay so that we can plan to arrive late to the hotel.

my mother who is elderly had to sit for along time in the reception area and found it difficult to walk afterwords as well.

we actually decided never to come back to this hotel again but we changed our minds after the experience afterwards.

the staff in the hotel mainly the room maintenance and restaurant staff were very polite friendly and courteous. never before had we experienced such a good service from staff in any other hotels we had been to.

another plus point was the food. the food was excellent. there was a wide variety and it was very tasty. one negative aspect is that we stayed one night on a day where there were less guests. on this day the food variety was not there and that was a bit of a undermining experience for us.

another unsatisfactory experience i faced was with the pool attendant. when i went to the swimming pool i asked the pool attendant for a towel. his reply was that the hotel had instructed him to inform guests to bring their room towels. this seemed very odd to me as i saw other patrons having pool towels. anyway i proceeded to have a swim and i could not  dry myself as i had no towel and i had to go to the room all wet. with the cold wind blowing i could have got pneumonia as well but thankfully that didn't happen.

later on i called the reception to clarify this and they said that the pool attendant should have given me towels and that he had given me false information. in any case i do hope the hotel takes this experience as a learning and inform their pool attendants as to not to refuse to give patrons pool towels.

finally i would like to say that the hotel did allow us to have a late check out in order to compensate for the delayed check in.

overall i would say that i would come back to heritance ahungalla due to the friendly and polite staff and the good food. however i hope that i will not face the unpleasent expeirnces i mentioned above, the next time i visit..

dilshan thambawita
