Review_text_2:
We stayed here for a four night beach stay to end our tour of Sri Lanka. The hotel is in a nice location next to the beach. It has two pools, one near the main foyer and another one in a quieter spot - you can't see the beach from this pool but it is nicer and used more than the other one. 

We checked in on a Sunday afternoon - although it is low season, during the weekends the hotel is still fully booked due to package specials. This meant the reception was very busy when we got in and may be why we were allocated a poor standard room initially. It was dirty and had an overpowering musty smell - we were very disappointed, but fortunately after a few hours we were able to go in a much nicer room without the smell and a good view over looking the ocean.

We generally felt that our stay here was below the quality of stays we have had a similar resorts. Some staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable, but then some staff were not as accommodating. For example there are hawkers from the beach that come up in to the resort, so that when we were relaxing they would be yelling out to us to buy their wares - there is a security guard there so it is hard to believe they are even allowed to do this. We were even more shocked when one of the pool attendants actually encouraged us to buy a shirt from one of them! The beach is not actually very nice to spend time on due to a lot of rubbish washed up on the shore. 

We stayed on a half board basis so ate at the hotel a lot and the quality of the meals was a bit inconsistent. The first night dinner buffet was very limited so we asked to have a la carte and this was kindly provided. The next night, there were so few guests that a special a la carte menu was offered - we had a seafood dish and wow - it was literally the best meal we had during our whole Sri Lankan holiday! Then we had a great buffet one night with lots of beautiful hot and fresh food. We also ordered lunches and the menu was quite limited - again we had some great dishes and some that were a little disappointing.

Review_text: The worst meal in Sri Lanka
Review_text_2: At the entrance to the hotel there was a big advertising board claiming to have the best culinary team in the island, since another tourist recommended the food here we booked in for lunch as a special treat. It was a buffet priced at over £27  per couple which is quite expensive compared to normal Sri Lankan standards, considering all the hype we were expecting a grand lunch to remember. We were tempted by the grilled seafood skewers as a starter and this was the beginning of the worst meal in Sri Lanka ever. We could not eat them they were stale and tough as old boots. I decided to go for the main course and on the way noticed to my horror the cause of the awful starters the chef was taking out old cooked seafood skewers from a container and putting them back on the hot grill. The main course did not impress one bit the meat curry was stale and very dry, the vegetables were overcooked. The desserts were awful and the only good thing served here was what they did not prepare themselves" the curd & honey". During our meal we requested to see the chef to make a complaint regarding this terrible food. Finally a gentleman appeared at our table who was unable to give us any satisfactory explanation. We ordered coffee and guess what it was stale and lukewarm. By then we were fuming and demanded to see the manager who was very apologetic and requested us to come back that evening for a meal on him, how kind. He even charged us in full for the worst meal we had in Sri Lanka. Do you think we went back that evening for another repeat performance on the house, "Hell no". Do not be fooled by false advertising claims when you can get a much better meal from any roadside cafe for less than £8 for two.
Review_text_3: Do not eat here if you are staying at this hotel go out for your meals

Review_text_2:
We stayed here for two nights.  At first we were given a standard room, but our toilet was not working.  So thankfully we were upgraded.  After this small hitch, all our tour group was upgraded.
This lovely hotel, has two beautiful pools and it is quiet and relaxing.  The food at this hotel is also good, the staff are friendly and overall a pleasant stay.  However on checkout much confusion with bills being mixed up within our tour group.  This took about 45 minutes to sort out and when the cashier was asked for proof of purchase, he had to fish the receipts from the bin.  This system needs an overhaul to ensure correct bills are billed to the correct person.
Would definitely stay here again.
Review_text_3: We very much enjoyed the rooms that led directly onto the pool.

Review_text_2:
My party of 6 couples tour Sri Lanka annually.  We have developed a friendly circle of Lankan friends there and never fail to enjoy our touring of this fascinating country.

This property has always been on our list of hostelries and we do enjoy the ambience.  Service is dependable and the food above average.  The rack rates are on a par with similar European hotels and you will certainly be relieved of a lot of Dollars or Euros during your visit.  And of course, the staff is paid at the prevailing poverty rate of Sri Lanka so the margin for this hotel must be handsome.  And yet we always marvel at how efficient and professional the staff is considering their vastly underpaid salaries.

As most international travelers know, these upscale hotels tout their in-room "convenience bar" as an enticing feature of their service.  Somehow we are supposed to be honored to be able to purchase these exaggeratedly priced items.  I suppose that the hotels theorize that throwing our money away on these insignificant "treasures" makes us feel socially superior.  As a result of this, and on principle, my party avoids the handy bandits like a plague supplying our own snacks purchased at a mom & pop store on the way and use the bandits for storage.
  
So it came to pass that I nonchalantly reached in for one of our Snickers and was horrified half way through that I realize that I had actually grabbed the hotel Mars Bar. So quickly I replaced it with one or our Snickers which was why the cashier at check-out time contracted a severe case of apoplexy when the chamber boy dramatically reported that he had found a desecrated Mars Bar wrapper in the trash and that a Snickers had been substituted.
 
To give you perspective on the severity of the cashier's grand mal seizure, a Mars Bar, at 51 grams of sugar, waxed chocolate and fat, sells at 300 rupees, [current exchange rate = $2.37, mom & pop price 85 rs, 7 cents USD]).  Through his glazed eyes the cashier could see a lost 353 % markup margin leading to corporate bankruptcy, for which he would undoubtedly be held responsible.  The replacement Snickers at 57 grams (mom & pop 150 rs [$1.19 USD]) seemed not to appease him at all.  Perhaps it was the total combined hotel bill of over $2,133 that clouded his aleertness and in the confusion we slipped out to our chauffeured car with instructions to the driver to out race the police if need be.

I have instructed our travel clerk to delete this property from our standing list of Lankan hotels so that the cashier and management at Ahungalla can be absolved of having to host a notorious international group of candy bar thieves.
Review_text_3: Ask for a room that backs onto the pool area.

Review_text_2:
We visited Heritance Ahungalla recently and observed some pros and cons that might be useful to point out.

Pros. 

1. As the room was booked as a part of our anniversary, we were given the most spacious room of the category and really loved every bit of it. It was cozy and relaxing. Our favorite part was how it seemed to be a sort of a separate building to the main hotel and opened up to the jacuzzi and resident green pool. 

2.  The hotel in general was very relaxing and spacious and never felt like it was crowded. well probably because it wasnt! but either way even if there was a heavy crowd it felt like you had your own space.

Cons.

1. TV - Ofcourse you dont come on a holiday to watch TV BUT it would be great to have a few good options. The cable tv had very few channels excluding some of the most entertaining movie and tv show channels which I thought was a bit of a bummer.

2. The food was not great and not bad. Average I must say. We expected a large spread but it seemed that since it was off peak season and less crowd also because it was a weekday, there was very little variety and thereby "threw a dagger" to our expectations. 

Anyway Thanks Heritance for the nice stay and we hope to see you again sometime!

Review_text_2:
We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our touring holiday. Although we had a room with a beach view it was above the bar area - and each evening we had to endure really loud really awful karaoke type music. Luckily this only went on until just past 11 but it sure wasn't the peaceful, relaxing stay we had anticipated. We asked to change rooms but were told it was not possible.
The food was luke warm and the service, particularly for drinks, was slow.
We did enjoy time spent around the quieter of the 2 pools and the beach was only a short stroll away. There were touts but we got used to them, it's a third world country after all.
It wasn't a disastrous stay by any means but I would describe it as more of a 3 star than it's supposed status of 5 star - so it's expensive for what you get.
Be warned - it's about 3-4 hours drive from the airport.
Review_text_3: Not over the bar area overlooking the main swimming pool. You have been warned!

Review_text: Overpriced, terrible service and dirty - AVOID AT ALL COSTS
Review_text_2:
I live in Dubai, so I know what a USD$400 per night hotel room should get you.  Therefore, in Sri Lanka, it should be at least on par - if not a thousand times better.  

This review comes with a disclaimer – the hotel did compensate me with a rather dramatic discount upon departure.  I do not believe that this hotel can realistically charge the amount they do for this level of property and service.  In the end I believe we paid a fair amount for what we received.  They begged me not to write a bad review, so I will not, but I will state the truth.

Let’s start with the “pros”:
-	Beautifully designed hotel with authentic colonial architecture.
-	Lovely view from most of the balconies.
-	Several dining options available.
-	Good bathrooms.
-	Good a/c in rooms.
-	Massages at the spa are heavenly.  Probably the best I’ve ever had!
-	Management responded well to our complaints.

Now over to the “cons”:
-	The “confirmed” airport transfer was not booked.  We waited 2 hours at the airport before they finally arranged.
-	Our room was filthy.  Even after complaining it did not improve.
-	Room service, bar and snack menus are the same.  No Sri Lankan food in sight!
-	Manicure and hair treatments at the spa were disastrous (rough nails and stripped colour from hair).
-	Dirty linen at all F&B outlets and room service.
processed_text_Review_text: overpriced, terrible service and dirty - avoid at all costs

Review_text: Great atmosphere but poor quality of service
Review_text_2:
I've spent two nights on B&B basis at Heritance Ahungalla.

Actually my wife and myself had a good time at the hotel with its really nice surroundings. The bedroom was pleasant and relaxing. We really loved the pretty large beach area which is just great! also the pool was spacious.

However the responsiveness of the staff and follow up was poor. 

E.g. My wife is pregnant and she needed bottled water as we have run out of the two, so i phoned house keeping .. hours passed by without any water at all. So i had to go my self to the bar and get two bottles. We even called the reception and they said they will look into it. Water to the room never arrived.   

Meal variety in ala carte menu was not good either. For people who signed up for B&B doesn't have a variety to choose from. Even at different locations such as Coffee shop and snack bar have the same menu. no choice what so ever and we couldn't make a decision as what to eat.
processed_text_Review_text: great atmosphere but poor quality of service

Review_text_2:
Came here for a couple of nights on our family trip to Sri Lanka. Rooms were clean and comfortable and service was overall very good. The main breakfast / dinner restaurant was always smoky (from preparing food) and it seemed there was no air con or exhaust fan to remove the smoke. Selection of food at the buffet was good. Cocktails were poorly made and extremely strong! 

Pool was not as clean as expected and it didn't seem that it was cleaned everyday. Jacuzzi was full of sand. The shower glass in our bathroom had soap scum which looked like it hadn't been cleaned for a month. 

Security around the perimeter of the hotel especially on the beach side needs to be beefed up. There were a few people around the beach who were hassling the patrons.  

The positives were that there was a live band at the bar every night and amazing views of the beach from the rooms. 

Overall, average especially for a resort that is meant to be 5 star.
processed_text_Review_text_2:
came here for a couple of nights on our family trip to sri lanka. rooms were clean and comfortable and service was overall very good. the main breakfast / dinner restaurant was always smoky (from preparing food) and it seemed there was no air con or exhaust fan to remove the smoke. selection of food at the buffet was good. cocktails were poorly made and extremely strong! 

pool was not as clean as expected and it didn't seem that it was cleaned everyday. jacuzzi was full of sand. the shower glass in our bathroom had soap scum which looked like it hadn't been cleaned for a month. 

security around the perimeter of the hotel especially on the beach side needs to be beefed up. there were a few people around the beach who were hassling the patrons.  

the positives were that there was a live band at the bar every night and amazing views of the beach from the rooms. 

overall, average especially for a resort that is meant to be 5 star.

Review_text_2:
HOTEL: 
We stayed at the Heritance for 10 Nights. The hotel and staff are lovely. After reading a previous review about being to scared to leave the room, i feel that this is an insult the the hard working staff there. At no point did we feel we threatened by staff, housekeeping staff smiled and never asked for a tip and the same said with the staff in the bar area.
I suppose the hotel could do with a lick of paint but as for broken sunbeds i didnt see any, and there was always loads to choose from.
The only negative thing about the room is the size of the fridge which is very small. But again it wasnt a real problem.

YES.. you tip for most things but we never felt preasured to do so, and even if you do its 100rs at a time! The sellers on the beach are a bit of a pain, but a firm no and they go off to the next person, and after a while getting the same response from us they didnt even bother. Our room was on the 3rd floor and it was lovely, and we even had our own little gekcho which was great for eating insects. Our room was cleaned twice a day with clean towels and more water.

The food was lovely, the only downside is there isnt much options for vegitarians.
The only major downside with ther Heritance was location. when we travel we like to go out and try local resturants which is why we booked b&b, however other then the little fish resturant (which is cheap with lovely food) along the beach there isnt anything walking distance. We did take a taxi RS3500 (that waited 3hrs and brought us back to the hotel) to Hikkaduwa where you'll find bars/resturants and several rotty cafe. 
If we'd of known this we would of booked HB as we ended up spending most evenings eating in the hotel.
TOURS:
We did several trips whilst in Sri Lanka. The first to Uda Walawe park, as much as it was a long drive it was lovely to see the elephants roaming around freely, its def worth a visit.
We then did a 2 day trip to Kandy and Sigiriya again a lot of driving, we stopped off at a tea shop on the way which was ok, then the botanical gardens which is a lovely place to sit with an ice cream and watch the world go by. We then went to the temple of tooth which was lovely, and to be honest go without a guide as ours was a bit of an idiot trying to get us to pay for him to study etc etc.. which we felt was very cheeky whilst inside a buddhist temple!!! In Kandy We stayed at Chaaya Citadel which was lovely and great food, to be honest it was a shame we only stayed the night.
The next day we had an early start and more driving to Sigiriya, this was via a spice market and to be honest at 830am we probably wasnt the most awake customers!! but we listened and left!
Once we arrived at Sigirya we headed up the many steps in the mid morning heat!!! the views at the top are lovely and make for great photos, they even had a family of monkeys that live on the top. Then it was the 7hr drive back to the hotel. Be warned your driver will take you to various tea/gem and spice shops!!!! We asked our driver if we could skip these but its something they have to do, even though we put our foot down and said no to the gem store.

Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Heritance and its lovely staff.

Review_text_2:
We stayed at this hotel for four days and it was the worst hotel experience ever. A COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY AND A VERY EXPENSIVE DISASTER!

I recommend reading the lowest reviews for this hotel before you book; there is a real discrepancy between the nightmare reviews and those that are praising this hotel. Make sure you understand what is the worst that could happen to you also if you choose to stay here, because the worst scenario did happen to us. We did not read what the low ratings on Tripadvisor said about the Heritance Ahungalla. We wished we did because so many of these complaints reflect our experience.

My friend and I are both seasoned travelers, and have stayed in both five star accommodation and budget ones, all over the world. Given the cost of staying at this hotel, we were both incredibly disappointed and also traumatised during their stay. We felt so uncomfortable and threatened during our stay that we locked ourselves in our hotel room.

We have lodged a formal complaint to the travel agency about our stay at the Heritance Ahungalla. Our main complaints are as follows:

- Worst service: for the entire duration of the trip, the staff was incredibly rude. There was no ‘hospitality’. The staff pestered us repeatedly for tips, from the receptionist to cleaning staff to waiters. When we made all the complaints listed below to the staff, we were completely ignored and were shouted at. No attempts were made to apologise or to resolve the problems. We were incredibly frustrated by this, and were very close to tears.

- Terribly unhygienic: stained bedsheets, dust and mould. Restaurant tableware and cutlery was not cleaned properly and had stains.

- Pests: cockroaches, flies and mosquitoes in the bedroom and the bathroom. 

- Touts: The hotel was full of touts, from the pool to the beach, also pestering us and other guests to buy their goods. At one point, one of the touts even made a completely disgusting sexual advance on my friend! The hotel made no effort to safeguard the safety and/or privacy of their guests.

- Food: the food was always lukewarm at best, and/or cold. Food would take at least 45 minutes to arrive. We ended up eating only burgers and fries for the four days that we were there, as it was the only food we felt was safe. For a holiday experience, this was disappointing. It would have been better to have just eaten McDonald’s.

- Bad facility condition: The hotel is quite old, and many parts require fixing. A number of sunbeds were broken and completely unusable.

We will never stay there again and are warning everyone who visits Sri Lanka to avoid this place. If you plan on staying there, at least read both the good and bad reviews to decide for yourself. There is a higher risk staying at this hotel, because of its location. It is incredibly far away from Colombo and any other properties, so if you arrive here and the hotel is a complete disappointment, there is no other property that you can escape to.

BEWARE!

Review_text_2: We stayed here for 3 days then visited Yala and came back for another 4 days the food is outstanding especially the desserts. The pools are both stunning and the wild life around it are amazing we saw several Squirrel type cute and friendly and several large reptiles. The staff are very friendly always happy and willing to help. The rooms very tasteful we had room 257 and 304 I like 304 best it is a little smaller than the others but the views of the sea and pool more than compensate. They also made a Birthday Cake for me which was much appreciated.
Review_text_3: Take plenty of Mosquito repellent we where badly bitten. Beware of the locals who trawl the beach and wont take no for an answer we also found it impossible to go out  of the hotel to look around again the locals are a pest, however there is nothing within walking distance and we did not feel brave enough to take the Tuk Tuks

Review_text_2:
We booked this hotel through an agency based on their recommendation. Stayed two nights. 
We loved the place. The hotel design is unbelivable. Stunning as you arrive at the reception. The blue pool and sea are seen in one veiw. Great. The rooms were large and very comfortable with wifi. Resturant and food very good. There are 4 restaurants. The most striking thing was the service. Unbelivable. People so responsive and freidly. I saw reviews from past years complaining about the service. I guess they made a big change. Bottom line - one of the best hotels we have visited. You have everything, great facilities, great pools great beach and great service.
Aldaag
Review_text_3: We had a roon facing the beach.

Customer_country: East Riding of Yorkshire, United Kingdom
Review_text_2:
The reception area is large and open with beautiful views out to sea.  The staff are welcoming and immediately cannot do enough for you.  We arrived tired and fed up after finding no room for us at Jetwing Lighthouse despite a booking being made April 2012 (see separate review).  The hotel was about to welcome the Sri Lanka and Bangladeshi international cricket teams and although there was great excitement we were made to feel just as important.  We were told there would be extra security but this did not affect us at all.  Bearing in mind we were not expected we had a fabulous 3rd floor upgraded room overlooking the sea and the pool.

The choices at dinner and breakfast could not have been better and when I asked for some French cheese the chef apologised and said he would try and get some for the morning.  Although it did not appear at breakfast the enthusiasm was there.

Great hotel, great location.
Review_text_3: Choose high floor ocean view

Review_text_2:
My husband booked this hotel for our holiday.  We were there for 5 days.  Absolutely loved it here.  It is an older hotel but with the best hospitality ever.  Our room was quite large and with a wonderful view of the ocean and the second pool. They take care of your every need.  You are greeted upon your arrival and through your stay.  The Indian Ocean is right there so, as you swim in the beautiful endless pool your view is spectacular.  They cleaned our room twice a day.  Waited on our every whim.  Took care of us through the stay.  They have a "Upper Room" restaurant that was a bit expensive but the food was the best I have ever put in my mouth.
 If you want to relax, be pampered, and have the most awesome holiday ever, than stay here!!!  
The drive from the airport is a bit long but by August of 2013 it will be a 45 minute drive because of the new toll road that will be complete.
Review_text_3: We were on the second floor near the corner by the second pool.  It was very, very quite.

Review_text_2:
It's what you don't see in the glossy photos and marketing blurb, but step one metre outside the hotel grounds (front/roadside or back/beachside) and you'll immediately be surrounded by local touts, who draw you into conversation with general chit-chat (Where are you from? How long are you staying?) before swiftly moving on to the HARD SELL (for tours, tuktuks, souvenirs,  restaurants, etc), or muscling in on trying to carry your shopping and gathering around when you get your change in the hope of receiving some cash.
In short, it doesn't make you feel like a human being; more like a walking Rupee or Dollar bill waiting to get rinsed.
I am expecting the mandatory response from the hotel manager (does he really write these Trip Advisor responses?!), saying the hotel is working with the touts to improve the experience for guests... if this is true (and it seems to have been ongoing for some time), it simply is not working. 
A cynic would suggest the touts benefit the hotel in scaring guests into only using the hotel's services. We did this initially - a 9km taxi trip was a set hotel price of $27 return, compared to £2.50 single in a tuktuk. And the hotel taxi driver was hell-bent on taking us to a turtle hatchery, temple, Ayurveda centre, tea shop, etc. instead of where we had actually asked to go, which was exasperating. 
As for the hotel itself, one you get beyond the wow factor of the pools, the hotel rooms are comfortable and functional, serviced by attentive housekeeping staff. The buffet restaurant is acceptable as a day-to-day dining option and the communal areas are decently maintained. 
But will we be recommending the hotel or visiting it again? Sadly, the persistent pestering and hassle we encountered from the locals means the response is a resounding 'NO'.

Review_text_2:
This place was amazing.
 From our arrival we felt very welcome here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They were always on hand to help with a smile and were immaculate in presentation.
The location of the hotel is idyllic, the pool was fantastic & the room was perfectly clean and practical.
The food was 5* quality, great selection to choose from and reasonable at cost. Take the buffet breakfast! You may see an elephant wandering the grounds ;)
This hotel had plenty of character, there were activities going on all day & entertainment in the evenings. We even got to try scuba diving in the pool.
The spa was fantastic, we had hot oil massages which were just heavenly.
We were very happy with our stay here, we only stayed 2 nights - We will be back again for sure! I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

I fell the Taste of Food can improve further to match the Hotel Setting and Buffet Prices. They had many entertainment items to keep the Guests on their feet during the Christmas holidays. We loved the "Jackson Five" performance.
We enjoyed the privacy of the Beach and the Private Blue Pool.
Rooms are maintained perfectly with daily House keeping. 
The place is extremely clean and safe.
I would no doubt recommend the Place to friends & Corporates.
Thank you Heritance!!

Review_text: Even if you book in advance you may not get a good room!
Review_text_2:
This was our first stop of our family vacation in Sri Lanka during the Christmas break in 2012. We had given the hotel a rooming list one month prior to coming to Sri Lanka and they screwed up royally with the rooms. 

They had rooms all over the hotel on the second floor in both wings and it was very difficult for the family with 7 children in total to keep an eye on them as the rooms were almost 5 minutes walk from each other. 

They also did not have the room types as we had requested (one month prior) given to us. Some of the couple were given twin beds and the extra beds which were requested were not given at all. 

Food was very good here though. The property itself is a beautiful one with the pool and beahc so close to each other.
Review_text_3: Ask for rooms in the main building facing the ocean and not the rooms in the left or right wings which sometimes have no view.
processed_text_Review_text: even if you book in advance you may not get a good room!

Review_text_2: We have just spent over a week at the much vaunted Geoffrey Bawa designed Heritance Hotel. We enjoyed our week on the coast but find it tough to rate the hotel better than average. No doubt in its day the hotel would have been considered ahead of its time however today its minimalist design and decor highlight the fact that hotel is getting tired. The rooms have apparently been renovated recently and they are OK however the public areas are uninspiring. We visited a number of hotels on the coast while in the area. It was noticeable how many are either new - Chaaya at Hikkaduwa or recently upgraded - and Surf and Avani at Bentota, or in the process of being renovated - Vivanta by Taj at Bentota. The latter, based on the upgrade we saw to date, is going to be fantastic. The Heritance will need to watch its competition. The beach is nice once you've been rude to the touts to keep them off. Tourist information is not readily available and most things you'll want to do are away from Ahungalla. We got most information and help in getting around from the on site taxi drivers who can arrange pretty much anything including motor bike hire which despite the local traffic we would recommend. Tuk Tuk drivers outside the hotel are bad news - rude and argumentative which we didn't find anywhere else. Finally the hotel entertainment is amateurish. At +US350 a night it wasn't cheap for what it is.
Review_text_3: Specify if you want a double bed otherwise you might get twins. Most rooms have balconies so if you can get above ground floor the beach view is good.
processed_text_Review_text_2: we have just spent over a week at the much vaunted geoffrey bawa designed heritance hotel. we enjoyed our week on the coast but find it tough to rate the hotel better than average. no doubt in its day the hotel would have been considered ahead of its time however today its minimalist design and decor highlight the fact that hotel is getting tired. the rooms have apparently been renovated recently and they are ok however the public areas are uninspiring. we visited a number of hotels on the coast while in the area. it was noticeable how many are either new - chaaya at hikkaduwa or recently upgraded - and surf and avani at bentota, or in the process of being renovated - vivanta by taj at bentota. the latter, based on the upgrade we saw to date, is going to be fantastic. the heritance will need to watch its competition. the beach is nice once you've been rude to the touts to keep them off. tourist information is not readily available and most things you'll want to do are away from ahungalla. we got most information and help in getting around from the on site taxi drivers who can arrange pretty much anything including motor bike hire which despite the local traffic we would recommend. tuk tuk drivers outside the hotel are bad news - rude and argumentative which we didn't find anywhere else. finally the hotel entertainment is amateurish. at +us350 a night it wasn't cheap for what it is.

Review_text_2: We were really looking forward to a relaxing stay here after a busy touring holiday but feel disappointed. When we arrived there was a beach disco party starting and the noise was deafening. This was followed by an aquerorobic session played at full volume, we have not stayed at such a noisy place ever! Tonight is Russian Xmas and we have two lots of noise, from the disco and the lounge bar! My advice? Bring ear plugs!  Our room is fantastic and of you were staying with a large group or family and friends it would be great, but I don't think we will be back

Review_text_2:
Unless your dream holiday is to sit by a pool all day with staff continually at beck and call this isn't for you. There is very little to do around the hotel unless you have a car or a driver. we found ourselves getting rather bored of it, quite quickly.  

The hotel is on a stunning sandy beach but you cannot swim in the sea, and the areas round the two pools are full of Russians with money to burn. I don't like customers being rude to staff but saw plenty of this. However staff accepted it due to massive tips and pretty much ignored everyone else.  Food in the hotel was good and rooms were clean but wouldn't go back.  The whole hotel was pretty impersonal with massive long white corridors which reminded me of Victorian hospitals. This hotel was the final one on our trip so we only stayed two nights, which for us was one night too many. 

As I said in my intro the hotel was perfect if you want to spend all day on a sun lounger but it didn't suit us.

Review_text_2:
For the layabout to do nothing, the fitness fanatic to be at peak, the gourmet to garner all the delights or the holiday maker in search of serenity, there is one place in Sri Lanka all rolled into one. That is the five-star Heritance at Ahungalla, where the blue ocean kisses the sand and the swimming pool stands between the airy reception area.
This may sound like a leaf from a flyer or an advertisement. It is not. That’s my experience during a week-long stay at the luxury resort. The absence of what seems an orchestrated hustle and bustle in some of the resorts, being left alone from the taunting touts on the beach and caring of the staff made all the difference. I fell in love with what I saw and what I enjoyed.
The buffet meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner had a wide variety to choose from – a cross section of the most popular Sri Lankan cuisine and a widespread selection of western and continental food. That is not to mention the fine dining restaurants.
If you need to learn a little more, go beyond what the glossy magazines and flashy advertisements on websites say. I did that. The tins, bottles, corrugated boxes and other degradable items do not go waste. There is a team to sort them to be re-cycled. An award winning Chef, Dimuthi Kumarasinghe finds no space on the walls of his room or his tables to place any more awards including trophies. They are full. Ask him to give you what they call an “indigenous meal.” It’s a three course lunch or dinner with produce including catch of the sea within a radius of five kilometres from the hotel.
I told Manager Refhan N. Razeen that I was pampered. “That is our style,” he said. 
So, if you also want to be pampered in southern Sri Lanka, Heritance is the resort. Don’t believe me. Have a go, try it.

The only savibg grace was being upgraded and the room we got was fantastic. The hotel is set in a great location but if you do not like being hasseled on the so called private beach then this hotel is not for you. There were many locals on the beach trying to sell guests goods in full view of the scurity guards. However the security guards did not stop this from happening and we will not be returning to this hotel.

Review_text_2:
After a week of touring around Sri Lanka for the first part of our honeymoon we were looking forward to spending a week by the sea in a 5 star resort. Unfotunately we were very disappointed with this hotel. The good points about the hotel are the large swimming pools and the view of the sea from most parts of the hotel. 
The bad points are numerous:
-During our stay the weather was very windy and it rained heavily. The hotel is not designed to cope  heavy rainfall as it is designed in a very modern, open minimalist way. All the corridors, a bar and the cafe are completely open to the elements. This meant that rain was constantly pouring in and the floors were several centimetres deep in some places. This made the floors very slippy and we found we were unable to get around the hotel much and it made sitting in the front bar and cafe impossible as the bar does not have any front covers to keep the rain out. The staff are constantly sweeping the water away and moving furniture around out of the rain which was very irritating. The overall cleanliness of the hotel is not that great either and the hotel is starting to look rundown. The bathroom in our room had lots of mould in the shower(picture attached), and there was no bath option, you have to pay for a premium top floor room to get a bath! Having stayed in many 5 star and 4 star hotels all over Europe and Asia, I would say this is a 3 star at best, the other 3 star hotels we stayed in during our holiday were in fact much better. 
-The food is boring and pricey by Sri Lankan standards although you would expect that in a 5 star hotel. We went to the fine dining restaurant one night which was pretty good, although very run-of-the-mill options such as steak and mash. The desserts were interesting but after waiting over half an hour, when they arrived they were poorly executed and my dessert was not even what I ordered. Being the only other couple in the restaurant this was certainly not what we expected. The breakfast is also disappointing, the only positive being the traditional Sri Lankan curries offered. The omelette queue was impressive every morning and that only left under-cooked waffles, anaemic chicken sausages and fatty bacon cooked to order. The rest of the buffet was luke-warm at best. The fresh fruit offered however was fesh and ripe and there was lots of choice.
-The beach is not for swimming or being on for any length of time. There are local people constantly waiting on the edge of the hotel and the beach trying to sell you things aggressively and stray dogs wandering about do not make you feel safe. The security guards do nothing about the sellers and leave them to shout at you whilst you are lying on sunbeds within the hotel grounds.
-Another point to make is that there is nothing to do in the local area- we went to the 'turtle hatchery' before going to the hotel and it took us 10min to look at the 2 ponds in which 2 poor adult turtles are kept, and a small area of sand where the eggs are buried before they hatch.  

We ended up leaving early as we were fed up with the food, not being able to go on to the beach and the inefficient staff. 

Wish we had gone to the Maldives!
Review_text_3: We had a deluxe ocean view with a nice view.

Review_text: Sadly, a bit of a disappointment...
Review_text_2:
We stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla towards the end of our tour around Sri Lanka, having stayed at two other Heritance Hotels (Kandalama and Tea Factory).  We were looking forward to a relaxing three days...

Firstly, the positives...We were upgraded to a beautiful suite, which was one of the best rooms we had during our tour.  The room had a comfy bed, a large flat-screen tv (with seating in front), and a huge, luxurious bathroom.  The whole room was kept scrupulously clean thoughout by our friendly "room boy".  

Breakfast was the usual buffet (including excellent dosas).  The staff at breakfast were friendly and offered us different teas to the usual.

The hotel has two pools...the residents' pool was generally quiet.  The other pool (in front of the reception area) was busier, and was somewhat blighted by the beach sellers (more on that later!).

So, the negatives...Looking at the hotel's website, they seem to be badging it as a luxury-style resort...hmmm, well sadly, we found it a bit lacking:

The food was rather average compared to the offerings in the other Heritance hotels we 'd stayed at.  Elsewhere we had good quality, creative snacks when we fancied a change to Sri Lankan food (for example excellent club-style sandwiches, items for sharing etc).  Here, there selection was a bit mundane.  We only found out that there was a veggie menu when we had a chance discussion with a staff member...there was no mention of this in the in-room pack, or displayed in the restaurants.  This really does need to be made clearer.  Also, the veggie menu is available 24hrs in the cafe/bar, but apparently isn't routinely available for room service!  We had a couple of frustrating phone calls trying to order from it...we called at 5.15pm and were told to call back after 6pm..and when we did call, were told to call back again at 7pm!  

We also ate in the cafe/bar, but one order was not as described on the menu (chop suey with pad thai turned out to be sloppy veggies with a small pile of rice).  The rice with veggie curries were delicious, but there were so many flies it put us off (we appreciate that its not unusual to get flies when effectively dining alfresco, but it was a bit much when I turned to spoon some more curries and half had flies in them (surely a cover would have been sensible?)).

Although the resident’s pool was generally quiet, we were disturbed a couple of times by people trying to sell stuff (the resident palm reader and vendor of wooden items which could be purchased from the other pool).  

And finally, our biggest complaint....the beach is effectively a no-go area due to sellers of sarongs, tours and local hoteliers trying to pursuade residents to visit their hotel for dinner and spa treatments etc.  These people were relentless and aggressive in their tactics, following tourists along the beach, and would not take no for an answer if you made the mistake of venturing onto their patch (ie. step off of the grass onto the sand).  We even witnessed them shouting to people sunbathing around the pool.  

We feel this could be an amazing hotel, but it is rather average at the moment...

Review_text_2:
Pros
- great view of the ocean (sea view avaiable with Premium rooms0
- speacious clean rooms
- good size pools (note there are two pools, and one is mostly only offered to foreigners)
- good spread for buffet (but its almost the same everyday for bfast)

Cons
- teriible reception/front desk service; had a don't care attitude and were often rude
- had electrical problems in the room when the fan was turned on but even after informing the reception twice (on two seperate days), they did nothing about it..did not even apologise or offer to change the room
- requested king/queen bed but were only given twin mattresses
- no bath tubs, this is only available in luxury rooms
- Not much choice for in-room dining
- Don't visit during the weekends; the hotel allows far too many groups to have the spend the day on the weekends (allowing one or two groups is fine but there should be a limit so that the pools are not over crowded); 

My personal opinion is that the hotel treated foreigners differently to the locals (including locals from overseas); with the locals, they just didn't care. Me and my husband are Sri Lankans and we visit Sri Lanka often and like to escape out of colombo for a few days. We were really disappointed with the way they treated us. I think i've had far better service in other hotels in the area (bentota etc).

Great hotel but would not recommend due to the horrible service.

Review_text: A Good looking hotel with terrible service
Review_text_2:
The hotel looks stunning offers great views.We had booked the premium rooms sea facing.
We found the service lacking in all aspects.From the rooms check in to the restaurant service. We were quite displeased with the hotel.
I had planned a surprise for my husband and had requested the hotel for a cake and for the room to be decorated and offered to pay extra for the same. I had called and re-confirmed this more than three times. I had called in even three hours before check-in to ensure this is done. I was assured it would be done before we arrived. We came to the hotel and the front desk staff intimated that they never received any such request. Since it was a surprise it turned out to be quite a spoiler. Though the room was nice. We were given one with twin mattresses. We had to repeatedly request for a change in room with at least a queen mattress.(So much for an anniversary). We were told the hotel was running full.So we would be given a room change the next day.It never happened.Quite disappointing.
Even the service in the restaurant was appalling none of the waiters bother to even keep the cutlery on the table after we have taken out plates or serve us even drinking water we had to repeatedly request for it.Being a 5-star hotel we were surprised at the dismal service.
I might not consider the property again solely for the lack of service.
Also the restaurants lack a choice of vegetarian food. especially the fine dinning restaurants does not serve any vegetarian food. even on request.We we forced to use the buffet every time.Which also has limited options.Disappointed again.
We would not recommend this to others.
Review_text_3: Select rooms near the secondary pool while booking.Offers great views and its closer to the secondary pool which offers more privacy.

advice get as many books as you can for this holiday great place for readers as there is not to be done in the area so preferred to stay in the hotel with the two pools, great food, great hospitality.

Review_text_2:
This is a First Class hotel and deserves its rating 

It is excellent in every way but has one huge problem ! 

The huge problem is the Beach Gangs who patrol the hotel frontage to the beach 

These gangs are totally illegal but the hotel allows them to harass and harangue the guests 

These gangs do not accept a polite refusal

They are well organised and surround each guest and are extremely agressive 

They do not give up and basically they hound and bully each poor guest until in desperation a guest agrees to purchase goods from them 

The goods they sell are unlicensed excursions, unlicensed trips , unlicensed massage parlours and meals in local Hostelries which would be closed down by Health and Safety without even entering inside the premises 

I think that this is an appalling situation as it is blatantly obvious that Sri Lanka is a poor country  and relies heavily on the income from tourists 

I can assure readers of this column that not one rupee from the pockets of the Beach Gangs will be used to benefit the local community or Sri Lanka as a whole 

I would also remind readers that in the event of an accident ( which is very common on the crazy Sri Lanka roads ) that Insurance Companies will not pay one penny if a client was travelling on an illegal or unlicensed tour or trip or taxi ride . 

An unforeseen accident in Sri Lanka can result in enormous medical and hospital and repatriation bills 

I did complain to the Heritance staff about the continued agressive behaviour of the Beach Gangs ( who also shout to the guests reclining in the hotel grounds ) 

The staff advised that they all lived locally and thus did not wish to upset the Beach Gangs for fear of repercussions on themselves and on their families 

In conclusion , I find this an appalling situation whereby the Hotel Management is turning a blind eye to the discomfort and unhappiness of their guests 

I must also admit quite openly that unless there is some form of financial reward being given weekly to the Hotel Management , I can see no earthly reason why the Hotel Management encourages the Beach Gangs to extort money from their guests 

Apart from the above problem , I can confirm that this is an excellent hotel 

I have stayed in most of the decent hotels in Sri Lanka but this is definitely the best in my opinion

The rooms ( bedrooms and suites ) are a good size and immaculately furnished; towels , soaps , water etc are changed twice daily and the Housekeeping service is of a very high standard 

The food is superb and every mealtime offered a new selection of mouth watering delights ; huge prawns and devilled crabs were in such abundance that we eventually declined them as we simply could not eat any more !

There are 2 very large landscaped pools here and both of them were crystal clear and beautifully warm at all times 

There are also many sports and fitness facilities at this hotel and we really enjoyed our daily game of badminton 

This hotel  sits alone  on a massive empty silky sandy beach backed by tall swaying palm trees  ; the beach stretches for miles from one headland to the next

Swimming in the sea is definitely not possible at this time of the year as the sea is very rough with tremendous undercurrents 

However , the pools at the Heritance are so large you can easily  imagine you are swimming in the sea

I should also add that the Ayurveda Spa is a must and is in the most Romantic position imaginable ; their  treatments are excellent and their methods of curing aches and pains are really incredible   

In conclusion , this is an excellent hotel but it will quickly lose its popularity if the Owners do not step in and banish the Beach Gangs
Review_text_3:
Choose a first or  second floor for an unimpeded Ocean View 

Choose a room near the Green Pool for tranquility

 Rooms near the main pool are noisier as  the main pool area is adjacent to the Dining rooms and the day activities and the evening entertainments
processed_text_Review_text_2:
this is a first class hotel and deserves its rating 

it is excellent in every way but has one huge problem ! 

the huge problem is the beach gangs who patrol the hotel frontage to the beach 

these gangs are totally illegal but the hotel allows them to harass and harangue the guests 

these gangs do not accept a polite refusal

they are well organised and surround each guest and are extremely agressive 

they do not give up and basically they hound and bully each poor guest until in desperation a guest agrees to purchase goods from them 

the goods they sell are unlicensed excursions, unlicensed trips , unlicensed massage parlours and meals in local hostelries which would be closed down by health and safety without even entering inside the premises 

i think that this is an appalling situation as it is blatantly obvious that sri lanka is a poor country  and relies heavily on the income from tourists 

i can assure readers of this column that not one rupee from the pockets of the beach gangs will be used to benefit the local community or sri lanka as a whole 

i would also remind readers that in the event of an accident ( which is very common on the crazy sri lanka roads ) that insurance companies will not pay one penny if a client was travelling on an illegal or unlicensed tour or trip or taxi ride . 

an unforeseen accident in sri lanka can result in enormous medical and hospital and repatriation bills 

i did complain to the heritance staff about the continued agressive behaviour of the beach gangs ( who also shout to the guests reclining in the hotel grounds ) 

the staff advised that they all lived locally and thus did not wish to upset the beach gangs for fear of repercussions on themselves and on their families 

in conclusion , i find this an appalling situation whereby the hotel management is turning a blind eye to the discomfort and unhappiness of their guests 

i must also admit quite openly that unless there is some form of financial reward being given weekly to the hotel management , i can see no earthly reason why the hotel management encourages the beach gangs to extort money from their guests 

apart from the above problem , i can confirm that this is an excellent hotel 

i have stayed in most of the decent hotels in sri lanka but this is definitely the best in my opinion

the rooms ( bedrooms and suites ) are a good size and immaculately furnished; towels , soaps , water etc are changed twice daily and the housekeeping service is of a very high standard 

the food is superb and every mealtime offered a new selection of mouth watering delights ; huge prawns and devilled crabs were in such abundance that we eventually declined them as we simply could not eat any more !

there are 2 very large landscaped pools here and both of them were crystal clear and beautifully warm at all times 

there are also many sports and fitness facilities at this hotel and we really enjoyed our daily game of badminton 

this hotel  sits alone  on a massive empty silky sandy beach backed by tall swaying palm trees  ; the beach stretches for miles from one headland to the next

swimming in the sea is definitely not possible at this time of the year as the sea is very rough with tremendous undercurrents 

however , the pools at the heritance are so large you can easily  imagine you are swimming in the sea

i should also add that the ayurveda spa is a must and is in the most romantic position imaginable ; their  treatments are excellent and their methods of curing aches and pains are really incredible   

in conclusion , this is an excellent hotel but it will quickly lose its popularity if the owners do not step in and banish the beach gangs

Review_text_2:
Now, we have been coming back to this Hotel since it was called Triton because it stood out among typical beach hotels in Sri Lanka and coming here once in a while was treat for our children. It is a quite different now, and not particularly in a good manner.

Our last stay at the hotel was on a weekday and was out of season. The property was about half full and a renovation was going on in the main side. 

At the dining hall, for some odd reason, there were no cloth table napkins and instead, a cheap replacement of paper serviettes. The food served were all so bland and nothing impressive, that's including desserts. I even overheard a couple saying that it was the same for the past few days! 

Breakfast had in store for us, an averagely spicy Sri Lankan food corner which was quite good.

Pools and activity around the pool was enjoyable and the best part of this stay. An interesting underwater Zumba class also took place! 

The rooms were the same as before, thank goodness, but one thing made me stop my praise. The bidet shower was out of order. 

There was a surprise at the check out. I made reservation by calling this hotel and made sure that child meal charge was included with the price. (Child stays free in  a double room sharing bed but for the meal, they charge about 30USD). In any case, we were asked to pay extra for the child meal because the price mentioned was the Double room rate. It was a mistake done by booking operator and the Hotel said that if we refuse to pay, the balance will have to be deducted from operator's wage. Since we did not want that to happen, we just paid and left. 

 Overall, I think the hotel could have done a little more to repeating guests. I think that the hotel might have gotten complacent, due to the five star rankings people have given them, but as of now we lost loyalty to this hotel and unlikely to recommend others to stay.
Review_text_3: Third floor rooms facing to sea have great balcony view, it is a little more expensive compared to 1st and 2nd floor rooms.

Review_text_2:
As a traveler the two thingsI look for in a hotel are location and class. The Heritance Ahungalla is the perfect hotel which gives you both. it is in the heart of Ahungalla, a small beach village about 20 minutes away from Bentota. it is a relatively quiet town with not too much to do or see except bask in the Sri Lankan sun.
The first thing which caught our fancy was the infinity pool which led right into the beachfront. The lobby was clean and the staff extremely helpful. The beach was very clean and the water a pleasant greenish blue which made you want to just change into your swimsuit and sunbathe all day. The welcome drinks were a mixture of guava and mango juice which were extremely refereshing after our long drive from Nuwaraeliya. 
We were escorted to sea facing rooms which boasted of a beautiful view of the beach. Our balconies were spacious and had chairs where one could enjoy a hot cuppa tea and watch the sunset. 
After settling in, we went to the part of the beach which was owned by the hotel and sat for three hours in the tidal pool just lazing around and watching the world go by which is what a holiday is all about. For lunch, we went to a shack situated just five minutes away from the main beach sampling some of the best local fresh seafood in Sri Lanka. 
The coffee shop in the hotel was also a beach view and had the standard five star breakfast items which is always a good start to the day. the staff were courteous and attentive pouring coffee, water and juice within seconds of request. The gym was a small  but nonetheless a good workout. 
A calm place to spend the last two days of your holiday is what Ahungalla was all about. Initially we contemplated staying in Bentota given the reviews on the Vivanta but I am glad we made the decision to go to Ahungalla instead.
Review_text_3: Ask for a sea view room.

Review_text: Sadly disappointing and over rated 5 star
Review_text_2:
This hotel was a bit of a disappointment, not the five star rating we were expecting.  In our opinion this hotel needs to be downgraded to four star.  Whilst there was some painting/maintenance work taking place while we were there, the hotel didn’t have that ‘luxurious’ five star feeling about it.   Certainly comparing it to a five star rated hotel we stayed in whilst holidaying in Zanzibar 18 month's ago, it was definitely of a different class/standard.
  
The fruit bowl, dressing gowns and slippers were not in our room when we arrived and there was no mention, when we checked in, of them arriving later.  The cream rug was filthy (we rolled it up and put it under the bed) and that improved the look of the room immediately!  

On the plus side, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and very responsive to our needs.

On several occasions we only had one bath towel left instead of two which meant having to call  house-keeping.  Although immediately we called the second towel would rapidly appear, this isn't the level of service we would expect from a five star resort.

The restaurant areas were nice and the food was good.  We tended to eat in the coffee shop which also served as a restaurant which did some nice meals, we did eat occasionally in the buffet restaurant.  

The pool area is nice.  The hotel is located on the beach, but most of the time the red flags are flying due to the under currents there.  On most days despite the red flag flying people still went into the sea, if you went with caution you were fine, but there were occasions people got into difficulties and the life guard at the hotel had to come to their rescue.

We enjoyed watching a wedding take place whilst there.  

We also had the experience of seeing one of the resident monitor lizards digging up and eating another monitor lizard’s eggs (13 in all!!!).  

We were lucky enough to see a turtle come ashore and lay her eggs on the beach before going back out to sea – wow what a wonderful experience.

We also visited a turtle hatchery up the road, take a tuk tuk (it’s cheaper than a taxi) and if you want to experience putting baby turtles into the sea you need to go at dusk around 6.00 pm (in Feb).  

Before booking this hotel we were told we could go out of the hotel and that there were lots of eating places in the area, this is not the case.  We were told not to go out of the resort at night, so that was also disappointing.  Sadly there is no ‘all  inclusive’ option here.  

In summary, this is a nice hotel, situated on a lovely beach, not five star luxury, but a nice four star.  We were here celebrating my 50th birthday and wanted a bit of luxury after touring for 8 nights and in retrospect wish we had stayed at either The Jetwing Lighthouse or The Fortress in Galle.

Review_text_2:
A country full of lovely friendly people with happy smiling faces. Their delightfully naive view of life being that if they give something a 5* rating then it must be so. The problem is that prices have gone up to international 5* levels giving rise to the expectation that it will compare to other high graded hotels around the world. This maybe one of a group of Sri Lankan higher quality hotels but no way is it as 5* by INTERNATIONAL STANDARDS. At best it is a low 4*/high 3*.

The entrance is spectacular and beautiful but the rest of the property is simply awful. Poor maintenance, unsafe tiles around the pools, under equipped rooms with intermittent electrical supplies and poor drainage.

Hawkers on the beach screaming for your attention every time you go anywhere near them. Nobody walking around with any frequency to see if would like a drink whilst sunbathing etc.

It could be so good if only they understood what makes a 5* hotel. Still delightful and enjoyable providing you don't go expecting the best, but it is poor value for money.

Review_text_2:
At one stage furing the tour planning, we  planned to stay two nights at Heritance, Ahangulla. We thank our forefathers that we decided otherwise. It would have been an expensive disaster had we stayed there any longer than the 12 hours that we spent there. I can not fathom who ever gave this hotel a five star rating. It must be with the help of some under hand dealings. The mistake I did was that the tour was booked through the agency who owned this hotel. There is an obvious conflict of interest here. This is at best a three star hotel.....nothing more.

Minuses: unclean floors, dirty pool, dirtier pool towels, fountain with black water in the front of the hotel and by the side of the main dining area, walls, roof all badly needing a stroke of paint, cracked walls, beaches infested with intrusive locals, stray dogs....

Plus: couldn't think of any!
Review_text_3: Try another hotel

Review_text: Disappointing Stay and low service levels
Review_text_2: This hotel was a great disappointment for us. This was our sixth night in Srilanka and when we made the bookings we were so excited about this hotel and the photos we have seen. However, our stay there was a disaster! We waited for more than 30 mins to Check in. When we checked it, the room was in a mess and the telephone lines were not working. We complained to the reception and all they said that this was because of the rain and it will come back within 10 mins but it didn't. We tried again but it was useless. The receptionist and the staff were rude and their service was far below the standards. to make things worse, there was a school trip that night and the kids occupied the swimming pool, the restaurant and everywhere in the hotel. The restaurant was expensive and the food was average but the service was a little bit better than anywhere else in the hotel. The room was small but the balcony was nice. In general I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. If you still want to go there, then please ensure that you are in the middle of the week and not on Saturday/Sunday or Friday to avoid the busy times at the hotel where the service drops down to the lowest level.
Review_text_3: Always choose the rooms at the corners of every floor to make use of the big balcony that is not there in the aisle rooms.

Review_text_2: On first appearances this hotel wow's you. This is not 5 star by any stretch of imagination. Over priced and quite tacky. Maybe the best in Ahungalla, not in Sri Lanka. There sister concern "The Tea Factory Hotel" beats them by a canter on all counts. The long corridors leading to the rooms were run down. The room was large with a sit out. The housekeeping was slack. The food was quite mediocre. The buffet is a total rip off. It is very highly priced and the food was very average. The beach boys on the beach are a menace and quite intimidating. It put you off from wanting to step out on the beach. Would I return? No.

Review_text_2:
Reception staff were quite rude and took 2 hours to check us in. We were part of a large party and bookings were made some 6 months in advance of our arrival. One family of 4 were made wait in reception for over 3 hours before their room was available. Having said that the service staff, room attendants, waiters and bar staff were extremely accommodating and nothing was too much trouble.
Rooms were not up to 5 star cleanliness and linen was worse than 1 star standard. Mini Bar was only refilled on request.
The only thing 5 star about the hotel is the price and possibly the location, but be prepared to be pestered by hawkers as soon as you set foot on the beach.
Review_text_3: Get the key sent to you when you get the booking confirmation.

Review_text_2:
If you are into stuffing your face on buffets and booze, probably a great hotel for you.  If you are looking for quality food and culture, or even 5 star service probably not for you.

Outwardly the hotel looks great, they rely on the great infinity pool for the wow factor but scratch the surface and there is not much else a pontins holiday park wouldn't provide.  Probably why there are limited photo's on the website apart from the pool.

We paid extra for a luxury room, which was very nice but cost enough to justify.  The room along with the friendly staff were the best parts of the holiday.

Breakfast was average, dark, dingy, smokey (cooking smoke) buffet room.  Nice cooked options, and hoppers.  Waffles were very nice, but coffee served was just terrible.

Green pool was OK, but cloudy water.  Good green pool service

Nice beach, but not worth visiting due to the constant hassle.  People have to earn a living but it gets a bit draining to be friendly, only to be hassled to buy something every time you want to walk along the beach.

Grotty and hot gym, with old equipment.

Miles away from anywhere, so unless you want a 1/2hr tuk tuk ride to Bentota (which is fine and plenty of offers outside the gate) you are stuck with hotel options.  The best food we found was in the mustard cafe, lovely curries.  Everything else was overpriced euro buffet.

Final nail in the coffin was check-out, no service at the nice reception desk, you go round to the back office, smelly little room where you que up to pay your $$$$ bill while the cashier argues and discusses other bills with clients and colleagues.  Then the taxi you ordered with the concierge isn't booked after all, they just look at each other and call over the 20 year old smelly wagon.  We refused to get in, and they got an equally smelly but slightly newer car for the 9000 rupee ride to Colombo.  Smelly is a reoccurring issue here.

Overall, 5 star luxury room (for the right $$$) in a 3 star resort......With a really good looking pool.
Review_text_3: Pay more, we would stay away from the main pool as it is noisy.

Review_text_2:
We checked in on New Year's eve to see 2012 in. We'd booked a triple room and paid a 50% advance at the head office at Aitken Sence Colombo, which was mandatory due to the New Year's eve rush.
But the room was not ready at check- in and we had to wait quite awhile. We were given large half glasses (yeah half!) of a local fresh juice but realised later that other check in guests were given moist towels as well. Finally, we were taken into a 2 roomed suite that had been furnished for only two persons. We had to look for a room boy to tip him to bring in a third bed, third set of towels etc.etc. Our so-called luxury room was far from that - the 'fridge didn't work, the TV was badly tuned, the safety deposit locker malfunctioned, one bedside light didn't work.. Due to the malfunctioning fridge we were not even able to break a bottle of bubbly.. (now who likes warm champagne) - (BTW check the spelling of 'champagne' in the GM's letter of welcome - here my sex was wrong - I was titled as 'Mr'

We had tipped the check-in steward - a name like Achila - do avoid this scoundrel at all costs! - generously to get us a table for the gala dinner, but he was nowhere to be seen. We looked into the area four times, to ensure that we had a table, but nothing had been set up for us. Finally, we were told to come down for dinner and that we would then get our table. No table when we arrived for dinner. We were then told to sit at another table. Five minutes later the same steward - named Mudalige - said he was sorry but the table had been booked by somebody else!!- I refused to get up! Our table had no lamp of decor etc like the other tables and after telling just about every waiter passing by, we got some of these things over 1 1/2 hours later!! 

The next day at breakfast, after standing in line for awhile, I requested a warm item from a  serving chef, I was told by him that he had to serve over 50 guests at that time (so what?!). 

Finally, the time to depart arrived, and we breathed a sign of relief. We were all women but even the final receipt was titled 'Me & Mrs". When I got to my car in the hotel car park I found parts of it strewn about - it had been damaged by a tour operator who had claimed that I had been blocking him! Now this was a clearly designated hotel parking space which should have been so designed not to inconvenienced other vehicles. The hotel couldn't even inform the person to remove my vehicle (they didn't even know the name or company of the vandal) because it keeps no records of guest vehicles - rather a security threat in a country just recovering from civil strife, methinks.... 

Having said this, the general manager and front office manager were extremely nice and tried to compensate for our traumatic experience by even offering us an extra night on the house, but we had to get back to our families on new years day - so we were given a discount on the room rate, cakes and chocolates to forget our troubles..

The room rate for this unforgettable experience was well over $ 400 and unforgettable experience it certainly was! It will be a loooong time before we recover from the trauma of our stay at Heritance Ahungalla. This is a hotel that needs to get its act together in terms of processes, quality checks and staff training. This is what we pay for when we buy a hotel experience. It is also what we pay for when the hotel is incompetent.
Review_text_3: Do a quality check on the room you are allocated - while still at reception.... count on your fingers - bed - ok, bed linen - ok - fridge - ok? toilet - does it flush? does the shower/ hot water/ work...... really, is all this effort worth it?? there are much better hotels right along the coast

A hotel with really delicious food, couldn't resist. Very nice and helpful staff. Pool attendance take care of every lonely bed not to be reserves with a towel too long. Very nice furnished rooms with a lot wood and wooden floor and nice furniture. A lot of place for sunbeds. A really great architecture of the hotel designed by the famous architecture. Wonderful atmosphere for couples in the reastaurant during evening. 
Do not bother when locals thry to sell you cloths on the beach, they are freindly though noisy, they are not allowed in the hotel garden, so will try to seduce you from a distance. But this is their way of eraning money for living...

Review_text_2:
Our first stay here in 2009 was on the very strong recommendation of Sri Lankan friends and we vowed to return sooner  rather than later. Neither my wife or I recognised some of the negative comments on this site prior to booking our latest trip in December 2011 but we had some concerns.

Those concerns were totally unfounded.

From the moment we were met with  refreshing cinnamon tea until the redoubtable Dudley packed our cases in the car at the end of our stay, it was total relaxation. 

The attitude of the staff is a delight and may explain some of the complaints - they have a wonderful ability of being remarkably attentive whilst appearing to be laid back which may be misinterpreted as appearing not to care.Nothing could be further from the truth. Some of the younger staff members are still extremely keen and their enthusiasm, whilst appreciated, intrudes slightly into the relaxed ambiance. They could do well to learn from Jacob. If you have the good fortune to have your table served by this gentleman you will understand the point I'm attempting to make. He is like a swan gliding serenely on the surface whilst away from view he is paddling like hell to ensure that you enjoy every minute in his care.

Our room was excellent - the only criticism we could make was the that the Venetian blind in the bathroom was past its best.... this is really struggling to be negative. 

I can't believe that someone on here had complained about the food - how absurd! Not only was the buffet absolutely first class but the puddings were out of this world. A real trip down memory lane for persons of a certain age! Unsurprisingly, the dessert table won first prize in the hotel industry awards. Please don't take my word for this - our visit coincided with that of an annual trip of French gamblers(???!) to the hotel. They attacked each meal with that Gallic gusto which is unique, (complete with napkins tied around their necks!) - if it hadn't been up to standard I'm sure that it would have been the kitchen staff at risk rather than the food! When these lovely characters found that my wife was multi-lingual they hijacked her on a regular basis to tell the hotel chefs of their appreciation.

Another negative comment I had read was regarding the beach folk. Yes, at times they can be boorish but they are trying to make a living. If you inform them that you are definitely not interested in purchasing anything today they will leave you alone. You are, however, missing the opportunity to chat to some fascinating people with experiences completely different to your own who would really appreciate the opportunity of honing their language skills on you - this is especially true of the clothing ladies. If all else fails the magic word to use is 'yanda!' whose interpretation is, I believe as rude as it is effective!

We would like to thank the management team of  Rifan (General Manager), Tilleth (Food and Beverage Manager) and above all the professional and gregarious Sampath (Assistant Manager) for a superb stay. You have staff and a hotel to be very proud of.
Review_text_3: Rather than asking for a balcony, we asked for a ground floor room which opened out directly onto the residents only 'Green Pool.'

Review_text: Pleased to see nothing has changed!
Review_text_2: I stayed here in Feb 2011, near to the end of what had been a wonderful trip; but its seems nowt has changed, Staff were not too friendly as we'd experienced in rest of country, the whole hotel had an worn tired feel, the restaurant dark and hot, moved to outside tables for breakfast to sit with dirty table clothes even worse service but plenty of flies for company, asked at least 6 times to turn fans on but never did happen, oh and someone died while there - not sure if that was waiting?

Review_text_2:
The Heritance Ahungalla is NOT a five or a four star. Was traveling with my older parents and children. The AC and lights in my parents room was not working, it took 3 hours, 3 phone calls and a conversion with a guy at the reception for someone to come and fix this. 2 strange men in the room fixing the AC and lights for 45 minutes. 
Moerover, the staff by the poolside is terribly slow. Hotel common areas are dirty. Saw used diapers and used band aids by the pool! Took them forever to ask for food and drinks. They did not even have mint to make certain cocktails! Ran out apparently.
I would rate this as a 3 star, and nothing more. Will not return. Diasppointed. Waste of money.

Review_text_2: We stayed at the Heritance Kandalama and were expecting the same high standard we had there. Unfortuantely we were very dissapointed by the Ahungalla. How this hotel managed to win an award I will never know! The hotel is dirty and tired and the service at breakfast is worth a special mention for all the wrong reasons. Dirty tables left uncleared for hours, the most disgusting tea and coffee I have ever tasted in my entire life and service without a smile. The only thing positive I have to say about the hotel is its location and the morning walk you can take along the stretch of beach on your door step. However, a word of warning, there are beach sellers who try to befriend (hassle) you about every 20 mins so go for your walk early before they get up!! All I can say is thank goodness we didnt spend our entire stay here!
Review_text_3: Deluxe double is just an ordinary sized double

Review_text_2: I have just had the experience of checking in my friend and his wife to the Heritance, it looked ok on the way in but the outlook is very sterile, having read most of the reviews about their coffee shop we eventually made it there after a labourious check in, I suggest to the management that they should send their coffee shop staff into the Capital city colombo to the almost genuine 5 star hotels to find out what a Capucino and a Cafe Latte is and how it is made and presented, we had 2 cups of ordinary coffee with a bit of milk froth on top and were charged the best part of 5 USD for this pathetic version of a Capucino and Latte, I don't mind paying 5 star prices but please please provide us with a 5 star cup of coffee, and how in heavens name do hotels classify themselves as 5 star, a ordinary 3 star hotel in Thailand will knock spots of any so called 5 star hotel in Sri Lanka, very very disappointed.

Review_text_2:
we were  stayed at the Heritance Ahungalla for reason our family louting. The location was perfect & Nice hotel. 

Positives:
- The bed was great, much more comfortable than my lousy bed back home!
- Restaurant food was good but service was not great
- Clean Towels

Negatives:
- Reception people did not do so great a job. When I arrived, there was many people around but no proper welcome.Dark GRE was not helpful at all.She was negative when we ask for bigger room.
- Service in restaurant was not very good.
- Bed room Carpet need to change.

Overall, experince was not soo great.!!!

Review_text: Front office staff are very rude
Review_text_2:
The reception people are very depressing. They are not courteous, rude and I was shocked that this hotel belongs to a group of hotels and a large company. The Reception people really gave my family a soar welcome and ruined our mood. They are very suspicious and look at you like we are thieves. Maybe the Management have to start customer service classes and put the right people there.At least people who can smile.
Also responsiveness of services is  also slow overall.

Review_text_2: Stayed in the hotel during my vacation to Sri Lanka on July. I stayed Cinnamon grand, Kandalama before Heritance Ahungalla. I don't know what make this hotel 5 star. I ordered 3 triple rooms but when I got to room they are double rooms. When asked they said they put another bed to make it triple. checked in at 4:30PM but didn't get third bed until 12:30AM. 12:30 AM !!!!. Every time I called they said they have asked housekeeping for the extra bed. Finally got third beds from drivers quarters. Very nasty bed with 2 inch mattress. Food is average not best. I've seen better verity in average buffets. Try a different hotel before considering this.

Review_text: Not great.  Not sure what alternative there may be.  Just a giant ugly hotel.
Review_text_2: A huge average tourist hotel.  I would not call this place luxurious.  Not sure if there are alternatives.  If you can, skip this place.  The beaches are not nice.  Everything outside the hotel is depressing.  They've had many years to fix, so there is no excuse for things looking so devastated and filthy after the Tsunami.  Sorry, it's a real shame.  The entire coast south and west looks terribly sad.  I cannot in good conscience tell any of my friends to go there.  There are so many poor people.  Please give them employment and pay them to clean up the ENTIRE coast!
