Review_text_2: Spent 7 nights at the hotel at the beginning of February. Enjoyed: the food, the pools (particularly the one with the leaning tree), the sound of the ocean waves crushing on the shore, the spa, the beautiful sunsets from the room balcony and generally the great feeling of being in Sri Lanka in a beautiful hotel. Did not enjoy: the monitor lizards walking around, (did not know they would be there and just got terrified when I saw the first one strolling around the beach!!!), the overwhelming strenght of the ocean waves which prevents you from swimming, the beach ladies constantly calling you in order to sell you something.

Review_text: Paradise - Did not want to leave.
Review_text_2: We were so lucky to have a wonderful room in an excellent position.  The views were fabulous.  The sea was quite rough, but my husband managed to swim for a little while before the waves knocked him down.  Beach fabulous and the swimming pool was the best we have ever experienced.  Staff were very attentive and helpful.  Nihal in the restaurant looked after us really well.  He produced a filet steak for my husband who said it was the best he had ever had.  My only adverse comment on this hotel is that the staff all expected a tip even for the smallest of job.

Review_text_2: I write this review purely to warn people to respect the surf.  I have recently returned from this hotel where immediately in front of the hotel I  body surfed a moderate size wave of hidden force which threw me head first into the ocean bottom.  I escaped breaking my neck, but did not escape a head injury which left me with two black eyes. I am an experienced body surfer and I write this to warn people.  There IS a danger flag in front of this hotel I just apparently chose to ignore it. Please don't be as stupid as I was.

Review_text: An absolute soul stirring experience...with perfect melange of mother nature in its best form
Review_text_2: After a long  and sick drive of about 9 hrs at a stretch right frm the Heritance Tea Factory Nuwaraeliya...totally devastated with the fluctuations in the temperatures ...n in the most crankiest  of states i checked in at around 8 pm with my husband and my 9 yr old child..assumin its gonna be sad..but to our surprise we were welcomed by the stafff with that everlasting smile..not to forget the very patent quality on every face of the stafff...must thank the management for training them well..smart guys....followed with a young charming  stafff leadin us to the main lobbyy..who offered us the welcom drinks..which she very meticulously carried each time ina lovely wooden old age herited trolly  and offerd it to the guests with  great pleasure..hope it was real...but if nt very well mastered.. Review_text: Not a 5 star in any category
Review_text_2: The hotel was a very big disapointment. we arrived late in evening, the guy at the reseption looked as he didnt feel like showing us arround, tired, bored (?). On the way to the room, he said that we had been upgrated from the room that we had reserved, we got to the room and the first thing I look at is the bathroom, there was a funny smell, when i told the guy he said that is nothing, we just spraid cinamon before you arrived. the towels were old and far from being smooth and nice. At 7 oclock we were woken up by restaurations done at the hotel; we were not told this was going on. All this is not a five star hotel!!! finally we were moved to a suite but still the higine was not perfet and towells not soft.

Review_text_2: Ignored by the bell boys at arrival and left for half an hour in a dingy bar to await our room.  Despite a choice of only 3 welcome drinks, the barman managed to get one of the two wrong !! Eventually given a room which was right on the beach, but seemed to be the only room in the hotel without net curtains, so no privacy at all.  We then noticed that the door lock was hanging off so called maintenance.  While waiting for them, we discovered a jammed cupboard (so no access to safe), a poky, smelly bathroom and a TV with no reception.  Eventually went back to reception (after unconvincing lock fix) and demanded a new room which we were given after another hour's wait.  It was better, although lighting was poor.  Cleaning was haphazard, towels were often taken but not replaced and there were no insect sprays/mats. Each morning one of the pool boys comes and blasts the pool area with rap music to try to encourage aerobics participants - they should listen to the words one day, which are about 50% expletives and not everyone's taste !!  Food was OK but nothing like the Kandalama, another Heritance hotel.  Spa was very expensive although treatments were good - watch out for $ prices which mysteriously end up being a lot more in rupees (works out about 140 to the $, not 115).  Lots of hassle from beach sellers as well.  Overall we were very disappointed as we had such a wonderful time at the Heritance Kandalama in Dambulla and expected the same from this sister hotel.  For half the price you can stay at the Kani Lanka in Kalutara which has better food and entertainment.

Review_text: Not a 5 Star hotel - no entertainment - poor restaurant choices.
Review_text_2:
Totally disappointed with this hotel.  The entrance foyer was cold and clinical which was about the standard for the whole hotel.  There was no entertainment until we complained and then there was some water aerobics and that was about it.  There was a games room that was filthy and had about 2 board games in it, the snooker table you had to pay for, the pool table you had to pay for.  There were 3 restaurants but you only really had a choice of 2 as the Upper Dining Room was ridiculously expensive, we did not actually see anyone eat there in our 2 week stayy!  There was a cafe with a very limited menu or the main restaurant that was a buffet.  The food in these 2 restaurants was okay but the service was terrible.  Breakfast was served in the buffet restaurant and the tables were always mucky, you had to constantly ask for tea or coffee and sometimes wait for up to 20 minutes for it to arrive.
On a Saturday the hotel opens the main infinity pool area up to local customers, this meant that we had to use the other pool which upset the children.  The main pool was rammed with people playing games and being extremely loud making it much to dangerous for children to swim and also a very uncomfortable environment.  Whilst at the other pool we ordered lunch and were told we would have a long wait as they were so busy as it was a Saturday!!  Whilst we were at the hotel the Sri Lankan and Indian national crickets teams were there, the hotels focus was totally on them and important members of staff were moved to run the catering at the matches - this was very much noticed by guests at the hotel as the service in the restaurants became ridiculously slow and many mistakes were made.
The people of Sri Lanka our lovely and very kind and helpful and we felt totally safe when we wandered along the beach way from the hotel.
We met a fantastic driver who was wonderful in showing us around and really looked after our children, he is a recommended driver at the hotel and his name is Erish.  We had some absolutely wonderful experiences when he took us out as he really worked to make sure we saw everything and enjoyed ourselves, he is also a good driver and very safe which is quite a rarity in Sri Lanka!!!

Review_text_2:
We visited Heritance Ahungalla after long flight from UK. It took us 3Hrs to reach the hotel  from the air port. Once we arrived in the hotel we had to wait another 2Hrs to get our rooms. 9in the mean time we not not informed that rooms were ready until I requested them the delay.

Rooms were dirty in the old block and damp.

Standard Sri Lankan food serverd in the main restaurant. But  pricing is so high. (USD$50.00 for two people for rice & curry)

Pool - was great - clean & large pool of two different pools were great.

Checking out was a experience where we had to go to a back office to make the payment.  The cashier in the back office has no customer service experience at all.  Not even  a THANK YOU were said when the final bill was settle down.

Around the hotel area their is no any other shops, restuarnt or attractions.

I hope the hotel improve standards. 

Considering the service you get in Asia South Hotels - Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, these hotels give a better value for your $$$ and more great options.

Review_text: Ok but could be so much better
Review_text_2:
Well having had a long flight and a long drive I may have been slightly over tired but my first impressions of the hotel and the room was disappointment. It does come down to taste but I found the hotel is characterless. Our room was good but without the two extra beds for the children which was irritating as my husband had emailed the hotel directly confirming them but they were set up quickly and our request for table lamps in the lounge rather than overhead lighting met as quickly. 

The children loved the pools and I absolutely hated breakfast!
It was enough to bring tears to your eyes the oppressive dining room the scrum around the breakfast bar seemingly at all times, the awful service.
I had so many variations on getting a cup of earl grey they were green tea, warm milk, teabags and nothing else including water or a cup,  they ran out of tea bags I supplied my own and then tea arriving 30 minutes later when you're just about to leave. In the land of bountiful fruit why are 3 out of 5 breakfast juices made from concentrate or nearer to cordial? Can they not default to 4 place servings, then if 2 come to breakfast  they are happy and if 4 come down they are instantly satisified a win win rather than waiting 10 minutes for cutlery for 2 of the party. Can they not allocate a server to families staying longer than 3 nights thus establishing a rapport.

Saying that the service elsewhere was fine. The food ranged from adequate to good.
Amal's in Bentota was excellent for sea food and Refresh in Hikkaduwa(45 mins) had an enormous choice and was very good.

The location was ok , Galle was an hour drive Bentota about 30 minutes. We did take some trips to Udawlawe 4 hours each way and Sinharaja 3 hours each way.

As mentioned in previous reviews the beach is effectively out of bounds if you do not wish to be pursued by the local tour guides and hawkers.

It could be a great hotel with adequate staff training to instill a sense of ownership and pride, a rethink of the decor, a complete overhaul of the main dining room practices, some investment in soft furnishings. 

Despite its short comings we thought the Heritance was good value for money.

Review_text_2:
Heritance Ahungalla is not by any standards a 4,5 star hotel. We have chosen it for our honeymoon trip as pictures seen on the website looked amazing and we also read many good reviews. However, our stay there turn out to be a great dissapointment and we won't be going back. 
To list just few problems you may encounter there : it is impossible to go for a walk on the beach as you are constantly pestered by locals who do not take no for an answer; cockroaches can be found not only on hotel corridors but also inside the rooms; the cutlery served at tables has leftovers of food stuck to it; the bed linen in the rooms as well as the curtains are stained and often with holes; the hotel provides hardly any toiletries and if so, they are stuck on the bottom of a ceramic bottles in a very small quantitiy; there are constant problems with electricity and it can go off for over 30mins at time.  
As for the service it is probably one of the most tiresom and annoying problems of all, as there is no communication between the team members serving meals in the restaurant, you need to ask several times for a pot of coffee or a bottle of water, provided that you will be understood by the waiter on the first occassion. If so, the requested drink may not be delivered at all, while few other team memers will approach with exactly the same question about your choice of drink but it will take ages for someone to actually deliver it to the table. The tips are expected while the service quality or rather its lack, does not jusitfy it at all. The most imposing are often the housekeeping supervisors (not the regular housekeepers- they work very hard and hardly ever strike a conversation with a guest), who can follow you down the corridor repeating few times that they are entirely responsible for cleaning your room....all obviously to be tipped.  In case of any problems with the room calling reception is normally a waste of time, as you have to call back several times before someone turns up to deal with the problem.  The hotel is full of damp and looks as if its times of glory have long gone. 
We have been travelling extensively over last couple of years throughout Africa and Asia and we are very much aware of difficulties some developing countries face, however we cannot find an explanation for advertising a very poor quality hotel as a 4,5 star resort.

Review_text: Could be good, but service is so patchy.
Review_text_2:
Have just returned from 2 weeks at the Heritance and overall it was a disappointing experience, primarily because the service was so mixed, ranging from good, to indifferent, to frankly poor.
My wife and I travelled with our 13 year old son, and we stayed in 2 adjacent luxury rooms, which were slightly tired, but extremely spacious, and thoroughly cleaned every day. A word of warning to anyone travelling with younger children, we had made 3 advance requests via our Tour Operator "Kuoni", for inter connecting rooms. We received no reply, and were only advised on arrival that the hotel has no interconnecting rooms.
The 2 hotel pools are large and well maintained, one offering some limited organised activities and the other  residents'  pool offering a quieter option.
The hotel and grounds are  spacious, and even though  the hotel was fully occupied for part of our stay, it never felt over crowded.
We had opted for bed and breakfast, so didn't experience the buffet, all inclusive option. However a few of our fellow guests did and commented that the food was good quality, but repetitive if staying for 2 weeks. We mainly ate in the Coffee Shop restaurant where the food was good, and given a supposed 5 star hotel, we thought the prices were reasonable.
Dining out options in the village of Ahungalla are non existent. If you walk out of the hotel complex, you are quickly surrounded by several locals, offering TukTuk rides, boat safaris, and numerous trips. They are persistent but never threatening, and several firm " no thank you"  will usually see them retreat. The village does have a pharmacy and a bank. If you are cashing travellers cheques, it is worth the 5 minute stroll to the bank as it offers a significantly better exchange  rate than the hotel.
For dining out you need to get a taxi or a TukTuk to Bentota or else to HIkkaduwa.
Bentota has several hotels and is 20 minutes in a taxi or about 25/30 minutes in a TukTuk.
The drivers will wait for you and negotiate a return trip price. A hotel taxi was about £20 for a return trip, with the tuktuks costing about half of that.
The best restaurant we found was the Golden Grill, good for curries and seafood. Dinner for    3 people with beer and soft drinks was typically £30 to £40 in total.

Main frustration came with the inconsistent service in the hotel. 
At breakfast, there was a great range of food, and all well presented, and plenty of staff on hand. Unfortunately it wasn't unusual for 3 different waiters to approach you to ask whether we wanted tea or coffee, but then none of them would get round to serving it.
The pool attendants are helpful but want tipping continually and the room cleaners changed several times and all made subtle overtures for tips.
Reception staff were always smiling, but poorly trained and inefficient with  simple requests having to be made several times before anything got done.
After the first week we found a great guy working reception and just made sure we dealt with him.
Some lovely staff serving drinks around the pool, always friendly and helpful.
Wandering onto the beach is spoilt because the locals will lie in wait and then follow you round trying to sell you gouges or trips. They will ask your name and if you give it, they will stand at the edge of the hotel property calling to you while you try  and relax on your sun 
bed. Again they aren't threatening in any way, just persistent and something of a pain. Just keep  saying "no thank you" and they will eventually give up !
Overall, the Heritance is nice but dated hotel, but represents pretty reasonable value for what it is. The location is isolated but the grounds and pools are good, and the rooms are fine. It has the potential to offer a relaxed, get away from it all style resort, IF the management could get their act together and get the service to a consistently efficient level.

Review_text_2:
This is definately not a 5 star hotel, it's decor is very shabby, bed linen is off colour, stained and has seen better days.
There isn't an on complex shop so you have to buy everything in the bar and trying to get out of the hotel main gate to the road is a nightmare as the locals swarm around the en trance ready to pounce on you, they find it very difficult to take "no" for an answer.
The same goes for the beach, you cannot get on it in without being harassed as they line the edge of the hotel grounds.
Would not recommend booking holidays thru the rep as these are double the price of using the hotel taxi's to take you to the same places.
If you are not giving the locals, be it where ever you are, tips for this that and everything then they are very abrupt and can't get rid of you quick enough, especially the rep!
They want tips for putting a cushion and towel on your sunlounger and then when it rains they want another one for putting it back again.

Review_text_2: Maybe our expectations were different, but we didn’t get what we were hoping for with our three-day stgay at the Heritance Ahungalla.  We thought that an all-inclusive resort would be a relaxing base of operations but found that we were pretty much sequestered on the property.  We wanted to get out and about during the day or night and the operation and setting did not lend themselves to that – the Heritance wants to capture all of your money during your visit.  Rooms were clean and nicely appointed but small.  High premiums for everything, from bottled water to laundry to room service to internet.  Food options were limited and consistently underwhelming.  Front desk and concierge staff were not particularly helpful when we did ask for suggestions for activities or dining off of the property.  Should we find ourselves back on the coast in Sri Lanka we will look for a smaller hotel closer to one of the towns or villages, not an all-inclusive resort.

Review_text: Absolutely Devine - Excellent Food, Excellent Staff, Excellent Location
Review_text_2:
Having returned on 11th June after 12 nights at this hotel on vacation with my wife, I feel the need to express my gratitude for such an amazing holiday. 
My wife and I were married in Sri Lanka last year and we fell in love with Sri Lanka - we felt compelled to return to celebrate our 1st anniversary (but this time at a different hotel).
As soon as we arrived - the first impressions were..........wow.  The brochures do not do this stunning hotel justice.   Having had a long tiring journey, we were given a very warm welcome.  We stayed in a Suite which was superb in every way.  The rooms are serviced daily by friendly housekeeping staff to a very very high standard.
I am a Executive Chef who is in charge of a group of Companies providing Fine Dining Catering with bespoke menu's to wealthy clientele, so I was intrigued to find out whether this 5* hotel would impress. I need not have questioned this thought. After talking to The Food and Beverage Manager, I was invited to look around the kitchens and meet their brigade. The kitchens were immaculate, staff spotless, motivated and relaxed in their work - delivering the most delicious fine dining experience. With Sri Lanka's top medal winning Chef at the helm this comes as no surprise.  If it is fantastic food and excellent service you require, then look no further.  We will definitely return.

Review_text: Ahun....I mean aha ...I will return to infinity.
Review_text_2:
Heritance Ahungalla is a place that will immediately bring your pulse rate down. A great atmosphere to relax, soak in the sun and enjoy a huge spread of Sri Lankan food.  Geoffery Bawa's characteristic infinity pool, the sound of the crashing waves and the setting sun are guaranteed to put you in a mellow mood. The bar by the pool is nice and has a band playing in the evenings. There is another fairly large pool by the fitness centre. The spa was average.

Rooms were large and clean. Strong smell of cinnamon oil - which I loved.  We were there for a conference and the hotel agreed to arrange a Mongolian barbeque for us on the beach which, unfortunately, was rained out. The following night we opted to use the Night Club.

The beach is clean - touts will point you in the direction of cheaper massages and shacks offering fresh sea food on the beach, both of which we did not try out.

Review_text: Excellent hotel with a beautiful setting and friendly poeple
Review_text_2:
We have just returned from a 2 week stay at the heritance. We travelled as a family of 2 children 2 and 4 yrs plus granparents. We had an excellent time and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. The architexture is stunning with a very calm atmosphere and a wonderful infinity pool that blends into the beach. The pictures don't do it justice.

We stayed in their 2 interconnecting rooms 301 and 302 which were spacious and had excellent see views. They made them up as a king size and 2 singles which suited us great. You could hear the entertainment but it finished at a reasonable time. The "animators" were really helpful, building sandcastles and flying kites with the children. We all enjoyed the daily aqua aerobics. 

One of the best things about the hotel and sri lanka is the poeple. The were very friendly and genuine and made our stay one to remember. The service was very occasionally slightly chaotic in a nice sri lankan way, but everyone was very helpful. The food was the best that we tasted anywhere on our trip in the hotel. Breakfast is excellent and the food in the coffee shop was v tasty. The chinese and BBQ buffets were worth it and we weren't charged for the children. Drink prices were reasonable (we were charged twice as much in the hotel on our trip to Kandy).

We did some trips around the area with Bertie from the sunshine resturant at the end of the beach. I would definitely recommend the river safari as not to be missed. 
This is an excellent choice for those looking for relaxation in a stunning setting. There is the option to explore locally and futher afield. We can't thank the hotel enough for an excellent stay, (they are happy to be contacted with room requests before you travel). We would go again!

Review_text_2:
Stayed for two nights found the room to be disappointing, small and a bit dirty, net curtains were stained as well as the rug on the floor very marked. Only one towel in room until more brought at 6pm which was a bit late. Toiletries supplied very poor, bathroom needed a good clean.
Found the buffet to be disappointing and dishes not refilled very often also one night the vegetables were very undercooked, also little choice. Breakfast buffet good.
Pool and beach lovely. snacks from pool bar good also.

Review_text: A good hotel, but in need of care and attention
Review_text_2:
We stayed at this hotel for twelve days and expected more from a hotel with a deluxe reputation.  The greatest asset this hotel has are its staff.  They  were simply excellent, so very friendly, exceptionally eager to please and polite and courteous at all times.  You would find it difficult to find a better hotel staff anywhere.  The food in the buffet restaurant was of a high standard and a perfect mix of Sri Lankan and International dishes.  The food in the fine dining restaurant was even better and probably better than manyy top restaurants in London.  The hotel is located right on the beach andmost of the rooms have a great sea view.  There are many beach venders, but we did not find this too much a problem as they quickly learnt not to bother you once you made it clear you were not interested.  

Yes, there are many positives to this hotel, but unfortunately it does not deserve a deluxe rating.  First impression are so important and this hotel is let down by being in need of care and attention.  For example the furnishings in the public areas were stained and needed replacing and much of the woodwork needed attention.   The tablecloths in the dining room were frequently filthy (unacceptable and easily rectified) and all the linen needed to be renewed.  Many of the sunbeds were broken and needed replacing and wer covered with dirty matresses.  However,  the pool attendents were excellent and helped to make up for these problems.  

Our overall impression of this hotel was that it required significant investment to bring it up to an acceptable standard for a deluxe hotel.  The hotel is saved by its excellent staff and fabulous food;  two of the most impotant factors for a successful hotel.  Would we return, possibly, but only if standards were improved.  There are many boutique hotels opening in Sri Lanka and the Heritance needs to be able to match the very high standard that these hotels set.

Review_text_2: After a 6 hour drive we were welcomed to Heritance Ahungalla with a drink and fast check in and shown to our rooms. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise and invited to the managers cocktail party. The rooms were very spacious, quiet and clean with wonderful views over the ocean. The pools and grounds were immaculately kept with staff to help you move day beds, supply towels and tend to your every need. The food was great in the restaraunts, but very dissapointing room service and pool bar/ outdoor cafe food - the "hot" food always came out cold and the icecream was served melted and the staff were not that keen to fix it. We wre lucky enough to be invited in to the kitchen for special cooking lessons which were wonderful. I found this hotel to be a wonderful place to relax and unwind at the end of a busy holiday.

Review_text_2:
I checked this hotel at tripadvisor before booking it and expected it to be nice and relaxing at the very least, however, the whole stay (we stayed there for 3 weeks) was a complete and utter disappointment! Looks like Heritance has changed a lot lately and it's surely not a 5* hotel anymore. 

After an almost 20-hour trip to the hotel, my only wish was to have a shower and lie down, however, we had to spent almost half an hour answering stupid questions about our anniversary, etc. 
The staff was too talkative and tactless even, several times we had spend almost the entire lunch in their company and nothing could possibly make them leave. 

All the advantages of this place faded away in comparison with its negative sides.
Quite nice design of the room couldn't make up for holes in bedsheets, dirty curtains, breaking conditioning, old towels and other things. 
The food was really fabulous, however, when the evening food was under a set menu, almost all guest opted for the a la carte restaurant as the set menu was really poor and the meal lasted forever.
The atmosphere was quite relaxing most of the time, however, there was no chance to even enter the pool as soon as weekend came and the hotel was fully packed with locals. 

Some things kept on spoiling our stay on every day basis. The beach area was constantly full of locals, who were trying to sell you a trip or whatever you wanted or didn't wanted. Even by the pool your every single movement was followed by their attempts to draw your attention. If you managed to escape and reach the ocean, several guys were waiting for you to come back.

I would never recommend this hotel to anyone! For the first time in my life I was looking forward for going home!!

Review_text_2:
It used to be a great place, sadly,  not any more. For $172 USD you can find more magic in many other locations in Srilanka's southern coast.
Food was nothing fabulous, the restaurant had  flies, really far too many. The servers were not on the ball, coffee was horrible.
checking in was not smooth, towels (some) threadbear or torn. bathroom water clogged up. However, It was fixed without much fuss.
Sorry, I am done with this hotel.

Review_text_2:
We have just returned from a three week stay at the Heritance Hotel. 
Hotel was basically good, everything worked, including the staff who, if anything, could be overly attentive. Rooms were stylish, had plenty of storage space and were serviced twice daily. Balconies had views across the beach to the setting sun. Some guests complained of minor faults, e.g. our fridge broke down but was repaired the same morning. Food was a good as could be expected with Buffet Service and we were never bored, although the dining room could be noisy. 

The hotel is proud of its swimming pools and rightly so. Attentive pool boys and life guards ensure there is not the usual scramble for beds and towels. We actually preferred the second (residents) pool to that shown in all the literature. The beach was regularly cleaned and patrolled. Constant slight surf, no problems for even moderate swimmers but small children should be supervised.

The hotel’s main drawback is its isolation. Locally, there is simply nowhere to go and little to do. Ahungalla village consists of some 70 yards of dilapidated shacks selling local produce and a few basics at blatantly ’tourist’ and local prices. There is also a passable bakery, a pharmacy, a bank with no ATM and a railway station at which few trains actually stop. There are two bus services and two qualities of bus i.e. Air Conditioned and Local. It is difficult to ascertain what is a public bus, as opposed to touring or private hire and even more difficult to have them stop. Heritance guests are not expected to want to walk anywhere, let alone get on a bus.

The weather was good. It rained frequently but usually in late evening and accompanied by spectacular lightning. Mosquitoes are in evidence and, despite a wall plug device and sprays we were both bitten frequently. 

Guests attempting to leave the hotel by the main entrance have to run the gauntlet of a persistent group of motorised tricycle (Tuk Tuk) taxi drivers who will resort to any device to have you hire them. In addition, the driver will insist on waiting for you and interfere with your activities. Their constant attentions became oppressive, more so than had we stayed in Bentota or Hikkaduwa where there are more hotels, more activities, thereby more tourists to go around.

Beach vendors were a nuisance but were not permitted onto hotel premises. A fellow female guests was accosted on the beach some 200yds from the hotel and robbed of her hat and wrap. This was however an isolated incident and we found the local people welcoming and keen to promote their countries new found stability.

Expeditions were possible, 400 yards North along the beach to a fish restaurant shack is worthwhile. I ordered Lobster and drank a local beer whist two young men went out with snorkels and a net to retrieve one. 

800yds south along the Galle road, on the left, is the Lucky Lanka Spice Garden and Ayurvidic Centre run by a charming young man. Full body massage for £10 and a large selection of herbal potions to buy at ‘local’ prices. 

Other worthwhile excursions are a tour of lagoon at Balapitaya (or Bentota) with a visit to one island to see cinnamon being hand rolled by a wonderful old man and his elfin grand daughter.

A morning’s snorkelling by Some at International Dive Centre, located at Coral Sands Hotel in Hikkaduwa is good value where there is an excellent parade of fish, including Octopus. The coral was badly damaged in the Tsunami but hopefully showing signs of a return.

If Temples and/or elephants are your thing, then there are further trips afield, e.g Kandy, Yala National Park and Burwela Bird Sanctuary. However, from Ahungalla, both entail an expenditure of over £110 pp, an overnight stay and between 5-7 hours in a minivan, each way. 

In summary; great hotel but we chose the wrong location for the type of holiday we enjoy. To get the best from Sri Lanka we would recommend dividing time between the Highlands, forests, wildlife parks and beaches. If however, you want a hotel based beach stay for a few days, you would be pushed to find better.

Sri Lanka has great potential, stunning scenery, culture, a vibrant history and the most glorious beaches I have seen.

Review_text: Superb!!...couldn't fault any aspect of it!!
Review_text_2:
I have just returned form 10 days at the Heritance with my girlfriend and can honestly say there wasnt any aspect fo the hotel that was disappointing. I work for a top tour operator in england and have travelled around the world staying at many top hotels. The service at the Heritance matched, if not exceeded many of these. The pools were fantastic...clean, great suze and we had one of the two at leat to ourselves on many occasions..it was great!! Below are some further comments:

Room - was brilliant. It was a great size, really nicely furnished, clean with a great bathroom. Great views to pool and ocean. Cleaned daily.

Food - amazing! we were on  ahalf board basis and te food was superb. Great choice, different them every day, fresh, beautiful curries!

Service - amazing. The staff were so attentive it was incredible. They were polite and friendly all the time. They alwas say hello and and make a real rapport with you throughout the time we were there.

Beach - lovely but you do get hounded a bit by the touts when you walk on it. Just ignore them if you want them to leave you alone. Theyre firendly though. The sea is a bit rough so you cant really swim in it.

Touts - if you want to get a taxi just ask one of the touts for a tuk tuk Its so much cheaper than the hotel taxis. We had the same driver for the whole 10 days and he was great. He took us to lots of places cheaply and was a safe driver. Dont be scared to use one..youll probably be a bit nervous the first time you get in one but then you can get their number and as soon as you want to go somewheer give them a call and theyll come and pick you up.

Overall..couldnt fault our time at the heritance in any way. Ive read some of the negative reviews on this site and cant really understand what theyre on about. One said this hotel was dated which is complete rubbish!

Feel free to email me if you have any questinos or want to know more.

Nick

service - amazing. the staff were so attentive it was incredible. they were polite and friendly all the time. they alwas say hello and and make a real rapport with you throughout the time we were there.

beach - lovely but you do get hounded a bit by the touts when you walk on it. just ignore them if you want them to leave you alone. theyre firendly though. the sea is a bit rough so you cant really swim in it.

touts - if you want to get a taxi just ask one of the touts for a tuk tuk its so much cheaper than the hotel taxis. we had the same driver for the whole 10 days and he was great. he took us to lots of places cheaply and was a safe driver. dont be scared to use one..youll probably be a bit nervous the first time you get in one but then you can get their number and as soon as you want to go somewheer give them a call and theyll come and pick you up.

overall..couldnt fault our time at the heritance in any way. ive read some of the negative reviews on this site and cant really understand what theyre on about. one said this hotel was dated which is complete rubbish!

feel free to email me if you have any questinos or want to know more.

nick

Review_text_2:
We stayed beginning of August for 3 nights in the Junior Suite in Heritance Ahungalla.

In general, the rooms are clean, the swimming pool is nice, especially for kids and also the beach is great.

Unfortunately, like most 5-star hotels in Sri Lanka, also this one lacked essential things like a proper finishing in the room (the bathroom was a desaster, I cut myself several times at the glass door there), a very small TV only etc.

The food was good quality, thoug a little expensive, but because we liked it we only ate at the hotel. The breakfast had a wide selection, and there was a big variety at the dinner buffetts, for example "seafood grill night" etc.

The service was very poor, anything you wanted to do or to get took ages and did not work properly. On one saturday night there was a wedding with extremely loud music next to the second pool (where all the suites are localed; it was like a disco), and with still going on after 11 o´clock and the kids not being able to sleep I complained several times without success. It went on until 3 in the morning, which literally destroyed our next day and is something no 5-star hotel should accept. Many guests complained, but the management rather preferred to cash in the money for the ceremony instead of satisfiying their guests.

Nevertheless we had altogether a good time, the animateurs at the hotel were dedicated and we had a lot of fun with waterpolo and beach volleyball.

One last note: as generally in Sri Lankan 5 star hotels, they overprice taxis etc. by 300 to 400%. Just go out of the hotel and rent a taxi or tuc-tuc there, as next to the savings the locals know all the places to go.

Review_text: Beautiful beach, Seedy, Overpriced, with friendly but incompetant staff
Review_text_2:
The stunning view beach is the only positive memory that we have from our stay.  Otherwise the hotel is dated, poorly managed, and many unmaintained facilities. Air conditioning, ceiling fan in our room did not work.  The door locks in our room to the bathroom and balcony were broken.  Considering that balconies from other rooms are essentially interconnected, there was little or no security from the balcony side of our room.  

The main restaurant buffet is expensive and of poor cafeteria style food. Very little flair to the food, designed to please those who did not really want to leave home.

Entertainment in the lobby at night is essentially Karaoke musicians mouthing CD music.  The hotel was built in the 1960s and it seems nothing was done to improve or redecorate the place since it's initial opening.  It is a nice visit back to a mid 1960's contemporary architecture that has a seedy ambiance.

The staff is friendly and helpful as long as it does not involve complicated activities such as room maintenance, directions to anywhere, or being served coffee in the restaurants.

The hotel has no control over the touts in front of the hotel nor at the beach.  These touts are of course part of the scenery but makes the guests not want to wander onto the beach since they will not leave visitors alone and will not take no as an answer.  It is a sad commentary of Sri Lanka, but the hotel could do more to discourage these parasites.

Review_text: Didn't live up to the reviews
Review_text_2:
We booked this hotel for the second part of our holiday by the coast. We were swayed to book this hotel due to the raging reviews on Trip Advisor. Unfortunately it didn’t quite live up to our expectations, especially after leaving the Cinnamon Lodge in Habarana which was advertised to be a lower rating hotel.
Our opinions do differ from those on here. The hotel is well known for the architect and so we expected something quite special, as it was also a ‘5’ star resort. On arrival the Loby is attractive as you can see through to a lush swimming pool right onto the sea. The swimming pools were the best bit of this hotel. They are lovely.
However, we did find the hotel lacked character and that holiday feel. The architecture was a bit cold and bleak, very concrete, modern and minimalist. Somewhat like a business Hilton hotel which is just not we want on a holiday. The plants around the hotel seemed tired and a bit dead, just outside our room we overlooked a moulding wall where there used to be vegetation climbing up it. The hotel was all very open which was good for a natural breeze, but as soon as the monsoons came this caused a death trap of slippery hallways bars, seat cushions etc.
The hotel rooms were nice, again modern but of good quality. The whole place lacked good lighting though. There was also the natural bare plastered look in the hotel bathrooms etc. Not our taste but might appeal to some. I personally like a bright lick of paint or something it bit more luxurious.
The hotel did have good facilities if you wanted tennis, ping pong, badminton, spa’s etc. However going onto the beach was slightly annoying due to the persistent locals selling on the beach who would sit on the beach facing the hotel shouting at you to come and look as they will “give you good price”. This is a little off putting but I understand it’s just the way there. We never managed to go onto the beach without having to say no thanks to several different people.
The restaurants and entertainment were the biggest disappointment. The food was always nice (wine expensive) but the restaurants lacked atmosphere. The main restaurant had set menus for most of our stay and these were quite pricey. The buffets in that restaurant were a bit better as at least you got more choice. But the restaurant is dark and dreary. No ambience. The a la carte “Cafe”? did have nice food but a bit limited on choice. You also don’t expect to have your a la carte meal in a cafe which lacked again any sort of luxury and really had the ambience slightly above that of a McDonalds. (I am being slightly harsh).
The entertainment at the hotel was pretty poor. Sometimes there was a band singing the same songs every night.  A cocktail promotion (doesn’t mean it’s a price promotion) with live demonstration. Or simply someone plays an instrument. It was very quiet during our stay so maybe they do more in the main season.
We actually spent many of our nights at the Taj hotel in Bentota after this was recommended to us by fellow guests in the same boat as us.  I suggest you go there just to get a comparison of what a 5 star hotel should really be like. We had a Chinese in the restaurant there and it was lovely. There buffet meals also had a great deal more ambience. Just grab a tuk tuk to get there. The Refresh restaurant 20 mins away in Hikkaduwa was also lovely. I recommend you stay in Bentota though if you want choice and to be able to walk out the hotel to more restuarants. There is nothing near the Heritance.
Having said all that, if you want a quiet, clean relaxing hotel to just unwind sit by the pool and have early nights then it’s a great option. If you are lucky you will see some black monkeys around the hotel. We did get this hotel at a good price so we can’t complain I just believe the ratings on here are misleading. This is not to discredit the staff at the Heritance who were mostly all very helpful and nice people.

Review_text_2:
We travelled to this hotel with Kuoni travel under the idea that it was a 5* luxury hotel. 

This hotel had all the potential of a good 4* hotel. The beech was amazing the staff were amazing, however there always seemed to be something missing and not quality about the hotel. We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights having travelled around the island for 4-5 days. The poolside service was very good with staff being extremely friendly and chatty. The animator was also a healthy addition to the hotel encouraging water polo and other activates throughout the day. The pool bar offered a nice little lunchtime snack menu however every meal was with French fries and wasn’t the best quality. We recommend sprite as it was half the price of coke or diet coke. The sprite was around 70p and coke was £1.50 for a can. There was also a service charge on each bill so there was no need for tipping and carrying cash as it could all be  charged to the room

The evening food in the main restaurant under a set menu was very average and was trying to be to clever for its own good. Not much variety if you were a fussy eater and didn’t like fish. The al a carte restaurant (or coffee shop) offered a welcome opportunity to get a square meal. This was available with a 10% discount to half and full board customers. when the hotel got busy at the weekend however the restaurant came alive with a huge Mexican and bbq buffet on the Friday and Saturday nights. The breakfasts were also very good with every possible breakfast such as omelettes and waffles. 

However, when the weekend did arrive the hotel filled with hundreds of locals. This wasnt a problem until the quiet pool became a holiday at butlans with kids screaming and weeing into the pool. The locals were then extremely rude to the friendly staff making the stay extremely uncomfortable as you had to witness this behaviour. The staff were being shouted at and fingers clicked at with no manners. It was clear that the other guests felt the same through conversations in the lobby. The evening buffet at the weekend although it had good food resembled a school canteen. At 9 oclock families were bringing there young screaming children to dinner. Those children who were not dead on there feet at this time were runing around bumping in to the staff and other guests. This un civilised behaviour caused some couples to leave in disgust.  

The room was very good although we were continually being pested by staff asking if the room was ok. Also the wiring of the room was questionable with switches for different lights being in the wrong place. 

The beech was a no go area also as you were trying to have a romantic walk along the beech and were surrounded by peopel trying to sell you trips and clothing. Even when you were trying to sun bathe there was a constant noise coming from the beech of people trying to grab your attention.

As a result of this I would not recommend this hotel to anyone I liked. I will also be informing Kuoni of the hotel at the weekend.

Review_text_2: Having read some fantastic reviews of this hotel, we arrived with high expectations.  Twice prior to arrival we had reqested a room with a sea view and a double bed.  On arrival however we were asked if we wanted to upgrade before even seeing the room, therefore, it came as no suprise that we had neither a sea view nor a double bed as requested.  Now I appreciate the hotel was very busy over the Sri Lankan New Year however we had booked well in advance and were assured that within two days we would be moved, which did not materialise despite constant pleas, until day 7 of 10!  Agreed the hotel was very clean and in a fantastic location, however, if you are looking for something intimate and romantic this is not the place for you.  The beach is beautiful though the hawkers provide little peace and are a constant menace and not to be trusted, given the stories we heard from trusted locals inland.

Review_text_2:
We visited Heritence Ahungalle for 2 nights in mid-April 2009.  This was our second trip to the property having visited 5 years ago on our last trip to SL.

Booked directly through the hotel website after comparing other similar properties such as Taj Exotica Bentota, The Fortress, Galle Fort Hotel and Eden Resort.  Chose the Heritence given we had a wonderful stay 5 years ago.  I wrote to the hotel inquiring about rates and was promised a free upgrade to a luxury room given that I was a returning guest.  The hotel also stated that the property has been completely refurbished hence the drastic increase in price.

When I got to the Heritence, I was told I would be given a deluxe room (the most basic room).  I advised that I was promised a free upgrade to which I was told that they cannot honour this promise.  They then advised that I could have an upgrade to a luxury room for an additional cost of Rs. 10,000 (US$86) per night.   Given the higher cost I declined the upgrade and was quite disappointed.

I had also requested a cot for my infant son when the booking was made.  When I got to the hotel I was told that all the cots were in use.  I complained to the General Manager who promised to look into it and get back to me, which he never did.

We could not notice the refurbishments made to the property.  The room we had looked very similar to the room we had five years ago as did the common areas.  

The property itself is beautifully maintained and is set on a stunning section of beach in SL.  The main infinity pool and lobby area are very beautiful.  The food is exceptional with a wide variety of choice all of which are of a very high level of quality.

We visited this hotel during the Sri Lankan New Year and the hotel was full of local guests.  

We were blown away by the property and service on our last visit and were disappointed in the level of service during this trip (the GM has changed once during the past 5 years).  I would say that we did have a good time and enjoyed the pool but would not likely return on our next trip to SL given they did not follow through on their promises.

Review_text: first impression so poor we left after 15 minutes
Review_text_2:
we were booked here for 6 nights after our round-the-island tour.  This hotel was selected as it was the one being pushed by the major tour operator (to whom we have sent a full and damning report) and, at the time of booking the reports on this site were good, although these have now changed.
To be fair, we WERE tired after travelling all day.  Reception seemed ok until you raised your eyes sea-ward and saw the lager-swilling, chain-smoking and tattooed "guests" and the dirty looking swimming pool with broken sunbeds (covered with filthy mattresses) Need I go on?  We checked out to the Taj Exotica which for a few pounds more per night was first class  I should say that Heritance is about 20 minutes south of Bentota, so not exactly close to anything to allow you to escape

Review_text_2:
I couldn't agree more with the comments below.  We stayed there from 26th December until after New Year.  Had we been able to get a refund we would have moved out on day 1!

Firstly, despite what their website says, all rooms do NOT have a sea view.  We were given a room overlooking the tennis courts.  After a huge discussion, they said that we could move to a lower category room - where a seaview was availabile - BUT they wouldn't refund us the £450 difference.  After I pointed out that they were falsely advertising, the local agent out there agreed to pay for us to upgrade us to a luxury suite -  however, the hotel really should have picked up this cost as their website was giving incorrect information!

The suite was ok - but not worth the money they charge.  Again, their website states luxury goods and free sparkling wine, fruit etc.  None of those things materialised!  The shower gel was provided in glass bottles which took forever to let the gel out.  There was no conditioner, no bubble bath and the cotton buds were only supplied on the first day - all basic things for a 5 star hotel!

The lighting is also totally illogical as the person states below.  

It's certainly not a luxury 5 star property.  There's water aerobics in the pool every day - with loud techno music blaring out of the speakers.  They had Karaoke in one bar and a very naff electronic keyboard player belting out songs like "lady in red" in the other.  Not exclusive property that it claims to be!

The sun loungers had dirty cushions - which didn't even cover the whole of the lounger - and there weren't enough for the number of guests.  

You were also shouted at by the hawkers from the beach - which really shouldn't happen at this type of property (I've stayed at lots in Sri Lanka and nowhere else is like that!)

Finally, the food.  It was very uninspiring for the cost.  The upper restaurant was not open the whole time we were there - so the only a la carte menu available was from the coffee shop.  

I think it's an absolute disgrace to charge the money they do - I was incredibly misled and I too will be lodging a formal complaint.  

The only saving grace was the location - but frankly - there are lots of hotels in Sri Lanka with just as nice locations - minus the hawkers and at a much cheaper cost!

Review_text_2:
We stayed at this place for 4 days 3 nights - US$1,100, included a lame New Year buffet and "celebration"  (US$125 per person) 

This hotel bore no resemblance with its sister hotel in the same group Heritance Kandalama (where we stayed over Christmas and which was impressive). The architectual and design elememts that make Heritance Kandalama very special are total lacking in the Heritance Alungalla. The level of service could not compared. The attitude of staff generally was insincere and gear towards tips rather than service. We also had 2 experiences of male staff members making inappropriate comments to the females in our group. 

The food was uninspiring at best and unhygenically prepared at worst (one of our party and a known other guest were both made ill by poor food preparation.) When the issue was raised  on our departure with the most senior staff member made available (only a room division manager), no responsiblity was taken nor apology offered and  the stock response was that the guest had not until then made a formal complaint (despite the matter being known to reception and housekeeping staff) and the guest was blamed for not having asked for a hotel doctor at the time. 

The room we had was an attempt maximizing a corner area and was at first glance impressive. However, not all the electrics were wired up and the basic layout of the location of the light switches was poor (you have to get out of bed to turn off the bed side light). And one of the toilet in the suite smelt which affected our enjoyment of the suite. We couldn't use the sitting area of the suite.

To cap it all, having paid US$100 for a vehicle to take us to the airport, the hotel provided a desperately underpower, mini people mover which had no safety belts for passengers (an essential requirement for Sri Lankan roads).

Compared to the rest of our experience of accommodation in Sri Lanka, Heritance Alungalla was over-priced and poor value. It is definitely not 5 star accommodation as it claims to be. It just seems to be a money making "machine".

The main positive point about this hotel is the beach which is beautiful like the rest of the West coast of Sri Lanka (you do have to however put up with beach touts). 

We will be lodging a formal complaint to the hotel but given their initial response we do not expect any joy.

Review_text: Beautiful hotel but not for us The Downeys, Cork Ireland
Review_text_2:
We've just returned from our honeymoon - a week in the Maldives(paradise) followed by a week in Sri Lanka staying in the Heritance Ahungalla. The hotel is beautiful just like any hotel in a major city let it be London, Dublin or New York so if its traditional Sri Lankan style your looking for than its not for you.
Our room was looking out onto the ocean however the water was unfortunately too rough for swimming. There wasn't a soul on the beach for the entire duration of our trip apart from the usual hawkers who camp out on the beach for the day in the hope of selling the odd sarong or two.
The food was nice but became extremely repetitive when your there for 6 days, bearing in mind there's nothing outside the hotel so no chance of eating anywhere else. If you like a drink and a bit of a buzz at nite then this is also not the hotel for you, the bars have no atmosphere.Your not encouraged to go out of the hotel however saying that there's nothing to go out for in the line of entertainment, shopping or eating just a little shop across the road which sells water and snacks which may come in handy as hotels prices are the same if not even more expenive than home. Once you walk out of the hotel you'll be surrounded by hawkers trying to sell you tours which can be annoying as they're fairly persistent.
We went on a local tour by tuk tuk with Raji who camps out outside the hotel or beach, his English is perfect which helps. This was quite enjoyable apart from being brought to two different shops trying to get us to buy stuff, this is standard procedure if u take a tuk tuk anyway. We did the nearby river safari which we booked through our travel rep. This would be very managable and much cheaper to do by travelling by tuk tuk and hopping on a boat when you get there, just a few mins down the road. We also went to a national park spotting elephants, about 9 hrs in a car but enjoyable all the same.All of the staff in the hotel were outstanding very friendly and pleasant. Sri Lanka is really just a country for touring around, the ideal would be  4 or 5 days seeing the sights staying in a different hotel ever nite. As part of a tour I would defintely recommend a nite or two in this hotel but def no longer.

Review_text: stay away - not worth the trip!
Review_text_2: It took us 5 hours in a minibus to arrive to the hotel from Colombo (120 km trip) and  few attempts to move to a less moldy room (the rooms are nice and people are very friendly). You quickly realize you’ll be facing the same menu for 8 days at the same restaurant (there is nothing around, and don’t be fooled by hotel “choices” – none was available). The beach is unapproachable – even when the waves and the weather cooperate (July is Monsoon season for the west side of the island) beach vendors would not go away. If you plan trips to other parts of Sri Lanka, well, think again. Getting anywhere from Ahungalla takes many hours by train or bus (we were hoping to visit Kandy which turned out to be 7 to 8 hours trip!). In short, there is absolutely no need to travel all the way to Sri Lanka to be locked in a hotel with no options, no usable beach, and nowhere to visit.

Review_text: Beautiful beach, if you can get on it!
Review_text_2:
We stayed here for 2 weeks at the end of March and first week of April.  Mostly, I would agree the previous writer's review.  If you wish to really see Sri Lanka then I would suggest that you stay here at the end of your holiday as it is quite far south and means that travel to places such as Kandy are extremely long and tiresome and the driving is something else to be seen, I would describe it as a 'white knuckle ride'!.

The hotel is well designed but I would struggle to place it in the 4-5* bracket (try out hotels in Malaysia and you will really see the difference).  There is a so called shop in the hotel which really does not sell any essentials such as shampoo so make sure you take your own hair products. Also, we bought factor 40 sun tan cream which did not work and we were severely burned (another couple had the same experience) so again, make sure you take your own sun tan creams and after sun with you.

Regarding the beach terrorists, they do hassle you.  We were followed for an hour on the beach by 5 of them who just would not give up, no matter how politely you said you weren't interested.  They called and shouted to you if you were sunbathing near the beach and the only thing to do was to completely ignore them.  One day we went outside the hotel to go the the pharmacy to buy some after sun lotion (due to the rubbish cream the shop had sold) and found exactly the same hassle, we lasted about 20 minutes before going back to the hotel.

Our room smelled damp when we initially entered and the air con never seemed cool, the staff knocked on the door daily, sometimes 4-5 times to check the room was ok.  However, I think this had more to do with wanting a tip.  One time they completely ignored the 'do not disturb sign' and still persisted.

The restaurant did offer a very good selection (buffet style) and quality of food, the only thing that let it down was the length of time it took you to get a drink when requested, especially as the ratio of staff to customers was overwhelming at times.

If you don't like being hassled then maybe this isn't the place for you.  In terms of the staff, all were very friendly and polite apart from one or two who seemed to have tipping on their agenda as a priority more than genuine customer service.  

All in all, a good quality hotel but if they really wish to put themselves in the 4-5* bracket, they are missing a lot of extras which you would normally expect.

Review_text_2:
The Triton has been renovated and relaunched at the Heritance Ahungalla (May 2006).  Under the management of Aitken Spence, a major Sri Lanken hotel group, they have attempted to move away from their previous 'all inclusive' package approach to become 'Sri Lanka's first 6 star hotel'.  To be honest, they have a long way to go to achieve this level.  
We visited in June, very shortly after they reopened.  In fact, building work wasn't completed and the new Spa will not be on line for 6 months or more.  
It is a bit hard to know how to be fair to this hotel. They've done a great job renovating the public areas of the hotel.  Although only one bar & the coffee shop were open when we were there they were very attractive, with attentive service and good (but not outstanding) food.  There was also a small libary, well stocked with books for beach reading. 
However the biggest drawback is the size of the bedrooms.  In comparison to other Sri Lankan top end hotels - such as the Galle Lighthouse Hotel or Dambulla Kandalama - the rooms and bathrooms (no bath provided) are very small.  Although nicely decorated they lack a feeling of space and light.  Plus the layout of the hotel means that many rooms look (indirectly) into other rooms.  
Staff vary from excellent (thoughtful and friendly) to down right annoying in their continual expectation of tips.  The better staff including the restaurant staff were good, but lifeguards and one room boy were very pushy.
Plus the internet access is ridiculously expensive ($US15 hour - over 4 times higher than anywhere else we stayed).  
The beach is long and undeveloped.  The two pools are spacious, with plenty of deckchairs (however there were only 15 - 30 people there at the time).
All in all a reasonalbly good hotel, but they have some way to go to meet the standards they have set for themselves. I was a bit disappointed and would, if I had my time again, had chosen to stay in longer Galle in preference to moving along the coast.

Review_text: I'd go back to this particular hotel.
Review_text_2:
Nice hotel with wonderful staff. I have never seen such friendly, kind and sympathetic communication in any country. Jayaru has captured my heart in general, she has always helped with everything.

Now, on the turf, everything's fine, I can't even find the downside. We lived in the far wing and we were very quiet. Only black monkeys culturally disturbed our peace twice in 10 days 😅 the warblers behaved modestly and the chipmunks ran merrily around the grounds.

The food is also delicious, shrimp, squid, chicken, fish (except beef, here it is best not to take it :))), the fruit has always been in large quantities. Ice cream 👍

Rooms are cleaned well and always smell nice after cleaning.

Review_text_2: The hotel at 5* doesn't pull at all. It needs a good repair. Rooms are good, cleaning is good. But there are nuances like a broken kettle, the doors to the balcony don't close. Strange scenery on the walls. The linens are not exactly white. There are two pools. Beautiful ocean view. People are kind, sympathetic. The food isn't very varied. A lot of it's spicy, the beef's really tough. Delicious pineapple and papaya. There was no fish variety. Amateur salads. Ice cream liked it. They gave oysters once. The shrimp is delicious. The restaurant's not big. Wifi is weak. There are no TV channels in Russian. For all the faults, you can rest here well. In food find your own, the population is very positive and simple, nature is beautiful. Just whoever is coming here will tune in to another level of service 😊 Special thanks to the hotel, for your help and special attention to us!!! Not the hotel's indifference to tourists and quick response to the issue, for that thank you so much! Thank you very much to the staff! We wish the hotel prosperity and development!

Review_text: Unsanitary conditions, terrible food, old building, smells like grandma's old furniture
Review_text_2:
Good afternoon. I’m not a fan of leaving reviews and, in principle, too lazy to do this, however, after certain nuances, I still decided to write. I have been vacationing with my wife since the beginning of August in this hotel through the tour operator Anex Tour. After reading positive reviews and looking at beautiful photos on booking, we decided to go to this hotel without hesitation, it didn’t even bother us that it was not the season and that there were big waves on the side where the hotel is located at that time.
In general, I'll start with the positives.
Namely: the hotel is located among palm trees and many trees on which small chipmunks jump and beautiful birds fly, the beach is very large and wide, the length is about 3.5 km, but it is cleaned only directly in front of the hotel in the morning from among local vigilantes. which are photographed by a local police officer upon completion of work. The 5-star Heritance Hotel has: 2 swimming pools, one small gym, restaurant, one bar. That's basically all the advantages.)
I don’t want to be a boring person in your eyes, so that you don’t think: “Well, there are people who always don’t like something.” Because I thought so myself when I read several similar reviews before buying the tour. Arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by girls with white smiles. I was very pleased with the positive mood of the staff, always smiling. Always. But, as it turned out, from fulfilling my professional tasks of maintaining a comfortable client accommodation, this was the only well-developed skill.
Simply put, in addition to the fact that the hotel is over 60 years old, its technical condition leaves much to be desired. Apart from the smell of “grandmother’s sofa in the country,” no one plans to refresh the hotel and monitor its cleanliness, order in the premises, rooms, glass washing and sanitary disinfection!
On the first day we arrived and entered the room, I noticed that the drain in the shower was clogged and the flush in the toilet did not work well enough to fulfill its function. Going down to the restaurant, I am not a squeamish and meticulous person, I was not pleasantly surprised that the tables were simply sticky, like in a dumpling shop! The window glass is incredibly dirty and there are flies flying around the room and landing on your plate. My wife cried when she saw it all... she was in a terrible mood. Not once, not once during all the time were there paper napkins on the table. pepper shakers and salt shakers were very rarely found on tables. But what struck me and other visitors from Europe most of all was that 95% of the dishes were incredibly spicy! A couple of days before departure, I couldn’t resist and asked to see salads and hot dishes without “curry” and “black pepper”. I would NEVER call the restaurant a restaurant. They greet you beautifully, open the doors, smile, BUT the food and service are below par! After eating, you need to wait until the receipt is closed, and sign the zero receipt, indicating that you do not owe any money for the drinks. Yes, yes, even if you have “all inclusive”, even if you drank cola or local arak is free. The check takes a very long time. I left a lot of tips, but they still don’t want to work.
 On the opposite side of the so-called “restaurant” with flies, sticky tables, dirty glass, there is a bar. Where can you buy alcohol, fries and a burger. Most of the time we ate there, there is no spicy food at all! The all-inclusive option includes the above items and local alcoholic drinks. Everything else is paid. He works a couple of hours before lunch and an hour after for cooking.
By the way, after 24.00 it is impossible to drink cola, whiskey or smoke a pack of cigarettes. Everything in the hotel is closed. Outside the hotel, shops are closed after zero hours. For leisure, near the bar with paid drinks there is an area where a local musician plays until 23.00. Near the exit to the ocean, local traders and beggars are constantly on duty. Security guards do not allow them into the territory, but they watch you through a mesh fence when you go swimming at the beach. It looks funny, because you are 7-10 meters away on the sun loungers by the pool towards the ocean, you see them, and they look at you) they look at you, and you look at them) like in a zoo, it’s not clear just who the animal is.
The staff is very very lazy, no matter what anyone writes that they are trying. It is not true. While you give me a tip, they pretend. Sooo slow, very, very slow. And, of course, I couldn’t help but pay attention to the staff’s manicure and pedicure; this is a separate topic. There was a great desire to give nail scissors.
My appeal and review was sent not to criticize, but so that the management would take note and work on the mistakes. Because if you oppose yourself as 5 stars, then correspond, be so kind! But the bosses only taught me to smile and bow.

P.S.
On the day of departure, our flight was postponed several times. From early morning the hotel staff saw us sitting and waiting for our bus, but at 12.00 when we handed over our bracelets, we became a different kind of people. At 12.10, the wife asked the hostess for 2 free bottles of water to take with her to the airport, which they usually bring to the room, to which she replied with a smile: “and now it’s paid!” I was so amazed that I thought it was a joke, since I only didn’t tip chipmunks.
In general, thanks to the ocean and the cool chipmunks, they did not disappoint us.
Review_text_3: Show original
processed_text_Review_text: unsanitary conditions, terrible food, old building, smells like grandma's old furniture
processed_text_Review_text_2:
good afternoon. i’m not a fan of leaving reviews and, in principle, too lazy to do this, however, after certain nuances, i still decided to write. i have been vacationing with my wife since the beginning of august in this hotel through the tour operator anex tour. after reading positive reviews and looking at beautiful photos on booking, we decided to go to this hotel without hesitation, it didn’t even bother us that it was not the season and that there were big waves on the side where the hotel is located at that time.
in general, i'll start with the positives.
namely: the hotel is located among palm trees and many trees on which small chipmunks jump and beautiful birds fly, the beach is very large and wide, the length is about 3.5 km, but it is cleaned only directly in front of the hotel in the morning from among local vigilantes. which are photographed by a local police officer upon completion of work. the 5-star heritance hotel has: 2 swimming pools, one small gym, restaurant, one bar. that's basically all the advantages.)
i don’t want to be a boring person in your eyes, so that you don’t think: “well, there are people who always don’t like something.” because i thought so myself when i read several similar reviews before buying the tour. arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by girls with white smiles. i was very pleased with the positive mood of the staff, always smiling. always. but, as it turned out, from fulfilling my professional tasks of maintaining a comfortable client accommodation, this was the only well-developed skill.
simply put, in addition to the fact that the hotel is over 60 years old, its technical condition leaves much to be desired. apart from the smell of “grandmother’s sofa in the country,” no one plans to refresh the hotel and monitor its cleanliness, order in the premises, rooms, glass washing and sanitary disinfection!
on the first day we arrived and entered the room, i noticed that the drain in the shower was clogged and the flush in the toilet did not work well enough to fulfill its function. going down to the restaurant, i am not a squeamish and meticulous person, i was not pleasantly surprised that the tables were simply sticky, like in a dumpling shop! the window glass is incredibly dirty and there are flies flying around the room and landing on your plate. my wife cried when she saw it all... she was in a terrible mood. not once, not once during all the time were there paper napkins on the table. pepper shakers and salt shakers were very rarely found on tables. but what struck me and other visitors from europe most of all was that 95% of the dishes were incredibly spicy! a couple of days before departure, i couldn’t resist and asked to see salads and hot dishes without “curry” and “black pepper”. i would never call the restaurant a restaurant. they greet you beautifully, open the doors, smile, but the food and service are below par! after eating, you need to wait until the receipt is closed, and sign the zero receipt, indicating that you do not owe any money for the drinks. yes, yes, even if you have “all inclusive”, even if you drank cola or local arak is free. the check takes a very long time. i left a lot of tips, but they still don’t want to work.
 on the opposite side of the so-called “restaurant” with flies, sticky tables, dirty glass, there is a bar. where can you buy alcohol, fries and a burger. most of the time we ate there, there is no spicy food at all! the all-inclusive option includes the above items and local alcoholic drinks. everything else is paid. he works a couple of hours before lunch and an hour after for cooking.
by the way, after 24.00 it is impossible to drink cola, whiskey or smoke a pack of cigarettes. everything in the hotel is closed. outside the hotel, shops are closed after zero hours. for leisure, near the bar with paid drinks there is an area where a local musician plays until 23.00. near the exit to the ocean, local traders and beggars are constantly on duty. security guards do not allow them into the territory, but they watch you through a mesh fence when you go swimming at the beach. it looks funny, because you are 7-10 meters away on the sun loungers by the pool towards the ocean, you see them, and they look at you) they look at you, and you look at them) like in a zoo, it’s not clear just who the animal is.
the staff is very very lazy, no matter what anyone writes that they are trying. it is not true. while you give me a tip, they pretend. sooo slow, very, very slow. and, of course, i couldn’t help but pay attention to the staff’s manicure and pedicure; this is a separate topic. there was a great desire to give nail scissors.
my appeal and review was sent not to criticize, but so that the management would take note and work on the mistakes. because if you oppose yourself as 5 stars, then correspond, be so kind! but the bosses only taught me to smile and bow.

p.s.
on the day of departure, our flight was postponed several times. from early morning the hotel staff saw us sitting and waiting for our bus, but at 12.00 when we handed over our bracelets, we became a different kind of people. at 12.10, the wife asked the hostess for 2 free bottles of water to take with her to the airport, which they usually bring to the room, to which she replied with a smile: “and now it’s paid!” i was so amazed that i thought it was a joke, since i only didn’t tip chipmunks.
in general, thanks to the ocean and the cool chipmunks, they did not disappoint us.

Review_text: Hello . The hotel left a mixed impression, we stayed here from 02/03/24 to 02/12/24
Review_text_2:
Hello . The hotel left a mixed impression, we stayed here from 02/03/24 to 02/12/24
Ocean 5+ (if you are afraid of waves like me, then 35 minutes along the beach and you are in a dream lagoon without waves)
Kitchen 5+
Live music every evening 5+
The restaurant also has music for weekend dinners 5+
Cleaning 5+ cleaner Rukmal best every day did really masterpieces!
Pool 5+, service 5+, atmosphere 5+ the hotel is really very good, the monkeys running on the balconies are just super.
The worst ROOM 🤦‍♀️ 1+ or 2+
I think you can’t move into such rooms by any means. I'll attach a photo. Everything is falling apart, electrical wires are sticking out, the socket is barely there, everything is old and terrible, number 230 is terrible 🤦 ♀️ A 3 star hostel is better. We tried not to make the room creepy 🤪
Take the better room category and you will be happy 🙌🏼

Review_text_2: The hotel is terrible!!! How can you like the ruined rooms, old dirty towels, sun loungers that are falling apart!!! The service is terrible, they try to cheat at every step!!!! At the bar we ordered Black rum Bacardi, they brought it local for the price of Bacardi and also included service for what????????? Because they tried to sell local alcohol at the price of imported alcohol!!!! They also added 18% tax to the price indicated in the price list. It's not worth the money, it won't spoil your holiday by staying in this hotel!!!!

Review_text_2:
Good afternoon We wanted to share our impressions of our stay at the Heritance Ahungalla 5* hotel (Sri Lanka)

We really liked the hotel.

Rooms: The rooms are very large. Comfortable. Cleaning is done every day and very efficiently. The room has a kettle, tea, coffee, sugar, milk powder, water, refrigerator, hair dryer, shampoo, shower gel, body lotion, toothbrushes, slippers, bathrobes.

Hotel: the hotel area is very clean and well maintained. The hotel is located right on the ocean. Very quiet and peaceful.
Very long coastline.

Meals: we only had breakfast. The food is good.
We had lunch and dinner at the hotel's Alya Carte restaurant. The only negative of the restaurant is the small selection of dishes. But everything we didn’t try was very tasty. The waiters were always attentive, polite, and neat.

Animation: every evening there was live music in the lobby. Artists came, danced, and put on a fire show. During the day there was water aerobics. Water polo and some other games)

Beach: the hotel is located right on the ocean. There were huge waves during our holiday. But we really liked it. We spent all our time in the water) if you walk along the beach to the left, there will be a lagoon. There were no waves there at all.

Infrastructure outside the hotel: there is nowhere to go. There is the only store in Sri Lanka with prices - food city. You can also buy fruits and alcohol. There is a clothing store and a jewelry store.

We took a tuk here and went to the beach club restaurant. It's right on the ocean. Menu in Russian. Everything is very delicious. And the staff is just wonderful.

There is also a restaurant if you walk along the beach to the left. Jungle beach.

We are very glad that we chose this hotel. A very quiet and cozy place where you can relax from the hustle and bustle

Review_text: If you want to relax at a construction site, this is the place for you!!!!
Review_text_2: When we bought a tour to this hotel, we didn’t know that it was undergoing a complete restoration, so we arrived and ended up just at a construction site, all sorts of work is being done everywhere, sanding the walls, you breathe dust, or painting some kind of stinking paint, the rooms are shaky, it’s extremely uncomfortable, I’ll attach photos to you now If you want to go on vacation at a construction site, I ask you to go to this hotel. Now I am in hotel number 262. The next day after my arrival, having met our respected guide in quotes from Anex, I asked to move us to another hotel, no action was taken on the part of Anex, after 4 days of correspondence, hotel representatives tried to move us to other rooms exactly like this stinky. Informative for those who want to spoil their holiday, the end of the hotel renovation is scheduled for spring!

Review_text_2: The worst hotel I've ever seen. Traveled a lot. I don’t know where the positive reviews came from here, but it’s terrible. Dirty, the hotel is under construction (dirty construction workers eat with you at the next table, the dishes are dirty, the service is disgusting. During your vacation you listen not to the ocean, but to the sound of a jackhammer. The all-inclusive system is zero, you won’t wait for your cocktail (small choice). Bar from in the seventies. We got poisoned there (in response to our complaint, they said it was an allergy to curry), then other guys in this hotel got poisoned. The food was not tasty, the choice was small. After what I saw on the 4th day of our stay, I already had a showdown with the agent. , who sent us there with a tour operator and reached Colombo and Moscow, we were moved to another hotel in Rio (located nearby, the Heaven and Earth hotel is barely worthy of 2-3 stars, no more, very old with lazy staff,). the general lack of modern life, animation, etc. There are not enough sun loungers for everyone, there are 4 sun umbrellas for the entire hotel.

Review_text_2: An absolutely deserted beach, a very calm and quiet place, but shops, entertainment and restaurants are also quite far away. The area is beautiful: monkeys, chipmunks, monitor lizards, a lot of greenery. We only took breakfast - there were seafood, meat, and fruits. The staff is helpful and polite, speaks English, Rukmal cleaned our room - always clean, fresh towels and water.
